k

ka 1.1

pron. who?; what?; which? ✓

Grammar pron, interr, base
Meaning who?; what?; which?
Sanskrit ka

avijjam'p'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, s'āhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ. ko c'āhāro avijjāya?

AN 10.61 avijjāsuttaṃ

ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,
bhagavā hi me sakkhi brahmajjadiṭṭho,
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.

SNP 31 māghasuttaṃ, mahāvaggo 5
ka 1.2

pron. where? ✗
ka 2.1

abbrev. abbreviation of Cambodia; variant reading occurring in Cambodian texts ✓

Grammar abbrev
Meaning abbreviation of Cambodia; variant reading occurring in Cambodian texts

atthi, bhikkhave, ārambhadhātu {ārabbhadhātu (syā. ka.)} nikkamadhātu parakkamadhātu.

SN 46.2 kāyasuttaṃ
ka 3.1

ind. 1st item in a numerical list; lit. letter k ✓

Grammar ind
Meaning 1st item in a numerical list; lit. letter k
Sanskrit ka

(ka) katamo eko dhammo bahukāro? appamādo kusalesu dhammesu. ayaṃ eko dhammo bahukāro.

DN 34.2 dasuttarasuttaṃ
ka 4.1

nt. water [√ud + aka] ~

Grammar nt, abbrev of udaka
Meaning water
Root Family √ud
Root √ud･2 ṃa (be wet)
Construction √ud + aka
udaka > ka
Derivative kita (aka)
Phonetic Change udaka > ka (contraction)
Synonym ambu, daka, jala, oda, odaka, oka, salila, toya, uda, udaka, vāri
Sanskrit udaka
Sanskrit Root √und √ud 6, 7 (wet)
kakaca

masc. saw ✓

Grammar masc, onom
Meaning saw
Sanskrit krakaca

ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatr'āpi yo mano padūseyya, na me so tena sāsanakaro.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ

vuttaṃ kho pan'etaṃ bhagavatā kakac'ūpam'ovāde, ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatr'āpi yo mano padūseyya na me so tena sāsanakaro'ti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
kakacūpama

adj. containing the example of the saw ✗
kakacūpamasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 21; Discourse on the Simile of the Saw (MN21) [kakacūpama + sutta] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Majjhima Nikāya 21; Discourse on the Simile of the Saw (MN21)
Construction kakacūpama + sutta
Sanskrit krakaca + upamā + sūtra
kakacūpamā

fem. simile of the saw [kakaca + upamā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning simile of the saw
Construction kakaca + upamā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kakacassa + upamā)
Notes a simile mentioned in MN 21
Sanskrit krakaca + upamā

imañ'ca tumhe, bhikkhave, kakac'ūpamaṃ ovādaṃ abhikkhaṇaṃ manasi kareyyātha. passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, taṃ vacanapathaṃ, aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā, yaṃ tumhe n'ādhivāseyyāthā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ

vuttaṃ kho pan'etaṃ bhagavatā kakac'ūpam'ovāde, ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatr'āpi yo mano padūseyya na me so tena sāsanakaro'ti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
kakacūpamovāda

masc. exhortation with the simile of the saw [kakaca + upamā + ovāda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning exhortation with the simile of the saw
Construction kakaca + upamā + ovāda
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kakacūpamāya + ovāda)

vuttaṃ kho pan'etaṃ bhagavatā kakac'ūpam'ovāde, ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatr'āpi yo mano padūseyya na me so tena sāsanakaro'ti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
kakuṭapāda

adj. dove-footed; with pigeon feet [kakuṭa + pāda] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dove-footed; with pigeon feet
Construction kakuṭa + pāda
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kakuṭassa + pāda)
Commentary (DHPa) kakuṭapādānī'ti rattavaṇṇatāya pārevatapādasadisapādāni.
Sanskrit kaukkuṭika + pāda

tena kho pana samayena pañcamattāni accharāsatāni sakkassa devānam'indassa upaṭṭhānaṃ āgatāni honti kakuṭapādāni.

kakuthā

fem. name of a river ✗
kakudha 1

masc. name of a deity ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a deity
Commentary (SNa) kakudho devaputto'ti ayaṃ kira kolanagare mahāmoggallānattherassa upaṭṭhākaputto daharakāle'y'eva therassa santike vasanto jhānaṃ nibbattetvā kālaṅ'kato, brahmaloke uppajji. tatr'āpi naṃ kakudho brahmātv'eva sañjānanti.
Sanskrit kakuda

ekam'antaṃ ṭhito kho kakudho devaputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, nandasi, samaṇā'ti?

kakusandha

masc. name of the 3rd previous Buddha ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of the 3rd previous Buddha
Sanskrit krakucchanda, krakuchanda, krakutsanda

bhūtapubbāhaṃ, pāpima, dūsī nāma māro ahosiṃ, tassa me kāḷī nāma bhaginī. tassā tvaṃ putto. so me tvaṃ bhāgineyyo ahosi. tena kho pana, pāpima, samayena kakusandho bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno hoti.

kakkaṭa

masc. crab ✗
kakkaṭaka

masc. crab ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning crab
Sanskrit karkaṭa

seyyathā'pi, bhante, gāmassa vā nigamassa vā avidūre pokkharaṇī. tatr'āssa kakkaṭako. atha kho, bhante, sambahulā kumārakā vā kumārikā vā tamhā gāmā vā nigamā vā nikkhamitvā yena sā pokkharaṇī ten'upasaṅkameyyuṃ

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ

kakkaṭako āha, mātula, ayaṃ saro etto, tvaṃ pana ito kiṃ nesī'ti?

JAa 38 baka jātakavaṇṇanā
kakkarapatta

nt. name of a Koliyan town; lit. partridge feather [kakkara + patta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a Koliyan town; lit. partridge feather
Construction kakkara + patta
Compound catutthī tappurisa (kakkarassa + patta)
Sanskrit kṛkara, kṛkaṇa, kṛkala + pattra

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā koliyesu viharati kakkarapattaṃ nāma koliyānaṃ nigamo. atha kho dīghajāṇu koliyaputto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

AN 8.54 dīghajāṇusuttaṃ
kakkasa

adj. rough; harsh; (comm) rotten ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning rough; harsh; (comm) rotten
Antonym akakkasa
Commentary (MNa) kakkasā'ti pūtikā. yathā nāma pūtikarukkho kakkaso hoti paggharitacuṇṇo, evaṃ kakkasā hoti, sotaṃ ghaṃsamānā viya pavisati. tena vuttaṃ kakkasā'ti.
Notes PED suggests ku + √kar + ta
Sanskrit karkaśa

pharusavāco hoti. yā sā vācā aṇḍakā kakkasā parakaṭukā par'ābhisajjanī kodhasāmantā asamādhisaṃvattanikā, tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti

VIN 5.4.7 tiṇavatthārakaṃ
kaṅka 1

masc. heron [√kaṇ + ka] ✓

√ In Comps kan
Construction √kaṇ + ka
Derivative kita (ka)

seyyathā'pi, gahapati, gijjho vā kaṅko vā kulalo vā maṃsapesiṃ ādāya uḍḍīyeyya.

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, tam'eva bhaginiṃ passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ, kākehi vā khajjamānaṃ, kulalehi vā khajjamānaṃ, gijjhehi vā khajjamānaṃ, kaṅkehi vā khajjamānaṃ, sunakhehi vā khajjamānaṃ

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
kaṅka 2

masc. crow [√kaṇ] ✗
kaṅkaṇa

nt. bracelet ✗
kaṅkhacchida

adj. removing doubts ✗
kaṅkhachida

adj. removing doubts ✗
kaṅkhati 1

pr. (+loc) has doubt (about); is uncertain (about) [√kaṅkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning has doubt (about); is uncertain (about)
Root Family √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (doubt)
Base √kaṅkh + a > kaṅkha
Construction kaṅkha + ti
Synonym cikicchati, vicikicchati
Sanskrit kāṅkṣati (desires)
Sanskrit Root √śaṅk 1 (doubt)

dukkham'eva uppajjamānaṃ uppajjati, dukkhaṃ nirujjhamānaṃ nirujjhatī'ti na kaṅkhati na vicikicchati aparapaccayā ñāṇam'ev'assa ettha hoti. ettāvatā kho, kaccāna, sammādiṭṭhi hoti.

SN 12.15 kaccānagottasuttaṃ

yo so, sāriputta, ariyasāvako tathāgate ek'antagato abhippasanno, na so tathāgate vā tathāgatasāsane vā kaṅkheyya vā vicikiccheyya vā'ti?

SN 48.50 āpaṇasuttaṃ
kaṅkhati 2

pr. (+acc) expects; awaits; looks forward (to) [√kaṅkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning expects; awaits; looks forward (to)
Root Family √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (wish for)
Base √kaṅkh + a > kaṅkha
Construction kaṅkha + ti
Sanskrit kāṅkṣati
Sanskrit Root √kāṅkṣ 1 (desire)

yass'indriyāni bhāvitāni,
ajjhattaṃ bahiddhā ca sabbaloke,
nibbijjha imaṃ parañ'ca lokaṃ,
kālaṃ kaṅkhati bhāvito sa danto.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
kaṅkhanīya

adj. doubtful; uncertain; confusing; perplexing; lit. to be doubted [√kaṅkh + anīya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of kaṅkhati
Meaning doubtful; uncertain; confusing; perplexing; lit. to be doubted
Root Family √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (doubt)
Construction √kaṅkh + anīya
Derivative kicca (anīya)
Sanskrit kāṅkṣaṇīya (to be desitred)
Sanskrit Root √śaṅk 1 (doubt)

alañ'hi te, vaccha, kaṅkhituṃ, alaṃ vicikicchituṃ. kaṅkhanīye ca pana te ṭhāne vicikicchā uppannā.

SN 44.9 kutūhalasālāsuttaṃ
kaṅkhā

fem. doubt; uncertainty; perplexity [√kaṅkh + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from kaṅkhati
Meaning doubt; uncertainty; perplexity
Root Family √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (doubt)
Construction √kaṅkh + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Antonym akaṅkhā, nikkaṅkha
Synonym vicikicchā
Sanskrit kāṅkṣā (desire)
Sanskrit Root √śaṅk 1 (doubt)

siyā kho pana bhikkhave ekabhikkhussāpi kaṅkhā vā vimati vā buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā magge vā paṭipadāya vā pucchatha bhikkhave mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha

DN 16.36 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā dhammassavane. katame pañca? assutaṃ suṇāti, sutaṃ pariyodāpeti, kaṅkhaṃ vitarati, diṭṭhiṃ ujuṃ karoti, cittam'assa pasīdati.

AN 5.202 dhammassavanasuttaṃ
kaṅkhāṭṭhāniya

adj. doubtful; uncertain; confusing; perplexing; lit. based on doubt [kaṅkhā + ṭhāniya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning doubtful; uncertain; confusing; perplexing; lit. based on doubt
Construction kaṅkhā + ṭhāniya
kaṅkhāṭhāniya

adj. doubtful; uncertain; confusing; perplexing; lit. based on doubt [kaṅkhā + ṭhāniya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning doubtful; uncertain; confusing; perplexing; lit. based on doubt
Construction kaṅkhā + ṭhāniya
Compound kammadhāraya (kaṅkhā + ṭhāniya)
Variant kaṅkhāṭhānīya
Commentary (ANa) kaṅkhā'y'eva hi kaṅkhāṭhāniyā dhammā nāma.
Sanskrit kāṅkṣā + sthānīya

tassa te āyasmanto avivaṭañ'c'eva vivaranti, anuttānīkatañ'ca uttānī karonti, anekavihitesu ca kaṅkhāṭhāniyesu dhammesu kaṅkhaṃ paṭivinodenti.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ
kaṅkhāṭhānīya

adj. doubtful; uncertain; confusing; perplexing; lit. based on doubt [kaṅkhā + ṭhānīya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning doubtful; uncertain; confusing; perplexing; lit. based on doubt
Construction kaṅkhā + ṭhānīya
Compound kammadhāraya (kaṅkhā + ṭhānīya)
Variant kaṅkhāṭhāniya
Commentary (ANa) kaṅkhā'y'eva hi kaṅkhāṭhāniyā dhammā nāma.
Sanskrit kāṅkṣā + sthānīya

tassa te āyasmanto avivaṭañ'c'eva na vivaranti, anuttānīkatañ'ca na uttānī karonti, anekavihitesu ca kaṅkhāṭhānīyesu dhammesu kaṅkhaṃ na paṭivinodenti.

kaṅkhādhamma

masc. state of doubt; uncertainty ✗
kaṅkhāyita

nt. doubt, uncertainty ✗
kaṅkhārevata

masc. name of a monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost in jhāna; lit. doubting Revata [kaṅkhā + revata] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost in jhāna; lit. doubting Revata
Construction kaṅkhā + revata
Commentary (ANa) kaṅkhāyanabhāvena kaṅkhārevato'ti vuccati. kaṅkhā nāma kukkuccaṃ, kukkuccako'ti attho. kiṃ pana aññe kukkuccakā n'atthī'ti? atthi, ayaṃ pana thero kappiye'pi kukkuccaṃ uppādesi. ten'assa kukkuccakatā atipākaṭā jātā'ti kaṅkhārevato'tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gato.
Sanskrit śaṅkā + revata
kaṅkhārevatattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 3 (TH3) ✗
kaṅkhārevatasutta

nt. Udāna 47 (UD 47) ✗
kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddhattha

masc. for the sake of purity of crossing over doubt; for the purpose of purification of overcoming uncertainty [kaṅkhā + vitaraṇa + visuddhi + attha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning for the sake of purity of crossing over doubt; for the purpose of purification of overcoming uncertainty
Construction kaṅkhā + vitaraṇa + visuddhi + attha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddhiyā + attha)
Sanskrit kāṅkṣā + vitaraṇa + viśuddhi + artha

kiṃ pan'āvuso, kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddh'atthaṃ bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, āvuso ... diṭṭhivisuddhi yāva'd'eva kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddh'atthā, kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddhi yāva'd'eva magg'āmaggañāṇadassanavisuddh'atthā

kiṃ pan'āvuso, kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddh'atthaṃ bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

kiṃ pan'āvuso kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddhi anupādāparinibbānan'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
kaṅkhāvitaraṇī

fem. name of a commentary on the monk's and nun's Pātimokkha; lit. overcoming doubt [kaṅkhā + vitaraṇa + ī] ~

Construction kaṅkhā + vitaraṇa + ī
kaṅkhi 1

aor. doubted, was uncertain [√kaṅkh] ✗
kaṅkhi 2

adj. being unsettled, who is doubting or wavering [√kaṅkh] ✗
kaṅkhita

pp. doubted, uncertain [√kaṅkh] ✗
kaṅkhitā

fem. doubt; uncertainty; perplexity; lit. doubt state [√kaṅkh + ita + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from kaṅkhita
Meaning doubt; uncertainty; perplexity; lit. doubt state
Root Family √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (doubt)
Construction √kaṅkh + ita + ā
kaṅkhita + ā
Derivative taddhita (ā)
Commentary (VVt) kaṅkhitāya vā'ti vematikāya vā.
Sanskrit kāṅkṣitā (desire)
Sanskrit Root √śaṅk 1 (doubt)

yaṃ me kaṅkhitam'aññāsi,
vicikicchā maṃ tārayi namo te,
muni monapathesu pattipatta,
akhila ādiccabandhu sorato'si.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
kaṅkhituṃ

inf. (+loc) to doubt; to be uncertain (about) [√kaṅkh + ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of kaṅkhati, intrans (+loc)
Meaning to doubt; to be uncertain (about)
Root Family √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (doubt)
Construction √kaṅkh + ituṃ
Synonym vicikicchituṃ
Sanskrit śaṅkitum
Sanskrit Root √śaṅk 1 (doubt)

alañ'hi vo, kālāmā, kaṅkhituṃ alaṃ vicikicchituṃ

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ

alañ'hi te, vaccha, kaṅkhituṃ, alaṃ vicikicchituṃ. kaṅkhanīye ca pana te ṭhāne vicikicchā uppannā.

SN 44.9 kutūhalasālāsuttaṃ
kaṅkhivicikicchisandosahetu

ind. due to the defilement of having doubt and being uncertain [kaṅkhī + vicikicchī + sandosahetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to the defilement of having doubt and being uncertain
Construction kaṅkhī + vicikicchī + sandosahetu
Sanskrit kāṅkṣin + vicikitsin + saṃdosa + hetu

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kaṅkhī vicikicchī araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, kaṅkhivicikicchisandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
kaṅkhī

adj. having doubt; uncertain [√kaṅkh + ā + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from kaṅkhā
Meaning having doubt; uncertain
Root Family √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (doubt)
Construction √kaṅkh + ā + ī
kaṅkhā + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Antonym akaṅkhī
Commentary (MNa) kaṅkhī vicikicchī'ti ettha ekam'ev'idaṃ pañcamaṃ nīvaraṇaṃ.
Sanskrit kāṅkṣin
Sanskrit Root √śaṅk 1 (doubt)

kaṅkhī vecikicchī āgamaṃ,
pañhe pucchituṃ abhikaṅkhamāno,
tes'antakaro bhavāhi pañhe me puṭṭho,
anupubbaṃ anudhammaṃ byākarohi me.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kaṅkhī vicikicchī araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, kaṅkhivicikicchisandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

VIN 2.7.5 kabaḷavaggo
kaci

pron. someone; something; anyone; anything; whoever [ka + ci] ✓

Grammar pron, base, from ka
Meaning someone; something; anyone; anything; whoever
Construction ka + ci
Derivative taddhita (ci)
Antonym na kaci
Sanskrit ka + cid

yo'dha koci manussesu,
parapāṇāni hiṃsati,
asmā lokā paramhā ca,
ubhayā dhaṃsate naro.

TH 176 vāraṇattheragāthā

tasmā't'iha, phagguna, tava ce'pi koci sammukhā avaṇṇaṃ bhāseyya, tatr'āpi tvaṃ, phagguna, ye gehasitā chandā ye gehasitā vitakkā te pajaheyyāsi.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
kacca

ger. (+acc) doing; making; acting; performing [√kar + tya] ✓

Meaning doing; making; acting; performing
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction √kar + tya
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Sanskrit kṛtvā
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

yān'īdha bhūtāni samāgatāni,
bhummāni vā yāni va antalikkhe,
sabb'eva bhūtā sumanā bhavantu,
atho'pi sakkacca suṇantu bhāsitaṃ.

kaccānagottasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 12.15 (SN12.15) ✗
kaccānasutta

nt. Udāna 68 (UD 68) ✗
kaccāyana 1

masc. family name; lit. descendant of Kati [kati + yāyana] ✓

Grammar masc, patr, from kati
Meaning family name; lit. descendant of Kati
Construction kati > katy > kacc + yāyana

Phonetic Change ti > ty > cc
Variant kaccāna
Commentary (SNa) kaccāyano'ti pakudhassa gottaṃ.
Sanskrit kātyāyana

ye'pi te, bho gotama, samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa, seyyath'idaṃ, pūraṇo kassapo, makkhali gosālo, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto, sañcayo belaṭṭhaputto, pakudho kaccāyano, ajito kesakambalo

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ
kaccāyana 2

masc. seminal grammatical treatise written in Sri Lanka in the seventh century; lit. descendant of Kati [kati + yāyana] ~

Grammar masc, patr, from kati
Meaning seminal grammatical treatise written in Sri Lanka in the seventh century; lit. descendant of Kati
Construction kati > katy > kacc + yāyana
Derivative taddhita (yāyana)
Phonetic Change ti > ty > cc
Variant kaccāna
Notes Although traditionally described to Mahākaccāyana, there is no evidence that Buddhaghosa knew of Kaccāyana's grammar.
Sanskrit kātyāyana
kaccāhaṃ

sandhi. I hope I; I trust I [kacci + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning I hope I; I trust I
Construction kacci + ahaṃ
Sanskrit kad + cid + aham

kacc'āhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ byākaramāno vuttavādī c'eva bhagavato homi, na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkhāmi, dhammassa c'ānudhammaṃ byākaromi, na ca koci sahadhammiko vād'ānuvādo gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgacchatī'ti?

SN 42.10 maṇicūḷakasuttaṃ
kacci 1

ind. I hope; I trust; I wonder [ka + ci] ✓

Meaning I hope; I trust; I wonder
Construction ka + ci
Derivative taddhita (ci)
Sanskrit kaccid

kacci, tāta uttara, taṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ tathā santaṃ'y'eva saddo abbhuggato, no aññathā? kacci pana so bhavaṃ gotamo t'ādiso, no aññādiso'ti?

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

kacci, bhante, bhagavā sukham'asayitthā'ti? evaṃ, kumāra, sukham'asayitthaṃ. ye ca pana loke sukhaṃ senti, ahaṃ tesaṃ aññataro'ti

kaccittha 1

sandhi. I hope here; I trust in this matter [kacci + ettha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + adv
Meaning I hope here; I trust in this matter
Construction kacci + ettha
Commentary (VINa) kacc'itthā'ti kacci ettha, etesu catūsu pārājikesu kacci parisuddhā'ti attho.
Notes see kaccittha 2
Sanskrit kaccid + atra

tatth'āyasmante pucchāmi, kacci'ttha parisuddhā, dutiyam'pi pucchāmi, kacci'ttha parisuddhā, tatiyam'pi pucchāmi, kacci'ttha parisuddhā, parisuddh'etth'āyasmanto, tasmā tuṇhī, evam'etaṃ dhārayāmī'ti.

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso

kacci'ttha, bhante, na koci gihī ahosi odātavasano'ti? na h'ettha, āvuso, koci gihī ahosi odātavasano'ti. sādhu, bhante, yadettha na koci gihī ahosi odātavasano'ti.

AN 8.23 paṭhamahatthakasuttaṃ
kaccittha 2

sandhi. I hope you all are [kacci + attha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pr
Meaning I hope you all are
Construction kacci + attha
Commentary (VINa) atha vā kacci'ttha parisuddhā'ti kacci parisuddhā attha, bhavathā'ti attho.
Notes see kaccittha 1
Sanskrit kaccid + stha

tatth'āyasmante pucchāmi, kacci'ttha parisuddhā, dutiyam'pi pucchāmi, kacci'ttha parisuddhā, tatiyam'pi pucchāmi, kacci'ttha parisuddhā, parisuddh'etth'āyasmanto, tasmā tuṇhī, evam'etaṃ dhārayāmī'ti.

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso

kacci'ttha, bhante, na koci gihī ahosi odātavasano'ti? na h'ettha, āvuso, koci gihī ahosi odātavasano'ti. sādhu, bhante, yadettha na koci gihī ahosi odātavasano'ti.

AN 8.23 paṭhamahatthakasuttaṃ
kaccissu

sandhi. I hope; I trust; I doubt; I suspect; I wonder [kacci + su] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind
Meaning I hope; I trust; I doubt; I suspect; I wonder
Construction kacci + su
Sanskrit kaccid + svid

ye kec'ime isayo manujā,
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ,
yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,
kacci'ssu te bhagavā yaññapathe appamattā,
atāruṃ jātiñ'ca jarañ'ca mārisa,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

SNP 58 puṇṇaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 3

ye kec'ime samaṇabrāhmaṇāse,
diṭṭhassutenāpi vadanti suddhiṃ,
sīlabbatenāpi vadanti suddhiṃ,
anekarūpena vadanti suddhiṃ,
kacci'ssu te bhagavā tattha yatā carantā,
atāru jātiñ'ca jarañ'ca mārisa,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

SNP 62 nanda māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 7

Meaning shore land; marsh; wet-land

andhakamakasā na vijjare,
kacche rūḷhatiṇe caranti gāvo,
vuṭṭhim'pi saheyyum'āgataṃ,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

uragavaggo 2

kacche'v'āmakase magā,
jhānāni upasampajja,
ekodi nipakā satā'ti.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, dantebhi dantam'ādhāya jivhāya tāluṃ āhacca cetasā cittaṃ abhiniggaṇhato abhinippīḷayato abhisantāpayato kacchehi sedā muccanti.

Sanskrit kam + cid

n'ātimaññetha katthaci naṃ kañci,
byārosanā paṭighasaññā,
n'āññam'aññassa dukkham'iccheyya.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

kummo aṅgāni sake kapāle,
samodahaṃ bhikkhu manovitakke,
anissito aññam'aheṭhayāno,
parinibbuto n'ūpavadeyya kañcī'ti.

+d
Variant kiñcideva
Sanskrit kiṃcid + eva

puccheyyāma mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ channaṃ kañci'd'eva desaṃ, sace āyasmā channo okāsaṃ karoti pañhassa veyyākaraṇāyā'ti. pucch'āvuso sāriputta, sutvā vedissāmā'ti.

niyyānikaṃ vata buddhasāsanan'ti pasīditvā yojanikaṃ suvaṇṇacetiyaṃ kambalakañcukena parikkhipitvā tattha tattha rathacakkappamāṇehi suvaṇṇapadumehi alaṅ'kari.

kañcuka 2

masc. jacket, over-coat, mantle [√kañc] ✗
kañcuka 3

masc. armour [√kañc] ✗
kañcuka 4

nt. rice gruel; watery rice [kañji + ka] ✓

Meaning rice gruel; watery rice

so yāva bhattaṃ otarati, tāva sandhāretuṃ asakkonto uḷuṅkena kañjikaṃ harāpetvā yathāladdhena byañjanena saddhiṃ allam'eva bhattaṃ pacchiyaṃ opīḷetvā ādāya yojanikaṃ maggaṃ pakkanto, tassa gacchantass'eva bhattaṃ pakkaṃ ahosi

kaññā

fem. young girl; maiden; virgin [√kan + yā] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning young girl; maiden; virgin
Root Family √kan
Root √kan×1 a (shine, like)
Construction √kan + yā
Derivative kita (yā)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Sanskrit kanyā
Sanskrit Root √kan 4 (be pleased, enjoy)

so puṇṇako kāmavegena giddho,
irandhatiṃ nāgakaññaṃ jigiṃsaṃ,
gantvāna taṃ bhūtapatiṃ yasassiṃ,
iccabravī vessavaṇaṃ kuveraṃ.

JA 546 vidhura jātakaṃ

mahanto ca so puriso cā'ti mahāpuriso, kaṇho ca so sappo cā'ti kaṇhasappo, nīlañ'ca taṃ uppalañ'cā'ti nīluppalaṃ, lohitañ'ca taṃ candanañcā'ti lohitacandanaṃ, brāhmaṇī ca sā dārikā cā'ti brāhmaṇadārikā, khattiyā ca sā kaññā cā'ti khattiyakaññā.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 324
kaññāsahassa

Construction kaññā + sahassa
Commentary (SNa) sataṃ kaññāsahassānī'ti purimapadāni'pi iminā'va sahassapadena saddhiṃ sambandhanīyāni. yath'eva hi sataṃ kaññāsahassāni, sataṃ sahassāni hatthī, sataṃ sahassāni assā, sataṃ sahassāni rathāti ayam'ettha attho. iti ek'ekasatasahassam'eva dīpitaṃ.

kadā nu kaṭṭhe ca tiṇe latā ca,
khandhe ime'haṃ amite ca dhamme,
ajjhattikān'eva ca bāhirāni ca,
samaṃ tuleyyaṃ tadidaṃ kadā me.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

yadā kho, āvuso, imaṃ kāyaṃ tayo dhammā jahanti, āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ, ath'āyaṃ kāyo ujjhito avakkhitto seti, yathā kaṭṭhaṃ acetanan'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
kaṭṭhaka

masc. bamboo [kaṭṭha + ka] ✓

Meaning bamboo
Construction kaṭṭha + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (DHPa) tassa taṃ paṭikkosanaṃ sā ca pāpikā diṭṭhi veḷusaṅkhātassa kaṭṭhakassa phalāni viya hoti.
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bamboo
Sanskrit kāṣṭhaka

ariyānaṃ dhammajīvinaṃ,
paṭikkosati dummedho,
diṭṭhiṃ nissāya pāpikaṃ,
phalāni kaṭṭhakass'eva,
attaghātāya phallati.

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning gathering wood; collecting firewood (in reference to SN 7.18 Kaṭṭhahārasuttaṃ)
Construction kaṭṭha + hāra

Grammar masc, comp

Sanskrit kāṣṭha + hāraka

yadā passāmi gopālakaṃ vā pasupālakaṃ vā tiṇahārakaṃ vā kaṭṭhahārakaṃ vā vanakammikaṃ vā, vanena vanaṃ gahanena gahanaṃ ninnena ninnaṃ thalena thalaṃ saṃpatāmi.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rājakumāra, sac'āyaṃ kumāro tuyhaṃ vā pamādam'anvāya dhātiyā vā pamādam'anvāya kaṭṭhaṃ vā kaṭhalaṃ vā mukhe āhareyya, kinti naṃ kareyyāsī'ti?

nt. kathina privileges; kathina allowances ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning kathina privileges; kathina allowances
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.1) ubbhatasmiṃ kathine'ti aṭṭhannaṃ mātikānaṃ aññatarāya mātikāya ubbhataṃ hoti, saṅghena vā antarā ubbhataṃ hoti.
Sanskrit kaṭhina

niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine das'āhaparamaṃ atirekacīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ, taṃ atikkāmayato nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 1 kathinasikkhāpadaṃ

niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine ekarattam'pi ce bhikkhu ticīvarena vippavaseyya, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

Derivative taddhita (ukā)
Commentary (MNa) uccā kaṇerukā nāmā'ti uccā ca yaṭṭhisadisadīghapādā hutvā, kaṇerukā ca dantānaṃ kaṇerutāya, tā kira makuḷadāṭhā honti. tasmā kaṇerukā'ti vuccanti.
Notes see (MW) mukuṭa
Sanskrit kareṇukā

yo hoti kusalo nāgavaniko n'eva tāva niṭṭhaṃ gacchati, mahā vata, bho, nāgo'ti. taṃ kissa hetu? santi hi, brāhmaṇa, nāgavane uccā kaṇerukā nāma hatthiniyo mahāpadā, tāsaṃ p'etaṃ padaṃ assā'ti.

kaṇṭhasutta

adj. necklace or collar ✗

kaṇḍa 1

Grammar masc
Meaning arrow; arrow shaft
Root Family √kaṇḍ
Root √kaṇḍ･8 *e (break, pierce)
Construction √kaṇḍ + a
Derivative kita (a)
Notes (MW) a single joint of the stalk or stem of a plant, such as a bamboo or reed or can; i.e. the portion from one knot to another
Sanskrit kāṇḍa
Sanskrit Root √kaḍ √kaṇḍ 10 (separate, destroy)

atha puriso āgaccheyya, ahaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ daḷhadhammānaṃ dhanuggahānaṃ susikkhitānaṃ katahatthānaṃ kat'ūpāsanānaṃ catuddisā kaṇḍe khitte appatiṭṭhite pathaviyaṃ gahetvā āharissāmī'ti.

SN 20.6 dhanuggahasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, sāḷha, yodh'ājīvo bahūni ce'pi kaṇḍacitrakāni jānāti, atha kho so tīhi ṭhānehi rāj'āraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅgan't'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati. katamehi tīhi? dūrepātī ca, akkhaṇavedhī ca, mahato ca kāyassa padāletā.

iti ākhyātakappe dutiyo kaṇḍo.

kaṇḍaka

adj. thorny-stemmed; prickly-stemmed [√kat + ṃa + a + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from kaṇṭa
Meaning thorny-stemmed; prickly-stemmed
Root Family √kat
Root √kat･2 ṃa (cut)
Base √kat + ṃa > kaṇṭa > kaṇḍa (irreg)
Construction kaṇḍa + a + ka
kaṇḍa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change ṭ > ḍ
Variant kaṇtaka
Commentary (NIDD1) kaṇḍako vuccati kharadaṇḍo. (SNPa) kaṇṭakanāḷaṃ.
Sanskrit kaṇṭaka
Sanskrit Root √kṛt 1, 6 (cut)

yehi vivitto vicareyya loke,
na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo,
jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā,
jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ,
evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho,
kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

Meaning thorny; prickly
Root Family √kat
Root √kat･2 ṃa (cut)
Base √kat + ṃa > kaṇṭa > kaṇḍa (irreg)
Construction kaṇḍa + a + ka + ī
kaṇḍaka + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change ṭ > ḍ
Commentary (SNa) kaṇḍakīvane'ti mahā-karamanda-vane.
Sanskrit kaṇṭakin
Sanskrit Root √kṛt 1, 6 (cut)
kaṇḍakīvana

nt. name of a forest; lit. thorny wood [kaṇḍakī + vana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a forest; lit. thorny wood
Construction kaṇḍakī + vana
Commentary (SNa) kaṇḍakīvane'ti mahā-karamanda-vane.
kaṇḍacitraka

nt. different kinds of arrow shafts [kaṇḍa + citraka] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning different kinds of arrow shafts
Construction kaṇḍa + citraka
Compound kammadhāraya (kaṇḍa + citraka)
Commentary (ANa) kaṇḍacitrakānī'ti saralaṭṭhi-sararajju-sarapāsāda-sarasāṇi-sarapokkharaṇi-sarapadumānī'ti anekāni kaṇḍehi kattabbacitrāni.
Sanskrit kāṇḍa + citraka

seyyathā'pi, sāḷha, yodh'ājīvo bahūni ce'pi kaṇḍacitrakāni jānāti, atha kho so tīhi ṭhānehi rāj'āraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅgan't'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati. katamehi tīhi? dūrepātī ca, akkhaṇavedhī ca, mahato ca kāyassa padāletā.

Commentary (VINa) kaṇḍū'ti kacchu. (NIDD1a) kaṇḍū'ti khuddakapīḷakā.
Sanskrit kaṇḍū
Sanskrit Root √kaḍ √kaṇḍ 10 (separate, destroy)

kaṇḍuppaṭicchādiṃ pana bhikkhunā kārayamānena pamāṇikā kāretabbā, tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ, dīghaso catasso vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ dve vidatthiyo. taṃ atikkāmayato chedanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 90 kaṇḍuppaṭicchādisikkhāpadaṃ

kaṇḍuppaṭicchādi nāma yassa adhonābhi ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ kaṇḍu vā pīḷakā vā assāvo vā thullakacchu vā ābādho, tassa paṭicchādan'atthāya.

VIN 2.5.9.8 kaṇḍuppaṭicchādisikkhāpadaṃ

so puratthimena nagarassa navaṃ santh'āgāraṃ kārāpetvā kesamassuṃ ohāretvā khar'ājinaṃ nivāsetvā sappitelena kāyaṃ abbhañjitvā magavisāṇena piṭṭhiṃ kaṇḍuvamāno navaṃ santh'āgāraṃ pavisati, saddhiṃ mahesiyā brāhmaṇena ca purohitena.

Meaning ear
Sanskrit karṇa

masc. edge; border; corner ✓

Meaning edge; border; corner
Sanskrit karṇaka (bsk)

parimaṇḍalaṃ pārupitabbaṃ ubho kaṇṇe samaṃ katvā. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca purato vā pacchato vā olambento pārupati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.1 parimaṇḍalavaggo

seyyathā'pi nāma balavā soṇḍikākammakāro mahantaṃ soṇḍikākiḷañjaṃ gambhīre udakarahade pakkhipitvā kaṇṇe gahetvā ākaḍḍheyya parikaḍḍheyya samparikaḍḍheyya, evam'ev'āhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ vādena vādaṃ ākaḍḍhissāmi parikaḍḍhissāmi samparikaḍḍhissāmi.

kaṇṇasaṃdhovikā

fem. ear washing game [kaṇṇa + saṃdhovikā] ✓

Construction kaṇṇa + saṃdhovikā

Sanskrit karṇa + saṃdhāvaṇikā (bsk)

seyyathā'pi, upāli, mahāudakarahado. atha āgaccheyya hatthināgo sattaratano vā aḍḍh'aṭṭharatano vā. tassa evam'assa yaṃnūn'āhaṃ imaṃ udakarahadaṃ ogāhetvā kaṇṇasaṃdhovikam'pi khiḍḍaṃ kīḷeyyaṃ piṭṭhisaṃdhovikam'pi khiḍḍaṃ kīḷeyyaṃ.

kaṇṇikālakkhaṇa 2

nt. auspicious marks of rabbits ✗
kaṇha 1

adj. dark; black ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning dark; black
Antonym sukka
Sanskrit kṛṣṇa

pūraṇena, bhante, kassapena chaḷabhijātiyo paññattā, kaṇh'ābhijāti paññattā, nīl'ābhijāti paññattā, lohit'ābhijāti paññattā, halidd'ābhijāti paññattā, sukk'ābhijāti paññattā, paramasukk'ābhijāti paññattā.

AN 6.57 chaḷabhijātisuttaṃ
kaṇha 2

adj. bad; evil ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning bad; evil
Antonym sukka
Commentary (MNa) kaṇhan'ti kāḷakaṃ das'ākusalakammapathakammaṃ.
Sanskrit kṛṣṇa

dubhayāni viceyya paṇḍarāni,
ajjhattaṃ bahiddhā ca suddhipañño,
kaṇhaṃ sukkaṃ upātivatto,
paṇḍito tādi pavuccate tathattā.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

kaṇhaṃ dhammaṃ vippahāya,
sukkaṃ bhāvetha paṇḍito,
okā anokam'āgamma,
viveke yattha dūramaṃ.

DHP 87 paṇḍitavaggo
kaṇha 3

masc. dark one; black one; evil one; epithet of Māra ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning dark one; black one; evil one; epithet of Māra
Synonym kāla
Commentary (THa) kaṇhā'ti māraṃ ālapati, so hi kaṇhakammattā kaṇh'ābhijātitāya ca kaṇho'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit kṛṣṇa

yo vejayantapāsādaṃ,
pād'aṅguṭṭhena kampayi,
t'ādisaṃ bhikkhum'āsajja,
kaṇha dukkhaṃ nigacchasi.

TH 263 mahāmoggallānattheragāthā

theyyaṃ na kāre na musā bhaṇeyya,
mettāya phasse tasathāvarāni,
yadāvilattaṃ manaso vijaññā,
kaṇhassa pakkho'ti vinodayeyya.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
kaṇha 4

masc. name of a privately enlightened Buddha; lit. black ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a privately enlightened Buddha; lit. black
kaṇhakamma

masc. evil deed; wrong doing; criminal action; lit. black deed [kaṇha + kamma] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning evil deed; wrong doing; criminal action; lit. black deed
Construction kaṇha + kamma
Compound kammadhāraya (kaṇha + kamma)
Sanskrit kṛṣṇakarman

bāhukaṃ adhikakkañ'ca,
gayaṃ sundarikām'api,
sarassatiṃ payāgañ'ca,
atho bāhumatiṃ nadiṃ,
niccam'pi bālo pakkhando,
kaṇhakammo na sujjhati.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
kaṇhakhandhaka

adj. having a mass of black (hair) ✗
kaṇhadinnattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 150 (TH150) ✗
kaṇhadhamma

masc. evil quality; black trait [kaṇha + dhamma] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning evil quality; black trait
Construction kaṇha + dhamma
kaṇhapakkha 1

masc. dark half of the month; waning moon; new moon; lit. black side [kaṇha + pakkha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning dark half of the month; waning moon; new moon; lit. black side
Construction kaṇha + pakkha
Sanskrit kṛṣṇapakṣa
kaṇhapakkha 2

masc. negative aspect; negative side; lit. dark side [kaṇha + pakkha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning negative aspect; negative side; lit. dark side
Construction kaṇha + pakkha
Antonym sukkapakkha
Sanskrit kṛṣṇapakṣa
kaṇhamagga

masc. dark path; evil way [kaṇha + magga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning dark path; evil way
Construction kaṇha + magga
Compound kammadhāraya (kaṇha + magga)
Antonym sukkamagga
Sanskrit kṛṣṇa + mārga

kaṇhamaggañ'ca vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desessāmi sukkamaggañ'ca. taṃ suṇātha ... katamo ca, bhikkhave, kaṇhamaggo?

AN 10.146 kaṇhamaggasuttaṃ
kaṇhamaggasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.146 (AN10.146) ✗
kaṇhamaggasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.190 (AN10.190) ✗
kaṇhavattanī

adj. with black trail; leaving a black path [kaṇha + vattanī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with black trail; leaving a black path
Construction kaṇha + vattanī
Compound kammadhāraya (kaṇha + vattanī)
Commentary (SNa) kaṇhavattanin'ti vattanī'ti maggo, agginā gatamaggo kaṇho hoti kāḷako, tasmā kaṇhavattanī'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit kṛṣṇa + vartanī

pahūtabhakkhaṃ jālinaṃ,
pāvakaṃ kaṇhavattaniṃ,
daharo'ti n'āvajāneyya,
na naṃ paribhave naro.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ
kaṇhavipāka

adj. with bad results; having negative consequences [kaṇha + vipāka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with bad results; having negative consequences
Construction kaṇha + vipāka
Compound kammadhāraya (kaṇha + vipāka)
Antonym sukkavipāka
Commentary (MNa) kaṇhavipākan'ti apāye nibbattanato kāḷakavipākaṃ.
Sanskrit kṛṣṇa + vipāka

atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṃ kaṇhaṃ kaṇhavipākaṃ, atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṃ sukkaṃ sukkavipākaṃ, atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṃ kaṇhasukkaṃ kaṇhasukkavipākaṃ, atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṃ akaṇhaṃ asukkaṃ akaṇh'āsukkavipākaṃ, kammakkhayāya saṃvattati.

MN 57 kukkuravatikasuttaṃ
kaṇhasaṅkhāta

adj. considered bad; reckoned as evil ✗
kaṇhasappa

masc. black snake; black cobra [kaṇha + sappa] ✓

Meaning black snake; black cobra
Construction kaṇha + sappa

Sanskrit kālasarpa

mahanto ca so puriso cā'ti mahāpuriso, kaṇho ca so sappo cā'ti kaṇhasappo, nīlañ'ca taṃ uppalañ'cā'ti nīl'uppalaṃ, lohitañ'ca taṃ candanañcā'ti lohitacandanaṃ

kaccāyana samāsakappa 324
kaṇhasīsa

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a black head
Construction kaṇha + sīsa
kaṇhasukka 1

adj. black and white; dark and light [kaṇha + sukka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning black and white; dark and light
Construction kaṇha + sukka
Compound dvanda (kaṇha ca sukka ca)
Sanskrit kṛṣṇa + śukla

seyyathā'pi, māgaṇḍiya, jacc'andho puriso, so na passeyya kaṇhasukkāni rūpāni, na passeyya nīlakāni rūpāni, na passeyya pītakāni rūpāni, na passeyya lohitakāni rūpāni

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

ko ca, bhikkhave, āhāro anuppannassa vā dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā? atthi, bhikkhave, kusal'ākusalā dhammā, sāvajj'ānavajjā dhammā, hīnapaṇītā dhammā, kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgā dhammā.

SN 46.2 kāyasuttaṃ
kaṇhasukka 2

adj. bad and good; negative and positive; lit. black and white [kaṇha + sukka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bad and good; negative and positive; lit. black and white
Construction kaṇha + sukka
Compound dvanda (kaṇha ca sukka ca)
Commentary (MNa) kaṇhasukkan'ti vomissakakammaṃ.
Sanskrit kṛṣṇa + śukla

atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṃ kaṇhaṃ kaṇhavipākaṃ, atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṃ sukkaṃ sukkavipākaṃ, atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṃ kaṇhasukkaṃ kaṇhasukkavipākaṃ, atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṃ akaṇhaṃ asukkaṃ akaṇh'āsukkavipākaṃ, kammakkhayāya saṃvattati.

MN 57 kukkuravatikasuttaṃ
kaṇhasukkavipāka

adj. with bad and good results; having positive and negative consequences [kaṇha + sukka + vipāka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with bad and good results; having positive and negative consequences
Construction kaṇha + sukka + vipāka
Compound kammadhāraya (kaṇhasukka + vipāka)
Antonym akaṇhaasukkavipākaṃ
Commentary (MNa) kaṇhasukkavipākan'ti sukhadukkhavipākaṃ. missakakammañ'hi katvā akusalena tiracchānayoniyaṃ maṅgalahatthiṭṭhān'ādīsu uppanno kusalena pavatte sukhaṃ vediyati. kusalena rājakule'pi nibbatto akusalena pavatte dukkhaṃ vediyati.
Sanskrit kṛṣṇa + śukra + vipāka

atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṃ kaṇhaṃ kaṇhavipākaṃ, atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṃ sukkaṃ sukkavipākaṃ, atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṃ kaṇhasukkaṃ kaṇhasukkavipākaṃ, atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṃ akaṇhaṃ asukkaṃ akaṇh'āsukkavipākaṃ, kammakkhayāya saṃvattati.

MN 57 kukkuravatikasuttaṃ
kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāga

adj. with black and white (states) and their counterparts; having black and white (states) and their opposites [kaṇha + sukka + sapaṭibhāga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with black and white (states) and their counterparts; having black and white (states) and their opposites
Construction kaṇha + sukka + sapaṭibhāga
Compound dvanda (kaṇhasukka ca sappaṭibhāga ca)
Commentary (SNa) sappaṭibhāgā'ti kaṇhasukkāy'eva. kaṇhā hi kaṇhavipākadānato, sukkā ca sukkavipākadānato sappaṭibhāgā nāma, sadisavipākakoṭṭhāsā'ti attho. paṭipakkhabhūtassa vā bhāgassa atthitāya sappaṭibhāgā. kaṇhānañ'hi sukkā paṭipakkhabhāgā, sukkānañ'ca kaṇhā paṭipakkhabhāgā'ti evam'pi sappaṭibhāgā.
Sanskrit kṛṣṇa + śukla + sa + pratibhaaga

ko ca, bhikkhave, āhāro anuppannassa vā dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā? atthi, bhikkhave, kusal'ākusalā dhammā, sāvajj'ānavajjā dhammā, hīnapaṇītā dhammā, kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgā dhammā.

SN 46.2 kāyasuttaṃ

evaṃvādiṃ kho, bhikkhave, satthāraṃ arahati sāvako upasaṅkamituṃ dhammassavanāya. tassa satthā dhammaṃ deseti uttar'uttariṃ paṇītapaṇītaṃ kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgaṃ.

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ
kaṇhasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 2.7 (AN2.7) ✗
kaṇhāgotamaka

masc. name of a royal family of serpents [kaṇhā + gotama + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a royal family of serpents
Construction kaṇhā + gotama + ka
kaṇhāgotama + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit kṛṣṇagotamaka (bsk)

sace hi so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cattāri ahirājakulāni mettena cittena phareyya, na hi so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ahinā daṭṭho kālaṅ'kareyya. katamāni cattāri? virūp'akkhaṃ ahirājakulaṃ, erāpathaṃ ahirājakulaṃ, chabyāputtaṃ ahirājakulaṃ, kaṇhāgotamakaṃ ahirājakulaṃ.

AN 4.67 ahirājasuttaṃ
kaṇhābhijāti

fem. black class of beings; lowest class of beings; lit. black birth [kaṇha + abhijāti] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning black class of beings; lowest class of beings; lit. black birth
Construction kaṇha + abhijāti
Compound kammadhāraya (kaṇha + abhijāti)
Commentary (MNa) kaṇh'ābhijātiko'ti caṇḍāl'ādinīcakule jāto.
Sanskrit kṛṣṇa + abhijāti

ko sutvā nappasīdeyya,
api kaṇh'ābhijātiyo,
tasmā hi attakāmena,
mahattam'abhikaṅkhatā,
saddhammo garukātabbo,
saraṃ buddhāna'sāsanan'ti.

AN 7.62 mettasuttaṃ

tatr'idaṃ, bhante, pūraṇena kassapena kaṇh'ābhijāti paññattā, orabbhikā sūkarikā sākuṇikā māgavikā luddā macchaghātakā corā coraghātakā bandhan'āgārikā ye vā pan'aññe'pi keci kurūrakammantā.

AN 6.57 chaḷabhijātisuttaṃ
kaṇhābhijātika

adj. of low birth, basely born ✗
kaṇhābhijātiya

adj. belonging to the black class of beings; lit. of black birth [kaṇha + abhijāti + iya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from kaṇhābhijāti
Meaning belonging to the black class of beings; lit. of black birth
Construction kaṇha + abhijāti + iya
kaṇhābhijāti + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Variant kaṇhābhijātika
Commentary (ANa) kaṇh'ābhijātiko'ti kāḷakajātiko.
Sanskrit kṛṣṇa + abhijātīya

idh'ānanda, ekacco kaṇh'ābhijātiyo samāno kaṇhaṃ dhammaṃ abhijāyati. idha pan'ānanda, ekacco kaṇh'ābhijātiyo samāno sukkaṃ dhammaṃ abhijāyati. idha pan'ānanda, ekacco kaṇh'ābhijātiyo samāno akaṇhaṃ asukkaṃ nibbānaṃ abhijāyati.

AN 6.57 chaḷabhijātisuttaṃ
kaṇhāyana

masc. name of a clan [kaṇha] ✗
kaṇhuttara

adj. having a black surface ✗

Construction √kar + ta

Antonym akata
Sanskrit kṛta

khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti abbhaññāsi.

na paresaṃ kat'ākataṃ,

katāni akatāni ca.

DHP 150 jarāvaggo
kata 4

pp. formed; shaped; wrought; forged [√kar + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of karoti
Meaning formed; shaped; wrought; forged

Construction √kar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > t
Antonym akata
Sanskrit kṛta
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

nānappakārakaṃ nāma katam'pi akatam'pi kat'ākatam'pi. kataṃ nāma sīs'ūpagaṃ gīv'ūpagaṃ hatth'ūpagaṃ pād'ūpagaṃ kaṭ'ūpagaṃ. akataṃ nāma ghanakataṃ vuccati. kat'ākataṃ nāma tadubhayaṃ.

VIN 1.4.2.9 rūpiyasaṃvohārasikkhāpadaṃ

samāpajjeyyā'ti katena kataṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ. katena akataṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ. katena kat'ākataṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN 1.4.2.9 rūpiyasaṃvohārasikkhāpadaṃ
kata 5

masc. mat, cheek [√kar] ✗
kataka

nt. water-clearing nut ✗
katakamma 1

adj. who has committed a theft; who has done a crime; lit. done the deed [kata + kamma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has committed a theft; who has done a crime; lit. done the deed
Construction kata + kamma
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kata + kammaṃ)
Antonym akatakamma
Sanskrit kṛta + karman

theyyasattho nāma corā katakammā vā honti akatakammā vā, rājānaṃ vā theyyaṃ gacchanti suṅkaṃ vā pariharanti.

VIN 2.5.7.6 theyyasatthasikkhāpadaṃ

manussaphassā vuccanti corā vā assu mānavā vā katakammā vā akatakammā vā.

NIDD1 16 sāriputta sutta niddeso

Sanskrit kṛta + karman
katakamma 3

adj. practised, skilled ✗
katakaraṇīya

adj. who has done the job; who has done what needs to be done; who has fulfilled the obligation; epithet of an arahant [kata + karaṇīya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has done the job; who has done what needs to be done; who has fulfilled the obligation; epithet of an arahant
Construction kata + karaṇīya
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kata + karaṇīyaṃ)
Commentary (SNa) catūhi maggehi karaṇīyaṃ etesaṃ katan'ti katakaraṇīyā.
Sanskrit kṛta + karaṇīya

khīṇ'āsavassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno vusitavato katakaraṇīyassa ohitabhārassa anuppattasadatthassa parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojanassa samma'd'aññāvimuttassa ayam'anudhammo hoti veyyākaraṇāya

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ

yo so, bhante, bhikkhu arahaṃ khīṇ'āsavo vusitavā katakaraṇīyo ohitabhāro anuppattasadattho parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojano samma'd'aññāvimutto, so cha ṭhānāni adhimutto hoti

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ
katakalyāṇa

adj. who has done good deeds [kata + kalyāṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has done good deeds
Construction kata + kalyāṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kata + kalyāṇāni)
Commentary (ANa) akatakalyāṇo'tiādīsu kalyāṇaṃ vuccati puññakammaṃ, taṃ akataṃ etenā'ti akatakalyāṇo. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit kṛta + kalyāṇa

puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatapāpo hoti akataluddo akatakibbiso katakalyāṇo katakusalo katabhīruttāṇo. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

AN 4.184 abhayasuttaṃ
katakicca

adj. finished the job; done what needs to be done [kata + kicca] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning finished the job; done what needs to be done
Construction kata + kicca
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kata + kiccaṃ)
Sanskrit kṛta + kṛtya

pāragū anupādāno,
katakicco anāsavo,
tuṭṭho āyukkhayā hoti,
mutto āghātanā yathā.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

jhāyiṃ virajam'āsīnaṃ,
katakiccaṃ anāsavaṃ,
pāraguṃ sabbadhammānaṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
aññāvimokkhaṃ pabrūhi,
avijjāya pabhedanaṃ.

SNP 68 udaya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 13
katakibbisa

adj. who has done wrong; who has done dirty things; who has committed sin [kata + kibbisa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has done wrong; who has done dirty things; who has committed sin
Construction kata + kibbisa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kata + kibbisāni)
Antonym akatakibbisa
Commentary (ANa) kibbisan'ti samalaṃ aparisuddhakammaṃ
Sanskrit kṛta + kilbiṣa

kiṃ sundarikā karissati,
kiṃ payāgo kiṃ bāhukā nadī,
veriṃ katakibbisaṃ naraṃ,
na hi naṃ sodhaye pāpakamminaṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatakalyāṇo hoti akatakusalo akatabhīruttāṇo katapāpo kataluddo katakibbiso. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

katakusala

Meaning who has done good; who has made merit
Construction kata + kusala
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kata + kusalāni)
Commentary (ANa) puññakammam'eva hi kosallasambhūtattā kusalaṃ
Sanskrit kṛta + kuśala

puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatapāpo hoti akataluddo akatakibbiso katakalyāṇo katakusalo katabhīruttāṇo. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

AN 4.184 abhayasuttaṃ

yo'pi c'ettha katakusalo hoti, tam'pi ñātirogabhogabyasan'ādīnaṃ aññatarena byasanena samannāgataṃ disvā vā sutvā vā tesaṃ abhāve'pi vaṭṭadukkhaṃ anatikkantattā, dukkhito'va ayan'ti.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
kataṅgavippahīna

Sanskrit kati + aṅga + viprahīṇa

paṭhamaṃ pan'āvuso, jhānaṃ kat'aṅgavippahīnaṃ kat'aṅgasamannāgatan'ti?

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ
kataṅgasamannāgata

paṭhamaṃ pan'āvuso, jhānaṃ kat'aṅgavippahīnaṃ kat'aṅgasamannāgatan'ti?

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ
katañjalī

adj. having raised one's hands in salutation ✗
kataññutā

fem. gratitude; thankfulness; appreciativeness; lit. knowing what is done state [kata + ñū + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from kataññu
Meaning gratitude; thankfulness; appreciativeness; lit. knowing what is done state
Construction kata + ñū + tā
kataññu + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Antonym akataññutā
Sanskrit kṛtajñatā

gāravo ca nivāto ca,
santuṭṭhi ca kataññutā,
kālena dhammassavanaṃ,
etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.

KHP 5 maṅgalasuttaṃ

siyā kho, bhikkhave, tasmiṃ jarasiṅgāle yā kāci kataññutā kataveditā, na tv'eva idh'ekacce sakyaputtiyapaṭiññe siyā yā kāci kataññutā kataveditā.

SN 20.12 dutiyasiṅgālasuttaṃ
kataññutākataveditā

fem. gratefulness and thankfulness; gratitude and appreciativeness [kataññutā + kataveditā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning gratefulness and thankfulness; gratitude and appreciativeness
Construction kataññutā + kataveditā
Antonym akataññutāakataveditā
Commentary (SNa) kataññutā'ti katajānanaṃ. kataveditā'ti katavisesajānanaṃ.
kataññū

adj. grateful; thankful; lit. knowing what is done [kata + ñū] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning grateful; thankful; lit. knowing what is done
Construction kata + ñū
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kataṃ + ñū)
Antonym akataññū
Sanskrit kṛtajña

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kataññuno bhavissāma katavedino, na ca no amhesu appakam'pi kataṃ nassissatī'ti. evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabban'ti.

SN 20.12 dutiyasiṅgālasuttaṃ

kataññunā me bhavituṃ vaṭṭatī'ti ekaṃ satasahassaṃ gāhāpetvā cūḷaseṭṭhissa samīpaṃ gato

JAa 4 cūḷaseṭṭhi jātakavaṇṇanā
katato

ind. as done; as completed [√kar + ta + to] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of kata
Meaning as done; as completed
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction √kar + ta + to
kata + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Phonetic Change rt > t
Antonym akatato
Sanskrit kṛtāt
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yo so bhattu abbhantaro antojano, dāsā'ti vā pessā'ti vā kammakarā'ti vā, tesaṃ katañ'ca katato jānāti akatañ'ca akatato jānāti, gilānakānañ'ca bal'ābalaṃ jānāti khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyañ'c'assa paccaṃsena saṃvibhajati.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ
katatta

nt. fact of having done; lit. done state [√kar + ta + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from kata
Meaning fact of having done; lit. done state
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction √kar + ta + tta
kata + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change rt > t
Antonym akatatta
Sanskrit kṛtavat
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo yena m'idh'ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjantī'ti? katattā ca, brāhmaṇa, akatattā ca.

AN 2.17 adhikaraṇavaggo
katattā

nt. (+gen) because of doing; from the fact of having done; lit. from done state [√kar + ta + tta + ā] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, abl sg of katatta (+gen)
Meaning because of doing; from the fact of having done; lit. from done state
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction √kar + ta + tta + ā
katatta + ā
Phonetic Change rt > t
Antonym akatattā
Sanskrit kṛtavat
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo yena m'idh'ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjantī'ti? katattā ca, brāhmaṇa, akatattā ca.

AN 2.17 adhikaraṇavaggo
kataparappavāda

adj. familiar with others' doctrines; well acquainted with the beliefs of others; skilled in another's dogma [kata + parappavāda] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning familiar with others' doctrines; well acquainted with the beliefs of others; skilled in another's dogma
Construction kata + parappavāda
Compound kammadhāraya (kata + parappavāda)
Commentary (MNa) kataparappavāde'ti viññātaparappavāde c'eva parehi saddhiṃ katavādaparicaye ca.
Sanskrit kata + para + pravāda

katamāni cattāri? idh'āhaṃ, bho, passāmi ekacce khattiyapaṇḍite nipuṇe kataparappavāde vālavedhirūpe, te bhindantā maññe caranti paññāgatena diṭṭhigatāni.

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ
katapariyosita

adj. finished; complete; prepared; lit. done finished [kata + pariyosita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning finished; complete; prepared; lit. done finished
Construction kata + pariyosita
katapāpa

adj. who has done evil; who has done wrong [kata + pāpa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has done evil; who has done wrong
Construction kata + pāpa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kata + pāpāni)
Antonym akatapāpa
Commentary (ANa) katapāpo'tiādīsu pāpaṃ vuccati lāmakaṃ akusalakammaṃ.
Sanskrit kṛta + pāpa

puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatakalyāṇo hoti akatakusalo akatabhīruttāṇo katapāpo kataluddo katakibbiso. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

AN 4.184 abhayasuttaṃ
katapuñña

adj. who has made merit; who has done good; has gained spiritual wealth [kata + puñña] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has made merit; who has done good; has gained spiritual wealth
Construction kata + puñña
Compound kammadhāraya (kata + puñña)
Antonym pāpakārī, akatapuñña
Synonym puññakata
Sanskrit kṛtapuṇya

idha modati pecca modati,
katapuñño ubhay'attha modati,
so modati so pamodati,
disvā kammavisuddhim'attano.

DHP 16 yamakavaggo

sobhati idaṃ āyasmato kosiyassa, yathā taṃ pubbe katapuññassa. manussā'pi kiñci'd'eva rāmaṇeyyakaṃ disvā evam'āhaṃsu, sobhati vata bho yathā devānaṃ tāvatiṃsānan'ti.

MN 37 cūḷataṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
katapuññatā

fem. fact of having made merit; fact of having done good; fact of having spiritual wealth [kata + puñña + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from katapuñña
Meaning fact of having made merit; fact of having done good; fact of having spiritual wealth
Construction kata + puñña + tā
katapuñña + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Compound kammadhāraya (kata + puññatā)
Antonym akatapuññatā
Sanskrit kṛtapuṇya + tā

patirūpadesavāso ca,
pubbe ca katapuññatā,
attasammāpaṇidhi ca,
etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.

KHP 5 maṅgalasuttaṃ
katapubba

adj. done before; previously performed [kata + pubba] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning done before; previously performed
Construction kata + pubba
Compound kammadhāraya (kata + pubba)
Antonym akatapubbaṃ
Commentary (DNa) katapubban'ti pubbe kataṃ.
Sanskrit kṛta + pūrva

idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo yam'enaṃ hatthidammasārathi kāraṇaṃ kāreti, yadi vā katapubbaṃ yadi vā akatapubbaṃ, taṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbaṃ cetasā samannāharitvā ohitasoto suṇāti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo sotā hoti.

AN 5.140 sotasuttaṃ
katabhaṇḍa

nt. something manufactured (e.g. cloth or worked metal); something not in its natural state ✗
katabhīruttāṇa

adj. who has made a refuge from fear; who has made a protection against terror [kata + bhīruttāṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has made a refuge from fear; who has made a protection against terror
Construction kata + bhīruttāṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kata + bhīruttāṇaṃ)
Commentary (ANa) bhītassa parittāyakattā bhīruttāṇan'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit kṛta + bhīru + trāṇa

puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatapāpo hoti akataluddo akatakibbiso katakalyāṇo katakusalo katabhīruttāṇo. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

AN 4.184 abhayasuttaṃ
katama

pron. what?; which (of the many)? [ka + tama] ✓

Grammar pron, interr, from ka
Meaning what?; which (of the many)?
Construction ka + tama
Derivative taddhita (tama)
Sanskrit katama

katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā adhivāsanā pahātabbā? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso khamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa, jighacchāya pipāsāya

MN 2.5 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

evam'pi viggayha vivādayanti,
bālo paro akusalo'ti c'āhu,
sacco nu vādo katamo imesaṃ,
sabb'eva h'īme kusalā vadānā.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
katamañcāvuso

sandhi. and what, friends?; and which, brothers? [katamaṃ + ca + āvuso] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + masc, interr
Meaning and what, friends?; and which, brothers?
Construction katamaṃ + ca + āvuso
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit katama + ca + āyusmanto

katamañ'c'āvuso, dukkhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ? jāti'pi dukkhā, jarā'pi dukkhā, maraṇam'pi dukkhaṃ, sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā'pi dukkhā, yam'p'icchaṃ na labhati tam'pi dukkhaṃ, saṃkhittena, pañc'upādānakkhandhā dukkhā.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
katamatta

masc. which self? which individual? [katama + atta] ~

Grammar masc, comp, interr, atta group
Meaning which self? which individual?
Construction katama + atta
Sanskrit katama + ātman
katamanussaranta

prp. remembering what was done [kataṃ + anussaranta] ~

Grammar prp, comp vb
Meaning remembering what was done
Construction kataṃ + anussaranta
Commentary (ANa) pubbe katamanussaran'ti mātāpitūhi paṭhamataraṃ kataguṇaṃ anussarantā.
Sanskrit kṛta + anusmarat
katamasmiṃ

pron. in which? [katama + asmiṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt loc sg of katama, interr
Meaning in which?
Construction katama + asmiṃ
Variant katarasmiṃ
Sanskrit katamasmin

iminā tvaṃ, puṇṇa, mayā saṃkhittena ovādena ovadito katamasmiṃ janapade viharissasī'ti? atthi, bhante, sunāparanto nāma janapado, tatth'āhaṃ viharissāmī'ti.

SN 35.88 puṇṇasuttaṃ
katamettāvatā

sandhi. what has been done is enough; that is sufficient [kataṃ + ettāvatā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pp + adv
Meaning what has been done is enough; that is sufficient
Construction kataṃ + ettāvatā
Sanskrit kṛtam + etāvattva

atha kho āyasmā mahako ārāmaṃ sampāpuṇitvā āyasmantaṃ theraṃ etadavoca, alam'ettāvatā, bhante therā'ti? alam'ettāvatā, āvuso mahaka! katam'ettāvatā, āvuso mahaka! pūjitam'ettāvatā, āvuso mahako'ti.

SN 41.4 mahakapāṭihāriyasuttaṃ

siyā kho pana, bhikkhave, tumhākaṃ evam'assa, hir'ottappen'amha samannāgatā, alam'ettāvatā katam'ettāvatā, anuppatto no sāmaññ'attho, n'atthi no kiñci uttariṃ karaṇīyan'ti tāvataken'eva tuṭṭhiṃ āpajjeyyātha.

ind. in which direction? which way? where? ✗

masc. name of a monk ~

Meaning name of a monk

adj. well drilled; well trained; lit. done training [kata + yoggā + a] ✓

Meaning well drilled; well trained; lit. done training

katayoggā + a

Antonym akatayogga
Sanskrit kṛtayogya (joining in combat)

seyyathā'pi nāma daḷhadhammā dhanuggaho susikkhito katahattho katayoggo kat'ūpāsano lahukena asanena appakasiren'eva tiriyaṃ tālacchāyaṃ atipāteyya.

adj. who has done cruel deeds [kata + ludda] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has done cruel deeds
Construction kata + ludda
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kata + luddāni)
Antonym akataludda

Sanskrit kṛta + raudra

puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatakalyāṇo hoti akatakusalo akatabhīruttāṇo katapāpo kataluddo katakibbiso. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

AN 4.184 abhayasuttaṃ
kataveditā

fem. gratitude; thankfulness; appreciativeness; lit. knowing what is done state [kata + vedī + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from katavedi
Meaning gratitude; thankfulness; appreciativeness; lit. knowing what is done state
Construction kata + vedī + tā
katavedī + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Antonym akataveditā
Sanskrit kṛtavedin +

siyā kho, bhikkhave, tasmiṃ jarasiṅgāle yā kāci kataññutā kataveditā, na tv'eva idh'ekacce sakyaputtiyapaṭiññe siyā yā kāci kataññutā kataveditā.

SN 20.12 dutiyasiṅgālasuttaṃ
katavedī

adj. grateful; thankful; appreciative; lit. knowing what is done [kata + vedī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning grateful; thankful; appreciative; lit. knowing what is done
Construction kata + vedī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kataṃ + vedī)
Antonym akatavedī
Commentary (ANa) kataññū katavedī'ti iminā mayhaṃ katan'ti tena katakammaṃ ñatvā viditaṃ pākaṭaṃ katvā paṭikaraṇakapuggalo.
Sanskrit kṛtavedin

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kataññuno bhavissāma katavedino, na ca no amhesu appakam'pi kataṃ nassissatī'ti. evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabban'ti.

SN 20.12 dutiyasiṅgālasuttaṃ
katasaññī

adj. (+loc) perceiving one has done; imagining one has completed [kata + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving one has done; imagining one has completed
Construction kata + saññī
Compound kammadhāraya (kata + saññī)
Sanskrit kṛta + saṃjñin

adhimāniko kho ayam'āyasmā adhimānasacco, appatte pattasaññī, akate katasaññī, anadhigate adhigatasaññī. adhimānena aññaṃ byākaroti, khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti pajānāmī'ti.

AN 10.86 adhimānasuttaṃ
katasamaṇa

adj. who has completed the ascetic task; who has fulfilled monkhood [kata + samaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has completed the ascetic task; who has fulfilled monkhood
Construction kata + samaṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kata + samaṇaṃ)
Commentary (MNa) katasamaṇassā'ti katasāmaññassa, samaṇadhammassa matthakaṃ pattassā'ti attho.
Sanskrit kṛta + śramaṇa

akathaṃkathissa tusitassa,
vantalok'āmisassa muditassa,
katasamaṇassa manujassa,
antimasārīrassa narassa,
anopamassa virajassa,
bhagavato tassa sāvako'ham'asmi.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
katahattha

adj. skilful; dexterous; lit. made with hands [kata + hattha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning skilful; dexterous; lit. made with hands
Construction kata + hattha
Compound kammadhāraya (kata + hattha)
Antonym akatahattha
Commentary (SNa) katahattho'ti usabhappamāṇe'pi vāl'aggaṃ vijjhituṃ samatthabhāvena katahattho. (ANa) katahattho'ti eko sippam'eva uggaṇhāti, katahattho na hoti ayaṃ pana katahattho ciṇṇavasibhāvo.
Sanskrit kṛtahasta

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, evarūpo javo ahosi, seyyathā'pi nāma daḷhadhammo dhanuggaho sikkhito katahattho kat'ūpāsano lahukena asanena appakasirena tiriyaṃ tālacchāyaṃ atipāteyya.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, cattāro daḷhadhammā dhanuggahā susikkhitā katahatthā kat'ūpāsanā catuddisā ṭhitā assu.

SN 20.6 dhanuggahasuttaṃ
katākata 1

nt. (+gen) commissions and omissions (of); what is done and not done (by) [kata + akata] ✓

Grammar nt, comp (+gen)
Meaning commissions and omissions (of); what is done and not done (by)
Construction kata + akata
Compound dvanda (kata ca akata ca)
Sanskrit kṛta + akṛta

na paresaṃ vilomāni,
na paresaṃ kat'ākataṃ,
attano'va avekkheyya,
katāni akatāni ca.

DHP 50 pupphavaggo
katākata 2

adj. shaped and unshaped; made and unmade; wrought and wrought [kata + akata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning shaped and unshaped; made and unmade; wrought and wrought
Construction kata + akata
Compound dvanda (kata ca akata ca)
Sanskrit kṛta + akṛta

nānappakārakaṃ nāma katam'pi akatam'pi kat'ākatam'pi. kataṃ nāma sīs'ūpagaṃ gīv'ūpagaṃ hatth'ūpagaṃ pād'ūpagaṃ kaṭ'ūpagaṃ. akataṃ nāma ghanakataṃ vuccati. kat'ākataṃ nāma tadubhayaṃ.

VIN 1.4.2.9 rūpiyasaṃvohārasikkhāpadaṃ

samāpajjeyyā'ti katena kataṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ. katena akataṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ. katena kat'ākataṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN 1.4.2.9 rūpiyasaṃvohārasikkhāpadaṃ
katānisaṃsā

masc. how many benefits? how many advantages? [kati + ānisaṃsa + ā] ~

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning how many benefits? how many advantages?
Construction kati + ānisaṃsa + ā
katānisaṃsa + ā
katāvakāsa 1

adj. (+instr) granted permission (by); given leave (by); lit. made space [kata + avakāsa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+instr)
Meaning granted permission (by); given leave (by); lit. made space
Construction kata + avakāsa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kata + avakāsaṃ)
Sanskrit kṛta + avakāśa

atha kho so māṇavako yena brahmāyu brāhmaṇo ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā brahmāyuṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca, kat'āvakāso kho'mhi bhavatā samaṇena gotamena. yassadāni bhavaṃ kālaṃ maññatī'ti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

diṭṭhadhammahit'atthāya,
samparāyasukhāya ca,
kat'āvakāsā pucchāma,
yaṃ kiñci abhipatthitan'ti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
katāvakāsa 2

adj. (+instr) (of a request) accepted (by); granted (by); approved (by); lit. made space [kata + avakāsa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+instr)
Meaning (of a request) accepted (by); granted (by); approved (by); lit. made space
Construction kata + avakāsa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kata + avakāsaṃ)
Sanskrit kṛta + avakāśa

atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmā sahampati kat'āvakāso kho'mhi bhagavatā dhammadesanāyā'ti maṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā tatth'ev'antaradhāyi.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
katāvī

adj. skilled; consummate; complete; lit. who has done [√kar + tāvī] ✓

Grammar adj, app of karoti
Meaning skilled; consummate; complete; lit. who has done
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction √kar + tāvī
Derivative kita (tāvī)
Phonetic Change rt > t
Commentary (SNa) katāvī'ti catūhi maggehi katakicco
Sanskrit kṛtāvin
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

yo hoti bhikkhu arahaṃ katāvī,
khīṇ'āsavo antimadehadhārī,
ahaṃ vadāmī'ti'pi so vadeyya,
mamaṃ vadantī'ti'pi so vadeyyā'ti.

SN 1.25 arahantasuttaṃ
kati

pron. how many? [ka + ti] ✓

Grammar pron, interr
Meaning how many?
Construction ka + ti
Variant katī
Sanskrit kati

kati jāgarataṃ suttā,
kati suttesu jāgarā,
katīhi rajaṃ ādeti,
katīhi parisujjhatī'ti.

SN 1.6 jāgarasuttaṃ

katihi nu kho, bhante, dhammehi tathāgato nissaṭo visaṃyutto vippamutto vimariyādīkatena cetasā viharatī'ti?

AN 10.81 vāhanasuttaṃ
katiaṅgika

adj. consisting of how many parts?; composed of how many factors? [kati + aṅga + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, interr, comp
Meaning consisting of how many parts?; composed of how many factors?
Construction kati + aṅga + ika
katiaṅga + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Compound kammadhāraya (kati + aṅgika)
Sanskrit kati + aṅgaka

paṭhamaṃ pan'āvuso, jhānaṃ katiaṅgikan'ti? paṭhamaṃ kho, āvuso, jhānaṃ pañc'aṅgikaṃ. idh'āvuso, paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa bhikkhuno vitakko ca vattati, vicāro ca pīti ca sukhañ'ca citt'ekaggatā ca.

kata + ikā

Sanskrit kriyākāra

yathā yathā kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, upasaṅkamiṃ tathā tathā pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū n'āsakkhiṃsu sakāya katikāya saṇṭhātuṃ.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
katikā 2

fem. talk, conversation [√kar] ✗
katikkhattuṃ

ind. how many times? ✗
katichindasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.5 (SN1.5) ✗

Grammar aor, comp vb

Construction kati + chindi
katindriya

adj. developed in mind; lit. done faculty [kata + indriya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning developed in mind; lit. done faculty
Construction kata + indriya
Compound kammadhāraya (kata + indriya)
Sanskrit kṛta + indriya

te pabbajitvā sugatassa sāsane,
bhāvetva bojjh'aṅgabalāni paṇḍitā,
udaggacittā sumanā kat'indriyā,
phusiṃsu nibbānapadaṃ asaṅkhatan'ti.

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, evarūpo javo ahosi, seyyathā'pi nāma daḷhadhammo dhanuggaho sikkhito katahattho kat'ūpāsano lahukena asanena appakasirena tiriyaṃ tālacchāyaṃ atipāteyya.

kattha āpo ca pathavī,
tejo vāyo na gādhati,
kattha dīghañ'ca rassañ'ca,
aṇuṃ thūlaṃ subh'āsubhaṃ,
kattha nāmañ'ca rūpañ'ca,
asesaṃ uparujjhatī'ti?

paññā c'eva sati yañ'ca
nāmarūpañ'ca mārisa,
etaṃ me puṭṭho pabrūhi,
kattha-etaṃ uparujjhati.

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind + masc, interr
Meaning and how friends?; and how brothers?
Construction kathaṃ + ca + āvuso
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit kathaṃ + ca + āyusmanto

kathañ'c'āvuso, bhikkhu tathā tathā vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yath'āssa vihāraṃ kappayato na bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hoti, na bhaddikā kālakiriyā?

AN 6.14 bhaddakasuttaṃ
kathañhi

sandhi. how indeed!?; why indeed!? [kathaṃ + hi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind, interr
Meaning how indeed!?; why indeed!?
Construction kathaṃ + hi
Sanskrit katham + hi

kathañ'hi no siyā, bhante! idān'āhaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya amatena abhisitto'ti.

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ

m'āhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, evaṃvādiṃ evaṃdiṭṭhiṃ addasaṃ vā assosiṃ vā. kathañ'hi nāma sayaṃ abhikkamanto, sayaṃ paṭikkamanto evaṃ vakkhati, n'atthi attakāro, n'atthi parakāro'ti!

AN 6.38 attakārīsuttaṃ
kathanācarati

pr. does not speak (like) [kathā + nācarati] ~

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning does not speak (like)
Construction kathā + nācarati
Variant na kathaṃ vadati
kathamatta

masc. how (will they affect) oneself? [kathaṃ + atta] ~

Grammar masc, comp, interr, atta group
Meaning how (will they affect) oneself?
Construction kathaṃ + atta
Sanskrit katham + ātman
kathayati

pr. (+acc) speaks; tells; relates [√kath + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning speaks; tells; relates
Root Family √kath
Root √kath･8 *aya (speak, narrate)
Base √kath + aya > kathaya
Construction kathaya + ti
Sanskrit kathayati
Sanskrit Root √kath 10 (talk)

taṃ kathaṃ kathaye dhīro,
aviruddho anussito,
anunnatena manasā,
apaḷāso asāhaso.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ

na ca katthitā siyā bhikkhu,
na ca vācaṃ payuttaṃ bhāseyya,
pāgabbhiyaṃ na sikkheyya,
kathaṃ viggāhikaṃ na kathayeyya.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
kathala 1

nt. gravel; small stone; pebble ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning gravel; small stone; pebble
Variant kaṭhala, kaṭhalā, kathalā
Sanskrit kaṭhalya, kaṭhilla

attha cakkhumā puriso tīre ṭhito passeyya sippikasambukam'pi sakkharakathalam'pi macchagumbam'pi carantam'pi tiṭṭhantam'pi

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, biḷārabhastā madditā sumadditā suparimadditā, mudukā tūlinī chinnasassarā chinnabhabbharā. atha puriso āgaccheyya kaṭṭhaṃ vā kathalaṃ vā ādāya.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
kathala 2

nt. potsherd [kaṭhalā] ✗
kathali

fem. potsherd; scraper [kaṭhalā] ✗
kathaṃ 1

ind. how? [ka + thaṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, interr, from ka
Meaning how?
Construction ka + thaṃ
Derivative taddhita (thaṃ)
Sanskrit katham

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu attadīpo viharati?

SN 47.14 ukkacelasuttaṃ

yaṃ taṃ apucchimha akittayī no,
aññaṃ taṃ pucchāma tadiṅgha brūhi,
kathaṃ nu dhīrā vitaranti oghaṃ,
jātiṃ jaraṃ sokapariddavañ'ca,
taṃ me muni sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
kathaṃ 2

ind. what's the reason? [ka + thaṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, interr, from ka
Meaning what's the reason?
Construction ka + thaṃ
Derivative taddhita (thaṃ)
Commentary (MNa) kathan'ti kāraṇapucchā. kathaṃ pana tumhe evaṃ viharatha, kena kāraṇena viharatha, taṃ me kāraṇaṃ brūthā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit katham

yathā kathaṃ pana tumhe, anuruddhā, samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā khīrodakībhūtā aññam'aññaṃ piyacakkhūhi sampassantā viharathā'ti?

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
kathaṃ 3

ind. why?; what? [ka] ✗
kathaṃkathā

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning confusion; doubt; questioning; lit. asking how?
Construction kathaṃ + kathā
Compound kammadhāraya (kathaṃ + kathā)
Sanskrit kathaṃkathā

passām'ahaṃ devamanussaloke,
akiñcanaṃ brāhmaṇam'iriyamānaṃ,
taṃ taṃ namassāmi samantacakkhu,
pamuñca maṃ sakka kathaṃkathāhi.

SNP 60 dhotaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 5

yasmiṃ kāmā na vasanti,
taṇhā yassa na vijjati,
kathaṃkathā ca yo tiṇṇo,
vimokkho tassa n'āparo.

SNP 64 todeyya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 9
kathaṃkathī

adj. who is confused; who is not sure; who is in doubt; lit. asking how? [kathaṃ + kathī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is confused; who is not sure; who is in doubt; lit. asking how?
Construction kathaṃ + kathī
Compound kammadhāraya (kathaṃ + kathī)
Antonym akathaṃkathī
Sanskrit kathaṃkathika

eta'r'ahi vā paccuppannam'addhānaṃ ajjhattaṃ kathaṃkathī hoti, ahaṃ nu kho'smi? no nu kho'smi? kiṃ nu kho'smi? kathaṃ nu kho'smi? ayaṃ nu kho satto kuto āgato? so kuhiṃ gāmī bhavissatī'ti?

MN 2.2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

n'āhaṃ sahissāmi pamocanāya,
kathaṃkathiṃ dhotaka kañci loke,
dhammañ'ca seṭṭhaṃ abhijānamāno,
evaṃ tuvaṃ ogham'imaṃ taresi.

kathaṃjīviṃ jīvitam'āhu seṭṭhan'ti.

pucchito uttamaṃ naraṃ.

ko gambhīre na sīdatī'ti.

Sanskrit katham + ayam

Sanskrit kathā + vastu

appicchakathā, santuṭṭhikathā, pavivekakathā, asaṃsaggakathā, vīriy'ārambhakathā, sīlakathā, samādhikathā, paññākathā, vimuttikathā, vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā'ti, imāni kho, bhikkhave, dasa kathāvatthūni.

itiha bhagavā dīghatapassiṃ nigaṇṭhaṃ imasmiṃ kathāvatthusmiṃ yāvatatiyakaṃ patiṭṭhāpesi.

Grammar masc, comp

Commentary (MNa) kathāsallāpo'ti api nāma koci kathāsamudācāro'pi bhaveyya.
Notes + gen + saddhiṃ + instr = conversation between
Sanskrit kathā + saṃlāpa

app'eva nāma mayaṃ kadāci karahaci tena bhotā gotamena samāgaccheyyāma? app'eva nāma siyā koci'd'eva kathāsallāpo'ti!

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

ekam'antaṃ nisinnā kho therā bhikkhū yāvatako ahosi sabbeh'eva saddhiṃ kathāsallāpo, taṃ sabbaṃ bhagavato ārocesuṃ.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

Sanskrit kathika
Sanskrit Root √kath 10 (talk)

saṅghagato kho pana anānākathiko hoti atiracchānakathiko. sāmaṃ vā dhammaṃ bhāsati, paraṃ vā ajjhesati, ariyaṃ vā tuṇhībhāvaṃ n'ātimaññati.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ

evaṃ pabbajito c'āhaṃ,
na cirena bahussuto,
ahosiṃ dhammakathiko,
vicittapaṭibhāṇavā.

itaro kathetabbaniyāmen'eva pañhaṃ kathetvā'pi tassa kathāya, apañho nu kho mayā kathito'ti vimatiṃ karoti.

Variant kaṭhina
Sanskrit kaṭhina

bhūmiṃ gato bhūmigato, sabbarattiṃ sobhaṇo sabbarattisobhaṇo. apāyaṃ gato apāyagato, issarena kataṃ issarakataṃ, sallena viddho sallaviddho, kathinassa dussaṃ kathinadussaṃ

kathī

adj. (+acc) talking (about); asking (about) [√kath + ā + ī] ✓

Sanskrit kathika
Sanskrit Root √kath 10 (talk)

yass'ālayā na vijjanti,
aññāya akathaṃkathī,
amat'ogadham'anuppattaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 411 brāhmaṇavaggo

eta'r'ahi vā paccuppannam'addhānaṃ ajjhattaṃ kathaṃkathī hoti, ahaṃ nu kho'smi? no nu kho'smi? kiṃ nu kho'smi? kathaṃ nu kho'smi? ayaṃ nu kho satto kuto āgato? so kuhiṃ gāmī bhavissatī'ti?

MN 2.2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
katheti 1

pr. (+acc) speaks; tells; talks [√kath + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning speaks; tells; talks

Root √kath･8 *e (speak, narrate)

Construction kathe + ti
Sanskrit kathayati
Sanskrit Root √kath 10 (talk)

mā, bhikkhave, viggāhikakathaṃ katheyyātha, na tvaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānāsi, ahaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānāmi. kiṃ tvaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānissasi!

SN 56.9 viggāhikakathāsuttaṃ

anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathessāmī'ti paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo.

Sanskrit Root √kath 10 (talk)

pañhaṃ puṭṭho'pi, pañhaṃ kathessāmī'ti hanuṃ saṃsodheti, so itarena, idaṃ nāma kathessasī'ti vutto ñātabhāvaṃ ñatvā, na etaṃ, aññaṃ kathessāmī'ti vadati. evaṃ parikappe na saṇṭhāti nāma.

ANa 3.68 kathāvatthusuttavaṇṇanā

Sanskrit kath + kāma

aññavādako nāma saṅghamajjhe vatthusmiṃ vā āpattiyā vā anuyuñjīyamāno taṃ na kathetu'kāmo taṃ na ugghāṭetu'kāmo aññen'aññaṃ paṭicarati

VIN 2.5.2.2 aññavādakasikkhāpadaṃ

vihesako nāma saṅghamajjhe vatthusmiṃ vā āpattiyā vā anuyuñjīyamāno taṃ na kathetu'kāmo taṃ na ugghāṭetu'kāmo tuṇhībhūto saṅghaṃ viheseti. eso vihesako nāma.

aññavādako nāma saṅghamajjhe vatthusmiṃ vā āpattiyā vā anuyuñjīyamāno taṃ na kathetu'kāmo taṃ na ugghāṭetu'kāmo aññen'aññaṃ paṭicarati

VIN 2.5.2.2 aññavādakasikkhāpadaṃ

evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hotī'ti, bhikkhave, etaṃ imasmiṃ ca kāraṇe sati ayaṃ puggalo na kathetuṃ yutto nāma hoti.

te vādakāmā parisaṃ vigayha,
bālaṃ dahantī mithu aññam'aññaṃ,
vadanti te aññasitā kath'ojjaṃ,
pasaṃsakāmā kusalā vadānā.

aṭṭhakavaggo 8

ete vivādā samaṇesu jātā,
etesu ugghāti nighāti hoti,
etam'pi disvā virame kath'ojjaṃ,
na h'añña'd'atth'atthi pasaṃsalābhā.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
kadariya 1

adj. miserly; stingy; niggardly; lit. mean noble [ku + ariya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from ariya
Meaning miserly; stingy; niggardly; lit. mean noble
Construction ku > kad + ariya
Phonetic Change ku > kad
Compound kammadhāraya (kad + ariya)
Commentary (SNa) kadariyā'ti idaṃ maccharino'ti padass'eva vevacanaṃ. mudukam'pi hi macchariyaṃ macchariyan't'eva vuccati, thaddhaṃ pana kadariyaṃ nāma.
Sanskrit kadarya

na ve kadariyā devalokaṃ vajanti,
bālā have nappasaṃsanti dānaṃ,
dhīro ca dānaṃ anumodamāno,
ten'eva so hoti sukhī parattha.

DHP 177 lokavaggo

rosako kadariyo ca,
pāpiccho maccharī saṭho,
ahiriko anottappī,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7
kadariya 2

Phonetic Change ku > kad
Compound kammadhāraya (kad + ariya)
Antonym dāna
Sanskrit kadarya

akkodhena jine kodhaṃ,
asādhuṃ sādhunā jine,
jine kadariyaṃ dānena,
saccen'ālikavādinaṃ.

gabbho assatariṃ yathā'ti.

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

tatr'assa pallaṅko gonak'atthato paṭik'atthato paṭalik'atthato kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇo sauttaracchado ubhato lohitak'ūpadhāno

AN 3.35 hatthakasuttaṃ
kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇa 1

nt. spread made from high-quality antelope leather; lit. antelope beast excellent spread [kadali + miga + pavara + paccattharaṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning spread made from high-quality antelope leather; lit. antelope beast excellent spread
Construction kadali + miga + pavara + paccattharaṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (kadalimigapavara + paccattharaṇa)
Variant kadalimigapavarapaccttharaṇa, kādalimigapavarapaccattharaṇa
Commentary (SNa) kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇānī'ti kadalimigacammamayena uttamapaccattharaṇena atthatāni. taṃ kira paccattharaṇaṃ setavatthassa upari kadalimigacammaṃ attharitvā sibbetvā karonti.
Sanskrit kadalin + mṛga + pravara + pratyāstaraṇa

kodhano'yaṃ, bhikkhave, purisapuggalo kodh'ābhibhūto kodhapareto, kiñ'c'āpi so pallaṅke seti gonak'atthate paṭalik'atthate kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇe sauttaracchade ubhatolohitak'ūpadhāne, atha kho so dukkhaññ'eva seti kodh'ābhibhūto.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītipallaṅkasahassāni ahesuṃ dantamayāni sāramayāni sovaṇṇamayāni goṇak'atthatāni paṭik'atthatāni paṭalik'atthatāni kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇāni sauttaracchadāni ubhatolohitak'ūpadhānāni.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇa 2

adj. with a spread made from high-quality antelope leather; lit. antelope beast excellent spread [kadali + miga + pavara + paccattharaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a spread made from high-quality antelope leather; lit. antelope beast excellent spread
Construction kadali + miga + pavara + paccattharaṇa

Commentary (SNa) kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇānī'ti kadalimigacammamayena uttamapaccattharaṇena atthatāni. taṃ kira paccattharaṇaṃ setavatthassa upari kadalimigacammaṃ attharitvā sibbetvā karonti.
Sanskrit kadalin + mṛga + pravara + pratyāstaraṇa

seyyathā'pi, sāriputta, pāsādo, tatr'āssa kūṭāgāraṃ ullittāvalittaṃ nivātaṃ phusitaggaḷaṃ pihitavātapānaṃ. tatrāssa pallaṅko gonak'atthato paṭik'atthato paṭalik'atthato kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇo sauttaracchado ubhatolohitak'ūpadhāno.

fem. younger sister ✗
kanta 1.1

rūpā saddā rasā gandhā,
phassā dhammā ca kevalā,
iṭṭhā kantā manāpā ca,
yāvat'atthī'ti vuccati.

MN 13 mahā dukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ

so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati sammohaṃ āpajjati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bahiddhā asati paritassanā hotī'ti.

Meaning equal (to); identical (to); just like
Root Family √kapp
Root √kapp･1 a (be fit, be suitable)
Construction √kapp + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (MNa) satthukappenā'ti satthusadisena. iti ekapadene'va āyasmā puṇṇo sāriputtattheraṃ candamaṇḍalaṃ āhacca ṭhapento viya ukkhipi.
Sanskrit kalpa
Sanskrit Root √kḷp 1 (be adapted)

satthukappena vata kira, bho, sāvakena saddhiṃ mantayamānā na jānimha, āyasmā sāriputto'ti.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
kappa 2.1

Meaning thought; speculation; mental fabrication; imagination

Root √kapp･8 *e (think)

Sanskrit kalpa

kappāni viceyya kevalāni,

vigatarajam'anaṅgaṇaṃ visuddhaṃ,
pattaṃ jātikhayaṃ tam'āhu buddhan'ti.

vītagedho amaccharī,
na ussesu vadate muni,
na samesu na omesu,
kappaṃ n'eti akappiyo.

pāraṅ'gato na pacceti tādī'ti.

aṭṭhakavaggo 5

accantasuddhī'ti na te vadanti,
ādānaganthaṃ gathitaṃ visajja,
āsaṃ na kubbanti kuhiñci loke.

VIN 2.5.2.7 anupakhajjasikkhāpadaṃ
kappetvā 1.1

abs. (+acc) (of thought) having fashioned; having formulated; having constructed; having devised [√kapp + *e + tvā] ~

Grammar abs of kappeti, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of thought) having fashioned; having formulated; having constructed; having devised
Root Family √kapp
Root √kapp･8 *e (think)
Base √kapp + e > kappe
Construction kappe + tvā
Sanskrit kalpayitvā
Sanskrit Root √kḷp 1 (be adapted)

Construction kappe + tvā

tatr'āsayaṃ kappetvā amuṃ nivāpaṃ nivuttaṃ nevāpikassa ananupakhajja amucchitā bhojanāni bhuñjiṃsu, te tattha ananupakhajja amucchitā bhojanāni bhuñjamānā na madaṃ āpajjiṃsu, amattā samānā na pamādaṃ āpajjiṃsu

masc. headless (trunk of the) body ✗
kabaracchāya

adj. with patchy shade; with sparse cover [kabara + chāyā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with patchy shade; with sparse cover
Construction kabara + chāyā + a
kabaracchāyā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (kabara + chāya)
Commentary (MNa) kabaracchāyo'ti viraḷacchāyo.
Sanskrit kavara + chāyā

seyyathā'pi, sāriputta, rukkho visame bhūmibhāge jāto tanupattapalāso kabaracchāyo. atha puriso āgaccheyya ghammābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito ekāyanena maggena tam'eva rukkhaṃ paṇidhāya.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

kaṭukabhedano dunnivārayo,
baddho kabaḷaṃ na bhuñjati,
sumarati nāgavanassa kuñjaro.

DHP 324 nāgavaggo

n'ātimahantaṃ kabaḷaṃ karissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

na kabaḷ'āvacchedakaṃ bhuñjitabbaṃ. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca kabaḷ'āvacchedakaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.5 kabaḷavaggo
kabaḷikā

fem. poultice, compress [kabaḷa] ✗
kabaḷiṃkāra

Meaning (of food) material; physical; edible; lit. made into morsels
Construction kabaḷaṃ > kabaḷiṃ + kāra

Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kabaḷaṃ + kāra)
Variant kabaliṅkāra, kabaḷīkāra
Commentary (MNa) kabaḷīkāro āhāro'ti kabaḷaṃ katvā ajjhoharitabbato kabaḷīkāro āhāro, odanakummās'ādivatthukāya ojāy'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit kavalīkṛ

Variant kabaḷīkārabhakkha, kabaḷīkārāhārabhakkha
Commentary (ANa) kabaḷīkār'āhārabhakkhānaṃ devānan'ti kām'āvacaradevānaṃ.
Sanskrit kavalīkṛ + āhāra + bhakṣa
kabaḷīkāra

adj. (of food) material; physical; edible; lit. made into morsels [kabaḷa + kāra] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (of food) material; physical; edible; lit. made into morsels
Construction kabaḷa > kabaḷī + kāra
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kabaḷaṃ + kāra)
Variant kabaliṅkāra, kabaḷiṃkāra
Commentary (MNa) kabaḷīkāro āhāro'ti kabaḷaṃ katvā ajjhoharitabbato kabaḷīkāro āhāro, odanakummās'ādivatthukāya ojāy'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit kavalīkṛ

katame cattāro? kabaḷīkāro āhāro, oḷāriko vā sukhumo vā, phasso dutiyo, manosañcetanā tatiyā, viññāṇaṃ catutthaṃ.

SN 12.12 moḷiyaphaggunasuttaṃ

kabaḷīkāre ce, bhikkhave, āhāre atthi rāgo atthi nandī atthi taṇhā, patiṭṭhitaṃ tattha viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ. yattha patiṭṭhitaṃ viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ, atthi tattha nāmarūpassa avakkanti.

SN 12.64 atthirāgasuttaṃ
kabaḷīkārabhakkha

adj. feeding on physical food; eating material sustenance ✗
kabaḷīkārāhāra

masc. physical food; material sustenance; lit. food made into morsels [kabaḷīkāra + āhāra] ✓

Sanskrit kavalīkṛ + āhāra

saññā nu kho, bhante, purisassa attā, udāhu aññā saññā añño attā'ti? kaṃ pana tvaṃ, poṭṭhapāda, attānaṃ paccesī'ti? oḷārikaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, attānaṃ paccemi rūpiṃ cātumahābhūtikaṃ kabaḷīkār'āhārabhakkhan'ti.

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā

katamo ca, poṭṭhapāda, oḷāriko attapaṭilābho? rūpī cātumahābhūtiko kabaḷīkār'āhārabhakkho, ayaṃ oḷāriko attapaṭilābho.

DN 9.7 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, tayo attapaṭilābhā

aṅguttar'aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana paṭhamaṃ veripuggalo karuṇāyitabbo, tasmiṃ cittaṃ muduṃ katvā duggato, tato piyapuggalo, tato attā'ti, ayaṃ kamo vutto.

Sanskrit kimartha, kadartha + anubhavati

Sanskrit Root √kam 3, 5 (love)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, rañño vā rājamahāmattassa vā vīṇāya saddo assutapubbo assa. so vīṇāsaddaṃ suṇeyya. so evaṃ vadeyya, ambho, kassa nu kho eso saddo evaṃrajanīyo evaṃkamanīyo evaṃmadanīyo evaṃmucchanīyo evaṃbandhanīyo'ti?

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

na santi kāmā manujesu niccā,
sant'īdha kamanīyāni yesu baddho,
yesu pamatto apun'āgamanaṃ,
anāgantā puriso maccudheyyā'ti.

ariye pathe kamamānaṃ mahesin'ti.

so antaraghare nisinno samāno na chambhati na kampati na vedhati na paritassati. so achambhī akampī avedhī aparitassī vigatalomahaṃso.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

phuṭṭhassa lokadhammehi,
cittaṃ yassa na kampati,
asokaṃ virajaṃ khemaṃ,
etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.

t'ādisaṃ bhikkhum'āsajja,
kaṇha dukkhaṃ nigacchasi.

yo ve buddhena codito,
bhikkhu saṅghassa pekkhato,
migāramātupāsādaṃ,
pād'aṅguṭṭhena kampayi.

niyyānikaṃ vata buddhasāsanan'ti pasīditvā yojanikaṃ suvaṇṇacetiyaṃ kambalakañcukena parikkhipitvā tattha tattha rathacakkappamāṇehi suvaṇṇapadumehi alaṅ'kari.

kambala 2

adj. woollen; made of wool ✓

Meaning woollen; made of wool

suttaṃ nāma cha suttāni, khomaṃ kappāsikaṃ koseyyaṃ kambalaṃ sāṇaṃ bhaṅgaṃ.
