Grammar nt, irreg, from karoti
Meaning action; deed; doing
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction √kar + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Phonetic Change r > m
Sanskrit karman
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

iti kho, ānanda, kammaṃ khettaṃ, viññāṇaṃ bījaṃ, taṇhā sneho.

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ

cetan'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, kammaṃ vadāmi. cetayitvā kammaṃ karoti, kāyena vācāya manasā.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ
kamma 2

nt. work; job; occupation [√kar + ma] ✓

Grammar nt, irreg, from karoti
Meaning work; job; occupation
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction √kar + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Phonetic Change r > m
Antonym akamma
Sanskrit karman
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

sutvāna corā isino subhāsitaṃ,
nikkhippa satthāni ca āvudhāni ca,
tamhā ca kammā viramiṃsu eke,
eke ca pabbajjam'arocayiṃsu.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

taṃ hoti jātarūpaṃ dhantaṃ sandhantaṃ niddhantaṃ aniddhantaṃ anihitaṃ aninnītakasāvaṃ, na c'eva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ, na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca, na ca sammā upeti kammāya.

upasantassa tādino.

taṃ jano kurute piyaṃ.

DHP 217 piyavaggo

sace cuto sīlavatato hoti,
pavedhatī kamma virādhayitvā,
pajappatī patthayatī ca suddhiṃ,
satthā'va hīno pavasaṃ gharamhā.

VIN 1.2.13 kuladūsakasikkhāpadaṃ
kammakara 1

masc. worker; manual labourer; lit. doing work [kamma + kara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, from kammaṃ karoti
Meaning worker; manual labourer; lit. doing work
Construction kamma + kara
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kammaṃ + kara)
Commentary (MNa) kammakarā'ti bhattavetanabhatā.
Sanskrit karmakara

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yo so bhattu abbhantaro antojano, dāsā'ti vā pessā'ti vā kammakarā'ti vā, tesaṃ katañ'ca katato jānāti akatañ'ca akatato jānāti, gilānakānañ'ca bal'ābalaṃ jānāti khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyañ'c'assa paccaṃsena saṃvibhajati.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ

ye'pi'ssa te honti dāsā'ti vā pessā'ti vā kammakarā'ti vā, te'pi daṇḍatajjitā bhayatajjitā assumukhā rudamānā parikammāni karonti.

ny > ññ
Antonym akammañña
Variant kammanīya, kammaniya

Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yato kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu taṃ tadeva samāpattiṃ samāpajjati'pi vuṭṭhāti'pi, tassa mudu cittaṃ hoti kammaññaṃ. mudunā kammaññena cittena appamāṇo samādhi hoti subhāvito.

Sanskrit karmaṇya, karmaṇiya (bsk)

yato ca kho, bhikkhave, adhicittam'anuyutto bhikkhu kālena kālaṃ samādhinimittaṃ manasi karoti, kālena kālaṃ paggahanimittaṃ manasi karoti, kālena kālaṃ upekkhānimittaṃ manasi karoti, taṃ hoti cittaṃ muduñ'ca kammaniyañ'ca pabhassarañ'ca, na ca pabhaṅgu, sammā samādhiyati āsavānaṃ khayāya.

AN 3.103 nimittasuttaṃ

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhaṃ jātarūpaṃ na c'eva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca na ca sammā upeti kammāya.

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the end of intentional action
Construction kamma + nirodha + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kammanirodhaṃ + gāmī)
Sanskrit karman + nirodha + gāmin

kammaṃ, bhikkhave, veditabbaṃ, kammānaṃ nidānasambhavo veditabbo, kammānaṃ vemattatā veditabbā, kammānaṃ vipāko veditabbo, kammanirodho veditabbo, kammanirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbā.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ
kammanirodhasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.146 (SN35.146) ✗
kammanta 1

masc. work; business activity [kamma + anta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning work; business activity
Construction kamma + anta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kammassa + anta)
Sanskrit karmānta

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave puriso iṇaṃ ādāya kamm'ante payojeyya

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi vā pana, bho gotama, ye kec'ime balakaraṇīyā kammantā karīyanti, sabbe te pathaviṃ nissāya pathaviyaṃ patiṭṭhāya. evam'ete balakaraṇīyā kammantā karīyanti.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
kammanta 2

masc. workplace; business premises [kamma + anta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning workplace; business premises
Construction kamma + anta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kammassa + anta)
Sanskrit karmānta

atha kho bhagavā pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaram'ādāya yena kasibhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa kamm'anto ten'upasaṅkami.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ pitu sakkassa kamm'ante sītāya jambucchāyāya nisinno vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharitā.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
kammanta 3

masc. deed; action; activity [kamma + anta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, in comps
Meaning deed; action; activity
Construction kamma + anta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kammassa + anta)
Sanskrit karmānta

tassa mayhaṃ brāhmaṇa, etadahosi, ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā aparisuddhakāyakammantā araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, aparisuddhakāyakammantasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ

kiṃ nu kho me ayyā santaṃ'y'eva nu kho ajjhattaṃ kopaṃ na pātukaroti udāhu asantaṃ udāhu mayham'ev'ete kammantā susaṃvihitā yena me ayyā santaṃ'y'eva ajjhattaṃ kopaṃ na pātukaroti, no asantaṃ?

kammapaccayā

ind. due to (one's) deeds; because of (one's) actions [kamma + paccayā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to (one's) deeds; because of (one's) actions
Construction kamma + paccayā
Compound abyayībhāva (kamma + paccayā)
Commentary (KPa) kammapaccayā, attanā katassa adānadānappaṭisedhan'ādibhedassa kadariyakammassa paccayā. tañ'hi tesaṃ kammaṃ ñātīnaṃ sarituṃ na deti.
Sanskrit karman + pratyayāt

pahūte annapānamhi,
khajjabhojje upaṭṭhite,
na tesaṃ koci sarati,
sattānaṃ kammapaccayā.

KHP7 tirokuṭṭasuttaṃ

adj. with actions as refuge; supported by deeds; lit. action refuge [kamma + paṭisaraṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with actions as refuge; supported by deeds; lit. action refuge
Construction kamma + paṭisaraṇa

Commentary (MNa) kammaṃ etesaṃ paṭisaraṇaṃ patiṭṭhā'ti kammapaṭisaraṇā.
Sanskrit karman + pratisaraṇa

kammassakomhi kammadāy'ādo kammayoni kammabandhu kammapaṭisaraṇo, yaṃ kammaṃ karissāmi kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā tassa dāy'ādo bhavissāmī'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ

AN 10.48 dasadhammasuttaṃ
kammapatha

masc. course of action; mode of action; path of action [kamma + patha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning course of action; mode of action; path of action
Construction kamma + patha

Sanskrit karmapatha

vāc'ānurakkhī manasā susaṃvuto,
kāyena ca n'ākusalaṃ kayirā,
ete tayo kammapathe visodhaye,
ārādhaye maggam'isippaveditaṃ.

DHP 281 maggavaggo

ime kho, cunda, dasa akusalakammapathā. imehi kho, cunda, dasahi akusalehi kammapathehi samannāgato kālass'eva uṭṭhahanto'va sayanamhā pathaviṃ ce'pi āmasati, asuci'y'eva hoti.

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi
kammaphala

nt. fruit or result of karma ✗
kammaphalūpajīvī

adj. living off the fruit of one's actions [kamma + phalūpajīvī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning living off the fruit of one's actions
Construction kamma + phalūpajīvī
Commentary (ANa) uṭṭhānavīriyen'eva divasaṃ vītināmetvā tassa nissandaphalamattaṃ kiñcideva labhitvā jīvikaṃ kappeti, taṃ pana uṭṭhānaṃ āgamma kiñci puññaphalaṃ nappaṭilabhati, ayaṃ uṭṭhānaphal'ūpajīvī na kammaphal'ūpajīvī nāma. cātumahārājike pana deve ādiṃ katvā sabbe'pi devā uṭṭhānavīriyena vinā puññaphalasseva upajīvanato kammaphal'ūpajīvino na uṭṭhānaphal'ūpajīvino nāma. rājarājamahāmatt'ādayo uṭṭhānaphal'ūpajīvino ca kammaphal'ūpajīvino ca. nerayikasattā n'eva uṭṭhānaphal'ūpajīvino na kammaphal'ūpajīvino.
kammabandhu

adj. who is bound by actions; who is related to actions; lit. relative of actions [kamma + bandhu] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is bound by actions; who is related to actions; lit. relative of actions
Construction kamma + bandhu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kammānaṃ + bandhu)
Commentary (MNa) kammaṃ etesaṃ bandhū'ti kammabandhū. kammañātakā'ti attho.
Sanskrit karmabandha

kammassakomhi kammadāy'ādo kammayoni kammabandhu kammapaṭisaraṇo, yaṃ kammaṃ karissāmi kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā tassa dāy'ādo bhavissāmī'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ

AN 10.48 dasadhammasuttaṃ
kammayanta

nt. force or compulsion of action ✗
kammayantavighāṭana

idh'āvuso, bhikkhu kamm'ārāmo hoti kammarato kamm'ārāmataṃ anuyutto, bhass'ārāmo hoti bhassarato bhass'ārāmataṃ anuyutto, nidd'ārāmo hoti niddārato nidd'ārāmataṃ anuyutto

AN 6.14 bhaddakasuttaṃ
kammalakkhaṇa

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning characterized by one's actions; defined by one's deeds
Construction kamma + lakkhaṇa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kammuno + lakkhaṇa)
Sanskrit karman + lakṣaṇa

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kammalakkhaṇo bālo, kammalakkhaṇo paṇḍito'ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti.

AN 11.17 gopālasuttaṃ
kammavagga

masc. Chapter 24 of Catukkanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.232-242 ✗
kammavācā

fem. (vinaya) proclamation of the legal proposition; official legal statement; lit. stating of the matter [kamma + vācā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning (vinaya) proclamation of the legal proposition; official legal statement; lit. stating of the matter
Construction kamma + vācā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kammassa + vācā)
Sanskrit karmavācanā (bsk)

upasampādessāmī'ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariyaṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa. ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ. dvīhi kammavācāhi dukkaṭā.

VIN 2.5.7.5 ūnavīsativassasikkhāpadaṃ

ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ. dvīhi kammavācāhi dukkaṭā. kammavācāpariyosāne āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.7.8 ariṭṭhasikkhāpadaṃ
kammavācāpariyosāna

nt. (vinaya) completion of the legal statement; conclusion of the legal proposition; lit. end of stating of the matter [kammavācā + pariyosāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning (vinaya) completion of the legal statement; conclusion of the legal proposition; lit. end of stating of the matter
Construction kammavācā + pariyosāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kammavācāya + pariyosāna)
Sanskrit karmavācanā (bsk) + paryavasāna

ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ. dvīhi kammavācāhi dukkaṭā. kammavācāpariyosāne upajjhāyassa āpatti pācittiyassa. gaṇassa ca ācariyassa ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.5.7.5 ūnavīsativassasikkhāpadaṃ

ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ. dvīhi kammavācāhi dukkaṭā. kammavācāpariyosāne āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.7.8 ariṭṭhasikkhāpadaṃ
kammavāda 1

masc. (proponent of) doctrine of causality; who hold the view that actions have consequences [kamma + vāda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (proponent of) doctrine of causality; who hold the view that actions have consequences
Construction kamma + vāda
Compound kammadhāraya (kamma + vāda)
Sanskrit karman + vāda

sant'āvuso sāriputta, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā kammavādā sayaṃkataṃ sukhadukkhaṃ paññapenti. santi pan'āvuso sāriputta, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā kammavādā paraṃkataṃ sukhadukkhaṃ paññapenti.

SN 12.25 bhūmijasuttaṃ

kammavādī

masc. believing in karma ✗

Meaning failure of a legal action

masc. fruit of actions; results of one's deeds [kamma + vipāka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fruit of actions; results of one's deeds
Construction kamma + vipāka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kammānaṃ + vipāka)
Commentary (ANa) kammavipāko'ti diṭṭhadhammavedanīy'ādīnaṃ kammānaṃ vipāko.
Sanskrit karmavipāka

kammavipāko, bhikkhave, acinteyyo, na cintetabbo, yaṃ cintento ummādassa vighātassa bhāgī assa.

AN 4.77 acinteyyasuttaṃ

pittaṃ semhañ'ca vāto ca,
sannipātā utūni ca,
visamaṃ opakkamikaṃ,
kammavipākena aṭṭhamī'ti.

SN 36.21 sīvakasuttaṃ
kammavipākakovida

adj. skilled in action and its results [kammavipāka + kovida] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning skilled in action and its results
Construction kammavipāka + kovida
kammavipākaja

adj. caused by the effect of actions; generated by the results of one's deeds; lit. born from fruit of action [kamma + vipāka + ja] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning caused by the effect of actions; generated by the results of one's deeds; lit. born from fruit of action
Construction kamma + vipāka + ja
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (kammavipākasmā + ja)
Commentary (SNa) kammavipākajānī'ti kevalaṃ kammavipākato jātāni. tesu'pi hi uppannesu vuttanayen'eva koci kusalaṃ karoti, koci akusalaṃ, koci adhivāsento nipajjati. evaṃ sabbavāresu tividhāva vedanā honti. (ANa) kammavipākajā'ti balavakammavipākasambhūtā.
Sanskrit karmavipāka + ja

pittasamuṭṭhānāni'pi ... semhasamuṭṭhānāni'pi ... vātasamuṭṭhānāni'pi … sannipātikāni'pi … utupariṇāmajāni'pi … visamaparihārajāni'pi … opakkamikāni'pi … kammavipākajāni'pi kho, sīvaka, idh'ekaccāni vedayitāni uppajjanti.

SN 36.21 sīvakasuttaṃ

iti imasmiṃ kāye vividhā ābādhā uppajjanti, seyyath'idaṃ ... pittasamuṭṭhānā ābādhā semhasamuṭṭhānā ābādhā vātasamuṭṭhānā ābādhā sannipātikā ābādhā utupariṇāmajā ābādhā visamaparihārajā ābādhā opakkamikā ābādhā kammavipākajā ābādhā sītaṃ uṇhaṃ jighacchā pipāsā uccāro passāvo'ti.

AN 10.60 girimānandasuttaṃ
kammavipākajasutta

nt. Udāna 21 (UD 21) ✗

Meaning turning around of kamma; revolution of deeds; cycle of action

kammavisuddhimattano

sandhi. one’s own pure deeds [kamma + visuddhiṃ + attano] ✓

Grammar sandhi, nt + adj + masc
Meaning one’s own pure deeds
Construction kamma + visuddhiṃ + attano
Antonym kammakiliṭṭhamattano
Sanskrit karman + viśuddhi + ātmanaḥ

idha modati pecca modati,
katapuñño ubhay'attha modati,
so modati so pamodati,
disvā kammavisuddhim'attano.

DHP 16 yamakavaggo
kammasacca

Meaning having action is its reality; with deeds as its substance; with activity as fundamental; (comm) having action as inherent nature; lit. action truth

Commentary (ANa) kammasaccāyaṃ bho loko'ti bho ayaṃ loko kammasabhāvo.
kammasamaya

masc. time of work; time of physical activity [kamma + samaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning time of work; time of physical activity
Construction kamma + samaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kammassa + samaya)

Sanskrit karman + samaya

tatth'āyaṃ samayo diyaḍḍho māso seso gimhānan'ti vassānassa paṭhamo māso icc'ete aḍḍhateyyamāsā uṇhasamayo, pariḷāhasamayo, gilānasamayo, kammasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, vātavuṭṭhisamayo

VIN PAT PC 57 nahānasikkhāpadaṃ
kammasamādāna

nt. undertaking of activity; doing of a deed [kamma + samādāna] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning undertaking of activity; doing of a deed
Construction kamma + samādāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kammānaṃ + samādāna)
Commentary (ANa) kammasamādānānan'ti samādiyitvā katānaṃ kusal'ākusalakammānaṃ, kammam'eva vā kammasamādānaṃ.
Sanskrit karman + samādāna

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, tathāgato atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannānaṃ kammasamādānānaṃ ṭhānaso hetuso vipākaṃ yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.

AN 10.21 sīhanādasuttaṃ
kammasamādānasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 52.16 (SN52.16) ✗
kammasamārambhaṭṭhāyī

adj. continuing through initiating action; persisting through the performance of deeds [kammasamārambha + ṭhāyī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning continuing through initiating action; persisting through the performance of deeds
Construction kammasamārambha + ṭhāyī
Commentary (ANa) kammasamārambhaṭṭhāyī'ti kammasamārambhena tiṭṭhati. kammaṃ āyūhanto'va tiṭṭhati, anāyūhanto ucchijjatī'ti dīpeti.
kammasamudaya

masc. arising of action; initiating deeds [kamma + samudaya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning arising of action; initiating deeds
Construction kamma + samudaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kammuno + samudaya)
Antonym kammanirodha
Commentary (ANa) taṃ kammaṃ kammasamudayāya saṃvattatī'ti taṃ kammaṃ aññesam'pi vaṭṭagāmikammānaṃ samudayāya piṇḍakaraṇ'atthāya saṃvattati.
kammasampatti

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning success of a legal action
Construction kamma + sampatti
Commentary (VMVt) kammasampattiyo'ti sampannakammāni, visuddhakammānī'ti attho.
kammasampadā

fem. successful action; accomplished deed [kamma + sampadā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning successful action; accomplished deed
Construction kamma + sampadā
Commentary (ANa) karoti kammasampadan'ti paripuṇṇakammaṃ karoti.
Sanskrit karman + sampradā

vijjācaraṇasampanne,
laddhā cittassa sampadaṃ,
karoti kammasampadaṃ,
labhati c'atthasampadaṃ.

AN 8.34 khettasuttaṃ
kammasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.263 (AN4.263) ✗
kammassaka

adj. owner of actions; actions are one's property; lit. action property [kamma + saka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning owner of actions; actions are one's property; lit. action property
Construction kamma + saka
Compound kammadhāraya (kamma + saka)
Commentary (MNa) tattha kammaṃ etesaṃ sakaṃ attano bhaṇḍakan'ti kammassakā.
Sanskrit karman + svaka

kammassako'mhi kammadāy'ādo kammayoni kammabandhu kammapaṭisaraṇo, yaṃ kammaṃ karissāmi kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā tassa dāy'ādo bhavissāmī'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ

AN 10.48 dasadhammasuttaṃ
kammassakatā

fem. fact of being the owner of one's actions; fact that actions are one's property; lit. action property state [kamma + sakatā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning fact of being the owner of one's actions; fact that actions are one's property; lit. action property state
Construction kamma + sakatā
Compound kammadhāraya (kamma + sakatā)
Commentary (ADHa) kammassakataṃ vā'ti idaṃ kammaṃ sattānaṃ sakaṃ, idaṃ no sakan'ti evaṃ jānanañāṇaṃ.
Sanskrit karman + svaka +
kammassakomhi

idiom. I am the owner of my actions; my actions are my own property; lit. action property I am [kammasako + amhi] ✓

Grammar idiom, adj + pr
Meaning I am the owner of my actions; my actions are my own property; lit. action property I am
Construction kammasako + amhi
Commentary (MNa) tattha kammaṃ etesaṃ sakaṃ attano bhaṇḍakan'ti kammassakā.
Sanskrit karman + svaka + asmi

kammassako'mhi kammadāy'ādo kammayoni kammabandhu kammapaṭisaraṇo, yaṃ kammaṃ karissāmi kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā tassa dāy'ādo bhavissāmī'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ

AN 10.48 dasadhammasuttaṃ
kammāra

masc. smith; metal worker; blacksmith [√kar + ma + āra] ✓

Grammar masc, from kamma
Meaning smith; metal worker; blacksmith
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction √kar + ma + āra
kamma + āra
Derivative taddhita (āra)
Phonetic Change r > m
Sanskrit karmāra
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

anupubbena medhāvī,
thokaṃ thokaṃ khaṇe khaṇe,
kammāro rajatass'eva,
niddhame malam'attano.

DHP 239 malavaggo

kaṃ so sikkhaṃ samādāya,
ekodi nipako sato,
kammāro rajatass'eva,
niddhame malam'attano.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
kammārakula

nt. smithy; metal worker; lit. blacksmith household [kammāra + kula] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning smithy; metal worker; lit. blacksmith household
Construction kammāra + kula
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kammārānaṃ + kula)
Commentary (MNa) kammārakulā ... kaṃsapātikārakānaṃ kammārānaṃ gharato
Sanskrit karmāra + kula

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, kaṃsapāti ābhatā āpaṇā vā kammārakulā vā rajena ca malena ca pariyonaddhā. tam'enaṃ sāmikā na c'eva paribhuñjeyyuṃ na ca pariyodapeyyuṃ, rajāpathe ca naṃ nikkhipeyyuṃ.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ

fem. blacksmith's bellows [kammāra + gaggarī] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning blacksmith's bellows
Construction kammāra + gaggarī

Commentary (MNa) kammāragaggariyā'ti kammārassa gaggaranāḷiyā.
Sanskrit karmāra + gargarī, karmāragargarī (bsk)

seyyathā'pi nāma kammāragaggariyā dhamamānāya adhimatto saddo hoti, evam'eva kho me, aggivessana, mukhato ca nāsato ca assāsapassāsesu uparuddhesu kaṇṇasotehi vātānaṃ nikkhamantānaṃ adhimatto saddo hoti.

kammāsa 1

adj. spotted; speckled; blemished ✓

Grammar adj, in comps
Meaning spotted; speckled; blemished
Antonym akammāsa
Commentary (ANa) yassa antar'antarā bhinnāni, tassa antar'antarā visabhāgabinduvicitrā gāvī viya kammāsaṃ nāma hoti.
Sanskrit kalmāṣa

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kurūsu viharati kammāsadhammaṃ nāma kurūnaṃ nigamo, bhāradvājagottassa brāhmaṇassa agy'āgāre tiṇasanthārake.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, puggalo puggalena saddhiṃ saṃvasamāno evaṃ jānāti, dīgharattaṃ kho ayam'āyasmā khaṇḍakārī chiddakārī sabalakārī kammāsakārī, na santatakārī na santatavutti, sīlesu dussīlo ayam'āyasmā, n'āyam'āyasmā sīlavā'ti.

kammāsa 2

Compound kammadhāraya (kammāsa + kārī)
Antonym akammāsakārī
Sanskrit kalmāṣa + kārin

idha, bhikkhave, puggalo puggalena saddhiṃ saṃvasamāno evaṃ jānāti, dīgharattaṃ kho ayam'āyasmā khaṇḍakārī chiddakārī sabalakārī kammāsakārī, na santatakārī na santatavutti, sīlesu dussīlo ayam'āyasmā, n'āyam'āyasmā sīlavā'ti.

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kurūsu viharati kammāsadhammaṃ nāma kurūnaṃ nigamo, bhāradvājagottassa brāhmaṇassa agy'āgāre tiṇasanthārake.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

Root √kar･7 o (do, make)

Sanskrit karmaṇā
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

ete kho vasalā vuttā,
mayā yete pakāsitā,
na jaccā vasalo hoti,
na jaccā hoti brāhmaṇo,
kammunā vasalo hoti,
kammunā hoti brāhmaṇo.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7

na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā,
sa mānam'eti na hi tammayo so,
na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo,
anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9

kamma + e

Notes see SCPN §10 (Eastern Forms)

pañca ca kammuno satāni pañca ca kammāni tīṇi ca kammāni, kamme ca aḍḍhakamme ca, dvaṭṭhipaṭipadā, dvaṭṭh'antarakappā, chaḷābhijātiyo, aṭṭha purisabhūmiyo

yo ve kiñcikkhakamyatā,
panthasmiṃ vajantaṃ janaṃ,
hantvā kiñcikkham'ādeti,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puriso manuññabhojanaṃ bhuttāvī chaḍḍeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sunakkhatta, api nu tassa purisassa tasmiṃ vante puna bhottu'kamyatā assā'ti?

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
kaya

masc. buying; purchasing [√kī + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from kiṇāti
Meaning buying; purchasing
Root Family √kī

√ In Comps kkī
Construction √kī > kay + *a

Phonetic Change ī > ay
Sanskrit kraya
Sanskrit Root √krī 9 (buy)

yo pana bhikkhu nānappakārakaṃ kayavikkayaṃ samāpajjeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 20 kayavikkayasikkhāpadaṃ

dūteyyapahiṇagaman'ānuyogā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, kayavikkayā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, tulākūṭakaṃsakūṭamānakūṭā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, ukkoṭanavañcananikatisāciyogā paṭivirato ahosiṃ

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
kayavikkaya

masc. trading; bartering; exchanging; buying and selling [kaya + vikkaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning trading; bartering; exchanging; buying and selling
Construction kaya + vikkaya
Compound dvanda (kaya ca vikkaya ca)
Commentary (VIN 1.4.2.10) kayavikkayaṃ samāpajjeyyā'ti iminā imaṃ dehi, iminā imaṃ āhara, iminā imaṃ parivattehi, iminā imaṃ cetāpehī'ti.
Sanskrit krayavikraya

yo pana bhikkhu nānappakārakaṃ kayavikkayaṃ samāpajjeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 20 kayavikkayasikkhāpadaṃ

kayavikkaye na tiṭṭheyya,
upavādaṃ bhikkhu na kareyya kuhiñci,
gāme ca n'ābhisajjeyya,
lābhakamyā janaṃ na lapayeyya.

yato kayitañ'ca hoti vikkayitañ'ca attano bhaṇḍaṃ parahatthagataṃ parabhaṇḍaṃ attano hatthagataṃ, nissaggiyaṃ hoti.

VIN 1.4.2.10 kayavikkayasikkhāpadaṃ
kayirati

pr. is done; is made; is performed [√kar + iya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of karoti, intrans
Meaning is done; is made; is performed
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 iya (do, make)
Base √kar + iya > kariya > kayira (pass, irreg)
Construction kayira + ti
Phonetic Change kariya > kayira (metathesis)
Sanskrit kṛ
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

yañ'hi kiccaṃ apaviddhaṃ,
akiccaṃ pana kayirati,
unnaḷānaṃ pamattānaṃ,
tesaṃ vaḍḍhanti āsavā.

DHP 292 pakiṇṇakavaggo

tanu'icc'evam'ādito dhātugaṇato o yira'icc'ete paccayā honti kattari. tanoti, tanohi, karoti, karohi, kayirati, kayirāhi.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 451
kayiramāna

prp. being done; being made [√kar + iya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of karīyati, pass, intrans
Meaning being done; being made
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 iya (do, make)
Base √kar + iya > kariya > kayira (pass, irreg)
Construction kayira + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change kariya > kayira (metathesis)
Sanskrit kriyamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

atthi, bhikkhave, ṭhānaṃ amanāpaṃ kātuṃ. tañ'ca kayiramānaṃ anatthāya saṃvattati. atthi, bhikkhave, ṭhānaṃ amanāpaṃ kātuṃ. tañ'ca kayiramānaṃ atthāya saṃvattati.

AN 4.115 ṭhānasuttaṃ

no c'assa pāripūrī'ti kayiramānaṃ nappahoti.

VIN 1.4.1.3 tatiyakathinasikkhāpadaṃ
kayirā

opt. (+acc) should do; could make; wishes to do [√kar + o + eyya] ✓

Grammar opt of karoti, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning should do; could make; wishes to do
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + o > karo
Construction karo + eyya
kareyya > kayirā
Phonetic Change rey > yir (metathesis)
e > i
Sanskrit kriyāma, kurvīya
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

diso disaṃ yaṃ taṃ kayirā,
verī vā pana verinaṃ,
micchāpaṇihitaṃ cittaṃ,
pāpiyo naṃ tato kare.

DHP 42 cittavaggo

yo ve avidvā upadhiṃ karoti,
punappunaṃ dukkham'upeti mando,
tasmā pajānaṃ upadhiṃ na kayirā,
dukkhassa jātippabhav'ānupassī.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
kayirātha 1

opt. (+acc) one oneself should make; one oneself should do [√kar + o + eyya + ātha] ✓

Grammar opt, reflx 3rd sg of kayirā, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning one oneself should make; one oneself should do
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + o > karo
Construction karo + eyya + ātha
kareyyātha > kayirātha
Phonetic Change rey > yir (metathesis)
e > i
Sanskrit kuryeta, kriyeta
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

uṭṭhānen'appamādena,
saṃyamena damena ca,
dīpaṃ kayirātha medhāvī,
yaṃ ogho n'ābhikīrati.

DHP 25 appamādavaggo

puññañ'ce puriso kayirā,
kayirāth'etaṃ punappunaṃ,
tamhi chandaṃ kayirātha,
sukho puññassa uccayo.

DHP 118 pāpavaggo
kayirātha 2

opt. (+acc) you all should do; you all should make [√kar] ✗
kayirāthenaṃ

sandhi. one should do it oneself; one must perform this oneself [kayirātha + enaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, opt + pron
Meaning one should do it oneself; one must perform this oneself
Construction kayirātha + enaṃ
Commentary (SNa) kayirā ce kayirāth'enan'ti yadi vīriyaṃ kareyya, kareyyātha, taṃ vīriyaṃ na osakkeyya.

kayirā ce, kayirāth'enaṃ,
daḷham'enaṃ parakkame,
sithilo hi paribbājo,
bhiyyo ākirate rajaṃ.

SN 2.8 tāyanasuttaṃ
kayokaya

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning buying and renting; (comm) buying and selling
Construction kaya + okaya
Compound dvanda (kaya ca okaya ca)
Variant kayākkayaṃ, kayā kayaṃ
Commentary (KPa) hiraññena kay'ākayan'ti hiraññena kayavikkayam'pi tattha t'ādisaṃ n'atthi, yaṃ tesaṃ sampattipaṭilābhahetu bhaveyya.
Sanskrit kraya + avakraya

na hi tattha kasi atthi,
gorakkhettha na vijjati,
vaṇijjā t'ādisī n'atthi,
hiraññena kay'okayaṃ,
ito dinnena yāpenti,
petā kālaṅ'katā tahiṃ.

KHP7 tirokuṭṭasuttaṃ
kara 1

adj. doing; making [√kar + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from karoti
Meaning doing; making
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction √kar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit kara
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yo so bhattu abbhantaro antojano, dāsā'ti vā pessā'ti vā kammakarā'ti vā, tesaṃ katañ'ca katato jānāti akatañ'ca akatato jānāti, gilānakānañ'ca bal'ābalaṃ jānāti khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyañ'c'assa paccaṃsena saṃvibhajati.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ lahuparivattaṃ yatha'y'idaṃ cittaṃ. yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhikkhave, upamā'pi na sukarā yāva lahuparivattaṃ cittan'ti.

481, 524. karassa sapaccayassa kāho.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 481

kara'icc'etassa dhātussa sapaccayassa kāh'ādeso hoti vā bhavissantimhi vibhattimhi, ssassa ca niccaṃ lopo hoti. kāhati, kāhiti, kāhasi, kāhisi, kāhāmi, kāhāma. vā'ti kim'atthaṃ? karissati, karissanti.

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning doing things that should and shouldn't be done
Construction karaṇīya + akaraṇīya
Commentary (ANa) iti karaṇīy'ākaraṇīye kho pana saccato thetato anupalabbhiyamāne'ti evaṃ kattabbe ca akattabbe ca bhūtato thirato apaññāyamāne alabbhamāne. yadi hi kattabbaṃ kātuṃ akattabbato ca viramituṃ labheyya, karaṇīy'ākaraṇīyaṃ saccato thetato upalabbheyya. yasmā pana ubhayam'pi taṃ esa n'upalabbhati, tasmā taṃ saccato thetato na upalabbhati, evaṃ tasmiṃ ca anupalabbhiyamāne'ti attho.

SN 6.14 aruṇavatīsuttaṃ

etañ'hi tumhe paṭipannā,
dukkhass'antaṃ karissatha,
akkhāto vo mayā maggo,
aññāya sallakantanaṃ.

DHP 275 maggavaggo
karissaṃ

fut. (+acc) I myself will do; I myself will make [√kar + issa + aṃ] ✓

dukkhā hi kāmā kaṭukā mahabbhayā,
nibbānam'ev'ābhimano carissaṃ.

pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.

ind. pitiably [karuṇā] ✗

fem. compassion; sympathy; kindness (towards unfortunate beings); lit. action ✓

Meaning compassion; sympathy; kindness (towards unfortunate beings); lit. action
Notes MW suggests from √kṝ or √kṛ

seyyathā'pi nāma ekaṃ puggalaṃ duggataṃ durūpetaṃ disvā karuṇāyeyya, evam'eva sabbasatte karuṇāya pharatī'ti

VISM 1.1.2 sīlānisaṃsa kathā

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ āgamma, evaṃ mettaṃ karuṇaṃ muditaṃ upekkhaṃ bhāvetvā labhati ajjhattaṃ vūpasamaṃ.

kathañ'ca bhikkhu karuṇāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati? seyyathā'pi nāma ekaṃ puggalaṃ duggataṃ durūpetaṃ disvā karuṇāyeyya, evam'eva sabbasatte karuṇāya pharatī'ti

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā

añña'd'atthu, ayaṃ varāko idāni marissati, yaṃ yadeva hi ayaṃ padaṃ nikkhipati, tena tena santike maraṇassa hotī'ti taṃ jano karuṇāyati.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā

yath'āhaṃ ākāso'va abyāpajjamāno,
idh'eva santo asito careyyaṃ.

VIN 5.4.7 tiṇavatthārakaṃ
kalahappavaḍḍhanī

fem. increasing contention, fomenting strife ✗
kalahaviggahavivādatuvaṃtuvaṃpesuññamusāvādā

masc. quarrels, disputes, arguments, he said she said, slander and lies [kalaha + viggaha + vivāda + tuvaṃtuvaṃ + pesuñña + musāvāda + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning quarrels, disputes, arguments, he said she said, slander and lies
Construction kalaha + viggaha + vivāda + tuvaṃtuvaṃ + pesuñña + musāvāda + ā
kalahaviggahavivādatuvaṃtuvaṃpesuññamusāvāda + ā
Compound dvanda (kalaha ca viggaha ca vivāda ca tuvaṃtuvaṃ ca pesuñña ca musāvāda ca)
Sanskrit kalaha + vigraha + vivāda + tvam + tvam + paiśunya + mṛṣāvāda

macchariyaṃ paṭicca ārakkho, ārakkh'ādhikaraṇaṃ daṇḍ'ādānaṃ satthādānaṃ kalaha-viggaha-vivāda-tuvaṃtuvaṃ-pesuñña-musāvādā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti. ime kho, bhikkhave, nava taṇhāmūlakā dhammā'ti.

AN 9.23 taṇhāmūlakasuttaṃ
kalahaviggahavivādāpanna

adj. fallen into quarrels, disputes and arguments [kalaha + viggaha + vivāda + āpanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning fallen into quarrels, disputes and arguments
Construction kalaha + viggaha + vivāda + āpanna
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kalahaviggahavivādaṃ + āpanna)
Sanskrit kalaha + vigraha + vivāda + āpanna

te tattha kalahaviggahavivād'āpannā aññam'aññaṃ pāṇīhi'pi upakkamanti, leḍḍūhi'pi upakkamanti, daṇḍehi'pi upakkamanti, satthehi'pi upakkamanti. te tattha maraṇam'pi nigacchanti, maraṇamattam'pi dukkhaṃ.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
kalahavivādasutta

nt. Sutta Nipāta 4.11 (SNP 49) ✗
kalā

fem. fraction; small part [√kal + ā] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning fraction; small part
Root Family √kal
Root √kal×1 a (calculate, add)
Construction √kal + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Commentary (SNa) kalaṃ nāma soḷasabhāgo'pi satabhāgo'pi sahassabhāgo'pi. idha satabhāgo gahito.
English Cognate calculate
Sanskrit kalā
Sanskrit Root √kal 10 (drive, produce)

māse māse kus'aggena,
bālo bhuñjeyya bhojanaṃ,
na so saṅkhātadhammānaṃ,
kalaṃ agghati soḷasiṃ.

DHP 70 bālavaggo

saṅkham'pi na upeti upanidhim'pi na upeti kalabhāgam'pi na upeti mahāpathaviṃ upanidhāya bhagavatā paritto nakhasikhāyaṃ paṃsu āropito'ti.

SN 20.2 nakhasikhasuttaṃ
kalāpa 1

masc. quiver (of arrows); lit. bundle ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning quiver (of arrows); lit. bundle
Sanskrit kalāpa

sevamāno sevamānaṃ,
samphuṭṭho samphusaṃ paraṃ,
saro diddho kalāpaṃ'va,
alittam'upalimpati,
upalepabhayā dhīro,
n'eva pāpasakhā siyā.

ITI 76 sukhapatthanāsuttaṃ

asi ca cammañ'ca asicammaṃ, dhanu ca kalāpo ca dhanukalāpaṃ, hatthī ca asso ca hatthiassaṃ, ratho ca pattiko ca rathapattikaṃ. evaṃ sen'aṅg'atthe.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 322
kalāpa 2

masc. bundle; sheaf; pile ✓

Grammar masc, in comps
Meaning bundle; sheaf; pile
Sanskrit kalāpa

sādhu me, bhante, ayyo mahako uttarimanussadhammaṃ iddhipāṭihāriyaṃ dassetū'ti. tena hi tvaṃ, gahapati, ālinde uttarāsaṅgaṃ paññapetvā tiṇakalāpaṃ okāsehī'ti.

SN 41.4 mahakapāṭihāriyasuttaṃ
kalāpa 3

masc. group of elementary particles [kalāpa] ✗
kalāpaka

Meaning small bundle; small group
Construction kalāpa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit kalāpaka
kalābuka

nt. belt of strings or ropes ✗
kalāyamatta

adj. size of a chickpea ✗
kali 1

masc. disaster; bad luck; misfortune; lit. unlucky dice ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning disaster; bad luck; misfortune; lit. unlucky dice
Antonym kaṭa
Sanskrit kali

yo nindiyaṃ pasaṃsati,
taṃ vā nindati yo pasaṃsiyo
vicināti mukhena so kaliṃ,
kalinā tena sukhaṃ na vindati.

AN 4.3 paṭhamakhatasuttaṃ

sudassaṃ vajjam'aññesaṃ,
attano pana duddasaṃ,
paresaṃ hi so vajjāni,
opunāti yathā bhusaṃ,
attano pana chādeti,
kaliṃ'va kitavā saṭho.

DHP 252 malavaggo
kali 2

masc. fault; evil; badness; wrongness ✓

Grammar masc, abstr
Meaning fault; evil; badness; wrongness
Antonym kaṭa
Commentary (ANa) taṃ mamassa kalī'ti taṃ vacanaṃ mayhaṃ doso bhaveyyā'ti attho.
Sanskrit kali

yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ anuvicaritaṃ manasā, tam'ahaṃ n'eva jānāmi na na jānāmī'ti vadeyyaṃ, taṃ mam'assa kali.

AN 4.24 kāḷakārāmasuttaṃ

n'atthi rāgasamo aggi,
n'atthi dosasamo kali,
n'atthi khandhasamā dukkhā,
n'atthi santiparaṃ sukhaṃ.

DHP 202 sukhavaggo
kali 3

masc. losing dice ✓

Grammar masc, abstr
Meaning losing dice
Antonym kaṭa
Commentary (MNa) kaliggaho'ti parājayaggāho.
Notes (MW) name of the die or side of a die marked with one dot, the losing die
Sanskrit kali

sace kho atth'eva kiriyā, evaṃ imassa bhoto purisapuggalassa ubhay'attha kaliggaho, yañ'ca diṭṭh'eva dhamme viññūnaṃ gārayho, yañ'ca kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjissati.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
kali 4

masc. distress ✗
kaliggaha

masc. loss; defeat; disaster; ruin; lit. getting the losing dice [kali + gaha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning loss; defeat; disaster; ruin; lit. getting the losing dice
Construction kali + gaha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kaliṃ + gaha)
Antonym kaṭaggaha
Commentary (MNa) kaliggaho'ti parājayaggāho.
Sanskrit kali + graha

sace kho atth'eva paro loko, evaṃ imassa bhoto purisapuggalassa ubhay'attha kaliggaho, yañ'ca diṭṭh'eva dhamme viññūnaṃ gārayho, yañ'ca kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjissati.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
kaliggāha

adj. losing; failing; suffering disaster; lit. seizing the unlucky dice [kali + gāha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning losing; failing; suffering disaster; lit. seizing the unlucky dice
Construction kali + gāha
Commentary (ANa) ubhayattha kaliggāho'ti idhaloke ca paraloke cā'ti ubhayasmim'pi aparaddhaggāho, parājayaggāho hotī'ti attho. atha vā ubhayattha kaliggāho'ti ubhay'esam'pi diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikānaṃ atthānaṃ kaliggāho, parājayaggāho'ti attho.

Meaning name of a country
Sanskrit kaliṅga
kaliṅgara 1

masc. log; piece of wood; straw ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning log; piece of wood; straw
Sanskrit kaliñja, kiliñja, kaḍaṅgara, kaḍaṃkara

kaliṅgara-upadhānā, bhikkhave, eta'r'ahi licchavī viharanti appamattā ātāpino upāsanasmiṃ. tesaṃ rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto na labhati otāraṃ na labhati ārammaṇaṃ.

SN 20.8 kaliṅgarasuttaṃ
kaliṅgara 2

nt. log; piece of wood; straw ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning log; piece of wood; straw
Commentary (DHPa) niratthaṃ'va kaliṅgaraṃ nirupakāraṃ niratthakaṃ kaṭṭhakhaṇḍaṃ viya.
Sanskrit kaliñja, kiliñja, kaḍaṅgara, kaḍaṃkara

aciraṃ vat'ayaṃ kāyo,
pathaviṃ adhisessati,
chuddho apetaviññāṇo,
niratthaṃ'va kaliṅgaraṃ.

kalyāṇa 1

adj. good; favourable; propitious; beneficial; lovely ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning good; favourable; propitious; beneficial; lovely
Antonym pāpa, pāpaka, akalyāṇa
Sanskrit kalyāṇa

kammassakomhi kammadāy'ādo kammayoni kammabandhu kammapaṭisaraṇo, yaṃ kammaṃ karissāmi kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā tassa dāy'ādo bhavissāmī'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ

AN 10.48 dasadhammasuttaṃ

kiñ'c'āpi, bhikkhave, evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭh'ānugatiṃ āpajjati, atha kho naṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchati, kalyāṇamitto purisapuggalo kalyāṇasahāyo kalyāṇasampavaṅko'ti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
kalyāṇa 2

adj. (of speech) polite; kind; charming; (comm) soft and gentle; lit. good ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning (of speech) polite; kind; charming; (comm) soft and gentle; lit. good
Antonym pāpa, pāpaka
Commentary (SNa) kalyāṇan'ti saṇhaṃ mudukaṃ.
Sanskrit kalyāṇa

kim'atthakāmo na dade,
kiṃ macco na pariccaje,
kiṃsu muñceyya kalyāṇaṃ,
pāpikaṃ na ca mocaye'ti.

SN 1.78 kāmasuttaṃ

attānaṃ na dade poso,
attānaṃ na pariccaje,
vācaṃ muñceyya kalyāṇaṃ,
pāpikañ'ca na mocaye'ti.

SN 1.78 kāmasuttaṃ
kalyāṇa 3

nt. goodness; good deeds; virtue; merit; benefit; quality ✓

Grammar nt, abstr
Meaning goodness; good deeds; virtue; merit; benefit; quality
Antonym pāpa, pāpaka
Sanskrit kalyāṇa

abhittharetha kalyāṇe,
pāpā cittaṃ nivāraye,
dandhañ'hi karoto puññaṃ,
pāpasmiṃ ramatī mano.

DHP 116 pāpavaggo

paññaṃ purakkhatvā kalyāṇapīti,
vikkhambhaye tāni parissayāni,
aratiṃ sahetha sayanamhi pante,
caturo sahetha paridevadhamme.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
kalyāṇakamma

nt. good deed; beneficial action; act of kindness [kalyāṇa + kamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning good deed; beneficial action; act of kindness
Construction kalyāṇa + kamma
Compound kammadhāraya (kalyāṇa + kamma)
Sanskrit kalyāṇa + karman

ayaṃ varāko kiñ'c'āpi idāni sukhito susajjito bhoge paribhuñjati, atha kho tīsu dvāresu ekenā'pi katassa kalyāṇakammassa abhāvā idāni apāyesu anappakaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedissatī'ti.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
kalyāṇakamyatā

fem. desire for something good; wanting something of quality [kalyāṇa + kamyatā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning desire for something good; wanting something of quality
Construction kalyāṇa + kamyatā
Commentary (VINa) kalyāṇakamyataṃ upādāyā'ti sundarakāmataṃ visiṭṭhakāmataṃ cittena gahetvā, tassa āpajjeyya ce'ti iminā sambandho.
kalyāṇakāma

adj. desiring what is good ✗
kalyāṇakārī

adj. who, does good things, virtuous ✗
kalyāṇakusala

adj. (+dat) skilled in what is good (for) [kalyāṇa + kusala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+dat)
Meaning skilled in what is good (for)
Construction kalyāṇa + kusala
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kalyāṇassa + kusala)
Sanskrit kalyāṇa + kuśala

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu samādhikusalo hoti, samādhissa samāpattikusalo hoti, samādhissa ṭhitikusalo hoti, samādhissa vuṭṭhānakusalo hoti, samādhissa kalyāṇakusalo hoti, samādhissa gocarakusalo hoti, samādhissa abhinīhārakusalo hoti. imehi kho, bhikkhave, sattahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu cittaṃ vase vatteti, no ca bhikkhu cittassa vasena vattatī'ti.

Grammar adj, comp

Sanskrit kalyāṇadharman

etadaggaṃ bhagini pāricariyānaṃ yā mādisaṃ sīlavantaṃ kalyāṇadhammaṃ brahmacāriṃ etena dhammena paricareyyā'ti methun'upasaṃhitena, saṅghādiseso.

VIN PAT SA 4 attakāmapāricariyasikkhāpadaṃ

katamo ca, bhikkhave, puggalo sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo? idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sīlavā hoti kalyāṇadhammo.

THI 63 kisāgotamītherīgāthā

kalyāṇamittatā muninā,
lokaṃ ādissa vaṇṇitā,

api bālo paṇḍito assa.

AN 9.1 sambodhisuttaṃ
kalyāṇamittādivagga

masc. Chapter 8 of Ekakanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 1.71-80 ✗
kalyāṇavākkaraṇa

adj. well-spoken; eloquent; lit. making good speech [kalyāṇa + vākkaraṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning well-spoken; eloquent; lit. making good speech
Construction kalyāṇa + vākkaraṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (kalyāṇa + vākkaraṇa)
Antonym akalyāṇavākkaraṇa
Commentary (MNa) kalyāṇaṃ madhuraṃ vākkaraṇaṃ assā'ti kalyāṇavākkaraṇo.
Sanskrit kalyāṇavacana, kalyāṇa + vākyakaraṇa

bahussuto ca soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo, kalyāṇavākkaraṇo ca soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo, paṇḍito ca soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo, pahoti ca soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo samaṇena gotamena saddhiṃ asmiṃ vacane paṭimantetun'ti

DN 4.5 soṇadaṇḍasuttaṃ

no ca kalyāṇavāco hoti kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā

AN 4.97 khippanisantisuttaṃ
kalyāṇavākkaraṇatā

fem. fact of being well-spoken; eloquence; lit. making good speech state [kalyāṇa + vākkaraṇa + tā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from kalyāṇavākkaraṇa
Meaning fact of being well-spoken; eloquence; lit. making good speech state
Construction kalyāṇa + vākkaraṇa + tā
kalyāṇavākkaraṇa + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Commentary (ANa) kalyāṇavākkaraṇatā'ti vacanakiriyāya madhurabhāvo.
Sanskrit kalyāṇavacana, kalyāṇa + vākyakaraṇa +
kalyāṇavāca

adj. well-spoken; eloquent [kalyāṇa + vācā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning well-spoken; eloquent
Construction kalyāṇa + vācā + a
kalyāṇavācā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (kalyāṇa + vāca)
Commentary (DNa) kalyāṇā sundarā parimaṇḍalapadabyañjanā vācā assā'ti kalyāṇavāco.
Sanskrit kalyāṇa + vācā

no ca kalyāṇavāco hoti kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā

AN 4.97 khippanisantisuttaṃ
kalyāṇasaṅgatika

Construction kalyāṇa + saṅgatika
kalyāṇasampavaṅka

adj. with good associates; having good companions [kalyāṇa + sampavaṅka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with good associates; having good companions
Construction kalyāṇa + sampavaṅka
Compound kammadhāraya (kalyāṇa + sampavaṅka)
Antonym pāpasampavaṅka
Sanskrit kalyāṇa + sampravad

rājā, bhikkhave, māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto pāpamitto pāpasahāyo pāpasampavaṅko, rājā ca kho, bhikkhave, pasenadi kosalo kalyāṇamitto kalyāṇasahāyo kalyāṇasampavaṅko.

SN 3.14 paṭhamasaṅgāmasuttaṃ

kiñ'c'āpi, bhikkhave, evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭh'ānugatiṃ āpajjati, atha kho naṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchati, kalyāṇamitto purisapuggalo kalyāṇasahāyo kalyāṇasampavaṅko'ti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
kalyāṇasampavaṅkatā

Meaning fact of having good associates; fact of having good companions
Construction kalyāṇa + sampavaṅkatā

adj. with good companions; having good friends [kalyāṇa + sahāya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with good companions; having good friends
Construction kalyāṇa + sahāya
Compound kammadhāraya (kalyāṇa + sahāya)
Antonym pāpasahāya
Sanskrit kalyāṇa + sahāya

idh'āvuso, bhikkhu kalyāṇamitto hoti kalyāṇasahāyo kalyāṇasampavaṅko. sambodhipakkhikānaṃ, āvuso, dhammānaṃ ayaṃ paṭhamā upanisā bhāvanāya.

AN 9.1 sambodhisuttaṃ

kiñ'c'āpi, bhikkhave, evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭh'ānugatiṃ āpajjati, atha kho naṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchati, kalyāṇamitto purisapuggalo kalyāṇasahāyo kalyāṇasampavaṅko'ti.

kalyāṇasīlasutta

kalyāṇaṃ

ind. well; excellently; splendidly; magnificently [kalyāṇa + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of kalyāṇa
Meaning well; excellently; splendidly; magnificently
Construction kalyāṇa + aṃ
Commentary (SNa) kalyāṇaṃ vuccatī'ti catūhi paccayehi paṭijaggissāmī'ti vacanaṃ niddosaṃ anavajjaṃ vuccati tayā upāsakā'ti adhippāyena vadati.
Sanskrit kalyāṇam

ahaṃ ayyassa mahakassa ussukkaṃ karissāmi cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārānan'ti. kalyāṇaṃ vuccati, gahapatī'ti.

sādhu sādhu, bhikkhu, suggahitāni te, bhikkhu, soḷasa aṭṭhakavaggikāni sumanasikatāni sūpadhāritāni, kalyāṇiyā'si vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagaḷāya atthassa viññāpaniyā.

kalyāṇīsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 17.22 (SN17.22) ✗
kalla 1

adj. clever; smart; sharp [√kal + ya] ✓

Meaning clever; smart; sharp

Derivative kita (ya)
Phonetic Change ly > ll
Sanskrit kalya
Sanskrit Root √kal 10 (drive, produce)

ko nu kho, bhante, viññāṇ'āhāraṃ āhāretī'ti? no kallo pañho'ti bhagavā avoca, āhāretī'ti ahaṃ na vadāmi.

SN 12.12 moḷiyaphaggunasuttaṃ

kallo'si, bhante nāgasenā'ti.

MIL 2.3.10 milindapañho, saññālakkhaṇapañho

yadā bhagavā aññāsi brahmāyuṃ brāhmaṇaṃ kallacittaṃ muducittaṃ vinīvaraṇacittaṃ udaggacittaṃ pasannacittaṃ, atha yā buddhānaṃ sāmukkaṃsikā dhammadesanā taṃ pakāsesi, dukkhaṃ, samudayaṃ, nirodhaṃ, maggaṃ.

DHP 143 daṇḍavaggo

haneyyuṃ vā'ti hatthena vā pādena vā kasāya vā vettena vā aḍḍhadaṇḍakena vā chejjāya vā haneyyuṃ.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
kasāniviṭṭha

adj. touched by the whip; whipped; lit. entered down whip [kasā + niviṭṭha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning touched by the whip; whipped; lit. entered down whip
Construction kasā + niviṭṭha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (kasāya + niviṭṭha)
Commentary (DHPa) bhikkhave, yathā bhadro asso pamādam'āgamma kasāya niviṭṭho, aham'pi nāma kasāya pahaṭo'ti aparabhāge ātappaṃ karoti
Sanskrit kaśa + niviṣṭa

asso yathā bhadro kasāniviṭṭho,
ātāpino saṃvegino bhavātha,
saddhāya sīlena ca vīriyena ca,
samādhinā dhammavinicchayena ca,
sampannavijjācaraṇā patissatā,
jahissatha dukkham'idaṃ anappakaṃ.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
kasāva 2

yam'āhu saccaṃ tathiyan'ti eke,
tam'āhu aññe tucchaṃ musā'ti,
evam'pi vigayha vivādayanti,
kasmā na ekaṃ samaṇā vadanti.

uragavaggo 4

ko ubh'antam'abhiññāya,
majjhe mantā na lippati,
kaṃ brūsi mahāpuriso'ti,
ko idha sibbinim'accagā.

evaṃ vagguvado satthā,
tusitā gaṇim'āgato.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
kassati 1.1

fut. (+acc) will do; will make [√kar + a + ssa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of karoti, trans (+acc)
Meaning will do; will make
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + a + ssa > kassa (fut, irreg)
Construction kassa + ti
Sanskrit kariṣyati
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

dhātu āveṇikā n'atthi,
sarīraṃ ekapiṇḍitaṃ,
imamhi buddhathūpamhi,
kassāma kañcukaṃ mayaṃ.

APA 24 upavāna therāpadānaṃ

tathā tu kassāmi yathā'pi issaro,
yaṃ labbhati tena'pi hotu me alaṃ,
na t'āhaṃ kassāmi yathā atandito,
biḷārabhastaṃ'va yathā sumadditaṃ.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ

abhijānām'ahaṃ, bho gotama, pūraṇaṃ kassapaṃ vādena vādaṃ samārabhitā. so'pi mayā vādena vādaṃ samāraddho aññen'aññaṃ paṭicari, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmesi, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātvākāsi.

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ
kahāpaṇa

masc. silver coin; lit. (sk) karṣa-weight ~

Grammar masc
Meaning silver coin; lit. (sk) karṣa-weight
Commentary (VINa) kahāpaṇo'ti sovaṇṇamayo vā rūpiyamayo vā pākatiko vā.
Notes 4 pāda = 1 kahāpaṇa
Sanskrit kārṣāpaṇa
kahāpaṇaka

nt. torture which consisted in cutting off small pieces of flesh ✗
kahāpaṇavassa

masc. shower of silver coins [kahāpaṇa + vassa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning shower of silver coins
Construction kahāpaṇa + vassa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kahāpaṇānaṃ + vassa)
Commentary (DHPa) tattha kahāpaṇavassenā'ti yaṃ so apphoṭetvā sattaratanavassaṃ vassāpesi, taṃ idha kahāpaṇavassanti vuttaṃ. tena'pi hi vatthukāmakilesakāmesu titti nāma n'atthi. evaṃ duppūrā esā taṇhā.
Sanskrit kārṣāpaṇa + varṣa

na kahāpaṇavassena,
titti kāmesu vijjati,
app'assādā dukhā kāmā,
iti viññāya paṇḍito.

DHP14 buddhavaggo
kahāpaṇasata

nt. one hundred silver coins [kahāpaṇa + sata] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning one hundred silver coins
Construction kahāpaṇa + sata
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kahāpaṇānaṃ + sata)
Commentary (SNa) kahāpaṇasatan'ti pātarāse paṇṇāsaṃ sāyamāse paṇṇāsan'ti evaṃ kahāpaṇasataṃ.
Sanskrit kārṣāpaṇa + śata

ehi tvaṃ, tāta sudassana, bhagavato santike imaṃ gāthaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā mama bhatt'ābhihāre bhāsa. ahañ'ca te devasikaṃ kahāpaṇasataṃ bhikkhaṃ pavattayissāmī'ti.

JAa 542 umaṅga jātakavaṇṇanā
kahāpaṇika

Construction kahāpaṇa + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Commentary (MNa) kahāpaṇikan'ti sakalasarīraṃ tiṇhāhi vāsīhi koṭito paṭṭhāya kahāpaṇamattaṃ kahāpaṇamattaṃ pātentā koṭṭenti.
Sanskrit kārṣāpaṇika

tam'enaṃ rājāno gahetvā vividhā kammakāraṇā kārenti ... cīrakavāsikam'pi karonti, eṇeyyakam'pi karonti, baḷisamaṃsikam'pi karonti, kahāpaṇikam'pi karonti, khārāpatacchikam'pi karonti, palighaparivattikam'pi karonti

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
kaḷāya

masc. cow pea; Vigna trilobata ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning cow pea; Vigna trilobata
Notes or a peanut?
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vigna_trilobata
Sanskrit kalāya

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ thokaṃ thokaṃ āhāraṃ āhāreyyaṃ, pasataṃ pasataṃ, yadi vā muggayūsaṃ, yadi vā kulatthayūsaṃ, yadi vā kaḷāyayūsaṃ, yadi vā hareṇukayūsan'ti.

Meaning body

Sanskrit kalevara

yaṃ disvā vimano udikkhasi.

kaṃ 1.1

pron. which? what? whom? [ka] ✗

pron. which?; what?; whom? [ka + aṃ] ✓

Construction ka + aṃ
Sanskrit kam

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

ko'dha santusito loke,
kassa no santi iñjitā,
ko ubh'antam'abhiññāya,
majjhe mantā na lippati,
kaṃ brūsi mahāpuriso'ti,
ko idha sibbinim'accagā.

Construction kāka + peyya

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, udakamaṇiko ādhāre ṭhapito pūro udakassa samatittiko kākapeyyo. tam'enaṃ balavā puriso yato yato āvajjeyya, āgaccheyya udakan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

AN 5.28 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, udakamaṇiko pūro udakassa samatittiko kākapeyyo ādhāre ṭhapito. atha puriso āgaccheyya udakabhāraṃ ādāya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu so puriso labhetha udakassa nikkhepanan'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ
kākasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.77 (AN10.77) ✗
kākasūra

adj. brazen as a crow; lit. crow hero [kāka + sūra] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning brazen as a crow; lit. crow hero
Construction kāka + sūra
Compound kammadhāraya (kāka + sūra)
Commentary (DHPa) kākasūrenā'ti sūrakākasadisena. yathā hi sūrakāko kulagharesu yāgu'ādīni gaṇhitu'kāmo bhittiādīsu nisīditvā attano olokanabhāvaṃ ñatvā anolokento viya aññavihitako viya niddāyanto viya ca hutvā manussānaṃ pamādaṃ sallakkhetvā anupatitvā sūsū'ti vadantesuy'eva bhājanato mukhapūraṃ gahetvā palāyati
Sanskrit kāka + śūra

sujīvaṃ ahirikena,
kākasūrena dhaṃsinā,
pakkhandinā pagabbhena,
saṃkiliṭṭhena jīvitaṃ.

Derivative taddhita (ci)
Sanskrit kaḥ + cid

dvattikkhattuṃ kho bhavaṃ gotamo mukhe ālopaṃ samparivattetvā ajjhoharati, na c'assa kāci odanamiñjā asambhinnā kāyaṃ pavisati, na c'assa kāci odanamiñjā mukhe avasiṭṭhā hoti, ath'āparaṃ ālopaṃ upanāmeti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

imesaṃ pana, cunda, dasannaṃ akusalānaṃ kammapathānaṃ samannāgamanahetu nirayo paññāyati, tiracchānayoni paññāyati, pettivisayo paññāyati, yā vā pan'aññā'pi kāci duggatiyo

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
kāja

masc. carrying pole ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning carrying pole
Sanskrit kāca

seyyathā'pi, devānam'inda, gāmassa vā nigamassa vā avidūre mahādhaññarāsi. tato mahājanakāyo dhaññaṃ āhareyya, kājehi'pi piṭakehi'pi ucchaṅgehi'pi añjalīhi'pi.

Meaning obsessed by greed for sensual pleasure; consumed by the desire for sensual gratification
Construction kāma + gedha + pariyuṭṭhita
Commentary (SNa) kāmagedhapariyuṭṭhitānan'ti kāmesu gedhena pariyuṭṭhitānaṃ abhibhūtānaṃ
kāmaggasukha

nt. highest sensual pleasure; peak of sensual gratification [kāma + agga + sukha] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning highest sensual pleasure; peak of sensual gratification
Construction kāma + agga + sukha
kāmaṅkara

adj. as you wish; as you prefer; lit. making a desire [kāmaṃ + kara] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning as you wish; as you prefer; lit. making a desire
Construction kāmaṃ + kara
Commentary (SNa) kāmaṃkaro'ti icchitakaro.
kāmaṅgama

adj. able to go (wherever) one wants to [kāmaṃ + gama] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning able to go (wherever) one wants to
Construction kāmaṃ + gama
kāmacāgī

adj. who gives up sensual pleasures ✗
kāmacchanda

masc. (+loc) interest in sensual pleasure; sensual desire (for); sensual impulse (for) [kāma + chanda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp (+loc)
Meaning interest in sensual pleasure; sensual desire (for); sensual impulse (for)
Construction kāma + chanda
Compound kammadhāraya (kāma + chanda)
Variant kāmasaññā
Commentary (MNa) kāmacchando'tiādīsu kilesakāmo'va chandakaraṇavasena chando.
Sanskrit kāma + chandas

kāmacchando ca byāpādo,
thinamiddhañ'ca bhikkhuno,
uddhaccaṃ vicikicchā ca,
pañc'ete cittakelisā.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu santaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ kāmacchandaṃ, atthi me ajjhattaṃ kāmacchando'ti pajānāti, asantaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ kāmacchandaṃ, n'atthi me ajjhattaṃ kāmacchando'ti pajānāti

DN 22.10 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
kāmacchandanīvaraṇa

nt. obstacle of interest in sensual pleasure; hindrance of sensual interest [kāmacchanda + nīvaraṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning obstacle of interest in sensual pleasure; hindrance of sensual interest
Construction kāmacchanda + nīvaraṇa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāmacchandassa + nīvaraṇa)
Sanskrit kāma + chandas + nīvaraṇa

caṅgavāran'ti kho, bhikkhu, pañcann'etaṃ nīvaraṇānaṃ adhivacanaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, kāmacchandanīvaraṇassa, byāpādanīvaraṇassa, thīnamiddhanīvaraṇassa, uddhaccakukkuccanīvaraṇassa, vicikicchānīvaraṇassa.

MN 23 vammikasuttaṃ
kāmajjhosāna

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning clinging to sensual pleasures; attachment to sensual pleasures
Construction kāma + ajjhosāna

Sanskrit kāma + adhyavasāya

tassa kāmānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo kāmesu kāmarāgo kāmanandī kāmasneho kāmamucchā kāmapipāsā kāmapariḷāho kām'ajjhosānaṃ kāmataṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
kāmaṇḍaluka

adj. carrying water-pitchers [kamaṇḍalu + *ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from kamaṇḍalu
Meaning carrying water-pitchers
Construction kamaṇḍalu > kāmaṇḍalu + *ka
Derivative taddhita (*ka)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant kamaṇḍaluka
Notes (MW) kamaṇḍalu a gourd or vessel made of wood or earth used for water (by ascetics and religious students)
Sanskrit kamaṇḍalu + ka

brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchā bhūmakā kāmaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā udak'orohakā aggiparicārakā. te mataṃ kālaṅ'kataṃ uyyāpenti nāma saññāpenti nāma saggaṃ nāma okkāmenti.

kāmaṇḍā

Meaning name of a town
Commentary (SNa) kāmaṇḍāyan'ti evaṃnāmake nagare.
kāmataṇhā

Commentary (DNa) kāmataṇhā'ti pañcakāmaguṇikarāgavasena uppannā rūp'āditaṇhā. (SNa) sā kāmarāgabhāvena rūpaṃ assādentī pavattamānā kāmataṇhā
Sanskrit kāma + tṛṣṇā

y'āyaṃ taṇhā ponobhavikā nandirāgasahagatā tatratatr'ābhinandinī, seyyath'idaṃ, kāmataṇhā bhavataṇhā vibhavataṇhā

DN 22.16 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

so aññe satte passāmi kāmesu avītarāge kāmataṇhāhi khajjamāne kāmapariḷāhena pariḍayhamāne kāme paṭisevante. so tesaṃ na pihemi, na tattha abhiramāmi.

ariyā gacchanti kāmadā'ti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ

kāmanidān + aṃ
Commentary (MNa) mūl'aṭṭhena kāmā nidānam'assā'ti kāmanidāno. (SNa) kāmanidānan'ti kāmapaccayā.
Sanskrit kāma + nidāna

idh'āhaṃ, bhante, aḍḍakaraṇe nisinno passāmi khattiyamahāsāle'pi brāhmaṇamahāsāle'pi gahapatimahāsāle'pi aḍḍhe mahaddhane mahābhoge pahūtajātarūparajate pahūtavitt'ūpakaraṇe pahūtadhanadhaññe kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ sampajānamusā bhāsante.

SN 3.7 aḍḍakaraṇasuttaṃ

sītassa purakkhato uṇhassa purakkhato ḍaṃsamakasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīṃsapa-samphassehi rissamāno khuppipāsāya mīyamāno, ayam'pi, bhikkhave, kāmānaṃ ādīnavo sandiṭṭhiko, dukkhakkhandho kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ kāmānam'eva hetu.

Sanskrit kāma + paridāha

yo ca nesaṃ kāmesu kāmacchando kāmasneho kāmamucchā kāmapipāsā kāmapariḷāho, so ca ajjhattaṃ na suppahīno hoti, na suppaṭippassaddho ... abhabbā'va te ñāṇāya dassanāya anuttarāya sambodhāya.

so aññe satte passāmi kāmesu avītarāge kāmataṇhāhi khajjamāne kāmapariḷāhena pariḍayhamāne kāme paṭisevante. so tesaṃ na pihemi, na tattha abhiramāmi.

Notes see kāmabhava 2
Sanskrit kāma + bhava

yo'dha kāme pahantvāna,
anāgāro paribbaje,
kāmabhavaparikkhīṇaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 415 brāhmaṇavaggo

kāmadhātuvepakkañ'ca, ānanda, kammaṃ n'ābhavissa, api nu kho kāmabhavo paññāyethā'ti? no h'etaṃ bhante

kāmabhava 2

masc. desire for existence; sensual desire and existence [kāma + bhava] ✓

Meaning desire for existence; sensual desire and existence
Construction kāma + bhava
Compound dvanda (kāma ca bhava ca)
Notes see kāmabhava 1
Sanskrit kāma + bhava

nirāsaso so na ca āsasāno,
paññāṇavā so na ca paññakappī,
evam'pi todeyya muniṃ vijāna,
akiñcanaṃ kāmabhave asattan'ti.

SNP 64 todeyya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 9

yaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ vedagum'ābhijaññā,
akiñcanaṃ kāmabhave asattaṃ,
addhā hi so ogham'imaṃ atāri,
tiṇṇo ca pāraṃ akhilo akaṅkho.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4

SN 41.6 dutiyakāmabhūsuttaṃ
kāmabhūsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.233 (SN35.233) ✗

Sanskrit kāmabhoga

sārattā kāmabhogesu,
giddhā kāmesu mucchitā,
atisāraṃ na bujjhanti,
migā kūṭaṃ'va oḍḍitaṃ,
pacchā'saṃ kaṭukaṃ hoti,
vipāko hissa pāpako'ti.

Meaning who enjoys sensual gratification; who indulges in sensual pleasures

Sanskrit kāma + bhogin

ye keci kāmesu asaññatā janā,
avītarāgā idha kāmabhogino,
punappunaṃ jātijar'ūpagāmi te,
taṇh'ādhipannā anusotagāmino.

AN 4.5 anusotasuttaṃ

cattār'imāni, gahapati, sukhāni adhigamanīyāni gihinā kāmabhoginā kālena kālaṃ samayena samayaṃ upādāya. katamāni cattāri? atthisukhaṃ, bhogasukhaṃ, ānaṇyasukhaṃ, anavajjasukhaṃ.

yathā taṃ yuvā yuvatin'ti daharo dahariṃ, taruṇo taruṇiṃ, kāmabhogī kāmabhoginiṃ.

kāmabhogīsutta

kāmamayika

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
kāmayati

pr. wishes, desires; loves [√kam] ✗
kāmayamāna

prp. (+acc) wanting; desiring; craving [√kam + *aya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of kāmeti, trans (+acc)
Meaning wanting; desiring; craving
Root Family √kam
Root √kam･8 *aya (desire)
Base √kam + *aya > kāmaya
Construction kāmaya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant kāmayāna
Sanskrit kāmayamāna
Sanskrit Root √kam 3, 5 (love)

katamo ca, bhikkhave, kāmānaṃ vipāko? yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, kāmayamāno tajjaṃ tajjaṃ attabhāvaṃ abhinibbatteti puññabhāgiyaṃ vā apuññabhāgiyaṃ vā, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, kāmānaṃ vipāko.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ

kāmaṃ kāmayamānassa,
tassa ce taṃ samijjhati,
addhā pītimano hoti,
laddhā macco yadicchati.

SNP 39 kāmasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 1
kāmayāna

prp. (+acc) wanting; desiring; craving [√kam + *aya + āna] ✓

Grammar prp of kāmayati, trans (+acc)
Meaning wanting; desiring; craving
Root Family √kam
Root √kam･8 *aya (desire)
Base √kam + *aya > kāmaya
Construction kāmaya + āna
Derivative kita (āna)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant kāmayamāna
Sanskrit kāmayamāna
Sanskrit Root √kam 3, 5 (love)

tassa ce kāmayānassa,
chandajātassa jantuno,
te kāmā parihāyanti,
sallaviddho'va ruppati.

SNP 39 kāmasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 1
kāmayoga

masc. bond of sensual pleasures; bondage of sense pleasure [kāma + yoga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning bond of sensual pleasures; bondage of sense pleasure
Construction kāma + yoga
Compound sattamī tappurisa (kāmesu + yoga)
Commentary (ANa) pañcakāmaguṇiko rāgo kāmayogo ... kāmesu vā yojetī'ti kāmayogo.
Sanskrit kāma + yoga

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, yogā. katame cattāro? kāmayogo, bhavayogo, diṭṭhiyogo, avijjāyogo.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
kāmayogavisaññoga

masc. detachment from the bond of sensual pleasures [kāmayoga + visaññoga] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning detachment from the bond of sensual pleasures
Construction kāmayoga + visaññoga
kāmayogavisaṃyoga

masc. detachment from the bond of sensual pleasures; disconnection from bondage to sensual stimulation [kāmayoga + visaṃyoga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning detachment from the bond of sensual pleasures; disconnection from bondage to sensual stimulation
Construction kāmayoga + visaṃyoga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāmayogamhā + visaṃyoga)
Commentary (ANa) kāmayogavisaṃyogo'ti kāmayogato visaṃyojanakāraṇaṃ. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit kāma + visaṃyoga

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, visaṃyogā. katame cattāro? kāmayogavisaṃyogo, bhavayogavisaṃyogo, diṭṭhiyogavisaṃyogo, avijjāyogavisaṃyogo.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
kāmayogasutta

nt. Itivuttaka 96 (ITI 96) ✗
kāmarajas

masc. defilement of sensual pleasure; dirt of sense desire [kāma + rajas] ~

Grammar masc, comp, mano group
Meaning defilement of sensual pleasure; dirt of sense desire
Construction kāma + rajas
Commentary (SNa) mā taṃ kāmarajo'ti ayaṃ kāmarāgarajo taṃ mā avahari, apāyam'eva mā netū'ti attho.
kāmarata

adj. delighted with sensual desire; pleased with sensual pleasures [kāma + rata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning delighted with sensual desire; pleased with sensual pleasures
Construction kāma + rata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (kāmesu + rata)
Sanskrit kāma + rata

mayaṃ, bhante ānanda, gihī kāmabhogino kām'ārāmā kāmaratā kāmasammuditā. tesaṃ no, bhante, amhākaṃ gihīnaṃ kāmabhogīnaṃ kām'ārāmānaṃ kāmaratānaṃ kāmasammuditānaṃ papāto viya khāyati, yadidaṃ nekkhammaṃ.

AN 9.41 tapussasuttaṃ
kāmarati

fem. delight in sensual pleasure; enjoying sex [kāma + rati] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning delight in sensual pleasure; enjoying sex
Construction kāma + rati
Compound sattamī tappurisa (kāme + rati)
Sanskrit kāma + rati

mā pamādam'anuyuñjetha,
mā kāmaratisanthavaṃ,
appamatto hi jhāyanto,
pappoti vipulaṃ sukhaṃ.

DHP 27 appamādavaggo

sattisūl'ūpamā kāmā,
khandhāsaṃ adhikuṭṭanā,
yaṃ tvaṃ kāmaratiṃ brūsi,
aratī dāni sā mama.

API 19 uppalavaṇṇātherīapadānaṃ
kāmaratisanthava

masc. intimacy with the delight of sensual pleasure; close association with sexual pleasure [kāma + rati + santhava] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning intimacy with the delight of sensual pleasure; close association with sexual pleasure
Construction kāma + rati + santhava

Sanskrit kāma + rati + saṃstava

mā pamādam'anuyuñjetha,
mā kāmaratisanthavaṃ,
appamatto hi jhāyanto,
pappoti vipulaṃ sukhaṃ.

DHP 27 appamādavaggo
kāmarāga

masc. passion for sensual pleasure; sensual desire; lust for sensual pleasure [kāma + rāga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning passion for sensual pleasure; sensual desire; lust for sensual pleasure
Construction kāma + rāga
Compound sattamī tappurisa (kāmesu + rāga)
Commentary (ANa) kāmarāgo'ti kāme ārabbha uppannarāgo. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit kāma + rāga

yasmiṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, samaye kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati kāmarāgaparetena, uppannassa ca kāmarāgassa nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, aniccasaññā bhāvitā bahulīkatā sabbaṃ kāmarāgaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ rūparāgaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ bhavarāgaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ avijjaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ asmimānaṃ samūhanati.

SN 22.102 aniccasaññāsuttaṃ
kāmarāgaṭṭhāniya

adj. serving as a basis for sensual desire; giving support to sexual lust [kāmarāga + ṭhāniya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning serving as a basis for sensual desire; giving support to sexual lust
Construction kāmarāga + ṭhāniya
Commentary (SNa) kāmarāgaṭṭhāniyānan'ti kāmarāgassa kāraṇabhūtānaṃ ārammaṇadhammānaṃ.
kāmarāgaṭṭhānīya

adj. serving as a basis for sensual desire; giving support to sexual lust [kāmarāga + ṭhānīya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning serving as a basis for sensual desire; giving support to sexual lust
Construction kāmarāga + ṭhānīya
Commentary (SNa) kāmarāgaṭṭhāniyānan'ti kāmarāgassa kāraṇabhūtānaṃ ārammaṇadhammānaṃ.
kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhita

adj. obsessed by sensual desire; consumed by the desire for sensual objects [kāma + rāga + pariyuṭṭhita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning obsessed by sensual desire; consumed by the desire for sensual objects
Construction kāma + rāga + pariyuṭṭhita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (kāmarāgena + pariyuṭṭhita)
Commentary (ANa) kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhitenā'ti kāmarāgaggahitena.
Sanskrit kāma + rāga + paryavasthita

evam'evaṃ kho, sandha, idh'ekacco purisakhaḷuṅko araññagato'pi rukkhamūlagato'pi suññ'āgāragato'pi kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati kāmarāgaparetena uppannassa ca kāmarāgassa nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ

yasmiṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, samaye kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati kāmarāgaparetena, uppannassa ca kāmarāgassa nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ
kāmarāgapareta

adj. afflicted by sensual desire; overcome by sexual lust; overwhelmed sensual pleasure [kāma + rāga + pareta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning afflicted by sensual desire; overcome by sexual lust; overwhelmed sensual pleasure
Construction kāma + rāga + pareta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (kāmarāgena + pareta)
Commentary (ANa) kāmarāgaparetenā'ti kāmarāg'ānugatena.
Sanskrit kāma + rāga + parīta

evam'evaṃ kho, sandha, idh'ekacco purisakhaḷuṅko araññagato'pi rukkhamūlagato'pi suññ'āgāragato'pi kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati kāmarāgaparetena uppannassa ca kāmarāgassa nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ

yasmiṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, samaye kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati kāmarāgaparetena, uppannassa ca kāmarāgassa nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ
kāmarāgappahāna

nt. removal of sensual desire; giving up of sensual pleasure [kāma + rāga + pahāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning removal of sensual desire; giving up of sensual pleasure
Construction kāma + rāga + pahāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāmarāgassa + pahāna)
Sanskrit kāma + rāga + prahāṇa

sattiyā viya omaṭṭho,
ḍayhamāno'va matthake,
kāmarāgappahānāya,
sato bhikkhu paribbaje'ti.

SN 1.21 sattisuttaṃ
kāmarāgaratta

adj. obsessed with passion for sensual pleasure; enamoured with sensual desire [kāmarāga + ratta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning obsessed with passion for sensual pleasure; enamoured with sensual desire
Construction kāmarāga + ratta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (kāmarāgena + ratta)
Commentary (NIDD2a) kāmarāgaratt'āyan'ti kāmarāgena ratto ayaṃ.
Sanskrit kāma + rāga + rakta
kāmarāgānusaya

masc. underlying tendency to sensual pleasure; inherent inclination to sensual desire; lit. sensual lust sleeping alongside [kāma + rāga + anusaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning underlying tendency to sensual pleasure; inherent inclination to sensual desire; lit. sensual lust sleeping alongside
Construction kāma + rāga + anusaya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (kāmarāgassa + anusaya)
Sanskrit kāma + rāga + anuśaya

kāmarāg'ānusayassa ... paṭigh'ānusayassa ... diṭṭh'ānusayassa ... vicikicch'ānusayassa ... mān'ānusayassa ... bhavarāg'ānusayassa ... avijj'ānusayassa pahānāya samucchedāya brahmacariyaṃ vussati.

AN 7.12 dutiānusayassayānusayasuttaṃ
kāmarāgābhinivesavinibandhapaligedhapariyuṭṭhānajjhosāna

nt. attachment to passion for sensual pleasure, bondage to it, greed for it, obsession with it and fixation with it; adherence to love of sensual desire, being tied to it, craving for it, being consumed by it and addiction to it [kāmarāga + abhinivesa + vinibandha + paligedha + pariyuṭṭhāna + ajjhosāna] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning attachment to passion for sensual pleasure, bondage to it, greed for it, obsession with it and fixation with it; adherence to love of sensual desire, being tied to it, craving for it, being consumed by it and addiction to it
Construction kāmarāga + abhinivesa + vinibandha + paligedha + pariyuṭṭhāna + ajjhosāna
kāmarāgābhinivesavinibandhapaligedhapariyuṭṭhānajjhosānahetu

ind. due to attachment to passion for sensual pleasure, bondage to it, greed for it, obsession with it and fixation with it; because of adherence to love of sensual desire, being tied to it, craving for it, being consumed by it and addiction to it [kāmarāga + abhinivesa + vinibandha + paligedha + pariyuṭṭhāna + ajjhosāna + hetu] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to attachment to passion for sensual pleasure, bondage to it, greed for it, obsession with it and fixation with it; because of adherence to love of sensual desire, being tied to it, craving for it, being consumed by it and addiction to it
Construction kāmarāga + abhinivesa + vinibandha + paligedha + pariyuṭṭhāna + ajjhosāna + hetu
Commentary (ANa) kāmarāgābhinivesa-vinibandha-paligedha-pariyuṭṭhān'ajjhosānahetū'ti kāmarāg'ābhinivesahetu, kāmarāgavinibandhahetu, kāmarāgapaligedhahetu, kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhānahetu, kāmarāgaajjhosānahetū'ti attho. idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti, yv'āyaṃ pañca kāmaguṇe nissāya uppajjati kāmarāgo, tass'ābhinives'ādihetu. kāmarāgena abhiniviṭṭhattā vinibaddhattā tasmiṃ'y'eva ca kāmarāge mahāpaṅke viya paligedhattā anupaviṭṭhattā ten'eva ca kāmarāgena pariyuṭṭhitattā gahitattā kāmarāgene'va ca ajjhositattā gilitvā pariniṭṭhapetvā gahitattā'ti. diṭṭhirāg'ādipadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
kāmalāpī

adj. saying whatever one wants; chattering however one wishes ✗
kāmalābhābhijappī

adj. who desires to obtain sensual pleasures ✗
kāmavitakka

masc. sensual thought; sexual thought [kāma + vitakka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning sensual thought; sexual thought
Construction kāma + vitakka
Compound kammadhāraya (kāma + vitakka)
Commentary (MNa) kāmavitakko'ti kāmapaṭisaṃyutto vitakko.
Sanskrit kāma + vitarka

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ n'ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti

MN 2.7 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate santi adhicittam'anuyuttassa bhikkhuno majjhimasahagatā upakkilesā kāmavitakko byāpādavitakko vihiṃsāvitakko, tam'enaṃ sacetaso bhikkhu dabbajātiko pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti.

tassa yā purimā kāmasaññā, sā nirujjhati. vivekaja-pītisukha-sukhumasacca-saññā tasmiṃ samaye hoti, vivekaja-pītisukha-sukhumasacca-saññī'y'eva tasmiṃ samaye hoti.

DN 9.3 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, sahetukasaññuppādanirodhakathā

so vata, bhikkhave, aññatr'eva kāmehi aññatra kāmasaññāya aññatra kāmavitakkehi kāme paṭisevissatī'ti, n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

ohārinaṃ sithilaṃ duppamuñcaṃ,
etam'pi chetvāna paribbajanti,
anapekkhino kāmasukhaṃ pahāya.

DHP 346 taṇhāvaggo

yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ime pañca kāmaguṇe paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṃ somanassaṃ idaṃ vuccati kāmasukhaṃ mīḷhasukhaṃ puthujjanasukhaṃ anariyasukhaṃ.

masc. devotion to indulging in sense pleasures ✗

kāmasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.78 (SN1.78) ✗

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.7 (AN5.7) ✗
kāmasutta 3

nt. Sutta Nipāta 4.1 (SNP 39) ✗

masc. affection for sensual pleasure; love for sensual enjoyment [kāma + sneha] ✓

Compound sattamī tappurisa (kāmesu + sneha)

Sanskrit kāma + sneha

yo ca nesaṃ kāmesu kāmacchando kāmasneho kāmamucchā kāmapipāsā kāmapariḷāho, so ca ajjhattaṃ na suppahīno hoti, na suppaṭippassaddho ... abhabbā'va te ñāṇāya dassanāya anuttarāya sambodhāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
kāmahetu

ind. for the sake of sensual pleasures; on account of sensual gratification [kāma + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for the sake of sensual pleasures; on account of sensual gratification
Construction kāma + hetu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāmassa + hetu)
Commentary (SNa) kāmahetū'ti kāmamūlakaṃ. kāmanidānan'ti kāmapaccayā. kām'ādhikaraṇan'ti kāmakāraṇā. sabbāni hetāni aññam'aññavevacanān'eva.
Sanskrit kāma + hetu

idh'āhaṃ, bhante, aḍḍakaraṇe nisinno passāmi khattiyamahāsāle'pi brāhmaṇamahāsāle'pi gahapatimahāsāle'pi aḍḍhe mahaddhane mahābhoge pahūtajātarūparajate pahūtavitt'ūpakaraṇe pahūtadhanadhaññe kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ sampajānamusā bhāsante.

SN 3.7 aḍḍakaraṇasuttaṃ

sītassa purakkhato uṇhassa purakkhato ḍaṃsamakasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīṃsapa-samphassehi rissamāno khuppipāsāya mīyamāno, ayam'pi, bhikkhave, kāmānaṃ ādīnavo sandiṭṭhiko, dukkhakkhandho kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ kāmānam'eva hetu.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
kāmahetukaṃ

ind. because of sensual pleasures; on account of sensual desire ✗
kāmaṃ 1

ind. freely; according to one’s wishes; according to inclination [√kam + *a + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of kāma
Meaning freely; according to one’s wishes; according to inclination
Root Family √kam
Root √kam･8 *e (desire)
Construction √kam > kām + *a + aṃ
kāma + aṃ
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit kāmam
Sanskrit Root √kam 3, 5 (love)

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ imaṃ kullaṃ sīse vā āropetvā khandhe vā uccāretvā yena kāmaṃ pakkameyyan'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
kāmaṃ 2

ind. gladly; happily; willingly [√kam + *a + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of kāma
Meaning gladly; happily; willingly
Root Family √kam
Root √kam･8 *e (desire)
Construction √kam > kām + *a + aṃ
kāma + aṃ
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit kāmam
Sanskrit Root √kam 3, 5 (love)

appaṭivānī sud'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, padahāmi, kāmaṃ taco ca nahāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upasussatu maṃsalohitaṃ, yaṃ taṃ purisathāmena purisavīriyena purisaparakkamena pattabbaṃ na taṃ apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa saṇṭhānaṃ bhavissatī'ti.

AN 2.5 upaññātasuttaṃ

passaṃ naro dakkhati nāmarūpaṃ,
disvāna vā ñassati tāni'm'eva,
kāmaṃ bahuṃ passatu appakaṃ vā,
na hi tena suddhiṃ kusalā vadanti.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
kāmaṃ 3

ind. indeed; surely; of course; certainly; lit. according to desire [√kam + *a + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of kāma
Meaning indeed; surely; of course; certainly; lit. according to desire
Root Family √kam
Root √kam･8 *e (desire)
Construction √kam > kām + *a + aṃ
kāma + aṃ
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit kāmam
Sanskrit Root √kam 3, 5 (love)

kāmaṃ kho pana m'āhu paro loko, hotu nesaṃ bhavataṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ saccaṃ vacanaṃ, atha ca pan'āyaṃ bhavaṃ purisapuggalo diṭṭh'eva dhamme viññūnaṃ gārayho

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
kāmaṃkara

adj. as you wish; as you prefer; lit. making a desire [kāmaṃ + kara] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning as you wish; as you prefer; lit. making a desire
Construction kāmaṃ + kara
Commentary (SNa) kāmaṃkaro'ti icchitakaro.
kāmā

ind. willingly; eagerly [√kam] ✗
kāmādīnavakathā

fem. discussion about the drawbacks of sensuality [kāmādīnava + kathā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning discussion about the drawbacks of sensuality
Construction kāmādīnava + kathā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāmādīnavassa + kathā)
Sanskrit kāma + ādīnava + kathā
kāmādhikaraṇaṃ

ind. for the sake of sensual pleasures; for the purpose of sensual pleasures [kāma + adhikaraṇa + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of kāmādhikaraṇa
Meaning for the sake of sensual pleasures; for the purpose of sensual pleasures
Construction kāma + adhikaraṇa + aṃ
kāmādhikaraṇa + aṃ
Commentary (SNa) kām'ādhikaraṇan'ti kāmakāraṇā. sabbāni hetāni aññam'aññavevacanān'eva.
Sanskrit kāma + adhikaraṇa

idh'āhaṃ, bhante, aḍḍakaraṇe nisinno passāmi khattiyamahāsāle'pi brāhmaṇamahāsāle'pi gahapatimahāsāle'pi aḍḍhe mahaddhane mahābhoge pahūtajātarūparajate pahūtavitt'ūpakaraṇe pahūtadhanadhaññe kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ sampajānamusā bhāsante.

SN 3.7 aḍḍakaraṇasuttaṃ

sītassa purakkhato uṇhassa purakkhato ḍaṃsamakasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīṃsapa-samphassehi rissamāno khuppipāsāya mīyamāno, ayam'pi, bhikkhave, kāmānaṃ ādīnavo sandiṭṭhiko, dukkhakkhandho kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ kāmānam'eva hetu.

taṃ passatha sabbaviduṃ sumedhaṃ,
ariye pathe kamamānaṃ mahesin'ti.

fem. woman for sexual pleasure ✗

ogh'ātigaṃ puṭṭhum'akāmam'āgamaṃ,
santipadaṃ brūhi sahajanetta,
yathātacchaṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ

kāmesumicchācārī hoti. yā tā māturakkhitā piturakkhitā mātāpiturakkhitā bhāturakkhitā bhaginirakkhitā ñātirakkhitā gottarakkhitā dhammarakkhitā sasāmikā saparidaṇḍā antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittā'pi, tathārūpāsu cārittaṃ āpajjitā hoti

tassa sabbehi imehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi visuddham'attānaṃ samanupassato, vimuttam'attānaṃ samanupassato, pāmojjaṃ jāyati, pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vedeti, sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati.

atthi kho, brahme, subhakiṇho nāma kāyo, vehapphalo nāma kāyo, abhibhū nāma kāyo, taṃ tvaṃ na jānāsi na passasi, tam'ahaṃ jānāmi passāmi.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

tatra, bhante, y'āyaṃ attabhāvapaṭilābho yasmiṃ attabhāvapaṭilābhe attasañcetanā kamati no parasañcetanā, attasañcetanāhetu tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā kāyā cuti hoti.

Phonetic Change c > k
i > ay
Commentary (ANa) mahato kāyassa padāletā'ti ekatobaddhaṃ phalakasatam'pi mahiṃsacammasatam'pi aṅguṭṭhapamāṇabahalaṃ lohapaṭṭam'pi caturaṅgulabahalaṃ asanapadaram'pi vidatthibahalaṃ udumbarapadaram'pi dīghantena vālikasakaṭam'pi vinivijjhituṃ samattho'ti attho.
Sanskrit kāya
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

idha, bhikkhave, yodh'ājīvo ṭhānakusalo ca hoti, dūrepātī ca, akkhaṇavedhī ca, mahato ca kāyassa padāletā.

AN 4.181 yodhājīvasuttaṃ
kāya 2.1

pron. with what; by what [ka + āya] ✓

Construction ka + āya
Sanskrit kayā

ekam'antaṃ nisinnaṃ kho poṭṭhapādaṃ paribbājakaṃ bhagavā etadavoca, kāya nu'ttha, poṭṭhapāda, eta'r'ahi kathāya sannisinnā, kā ca pana vo antarākathā vippakatā'ti?

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu

nisajja kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, kāyanu'ttha, bhikkhave, etarahi kathāya sannisinnā?

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
kāyakamma

Meaning physical action; bodily act
