Sanskrit kāya + karman

idha, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu visamena kāyakammena samannāgato hoti, visamena vacīkammena samannāgato hoti, visamena manokammena samannāgato hoti.

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, imesu āyasmantesu mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ āvi c'eva raho ca

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
kāyakammantasandosabyāpatti

fem. corruption and failure of physical action [kāyakammanta + sandosa + byāpatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning corruption and failure of physical action
Construction kāyakammanta + sandosa + byāpatti
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāyakammantassa + sandosabyāpatti)
Sanskrit kāya + karmānta + saṃdoṣa (bsk) + vyāpatti

tatra, bhikkhave, tividhā kāyakammantasandosabyāpatti akusalasañcetanikā dukkh'udrayā dukkhavipākā hoti, catubbidhā vacīkammantasandosabyāpatti akusalasañcetanikā dukkh'udrayā dukkhavipākā hoti, tividhā manokammantasandosabyāpatti akusalasañcetanikā dukkh'udrayā dukkhavipākā hoti.

AN 10.217 paṭhamasañcetanikasuttaṃ
kāyakammantasampatti

fem. successfully accomplishment of physical action [kāyakammanta + sampatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning successfully accomplishment of physical action
Construction kāyakammanta + sampatti
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāyakammantassa + sampatti)
Sanskrit kāya + karmānta + sampatti

tatra, bhikkhave, tividhā kāyakammantasampatti kusalasañcetanikā sukh'udrayā sukhavipākā hoti, catubbidhā vacīkammantasampatti kusalasañcetanikā sukh'udrayā sukhavipākā hoti, tividhā manokammantasampatti kusalasañcetanikā sukh'udrayā sukhavipākā hoti.

AN 10.217 paṭhamasañcetanikasuttaṃ
kāyakammavacīkamma

nt. physical and verbal action ✗
kāyakammavacīkammamanokamma

nt. physical, verbal and mental action; deed by body, speech and mind [kāyakamma + vacīkamma + manokamma] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning physical, verbal and mental action; deed by body, speech and mind
Construction kāyakamma + vacīkamma + manokamma
kāyakasāva

masc. defects of body; imperfection of physical conduct [kāya + kasāva] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning defects of body; imperfection of physical conduct
Construction kāya + kasāva
kāyakilamatha

masc. physical fatigue; exhaustion of the body [kāya + kilamatha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning physical fatigue; exhaustion of the body
Construction kāya + kilamatha
Commentary (SNa) kāyakilamatho'ti kāyadaratho. (SNt) kāyakilamatho'ti kāyaparissamo, so pana aṭṭh'uppattiyā paccayattā daratho'ti vutto.
kāyagata

adj. related to the body; immersed in the body; focused within; lit. gone to the body [kāya + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning related to the body; immersed in the body; focused within; lit. gone to the body
Construction kāya + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kāyaṃ + gata)
Sanskrit kāyagata

buddho ce me varaṃ dajjā,
so ca labbhetha me varo,
gaṇhe'haṃ sabbalokassa,
niccaṃ kāyagataṃ satiṃ.

TH 225 lakuṇḍaka bhaddiyattheragāthā

daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā'ti kho, bhikkhave, kāyagatāya satiyā etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. tasmā't'iha vo, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kāyagatā no sati bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā'ti.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
kāyagatāsati

fem. awareness immersed in the body; dwelling in the body; lit. mindfulness gone to the body [kāyagatā + sati] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning awareness immersed in the body; dwelling in the body; lit. mindfulness gone to the body
Construction kāyagatā + sati
Compound kammadhāraya (kāyagata + sati)
Variant kāyagataṃ sati
Commentary (DNa) kāyagatāsatī'ti ānāpānaṃ catuiriyāpatho satisampajaññaṃ dvattiṃs'ākāro catudhātuvavatthānaṃ dasa asubhā nava sivathikā cuṇṇikamanasikāro kes'ādīsu cattāri rūpajjhānānī'ti ettha uppannasatiyā etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. (MNa) kāyagatāsatin'ti kāyapariggāhikam'pi kāy'ārammaṇam'pi satiṃ. kāyapariggāhikan'ti vutte samatho kathito hoti, kāy'ārammaṇan'ti vutte vipassanā. ubhayena samathavipassanā kathitā honti.
Sanskrit kāyagata + smṛti

amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, anabhiññātaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati anabhiññātā. amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, abhiññātaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati abhiññātā'ti.

AN 1.609 amatavaggo

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno kāyagatāsati abhāvitā abahulīkatā, taṃ cakkhu āviñchati manāpiyesu rūpesu, amanāpiyā rūpā paṭikūlā honti

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
kāyagatāsativagga

masc. Chapter 30 of Ekakanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 1.563-599 ✗
kāyagatāsatisutta 1

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 119 (MN119) ✗
kāyagatāsatisutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 43.1 (SN43.1) ✗
kāyagantha

masc. bodily fetter ✗
kāyagutta 1

adj. controlled in action; lit. guarded with body [kāya + gutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning controlled in action; lit. guarded with body
Construction kāya + gutta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (kāyena + gutta)
Sanskrit kāya + gupta

kāyagutto vacīgutto,
āhāre udare yato,
saccaṃ karomi niddānaṃ,
soraccaṃ me pamocanaṃ.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
kāyagutta 2

masc. bodily ✗
kāyachanda

masc. interest in the body; desire for the body [kāya + chanda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning interest in the body; desire for the body
Construction kāya + chanda
kāyaññatara

masc. (+loc) one of the bodies (among); a certain physical process (among) [kāya + aññatara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp (+loc)
Meaning one of the bodies (among); a certain physical process (among)
Construction kāya + aññatara
Compound kammadhāraya (kāya + aññatara)
Commentary (MNa) kāy'aññataran'ti pathavīkāy'ādīsu catūsu kāyesu aññataraṃ vadāmi, vāyo kāyaṃ vadāmī'ti attho. atha vā rūp'āyatanaṃ ... kabaḷīkāro āhāro'ti pañcavīsati rūpakoṭṭhāsā rūpakāyo nāma. tesu ānāpānaṃ phoṭṭhabb'āyatane saṅgahitattā kāy'aññataraṃ hoti, tasmā'pi evam'āha.
Sanskrit kāya + anyatara

kāyesu kāy'aññatar'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, evaṃ vadāmi yadidaṃ, assāsapassāsā. tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, kāye kāy'ānupassī tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ
kāyaḍāha

masc. fever, inflammation of the body ✗
kāyati

pr. talks, chants [√kā] ✗
kāyatta

nt. fact of having a (kind of) body [√ci + *a + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, from kāya
Meaning fact of having a (kind of) body
Root Family √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Construction √ci > ki > kay + *a + tta
kāya + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change c > k
i > ay
Sanskrit kāyatva
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)
kāyadaḍḍhibahula

masc. intent on strengthening the body; concerned with physical well being ✗
kāyadaṇḍa

masc. (Jain) physical action [kāya + daṇḍa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (Jain) physical action
Construction kāya + daṇḍa
Compound kammadhāraya (kāya + daṇḍa)
Commentary (MNa) kāyadaṇḍaṃ vacīdaṇḍaṃ manodaṇḍan'ti ettha purimadaṇḍadvayaṃ te acittakaṃ payyapenti. yathā kira vāte vāyante sākhā calati, udakaṃ calati, na ca tattha cittaṃ atthi, evaṃ kāyadaṇḍo'pi acittako'va hoti. yathā ca vāte vāyante tālapaṇṇ'ādīni saddaṃ karonti, udakāni saddaṃ karonti, na ca tattha cittaṃ atthi, evaṃ vacīdaṇḍo'pi acittako'va hotī'ti imaṃ daṇḍadvayaṃ acittakaṃ paññapenti. cittaṃ pana manodaṇḍan'ti paññapenti.
Sanskrit kāya + daṇḍa

tīṇi kho, āvuso gotama, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto daṇḍāni paññapeti pāpassa kammassa kiriyāya pāpassa kammassa pavattiyāti, seyyath'idaṃ, kāyadaṇḍaṃ, vacīdaṇḍaṃ, manodaṇḍan'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
kāyadaḷhibahula

adj. intent on making body firm; concerned with physical well being; lit. often strengthening the body ✗

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning physical suffering; lit. body pain
Construction kāya + dukkha
kāyaduccarita

nt. physical misconduct; bodily misbehaviour [kāya + duccarita] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning physical misconduct; bodily misbehaviour
Construction kāya + duccarita
Compound kammadhāraya (kāya + duccarita)
Antonym kāyasucarita
Sanskrit kāya + duścarita

idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako hirīmā hoti, hirīyati kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena, hirīyati pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ samāpattiyā. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, hirīdhanaṃ

AN 7.6 vitthatadhanasuttaṃ

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, santi adhicittam'anuyuttassa bhikkhuno oḷārikā upakkilesā kāyaduccaritaṃ vacīduccaritaṃ manoduccaritaṃ

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
kāyaduccaritasamaṅgī

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has the quality of unethical physical conduct; who physically misbehaves
Construction kāyaduccarita + samaṅgī
kāyaduṭṭhulla

nt. sluggishness; physical inertia; bodily heaviness [kāya + duṭṭhulla] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning sluggishness; physical inertia; bodily heaviness
Construction kāya + duṭṭhulla
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāyassa + duṭṭhulla)
Commentary (MNa) kāyaduṭṭhullānaṃ paṭippassaddhiyā'ti iminā kāy'ālasiyapaṭippassaddhi kathitā.
Sanskrit kāya + duṣṭhula (bsk), dauṣṭhulya (bsk)

idh'ānanda, bhikkhu upadhivivekā akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānā sabbaso kāyaduṭṭhullānaṃ paṭippassaddhiyā vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dependent on the body
Construction kāya + nissita
kāyanuttha

sandhi. with what here?; with what now? [kāya + nu + ettha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + adv, interr
Meaning with what here?; with what now?
Construction kāya + nu + ettha
Commentary (MNa) kāya nutthā'ti katamāya nu kathāya sannisinnā bhavathā'ti attho. kāya netthā'ti'pi pāḷi, tassā katamāya nu etthā'ti attho. kāya no'tthā'ti'pi pāḷi, tassā'pi purimo'y'eva attho.
Sanskrit kayā + nu + etra

nisajja kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, kāyanu'ttha, bhikkhave, etarahi kathāya sannisinnā?

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
kāyanvaya

adj. conforming to the body; subject to the body; subservient to the body; lit. following the body [kāya + anvaya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning conforming to the body; subject to the body; subservient to the body; lit. following the body
Construction kāya + anvaya
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kāyaṃ + anvaya)
Antonym cittanvaya
Commentary (MNa) kāy'anvayaṃ hotī'ti kāy'ānugataṃ hoti kāyassa vasavatti.
Sanskrit kāya + anvaya

tassa kho etaṃ, bho gotama, kāy'anvayaṃ cittaṃ hoti, kāyassa vasena vattati. taṃ kissa hetu? abhāvitattā cittassa.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
kāyanvayatā

fem. fact of conforming to the body; fact of being subject to the body ✗
kāyapaṭibaddha

adj. connected to the body; touching the body; lit. tied back onto the body [kāya + paṭibaddha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning connected to the body; touching the body; lit. tied back onto the body
Construction kāya + paṭibaddha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (kāye + paṭibaddha)
Sanskrit kāya + pratibandha

dinnaṃ nāma kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā nissaggiyena vā dente hatthapāse ṭhito kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā paṭiggaṇhāti, etaṃ dinnaṃ nāma.

VIN 2.5.4.10 dantaponasikkhāpadaṃ

pahāraṃ dadeyyā'ti kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā nissaggiyena vā antamaso uppalapattena'pi pahāraṃ deti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.8.4 pahārasikkhāpadaṃ
kāyapariyantika

adj. limited to the body; circumscribed within the body [kāya + pariyantika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning limited to the body; circumscribed within the body
Construction kāya + pariyantika
Compound kammadhāraya (kāya + pariyantika)
Commentary (ANa) kāyapariyantikan'ti kāy'antikaṃ kāyaparicchinnaṃ, yāva pañcadvārakāyo pavattati, tāva pavattaṃ pañcadvārikavedanan'ti attho.
Sanskrit kāya + paryanta

so kāyapariyantikaṃ vedanaṃ vedayamāno kāyapariyantikaṃ vedanaṃ vedayāmī'ti pajānāti, jīvitapariyantikaṃ vedanaṃ vedayamāno jīvitapariyantikaṃ vedanaṃ vedayāmī'ti pajānāti

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
kāyaparihārika

adj. for looking after the body; for taking care of the body [kāya + parihārika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning for looking after the body; for taking care of the body
Construction kāya + parihārika
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kāyaṃ + parihārika)
Commentary (ANa) kāyaparihārikenā'ti kāyapariharaṇamattakena.
Sanskrit kāya + parihāraka

so santuṭṭho hoti kāyaparihārikena cīvarena kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena so yena yen'eva pakkamati samādāy'eva pakkamati

MN 27 cūḷa hatthipadopamasuttaṃ
kāyapassaddhi

fem. physical calmness; bodily tranquillity; (comm) stilling of distress in the three aggregates of feeling, perception and thinking [kāya + passaddhi] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning physical calmness; bodily tranquillity; (comm) stilling of distress in the three aggregates of feeling, perception and thinking
Construction kāya + passaddhi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāyassa + passaddhi)
Commentary (SNa) kāyapassaddhī'ti tiṇṇaṃ khandhānaṃ darathapassaddhi.
Sanskrit kāya + praśrabdhi

atthi, bhikkhave, kāyapassaddhi, cittapassaddhi. tattha yonisomanasikārabahulīkāro, ayam'āhāro anuppannassa vā passaddhisambojjh'aṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā passaddhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā.

SN 46.2 kāyasuttaṃ
kāyappakopa

masc. physical agitation; physical irritation; physical disturbance [kāya + pakopa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning physical agitation; physical irritation; physical disturbance
Construction kāya + pakopa
Compound kammadhāraya (kāya + pakopa)
Commentary (DHPa) kāyappakopan'ti tividhaṃ kāyaduccaritaṃ rakkheyya.
Sanskrit kāya + prakopa

kāyappakopaṃ rakkheyya,
kāyena saṃvuto siyā,
kāyaduccaritaṃ hitvā,
kāyena sucaritaṃ care.

na kāyappacālakaṃ antaraghare gamissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 15 kāyappacālakasikkhāpadaṃ

tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kāyappacālakaṃ antaraghare gacchanti kāyaṃ olambentā

VIN 2.7.2 ujjagghikavaggo
kāyappaṭibaddha 1

Sanskrit kāya + pratibandha

assāsapassāsā kho, gahapati, kāyikā. ete dhammā kāyappaṭibaddhā, tasmā assāsapassāsā kāyasaṅkhāro.

kāyabandhana

nt. belt; waist-band; lit. body fastening [kāya + bandhana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning belt; waist-band; lit. body fastening
Construction kāya + bandhana
Compound catutthī tappurisa (kāyassa + bandhana)

Sanskrit kāyabandhana

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā nisīdanaṃ vā sūcigharaṃ vā kāyabandhanaṃ vā apanidheyya vā apanidhāpeyya vā antamaso has'āpekkho'pi, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 60 apanidhānasikkhāpadaṃ
kāyabala

nt. bodily strength; physical force; physical effort [kāya + bala] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bodily strength; physical force; physical effort
Construction kāya + bala
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāyassa + bala)
Commentary (MNa) kāyabalenā'ti bāhā khipanto sarīrato sedehi muccantehi na kāyabalena gacchati.
Sanskrit kāya + bala

so gacchanto na satthiṃ unnāmeti, na satthiṃ onāmeti, na satthiṃ sannāmeti, na satthiṃ vināmeti. gacchato kho pana tassa bhoto gotamassa adharakāyo'va iñjati, na ca kāyabalena gacchati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
kāyabalena

ind. forcefully; effortfully; physically; lit. with body strength [kāya + bala + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, instr sg of kāyabala
Meaning forcefully; effortfully; physically; lit. with body strength
Construction kāya + bala + ena
kāyabala + ena
Commentary (MNa) kāyabalenā'ti bāhā khipanto sarīrato sedehi muccantehi na kāyabalena gacchati.
Sanskrit kāya + balena

so gacchanto na satthiṃ unnāmeti, na satthiṃ onāmeti, na satthiṃ sannāmeti, na satthiṃ vināmeti. gacchato kho pana tassa bhoto gotamassa adharakāyo'va iñjati, na ca kāyabalena gacchati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
kāyabhāvanā 1

fem. self-mortification; physical torture; painful ascetic practices; lit. development of the body [kāya + bhāvanā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning self-mortification; physical torture; painful ascetic practices; lit. development of the body
Construction kāya + bhāvanā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāyassa + bhāvanā)
Antonym cittabhāvanā
Commentary (MNa) no kāyabhāvanan'ti pañc'ātapatappan'ādiṃ attakilamath'ānuyogaṃ sandhāy'āha. ayañ'hi tesaṃ kāyabhāvanā nāma.
Sanskrit kāya + bhāvanā

tassa mayhaṃ, bho gotama, evaṃ hoti, addhā bhoto gotamassa sāvakā cittabhāvan'ānuyogam'anuyuttā viharanti, no kāyabhāvanan'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
kāyabhāvanā 2

fem. development of the body; physical cultivation; (comm) insight [kāya + bhāvanā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning development of the body; physical cultivation; (comm) insight
Construction kāya + bhāvanā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāyassa + bhāvanā)
Antonym cittabhāvanā
Commentary (MNa) kāyabhāvanā'ti pana vipassanā vuccati, tāya cittavikkhepaṃ pāpuṇanto nāma n'atthi, iti nigaṇṭho asantaṃ abhūtaṃ yaṃ n'atthi, tadev'āha.
Sanskrit kāya + bhāvanā

atha kho bhagavā saccakaṃ nigaṇṭhaputtaṃ etadavoca, yā'pi kho te esā, aggivessana, purimā kāyabhāvanā bhāsitā sā'pi ariyassa vinaye no dhammikā kāyabhāvanā.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
kāyabhāvanānuyogamanuyutta

adj. devoted to the practice of developing the body; devoted to the practice of physical torture [kāya + bhāvanā + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoted to the practice of developing the body; devoted to the practice of physical torture
Construction kāya + bhāvanā + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (kāyabhāvanānuyogaṃ + anuyutta)
Antonym cittabhāvanānuyogamanuyutta
Sanskrit kāya + bhāvanā + anuyoga + anuyukta

santi, bho gotama, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā kāyabhāvan'ānuyogamanuyuttā viharanti, no cittabhāvanaṃ.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
kāyamuni

nt. physical sagacity [kāya + muni] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning physical sagacity
Construction kāya + muni
Commentary (ANa) kāyamunin'ti kāyadvāre muniṃ uttamaṃ parisuddhaṃ, kāyena vā muniṃ. sesadvaye'pi es'eva nayo.
kāyamoneyya

nt. physical sage-hood [kāya + moneyya] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning physical sage-hood
Construction kāya + moneyya
Commentary (DNa) tesaṃ vitthāro tattha katamaṃ kāyamoneyyaṃ? tividhakāyaduccaritassa pahānaṃ kāyamoneyyaṃ, tividhaṃ kāyasucaritaṃ kāyamoneyyaṃ, kāy'ārammaṇe ñāṇaṃ kāyamoneyyaṃ, kāyapariññā kāyamoneyyaṃ, kāyapariññāsahagato maggo kāyamoneyyaṃ, kāyasmiṃ chandarāgappahānaṃ kāyamoneyyaṃ, kāyasaṅkhāranirodhā catutthajjhānasamāpatti kāyamoneyyaṃ. (ANa) kāyamoneyyan'ti kāyadvāre munibhāvo sādhubhāvo paṇḍitabhāvo. sesadvaye'pi es'eva nayo.
kāyaroga

masc. disease of the body [kāya + roga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning disease of the body
Construction kāya + roga
Compound sattamī tappurisa (kāyasmiṃ + roga)
Sanskrit kāya + roga

iti imasmiṃ kāye vividhā ābādhā uppajjanti, seyyath'idaṃ, cakkhurogo sotarogo ghānarogo jivhārogo kāyarogo sīsarogo kaṇṇarogo mukharogo dantarogo oṭṭharogo kāso sāso pināso ḍāho jaro kucchirogo mucchā

AN 10.60 girimānandasuttaṃ
kāyavaṅka

masc. crookedness of action ✗
kāyaviññāṇa

nt. body consciousness; tactile awareness; lit. body knowing [kāya + viññāṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning body consciousness; tactile awareness; lit. body knowing
Construction kāya + viññāṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (kāya + viññāṇa)
Sanskrit kāya + vijñāna

kāyañ'c'āvuso paṭicca phoṭṭhabbe ca uppajjati kāyaviññāṇaṃ

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, viññāṇaṃ? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, viññāṇakāyā, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ, sotaviññāṇaṃ, ghānaviññāṇaṃ, jivhāviññāṇaṃ, kāyaviññāṇaṃ, manoviññāṇaṃ.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
kāyaviññāṇadhātu

fem. awareness of physical feelings; lit. body consciousness state [kāyaviññāṇa + dhātu] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning awareness of physical feelings; lit. body consciousness state
Construction kāyaviññāṇa + dhātu
kāyaviññāṇaviññātabba

adj. knowable by touching; lit. to be known by body knowing [kāya + viññāṇa + viññātabba] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning knowable by touching; lit. to be known by body knowing
Construction kāya + viññāṇa + viññātabba
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (kāyaviññāṇena + viññātabba)
Sanskrit kāya + vijñāna + vijñātavya

kāyaṃ, āvuso channa, kāyaviññāṇaṃ kāyaviññāṇaviññātabbe dhamme etaṃ mama, eso'ham'asmi, eso me attā'ti samanupassasi?

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ
kāyaviññeyya

adj. touchable; known by the body; lit. to be known by the body [kāya + viññeyya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp, comp
Meaning touchable; known by the body; lit. to be known by the body
Construction kāya + viññeyya
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (kāyena + viññeyya)
Sanskrit kāya + vijñeya

bhusā ce'pi kāyaviññeyyā phoṭṭhabbā kāyassa āpāthaṃ āgacchanti, n'ev'assa cittaṃ pariyādiyanti. amissīkatam'ev'assa cittaṃ hoti ṭhitaṃ āneñjappattaṃ vayañ'c'ass'ānupassati.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

ye te kāyaviññeyyā phoṭṭhabbā asamphuṭṭhā asamphuṭṭhapubbā, na ca phusasi, na ca te hoti phuseyyan'ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ
kāyavūpakāsa

masc. physical seclusion; bodily isolation [kāya + vūpakāsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning physical seclusion; bodily isolation
Construction kāya + vūpakāsa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāyassa + vūpakāsa)
Antonym cittavūpakāsa
Sanskrit kāya + vyavakarṣaṇa

tathārūpānaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ dhammaṃ sutvā dvayena vūpakāsena vūpakaṭṭho viharati, kāyavūpakāsena ca cittavūpakāsena ca.

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ

so taṃ dhammaṃ sutvā dvayena vūpakāsena sampādeti, kāyavūpakāsena ca cittavūpakāsena ca.

kāyasakkhi

adj. body-witness, who experienced formless states ✗
kāyasakkhī

adj. who has witnessed (the truth) with the body; who has experienced viscerally [kāya + sakkhī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has witnessed (the truth) with the body; who has experienced viscerally
Construction kāya + sakkhī
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (kāyena + sakkhī)
Commentary (ANa) kāyasakkhī'ti kāyena jhānaphassaṃ phusitvā pacchā nirodhaṃ nibbānaṃ sacchikatvā ṭhito.
Sanskrit kāya + sākṣin

idh'āvuso, bhikkhu vivicc'eva kāmehi ... paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati. yathā yathā ca tadāyatanaṃ tathā tathā naṃ kāyena phusitvā viharati. ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, kāyasakkhī vutto bhagavatā pariyāyena.

AN 9.43 kāyasakkhīsuttaṃ
kāyasakkhīsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.43 (AN9.43) ✗
kāyasaṅkhāra 1

masc. physical process; bodily function; (comm) in and out breathing [kāya + saṅkhāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning physical process; bodily function; (comm) in and out breathing
Construction kāya + saṅkhāra
Compound kammadhāraya (kāya + saṅkhāra)
Commentary (MNa) kāyasaṅkhārā'ti assāsapassāsā. (SNa) tattha kāyappaṭibaddhattā kāyena saṅkharīyati nibbattīyatī'ti kāyasaṅkhāro.
Sanskrit kāya + saṃskāra

yv'āyaṃ, āvuso, mato kālaṅ'kato tassa kāyasaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, vacīsaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, cittasaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, āyu parikkhīṇo, usmā vūpasantā, indriyāni paribhinnāni.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

passambhayaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, passambhayaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ passasissāmī'ti sikkhati.

DN 22.2 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
kāyasaṅkhāra 2

masc. intention which results in bodily action [kāya + saṅkhāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning intention which results in bodily action
Construction kāya + saṅkhāra
Compound kammadhāraya (kāya + saṅkhāra)
Commentary (MNa) kāyadvāre gahaṇādivasena copanappattā dvādasa akusalacetanā sabyābajjhakāyasaṅkhāro nāma.
Sanskrit kāya + saṃskāra

katamañ'ca, puṇṇa, kammaṃ kaṇhaṃ kaṇhavipākaṃ? idha, puṇṇa, ekacco sabyābajjhaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti, sabyābajjhaṃ vacīsaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti, sabyābajjhaṃ manosaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti.

MN 57 kukkuravatikasuttaṃ
kāyasañcetanāhetu

ind. due to intention regarding the body; caused by physical volition [kāya + sañcetanā + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to intention regarding the body; caused by physical volition
Construction kāya + sañcetanā + hetu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāyasañcetanāya + hetu)
Commentary (SNa) kāyasañcetanāhetū'ti kāyadvāre uppannacetanāhetu.
Sanskrit kāya + saṃcetanā + hetu

kāye vā h'ānanda, sati kāyasañcetanāhetu uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhadukkhaṃ. vācāya vā h'ānanda, sati vacīsañcetanāhetu uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhadukkhaṃ.

SN 12.25 bhūmijasuttaṃ
kāyasattha

nt. bodily weapon; physical sword [kāya + sattha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bodily weapon; physical sword
Construction kāya + sattha
Antonym vacīsattha, manosattha
Commentary (NIDD1a) kāyaduccaritaṃ kāyasatthaṃ. vacīsatthādīsu'pi es'eva nayo. taṃ vibhāgato dassetuṃ tividhaṃ kāyaduccaritaṃ kāyasatthan'ti āha.
Sanskrit kāya + śastra

aggiṃ, brāhmaṇa, ādhento yūpaṃ ussāpento pubb'eva yaññā idaṃ tatiyaṃ kāyasatthaṃ ussāpeti akusalaṃ dukkh'udrayaṃ dukkhavipākaṃ.

AN 7.47 dutiyaaggisuttaṃ

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning physical corruption; defilement of the body
Construction kāya + sandosa
Commentary (ANa) kāyasandosan'ti kāyadvārassa dussanākāraṃ. sesadvaye'pi es'eva nayo.
kāyasamācāra

masc. physical conduct; bodily behaviour [kāya + samācāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning physical conduct; bodily behaviour
Construction kāya + samācāra
Compound kammadhāraya (kāya + samācāra)
Sanskrit kāya + samācāra

pañc'ime, āvuso, āghātapaṭivinayā yattha bhikkhuno uppanno āghāto sabbaso paṭivinetabbo. katame pañca? idh'āvuso, ekacco puggalo aparisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti parisuddhavacīsamācāro.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

codakena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetu'kāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ, parisuddhakāyasamācāro nu kho'mhi, parisuddhen'amhi kāyasamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena

AN 10.44 kusinārasuttaṃ
kāyasamārambha

masc. physical exertion; initiating bodily action [kāya + samārambha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning physical exertion; initiating bodily action
Construction kāya + samārambha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāyassa + samārambha)
Sanskrit kāya + samārambha

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, vappa, ye kāyasamārambhapaccayā uppajjanti āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, kāyasamārambhā paṭiviratassa evaṃ'sa te āsavā vighātapariḷāhā na honti.

AN 4.195 vappasuttaṃ
kāyasamārambhapaccayā

ind. due to physical exertion; due to initiating bodily action [kāya + samārambha + paccaya + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, abl sg of kāyasamārambhapaccaya
Meaning due to physical exertion; due to initiating bodily action
Construction kāya + samārambha + paccaya + ā
kāyasamārambhapaccaya + ā
Notes (ANa) kāyasamārambhapaccayā'ti kāyakammapaccayena
Sanskrit kāya + samārambha + pratyayāt

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, vappa, ye kāyasamārambhapaccayā uppajjanti āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, kāyasamārambhā paṭiviratassa evaṃ'sa te āsavā vighātapariḷāhā na honti.

AN 4.195 vappasuttaṃ
kāyasamphassa

masc. physical contact; somatic impression [kāya + samphassa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning physical contact; somatic impression
Construction kāya + samphassa
Compound kammadhāraya (kāya + samphassa)
Sanskrit kāya + saṃsparśa

yo'pi hetu yo'pi paccayo kāyasamphassassa uppādāya, so'pi hetu so'pi paccayo anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī. aniccaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, paccayaṃ paṭicca uppanno kāyasamphasso kuto nicco bhavissati!

SN 35.93 dutiyadvayasuttaṃ

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ? yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, kāyikaṃ dukkhaṃ kāyikaṃ asātaṃ kāyasamphassajaṃ dukkhaṃ asātaṃ vedayitaṃ, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ

DN 22.15 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
kāyasamphassaja

adj. caused by physical contact; produced by somatic impression; lit. born from body touch [kāya + samphassa + ja] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning caused by physical contact; produced by somatic impression; lit. born from body touch
Construction kāya + samphassa + ja
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (kāyasamphassasmā + ja)
Sanskrit kāya + saṃsparśa + ja

katamā ca, bhikkhave, vedanā? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, vedanākāyā, cakkhusamphassajā vedanā, sotasamphassajā vedanā, ghānasamphassajā vedanā, jivhāsamphassajā vedanā, kāyasamphassajā vedanā, manosamphassajā vedanā.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ? yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, kāyikaṃ dukkhaṃ kāyikaṃ asātaṃ kāyasamphassajaṃ dukkhaṃ asātaṃ vedayitaṃ, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ

DN 22.15 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
kāyasamphassapaccayā

ind. dependent on physical contact; due to somatic impression; lit. from condition of body contact [kāya + samphassa + paccaya + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, abl sg of kāyasamphassapaccaya
Meaning dependent on physical contact; due to somatic impression; lit. from condition of body contact
Construction kāya + samphassa + paccaya + ā
kāyasamphassapaccaya + ā
Sanskrit kāya + saṃsparśa + pratyayāt

kāyasmiṃ sati kāyasamphassapaccayā uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhaṃ dukkhaṃ. manasmiṃ sati manosamphassapaccayā

SN 35.236 paṭhamahatthapādopamasuttaṃ

kāyaṃ aññato passati, phoṭṭhabbe aññato passati, kāyaviññāṇaṃ aññato passati, kāyasamphassaṃ aññato passati, yam'p'idaṃ kāyasamphassapaccayā

SN 35.80 dutiyāvijjāpahānasuttaṃ
kāyasamphassaviññāṇāyatana

nt. physical contact and the corresponding field of consciousness; somatic impression and the associated dimension of knowing [kāyasamphassa + viññāṇāyatana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning physical contact and the corresponding field of consciousness; somatic impression and the associated dimension of knowing
Construction kāyasamphassa + viññāṇāyatana
Commentary (SNa) cakkhusamphassaviññāṇāyatanan'ti cakkhuviññāṇena sampayutto cakkhusamphasso'pi viññāṇ'āyatanam'pi mam'evā'ti. ettha ca cakkhusamphassena viññāṇasampayuttakā dhammā gahitā, viññāṇ'āyatanena sabbāni'pi cakkhudvāre uppannāni āvajjan'ādiviññāṇāni. sotadvār'ādīsu'pi eseva nayo.
kāyasamphassāyatana

nt. field of somatic experience; lit. body contact field [kāya + samphassāyatana] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning field of somatic experience; lit. body contact field
Construction kāya + samphassāyatana
kāyasaṃvara

masc. physical restraint; bodily control [kāya + saṃvara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning physical restraint; bodily control
Construction kāya + saṃvara
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kāyassa + saṃvara)
Sanskrit kāya + saṃvara

sītaṃ, uṇhaṃ, jighacchā, pipāsā, uccāro, passāvo, kāyasaṃvaro, vacīsaṃvaro, ājīvasaṃvaro, ponobhaviko bhavasaṅkhāro, ime kho, bhikkhave, dasa dhammā sarīraṭṭhā'ti. navamaṃ.

AN 10.49 sarīraṭṭhadhammasuttaṃ
kāyasaṃsagga

masc. physical contact; physical intimacy; touching the body [kāya + saṃsagga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning physical contact; physical intimacy; touching the body
Construction kāya + saṃsagga
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (kāyena + saṃsagga)
Commentary (VIN 1.2.2) kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjeyyā'ti ajjhācāro vuccati.
Sanskrit kāya + saṃsarjana

yo pana bhikkhu otiṇṇo vipariṇatena cittena mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjeyya hatthaggāhaṃ vā veṇiggāhaṃ vā aññatarassa vā aññatarassa vā aṅgassa parāmasanaṃ, saṅghādiseso.

VIN PAT SA 2 kāyasaṃsaggasikkhāpadaṃ
kāyasaṃsaggasikkhāpada

Meaning rule about physical contact; Saṅghādisesa 2
Construction kāyasaṃsagga + sikkhāpada
kāyasukha

nt. physical pleasure; lit. body ease [kāya + sukha] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning physical pleasure; lit. body ease
Construction kāya + sukha
kāyasucarita

nt. good physical conduct; virtuous bodily behaviour [kāya + sucarita] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning good physical conduct; virtuous bodily behaviour
Construction kāya + sucarita
Compound kammadhāraya (kāya + sucarita)
Antonym kāyaduccarita
Sanskrit kāya + sucarita

aho vata ayam'āyasmā kāyaduccaritaṃ pahāya kāyasucaritaṃ bhāveyya, vacīduccaritaṃ pahāya vacīsucaritaṃ bhāveyya, manoduccaritaṃ pahāya manosucaritaṃ bhāveyya!

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

ime vā pana bhonto sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā vacīsucaritena samannāgatā manosucaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṃ anupavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā

VIN 1.0 verañjakaṇḍaṃ
kāyasucaritasamaṅgī

adj. who has the quality of ethical physical conduct; who has virtuous bodily behaviour [kāyasucarita + samaṅgī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has the quality of ethical physical conduct; who has virtuous bodily behaviour
Construction kāyasucarita + samaṅgī
kāyasuci

nt. purity of body [kāya + suci] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning purity of body
Construction kāya + suci
Commentary (ITIa) gāthāyaṃ samucchedavasena pahīnasabbakāyaduccaritattā kāyena sucī'ti kāyasuci.
kāyasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.2 (SN46.2) ✗
kāyasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.23 (AN10.23) ✗
kāyasoceyya

nt. purity of the body ✗
kāyasneha

masc. affection for the body; love for the body [kāya + sneha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning affection for the body; love for the body
Construction kāya + sneha
kāyānamantarena

sandhi. in-between the bodies; in-between the masses [kāyānaṃ + antarena] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + adv
Meaning in-between the bodies; in-between the masses
Construction kāyānaṃ + antarena
Commentary (MNa) sattannaṃtv'eva kāyānan'ti yathā muggar'āsi'ādīsu pahaṭaṃ satthaṃ muggar'āsiādīnaṃ antarena pavisati, evaṃ sattannaṃ kāyānaṃ antarena chiddena vivarena satthaṃ pavisati. tattha ahaṃ imaṃ jīvitā voropemī'ti kevalaṃ saññāmattam'eva hotī'ti dasseti.
Sanskrit kāyānām + antareṇa

tattha n'atthi hantā vā ghātetā vā sotā vā sāvetā vā viññātā vā viññāpetā vā. yo'pi tiṇhena satthena sīsaṃ chindati, na koci kañci jīvitā voropeti. sattannaṃtv'eva kāyānam'antarena satthaṃ vivaram'anupatati.

MN 76 sandakasuttaṃ
kāyānupassanā

fem. body-watching; contemplating the body [kāya + anupassanā] ~

Grammar fem, act, comp
Meaning body-watching; contemplating the body
Construction kāya + anupassanā
kāyānupassī

adj. observing the body; who watches the body [kāya + anupassī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning observing the body; who watches the body
Construction kāya + anupassī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kāyaṃ + anupassī)
Sanskrit kāya + anupaśyin

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāy'ānupassī viharati

SN 47.14 ukkacelasuttaṃ

yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dīghaṃ vā assasanto dīghaṃ assasāmī'ti pajānāti ... kāye kāy'ānupassī, bhikkhave, tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.

i > ay

Commentary (ANa) kāyikā'ti pañcadvārakāyaṃ khobhayamānā.
Sanskrit kāyika
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, kumāra, api nu tassa gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā uppajjeyyuṃ rāgajā pariḷāhā kāyikā vā cetasikā vā yehi so rāgajehi pariḷāhehi pariḍayhamāno dukkhaṃ sayeyyā'ti?

AN 3.35 hatthakasuttaṃ

no ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu parisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti parisuddhena kāyasamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena, tassa bhavanti vattāro, iṅgha tāva āyasmā kāyikaṃ sikkhassū'ti, iti'ssa bhavanti vattāro

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo

adhipātakā vuccanti sabbā'pi makkhikāyo. kiṃkāraṇā adhipātakā vuccanti sabbā'pi makkhikāyo? tā uppatitvā uppatitvā khādanti, taṃkāraṇā adhipātakā vuccanti sabbā'pi makkhikāyo.

kāraṇḍava

masc. rubbish; junk; garbage ✓

Grammar masc, derog
Meaning rubbish; junk; garbage
Commentary (ANa) samaṇakāraṇḍavo'ti samaṇakacavaro. (SNPa) kāraṇḍavaṃ niddhamatha, kasambuṃ apakassatha, taṃ kacavarabhūtaṃ puggalaṃ kacavaram'iva anapekkhā niddhamatha, kasaṭabhūtañ'ca naṃ khattiy'ādīnaṃ majjhe paviṭṭhaṃ pabhinnapaggharitakuṭṭhaṃ caṇḍālaṃ viya apakassatha, hatthe vā sīse vā gahetvā nikkaḍḍhatha. seyyathā'pi āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṃ puggalaṃ pāpadhammaṃ bāhāya gahetvā bahidvārakoṭṭhakā nikkhāmetvā sūcighaṭikaṃ adāsi, evaṃ apakassathā'ti dasseti. kiṃ kāraṇā? saṅgh'ārāmo nāma sīlavantānaṃ kato, na dussīlānaṃ.
Sanskrit śramaṇa + kāraṇḍava (bsk)

kāraṇḍavaṃ niddhamatha,
kasambuṃ apakassatha,
tato palāpe vāhetha,
assamaṇe samaṇamānine.

AN 8.10 kāraṇḍavasuttaṃ

Sanskrit kārayati
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

yo koci karoti, taṃ añño, karohi karohi, icc'evaṃ bravīti, atha vā karontaṃ payojayati, kāreti, kārayati, kārāpeti, kārāpayati. ye keci karonti, te aññe, karotha karotha, icc'evaṃ bruvanti, kārenti, kārayanti, kārāpenti, kārāpayanti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 438
kārayati 2

pr. (+acc) causes to make [√kar + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of karoti, trans (+acc)
Meaning causes to make
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 *aya (do, make)
Base √kar + *aya > kāraya (caus)
Construction kāraya + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant kāreti
Sanskrit kārayati
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

yo koci karoti, taṃ añño, karohi karohi, icc'evaṃ bravīti, atha vā karontaṃ payojayati, kāreti, kārayati, kārāpeti, kārāpayati. ye keci karonti, te aññe, karotha karotha, icc'evaṃ bruvanti, kārenti, kārayanti, kārāpenti, kārāpayanti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 438
kārayanta

prp. (+acc) causing to do; causing to make [√kar + *aya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of kārayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning causing to do; causing to make
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 *aya (do, make)
Base √kar + *aya > kāraya (caus)
Construction kāraya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) kārayato'ti āṇattiyā kārentassa.
Sanskrit kārayat
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

santi, gahapatayo, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, karoto kārayato, chindato chedāpayato, pacato pācāpayato, socayato socāpayato, kilamato kilamāpayato, phandato phandāpayato ... karoto na karīyati pāpaṃ.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
kārayamāna 1

Grammar prp of kāreti, caus, trans (+acc)

Root √kar･7 *aya (do, make)

Sanskrit kārayamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

navaṃ pana bhikkhunā santhataṃ kārayamānena dve bhāgā suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ ādātabbā, tatiyaṃ odātānaṃ, catutthaṃ gocariyānaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 13 dvebhāgasikkhāpadaṃ

vassikasāṭikaṃ pana bhikkhunā kārayamānena pamāṇikā kāretabbā, tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ, dīghaso cha vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ aḍḍhateyyā. taṃ atikkāmayato chedanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT SA 6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ

mahallakaṃ pana bhikkhunā vihāraṃ kārayamānena sassāmikaṃ att'uddesaṃ bhikkhū abhinetabbā vatthudesanāya, tehi bhikkhūhi vatthu desetabbaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

tassa heṭṭhābhāgaṃ sodhāpetvā pākāraparikkhepaṃ kārāpetvā vālukaṃ okirāpetvā dhajapaṭākaṃ ussāpetvā vanappatiṃ alaṅ'karitvā añjaliṃ karitvā, sace puttaṃ vā dhītaraṃ vā labheyyaṃ, tumhākaṃ mahāsakkāraṃ karissāmī'ti patthanaṃ katvā pakkāmi.

tasmā nāmasmā ṇayapaccayo hoti kāritasañño ca dhāturūpe sati. hatthinā atikkamati maggaṃ, atihatthayati, vīṇāya upagāyati gītaṃ, upavīṇayati, daḷhaṃ karoti vīriyaṃ, daḷhayati, visuddhā hoti ratti, visuddhayati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 439
kāriyamāna

prp. being made to do [√kar] ✗

adj. doing; making [√kar + *ī] ✓

niccaṃ kāyagatā sati,
akiccaṃ te na sevanti,
kicce sātaccakārino,
satānaṃ sampajānānaṃ,
atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā.

yo koci karoti, taṃ añño, karohi karohi, icc'evaṃ bravīti, atha vā karontaṃ payojayati, kāreti, kārayati, kārāpeti, kārāpayati. ye keci karonti, te aññe, karotha karotha, icc'evaṃ bruvanti, kārenti, kārayanti, kārāpenti, kārāpayanti.

aṭṭhakavaggo 16

Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 *e (do, make)
Base √kar + *e > kāre (caus)
Construction kāre + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit kārayati
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

sace mayaṃ imāhi āpattīhi aññam'aññaṃ kāressāma, siyā'pi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvatteyya.

VIN 5.4.7 tiṇavatthārakaṃ
kāreti 4

pr. (+acc) builds; has constructed; lit. causes to build [√kar + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of karoti, trans (+acc)
Meaning builds; has constructed; lit. causes to build
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 *e (do, make)
Base √kar + *e > kāre (caus)
Construction kāre + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit kārayati
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

sārambhe ce bhikkhu vatthusmiṃ aparikkamane saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kāreyya, bhikkhū vā anabhineyya vatthudesanāya, pamāṇaṃ vā atikkāmeyya, saṅghādiseso.

VIN PAT SA 6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ

sārambhe ce bhikkhu vatthusmiṃ aparikkamane mahallakaṃ vihāraṃ kāreyya, bhikkhū vā anabhineyya vatthudesanāya, saṅghādiseso.

Base √kar + *e > kāre (caus)
Construction kāre + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit kārayati
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

santi kho pana, bhante, imasmiṃ rājakule khattiyakaññā'pi brāhmaṇakaññā'pi gahapatikaññā'pi, tās'āhaṃ issar'ādhipaccaṃ kāremi.

AN 4.197 mallikādevīsuttaṃ
kāretuṃ

inf. to cause to do; to cause to make [√kar] ✗
kāretvā 1

abs. (+acc) having made; having caused to do [√kar + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of kāreti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having made; having caused to do
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 *e (do, make)
Base √kar + *e > kāre (caus)
Construction kāre + tvā
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym akāretvā
Sanskrit krayitvā
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

divāṭṭhāne nisinnakāle pana okāsaṃ kāretvā'va pucchantassa kathetabbo, akāretvā pucchantassa na kathetabbo. idaṃ vattaṃ ajānitvā pucchanto paṭipadāya na saṇṭhāti nāma.

atīte bārāṇasiyaṃ brahmadatte rajjaṃ kārente bodhisatto kāsigāmake kumbhakārakule nibbattitvā kumbhakārakammaṃ katvā puttadāraṃ posesi.

Sanskrit kṛ
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

seṭṭhi, sace me dhītā vijāyissati, tāya naṃ saddhiṃ nivesetvā seṭṭhiṭṭhānassa sāmikaṃ karissāmi. sace me putto vijāyissati, māressāmi nan'ti cintetvā taṃ gehe kāresi.

Meaning time; occasion

Construction √kal > kāl + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit kāla
Sanskrit Root √kal 10 (drive, produce)

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, kālā sammā bhāviyamānā sammā anuparivattiyamānā anupubbena āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpenti

AN 4.147 dutiyakālasuttaṃ

sādhu, devo, vāhanāgāresu ca dvāresu ca āṇāpetu, yena vāhanena jīvako icchati tena vāhanena gacchatu, yena dvārena icchati tena dvārena gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ pavisatū'ti.

aṭṭhakavaggo 6

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, maraṇaṃ? yaṃ tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā tamhā sattanikāyā cuti cavanatā bhedo antaradhānaṃ maccu maraṇaṃ kālakiriyā khandhānaṃ bhedo kaḷevarassa nikkhepo jīvitindriyassupacchedo, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, maraṇaṃ

Sanskrit kālam + atināmayati

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
kālasaññī

adj. (+loc) perceiving (something) as the right time; regarding it as before midday [kāla + saññī] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (something) as the right time; regarding it as before midday
Construction kāla + saññī
kālasseva

sandhi. very early in the morning [kālassa + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + ind
Meaning very early in the morning
Construction kālassa + eva
Notes kālassa is gen of time
Sanskrit kāla + eva

ehi tvaṃ, ambho purisa, kālass'eva uṭṭhahanto'va sayanamhā pathaviṃ āmaseyyāsi

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

kālass'eva vuṭṭhāya upāhanā omuñcitvā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā dantakaṭṭhaṃ dātabbaṃ, mukh'odakaṃ dātabbaṃ, āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.

VIN 4.1.15 upajjhāya vatta kathā
kālaṃkaroti

pr. dies; passes away [kālaṃ + karoti] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning dies; passes away
Construction kālaṃ + karoti
Commentary (MNa) kālaṃ karissatī'ti marissati.
Sanskrit kālam + karoti

tass'etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ, na chandaṃ janessati na vāyamissati na vīriyaṃ ārabhissati tass'aṅgaṇassa pahānāya, so sarāgo sadoso samoho sāṅgaṇo saṃkiliṭṭhacittokālaṃkarissati.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
kālaṃkiriyā

fem. dying; death; lit. doing time [kālaṃ + kiriyā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning dying; death; lit. doing time
Construction kālaṃ + kiriyā
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (kālaṃ + kiriyā)
Synonym maraṇa
Variant kālakiriyā
Sanskrit kālakriyā

mā bhāyi, mahānāma, mā bhāyi, mahānāma! apāpakaṃ te maraṇaṃ bhavissati apāpikā kālaṃkiriyā.

SN 55.21 paṭhamamahānāmasuttaṃ

yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā tamhā sattanikāyā cuti cavanatā bhedo antaradhānaṃ maccu maraṇaṃ kālaṃkiriyā khandhānaṃ bhedo, kaḷevarassa nikkhepo, jīvit'indriyass'upacchedo, idaṃ vuccat'āvuso, maraṇaṃ.

kāla + ā

accenti kālā tarayanti rattiyo,
vayoguṇā anupubbaṃ jahanti,
etaṃ bhayaṃ maraṇe pekkhamāno,
puññāni kayirātha sukh'āvahānī'ti.

ayaṃ kho āḷāro kālāmo paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī dīgharattaṃ apparaj'akkhajātiko. yaṃnūn'āhaṃ āḷārassa kālāmassa paṭhamaṃ dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ.

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ

Root √kal×8 *e (spend time)

kāla + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym akālika
Synonym sandiṭṭhika
Commentary (SNa) na kho ahaṃ, āvuso'ti, āvuso, ahaṃ sandiṭṭhike kāme hitvā kālike kāme na anudhāvāmi na patthemi na pihemi
Sanskrit kālika
Sanskrit Root √kal 10 (drive, produce)

bhuñja, bhikkhu, mānusake kāme, mā sandiṭṭhikaṃ hitvā kālikaṃ anudhāvī'ti.

SN 1.20 samiddhisuttaṃ

na khv'āhaṃ, āvuso, sandiṭṭhikaṃ hitvā kālikaṃ anudhāvāmi. kālikañ'ca khv'āhaṃ, āvuso, hitvā sandiṭṭhikaṃ anudhāvāmi.

VIN 1.4.1.3 tatiyakathinasikkhāpadaṃ

Sanskrit kāvya

atthaṃ samecc'āham'apetasoko,
eko vivitte sayan'āsanamhi,
sayām'ahaṃ sabbabhūt'ānukampī.

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

kāsikasukhumāni dhāraya,
abhiropehi ca mālavaṇṇakaṃ,
kañcanamaṇimuttakaṃ bahuṃ,
vividhaṃ ābharaṇaṃ karomi te.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
kāsikosala

masc. kingdoms of Kāsi and Kosala [kāsi + kosala] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning kingdoms of Kāsi and Kosala
Construction kāsi + kosala
Compound dvanda (kāsi ca kosala ca)
Sanskrit kāśi + kosala

yāvatā, bhikkhave, kāsikosalā, yāvatā rañño pasenadissa kosalassa vijitaṃ, rājā tattha pasenadi kosalo aggam'akkhāyati.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
kāsikosalā

masc. people of Kāsi and Kosala ✗
kāsituṃ

inf. (+acc) to cause to drag; to cause to pull [√kas + *e + ituṃ] ~

Grammar inf of kāseti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning to cause to drag; to cause to pull
Root Family √kas
Root √kas･1 *e (drag, draw)
Base √kas + *e > kāse (caus)
Construction kāse + ituṃ
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit karṣayitum
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)
kāsirāja

masc. king of Kāsi [kāsi + rāja] ~

Grammar masc, comp, atta group
Meaning king of Kāsi
Construction kāsi + rāja
kāhati

fut. (+acc) will do; will make [√kar + o + ssa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of karoti, trans (+acc)
Meaning will do; will make
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + o + ssa > kāha (fut, irreg)
Construction kāha + ti
Phonetic Change karissa > kāhā (Kacc 481, 524)
Sanskrit kariṣyati
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

kara'icc'etassa dhātussa sapaccayassa kāh'ādeso hoti vā bhavissantimhi vibhattimhi, ssassa ca niccaṃ lopo hoti. kāhati, kāhiti, kāhasi, kāhisi, kāhāmi, kāhāma. vā'ti kim'atthaṃ? karissati, karissanti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 481
kāhasi

fut. (+acc) you will make; you will build [√kar + o + ssa + si] ✓

Grammar fut 2nd sg of kāhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning you will make; you will build
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + o + ssa > kāha (fut, irreg)
Construction kāha + si
Phonetic Change karissa > kāhā (Kacc 481, 524)
Commentary (THa) kāhasi ... karissasi
Sanskrit kariṣyās
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

gahakāraka diṭṭho'si,
puna gehaṃ na kāhasi,
sabbā te phāsukā bhaggā,
gahakūṭaṃ visaṅkhataṃ,
visaṅkhāragataṃ cittaṃ,
taṇhānaṃ khayamajjhagā.

DHP 154 jarāvaggo

sace musā na bhaṇasi,
sace pāṇaṃ na hiṃsasi,
sace adinnaṃ n'ādiyasi,
saddahāno amaccharī,
kiṃ kāhasi gayaṃ gantvā,
udapāno'pi te gayā'ti.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
kāhāmi 1

fut. (+acc) I will do [√kar + o + ssa + āmi] ✓

Grammar fut 1st sg of kāhiti, trans (+acc)
Meaning I will do
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + o + ssa > kāha (fut, irreg)
Construction kāha + āmi
Phonetic Change karissa > kāhā (Kacc 481, 524)
Sanskrit kṛ
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

s'āhaṃ nūna ito gantvā,
yoniṃ laddhāna mānusiṃ,
vadaññū sīlasampannā,
kāhāmi kusalaṃ bahuṃ.

VV 52 revatī vimānavatthu

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 481
kāhiti

fut. (+acc) will do; will make [√kar + a + ssa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of karoti, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning will do; will make
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)

Construction kāhi + ti
Phonetic Change karissa > kāhā (Kacc 481, 524)

Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

vitakk'ūpasame ca yo rato,
asubhaṃ bhāvayate sadā sato,
esa kho byanti kāhiti,
esa checchati mārabandhanaṃ.

kara'icc'etassa dhātussa sapaccayassa kāh'ādeso hoti vā bhavissantimhi vibhattimhi, ssassa ca niccaṃ lopo hoti. kāhati, kāhiti, kāhasi, kāhisi, kāhāmi, kāhāma. vā'ti kim'atthaṃ? karissati, karissanti.

tāva sunakho'va saṅkhalābaddho,

chātā sunakhaṃ'va caṇḍālā.

THI 73 sumedhātherīgāthā

fut. (+acc) you will make; you will build [√kar + a + ssa + si] ✓

dhitipparaṃ kiṃ mama citta kāhisi,
na te alaṃ citta vas'ānuvattako,
na jātu bhastaṃ ubhatomukhaṃ chupe,
dhi'r'atthu pūraṃ nava sotasandaniṃ.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 481
kāḷa 1

adj. dark; black ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning dark; black
Synonym kaṇha
Non IA kār̤, kāḻ (Tamil)
Sanskrit kāla

yadā balākā sucipaṇḍaracchadā,
kāḷassa meghassa bhayena tajjitā,
palehiti ālayam'ālay'esinī,
tadā nadī ajakaraṇī rameti maṃ.

TH 196 sappakattheragāthā

tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate santi jātarūpassa sukhumasahagatā upakkilesā sukhumavālukā kāḷajallikā.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
kāḷa 2

masc. necklace plant; Sophora tomentosa ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning necklace plant; Sophora tomentosa
Commentary (MNa) āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā'ti yathā āsītikavalliyā vā kāḷavalliyā vā sandhiṭṭhānesu milāyitvā majjhe unnatunnatāni honti, evaṃ mayhaṃ aṅgapaccaṅgāni hontī'ti dasseti.
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sophora_tomentosa
Sanskrit kāla

seyyathā'pi nāma āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā, evam'ev'assu me aṅgapaccaṅgāni bhavanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya. seyyathā'pi nāma oṭṭhapadaṃ, evam'ev'assu me ānisadaṃ hoti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

Meaning name of a privately enlightened Buddha; lit. black
kāḷaka 1

adj. black; black in colour; (comm) naturally black or dyed black [kāḷa + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from kāḷa
Meaning black; black in colour; (comm) naturally black or dyed black
Construction kāḷa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (VIN 1.4.2.2) kāḷakaṃ nāma dve kāḷakāni, jātiyā kāḷakaṃ vā rajanakāḷakaṃ vā.
Sanskrit kālaka

yo pana bhikkhu suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 12 suddhakāḷakasikkhāpadaṃ

kīdiso, bho purisa, kiṃsuko'ti? so evaṃ vadeyya, kāḷako kho, ambho purisa, kiṃsuko, seyyathā'pi jhāmakhāṇū'ti.

daharo tvaṃ bhikkhu, pabbajito susu kāḷakeso, bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato, paṭhamena vayasā, anikkīḷitāvī kāmesu.

santi hi, brāhmaṇa, nāgavane uccā kāḷārikā nāma hatthiniyo mahāpadā, tāsaṃ p'etaṃ padaṃ assā'ti.

masc. name of a lay disciple ✗
kāḷī 1

fem. woman of black complexion [kāḷa + ī] ✓

Grammar fem, from kāḷa
Meaning woman of black complexion

Derivative taddhita (ī)
Sanskrit kālī

jānāsi taṃ janapadakalyāṇiṃ evaṃnāmā evaṃgottā'ti vā, dīghā vā rassā vā majjhimā vā kāḷī vā sāmā vā maṅguracchavī vā'ti, amukasmiṃ gāme vā nigame vā nagare vā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, ekaṃsikadhammo

Sanskrit kālī

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
kāḷī 3

fem. name of Mahāmoggallāna's sister in a previous incarnation [kāḷa + ī] ✓

Grammar fem, from kāḷa
Meaning name of Mahāmoggallāna's sister in a previous incarnation
Construction kāḷa + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Sanskrit kālī

bhūtapubbāhaṃ, pāpima, dūsī nāma māro ahosiṃ, tassa me kāḷī nāma bhaginī. tassā tvaṃ putto. so me tvaṃ bhāgineyyo ahosi. tena kho pana, pāpima, samayena kakusandho bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno hoti.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
kāḷīgodhā

fem. name of a Sakyan princess; lit. black iguana [kāḷī + godhā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning name of a Sakyan princess; lit. black iguana
Construction kāḷī + godhā
Compound kammadhāraya (kāḷī + godhā)
Commentary (UDa) kāḷīgodhāya putto'ti kāḷīgodhā nāma sākiyānī sakyarājadevī ariyasāvikā āgataphalā viññātasāsanā, tassā ayaṃ putto.
Sanskrit kālī + godhā

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā bhaddiyo kāḷīgodhāya putto araññagato'pi rukkhamūlagato'pi suññ'āgāragato'pi abhikkhaṇaṃ udānaṃ udānesi, aho sukhaṃ, aho sukhan'ti!

UD20 bhaddiyasuttaṃ
kāḷīsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.26 (AN10.26) ✗
kāḷudāyittheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 233 (TH233) ✗
kāḷudāyī

masc. name of a monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost in those who inspire confidence in families [kāḷa + udāyī] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost in those who inspire confidence in families
Construction kāḷa + udāyī
Commentary (ANa) thokaṃ kāḷadhātukattā pana kāḷ'udāyī nāma jāto. so bodhisattena saddhiṃ kumārakīḷaṃ kīḷanto vuddhiṃ agamāsi.
kāḷūpakāḷā

masc. name of two privately enlightened Buddhas; Kāḷa and Upakāḷa [kāḷa + upakāḷa + ā] ~

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning name of two privately enlightened Buddhas; Kāḷa and Upakāḷa
Construction kāḷa + upakāḷa + ā
kāḷūpakāḷa + ā
ki

pron. who?; what?; which? ✓

Grammar pron, interr, base
Meaning who?; what?; which?
Notes another base of pronoun ka. kiṃ, kissa, kisṃiṃ, kiṃhi, etc.
Sanskrit ki

kiṃ sundarikā karissati,
kiṃ payāgo kiṃ bāhukā nadī,
veriṃ katakibbisaṃ naraṃ,
na hi naṃ sodhaye pāpakamminaṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

ky'āssa byappathayo assu,
ky'āss'assu idha gocarā,
kāni sīlabbatān'āssu,
pahit'attassa bhikkhuno.

kicca 1

nt. (+dat) obligation (for); duty (for); work (for); lit. to be done [√kar + tya] ✓

Grammar nt, ptp of karoti (+dat)
Meaning obligation (for); duty (for); work (for); lit. to be done
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction √kar > kir + tya
Derivative kicca (tya)
Phonetic Change a > i (sk ṛ)
ty > cc
Sanskrit kṛtya
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

santussako ca subharo ca,
appakicco ca sallahukavutti,
sant'indriyo ca nipako ca,
appagabbho kulesu ananugiddho.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

yo ca sītañ'ca uṇhañ'ca,
tiṇā bhiyyo na maññati,
karaṃ purisakiccāni,
so sukhā na vihāyati.

TH 174 mātaṅgaputtattheragāthā
kicca 2

ptp. (+instr or +dat) should be done (by); ought to be made (by); lit. to be done [√kar + tya] ✓

Grammar ptp of karoti (+instr or +dat)
Meaning should be done (by); ought to be made (by); lit. to be done
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction √kar > kir + tya
Derivative kicca (tya)
Phonetic Change a > i (sk ṛ)
ty > cc
Antonym akicca
Sanskrit kṛtya
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

yaṃ vo kiccaṃ sarīrena,
taṃ karotha yadicchatha,
na me tappaccayā tattha,
doso pemañ'ca hehiti.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

tumhehi kiccam'ātappaṃ,
akkhātāro tathāgatā,
paṭipannā pamokkhanti,
jhāyino mārabandhanā.

santi hi, moggallāna, kulesu kiccakaraṇīyāni

niccaṃ utrastam'idaṃ cittaṃ,

anuppannesu kicchesu,

sace atthi anutrastaṃ,
taṃ me akkhāhi pucchito'ti.

pārāyanavaggo 11

yassa n'atthi idaṃ me'ti,

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
kiñcana 3

nt. owning; having something; worldly attachment [kiṃ + ci + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from kiñci
Meaning owning; having something; worldly attachment
Construction kiṃ + ci + ana
kiñci + ana
Derivative taddhita (ana)
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Antonym akiñcana
Commentary (MNa) mama kismiñci kiñcanaṃ n'atthī'ti so parassa attā mama kismiñci kiñcanabhāve atthī'ti na passati. attano bhātiṭṭhāne bhātaraṃ sahāyaṭṭhāne sahāyaṃ parikkhāraṭṭhāne vā parikkhāran'ti kismiñci ṭhāne parassa attānaṃ iminā kiñcanabhāvena upanetabbaṃ na passatī'ti attho.
Sanskrit kim + cana

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, n'āhaṃ kvacani kassaci kiñcanat'asmiṃ, na ca mama kvacani kismiñci kiñcanaṃ n'atthī'ti.

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ
kiñcana 4

nt. trouble [kaci] ✗
kiñcana 5

nt. obstruction [kaci] ✗
kiñcanatasmiṃ

sandhi. possession of this; ownership in this [kiñcanatā + asmiṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, fem + pron
Meaning possession of this; ownership in this
Construction kiñcanatā + asmiṃ
Commentary (MNa) kiñcanat'asmin'ti attano attānaṃ kassaci parassa kiñcanabhāve upanetabbaṃ na passati, attano bhātiṭṭhāne bhātaraṃ sahāyaṭṭhāne sahāyaṃ parikkhāraṭṭhāne vā parikkhāraṃ maññitvā upagantvā upanetabbaṃ na passatī'ti attho.
Sanskrit kim + cana + asmin

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, n'āhaṃ kvacani kassaci kiñcanat'asmiṃ, na ca mama kvacani kismiñci kiñcanaṃ n'atthī'ti.

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ
kiñcanatā

fem. (+gen) possession (of); ownership (of); fact of having something; lit. having something state [kiṃ + ci + ana + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from kiñcana (+gen)
Meaning possession (of); ownership (of); fact of having something; lit. having something state
Construction kiṃ + ci + ana + tā
kiñcana + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Commentary (MNa) kiñcanat'asmin'ti attano attānaṃ kassaci parassa kiñcanabhāve upanetabbaṃ na passati, attano bhātiṭṭhāne bhātaraṃ sahāyaṭṭhāne sahāyaṃ parikkhāraṭṭhāne vā parikkhāraṃ maññitvā upagantvā upanetabbaṃ na passatī'ti attho.
Sanskrit kim + cana +

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, n'āhaṃ kvacani kassaci kiñcanat'asmiṃ, na ca mama kvacani kismiñci kiñcanaṃ n'atthī'ti.

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ
kiñcanaṃ

ind. at all, in any way [kaci] ✗
kiñcarahi

sandhi. what then?; how then?; what exactly?; how is it?; what just?; why? [kiṃ + carahi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind, interr
Meaning what then?; how then?; what exactly?; how is it?; what just?; why?
Construction kiṃ + carahi
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Commentary (MNa) atha kiñ'carahī'ti atha kasmā evaṃ ñāṇe asati tayā evaṃ kathitan'ti vadati. (SNt) atha kiñ'carahī'ti atha kasmā tvaṃ asampannagaṇaṃ bandhitvā carasī'ti adhippāyo.
Sanskrit kim + tarhi

atha kiñ'carahi bhotā gotamena byākatan'ti?

AN 10.95 uttiyasuttaṃ

atha kiñ'carahi tumhe, moghapurisā, kiṃ jānantā kiṃ passantā bhaṇḍanajātā kalahajātā vivādāpannā aññam'aññaṃ mukhasattīhi vitudantā viharatha, te na c'eva aññam'aññaṃ saññāpetha, na ca saññattiṃ upetha, na ca aññam'aññaṃ nijjhāpetha, na ca nijjhattiṃ upetha?

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
kiñcāpi

sandhi. however much; even if; even though; although; but how? [kiṃ + ca + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + ind
Meaning however much; even if; even though; although; but how?
Construction kiṃ + ca + api
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit kim + ca + api

kiñ'c'āpi-ahaṃ, bhante, jiṇṇo vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto, desetu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ, desetu sugato saṃkhittena dhammaṃ, app'eva nām'āhaṃ bhagavato bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājāneyyaṃ.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, ahi gūthagato kiñ'c'āpi na daṃsati, atha kho naṃ makkheti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
kiñcāyaṃ

Meaning whatever this
Construction kiñci + ayaṃ
Sanskrit kiṃcid + ayam

santi, bho gotama, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, yaṃ kiñc'āyaṃ purisapuggalo paṭisaṃvedeti sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkham'asukhaṃ vā sabbaṃ taṃ pubbekatahetū'ti. idha bhavaṃ gotamo kim'āhā'ti?

pariccattaṃ kho rañño nāgassa jīvitaṃ. n'atthi dāni kiñci rañño nāgassa akaraṇīyan'ti.

aṭṭhakavaggo 13

masc. name of a town ✗

Root √kas･1 a (drag, draw)
Construction √kas + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Commentary (SNa) kiṭṭhan'ti kiṭṭhaṭṭhāne uppannasassaṃ.
Sanskrit kṛṣi, kṛṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kiṭṭhaṃ sampannaṃ. kiṭṭh'ārakkho ca pamatto, goṇo ca kiṭṭh'ādo aduṃ kiṭṭhaṃ otaritvā yāva'd'atthaṃ madaṃ āpajjeyya pamādaṃ āpajjeyya.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, vassānaṃ pacchime māse saradasamaye kiṭṭhasambādhe gopālako gāvo rakkheyya. so tā gāvo tato tato daṇḍena ākoṭeyya paṭikoṭeyya sannirundheyya sannivāreyya.

kaccāyana kibbidhānakaṇḍa 562
kita 2.1

root. (gram) √kit (know) [√kit + a] ✓

Sanskrit kit, cit
Sanskrit Root √cit 1 (perceive, know, appear)

463, 532. māna kitānaṃ va tattaṃ vā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 463

māna kita'icc'etesaṃ dhātūnaṃ abbhāsagatānaṃ vakāra takārattaṃ hoti vā yathāsaṅkhyaṃ. vīmaṃsati, tikicchati. vā'ti kim'atthaṃ? cikicchati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 463
kitava

masc. gambler; cheat; conman; (comm) fowler ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning gambler; cheat; conman; (comm) fowler
Commentary (SNa) kitavass'evā'ti kitavo vuccati sākuṇiko. so hi agumbo'va samāno sākhapaṇṇ'ādipaṭicchādanena gumbavaṇṇaṃ dassetvā upagate moratittir'ādayo sakuṇe māretvā dārabharaṇaṃ karoti.
Sanskrit kitava

sudassaṃ vajjam'aññesaṃ,
attano pana duddasaṃ,
paresaṃ hi so vajjāni,
opunāti yathā bhusaṃ,
attano pana chādeti,
kaliṃ'va kitavā saṭho.

DHP 252 malavaggo

aññathā santam'attānaṃ,
aññathā yo pavedaye,
nikacca kitavass'eva,
bhuttaṃ theyyena tassa taṃ.

SN 1.35 ujjhānasaññisuttaṃ
kittaka

Meaning how many?
Construction ka > ki + tta + ka
kitta + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change a > i
Sanskrit katika

imasmiṃ uposath'agge sannipatitānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ gaṇanā kittakā bhikkhū honti?

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi
kittayati 1

pr. (+acc) explains; declares; relates [√kitt + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning explains; declares; relates
Root Family √kitt
Root √kitt･8 *aya (make known)
Base √kitt + aya > kittaya
Construction kittaya + ti
Sanskrit kīrtayati
Sanskrit Root √kṝt √kīrt 10 (mention)

kittayissāmi te dhammaṃ,
diṭṭhe dhamme anītihaṃ,
yaṃ viditvā sato caraṃ,
tare loke visattikaṃ.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4

attadaṇḍā bhayaṃ jātaṃ,
janaṃ passatha medhagaṃ,
saṃvegaṃ kittayissāmi,
yathā saṃvijitaṃ mayā.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
kittayati 2

pr. (+acc) celebrates; praises; glorifies; speaks highly (of) [√kitt + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning celebrates; praises; glorifies; speaks highly (of)
Root Family √kitt
Root √kitt･8 *aya (make known)
Base √kitt + aya > kittaya
Construction kittaya + ti
Sanskrit kīrtayati
Sanskrit Root √kṝt √kīrt 10 (mention)

nāgaṃ vo kittayissāmi,
na hi āguṃ karoti so,
soraccaṃ avihiṃsā ca,
pādā nāgassa te duve.

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā

kittayamāna

prp. (+acc) celebrating; praising; glorifying; speaking highly (of) [√kitt + *aya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of kittayati, trans (+acc)

Construction kittaya + māna

Sanskrit Root √kṝt √kīrt 10 (mention)

yassa kho tvaṃ, āvuso sāriputta, puṇṇassa nāma bhikkhuno mantāṇiputtassa abhiṇhaṃ kittayamāno ahosi, so ... yena andhavanaṃ tena pakkanto divāvihārāyā'ti.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
kittayamānarūpa

adj. as if celebrating; as if singing the praises of ✗
kittāvatā

ind. in what way?; to what extent?; in what respect? [ka + tāva + tā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, interr
Meaning in what way?; to what extent?; in what respect?
Construction ka > ki + tāva + tā
kittāva + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Phonetic Change a > i
Commentary (ANa) kittāvatā nu kho'ti kittakena nu kho.
Sanskrit ki + tāvatā

suñño loko, suñño loko'ti, bhante, vuccati. kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, suñño loko'ti vuccatī'ti?

SN 35.85 suññatalokasuttaṃ

na hi pana taṃ, gahapati, paṭibhāsi bhagavantaṃ uttariṃ paṭipucchituṃ, kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, āturakāyo c'eva hoti āturacitto ca, kittāvatā ca pana āturakāyo hi kho hoti no ca āturacitto'ti?

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ
kitti

fem. fame; renown; celebrity [√kitt + i] ✓

Root Family √kitt
Root √kitt･8 *e (make known)
Construction √kitt + i
Derivative kita (i)
Sanskrit kīrti
Sanskrit Root √kṝt √kīrt 10 (mention)

yaso kitti ca yā pubbe,
hāyate v'āpi tassa sā,
etam'pi disvā sikkhetha,
methunaṃ vippahātave.

SNP 45 tissametteyyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 7

kappaṃ saggamhi mod'ahaṃ.

Commentary (MNa) kittisaddo'ti kitti'y'eva, thutighoso vā (MNa) kittisaddo'ti kittighoso.
Sanskrit kīrti + śabda

taṃ kho pana bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ evaṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato

VIN 1.0 verañjakaṇḍaṃ

kiñ'c'āpi, bhikkhave, evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭh'ānugatiṃ āpajjati, atha kho naṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchati, kalyāṇamitto purisapuggalo kalyāṇasahāyo kalyāṇasampavaṅko'ti.

yaso ca kittī ca tatv'assa hoti,
saggañ'ca so gacchati sarīraṃ vihāyā'ti.

APA 320 tiraṃsiyattherāpadānaṃ
kittesi

aor. praised, extolled, related, announced [√kitt] ✗
kintāhaṃ 1

sandhi. how can I?; in what way can I?; what do you think I? [kiṃ + iti + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron, interr
Meaning how can I?; in what way can I?; what do you think I?
Construction kiṃ + iti + ahaṃ
Sanskrit kim + ti + aham

saddho ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hoti, no ca sīlavā. evaṃ so ten'aṅgena aparipūro hoti. tena taṃ aṅgaṃ paripūretabbaṃ, kin't'āhaṃ saddho ca assaṃ, sīlavā cā'ti!

AN 10.8 jhānasuttaṃ
kintāhaṃ 2

sandhi. what do I (say) to you [kiṃ + te + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron, interr
Meaning what do I (say) to you
Construction kiṃ + te + ahaṃ
Phonetic Change ṃ > n
Commentary (SNa) kin't'āhan'ti kiṃ te ahaṃ.
Sanskrit kim + tvam + aham

kin't'āhaṃ kuṭikaṃ brūmi,
kiṃ te brūmi kulāvakaṃ,
kiṃ te santānakaṃ brūmi,
kin't'āhaṃ brūmi bandhanan'ti.

SN 1.19 kuṭikāsuttaṃ
kinti

sandhi. how then?; what then?; in what way? [kiṃ + iti] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind, interr
Meaning how then?; what then?; in what way?
Construction kiṃ + iti
Commentary (VINa) kin'ti ... upāyapucchā. (ANa) kinti mayan'ti kena nāma upāyena mayaṃ
Sanskrit kim + iti

so tesaṃ bhogānaṃ ārakkh'ādhikaraṇaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, kin'ti me bhoge n'eva rājāno hareyyuṃ, na corā hareyyuṃ, na aggi daheyya, na udakaṃ vaheyya, na appiyā dāy'ādā hareyyun'ti

MN 14 cūḷa dukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ

evaṃ puṭṭhā tumhe, bhikkhave, tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ kin'ti byākareyyāthā'ti?

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
kintisutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 103 (MN103) ✗
kinte

sandhi. what by you? [kiṃ + te] ✓

Meaning what by you?
Construction kiṃ + te

Commentary (VINa) kiṃ te adhigatan'ti adhigamapucchā, jhānavimokkh'ādīsu, sot'āpattimagg'ādīsu vā kiṃ tayā adhigatan'ti.

samanuggāhīyamāno'ti yaṃ vatthu paṭiññātaṃ hoti tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ samanuggāhīyamāno, kin'te adhigataṃ, kin'ti te adhigataṃ, kadā te adhigataṃ, kattha te adhigataṃ

VIN 1.1.4 catutthapārājikaṃ
kinnarimandalocana

adj. like a mythical creature with soft eyes [kinnarī + manda + locana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a mythical creature with soft eyes
Construction kinnarī + manda + locana
Compound kammadhāraya (kinnarī + mandalocana)
Commentary (THIa) kinnarimandalocane'ti kinnariyā viya mandaputhuvilocane.
Sanskrit kiṃnarī + mandra + locana

ahaṃ tava vas'ānugo siyaṃ,
yadi viharemase kānan'antare,
na hi m'atthi tayā piyattaro,
pāṇo kinnarimandalocane.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

Commentary (THIa) kinnarimandalocane'ti kinnariyā viya mandaputhuvilocane.
Notes see MW kiṃnarī for a detailed description
Sanskrit kiṃnarī

ahaṃ tava vas'ānugo siyaṃ,
yadi viharemase kānan'antare,
na hi m'atthi tayā piyattaro,
pāṇo kinnarimandalocane.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

akkhīni ca turiyā'r'iva,
kinnariyā'r'iva pabbat'antare,
tava me nayanāni dakkhiya,
bhiyyo kāmaratī pavaḍḍhati.

kinnāma

adj. of what name? called what? ✗

kinnusīhasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 4.12 (SN4.12) ✗
kipillika

masc. ant; (comm) red, black or brown ant ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning ant; (comm) red, black or brown ant
Variant kipīllakā
Commentary (VINa) kipillikānan'ti rattakāḷapiṅgal'ādibhedānaṃ yāsaṃ kāsañci kipillikānaṃ.
Sanskrit pipīlaka

atha te, jarasakko amhe matte katvā mahāsamuddapiṭṭhe khipitvā amhākaṃ devanagaraṃ gaṇhi, te mayaṃ tena saddhiṃ yujjhitvā amhākaṃ devanagaram'eva gaṇhissāmā'ti kipillikā viya thambhaṃ sineruṃ anusañcaramānā uṭṭhahiṃsu.

JAa 31 kulāvaka jātakavaṇṇanā

ḍaṃsā ca makasā ca ḍaṃsamakasaṃ, kuntho ca kipilliko ca kunthakipillikaṃ, kīṭo ca sarīsapo ca kīṭasarīsapaṃ. evaṃ khuddajantuk'atthe.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 322
kipillikā

fem. ant; (comm) red, black or brown ant [kipilla + ikā] ✓

Meaning ant; (comm) red, black or brown ant

Sanskrit pipīlaka

sārambhaṃ nāma kipillikānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, upacikānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, undurānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, ahīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti, vicchikānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, satapadīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti, hatthīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ
kibbisa

nt. dirty deed; crime; offence [√kilis + a] ✓

Grammar nt, from kilissati
Meaning dirty deed; crime; offence

Root √kilis･3 ya (be dirty, be molested)
√ In Comps kilis or kkilis
Construction √kilis > kibbis + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change l > b
Commentary (ANa) kibbisan'ti samalaṃ aparisuddhakammaṃ
Sanskrit kilbiṣa
Sanskrit Root √kliś 4, 9 (distress)

tassa aññatarena gāḷhena rog'ātaṅkena phuṭṭhassa evaṃ hoti, akataṃ vata me kalyāṇaṃ, akataṃ kusalaṃ, akataṃ bhīruttāṇaṃ, kataṃ pāpaṃ, kataṃ luddaṃ, kataṃ kibbisaṃ.

AN 4.184 abhayasuttaṃ

kiṃ sundarikā karissati,
kiṃ payāgo kiṃ bāhukā nadī,
veriṃ katakibbisaṃ naraṃ,
na hi naṃ sodhaye pāpakamminaṃ.

na hi nūna kibbisī siyā'ti.

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

idha no, āvuso sāriputta, bhagavā kiṃvādī kim'akkhāyī, kathaṃ byākaramānā ca mayaṃ vuttavādino c'eva bhagavato assāma, na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkheyyāma

SN 12.25 bhūmijasuttaṃ
kimaṅga

ind. how much more so?; how much rather?; what to say of?; why not? [kiṃ + aṅga] ✓

Meaning how much more so?; how much rather?; what to say of?; why not?
Construction kiṃ + aṅga
Compound abyayībhāva (kiṃ + aṅga)
Variant kimaṅgaṃ
Sanskrit kim + aṅga

tadā'pi me, bhikkhave, amanāpā nīce āsane nisīditvā ucce āsane nisinnassa mantaṃ vācetuṃ, kim'aṅga pana etarahi na amanāpā bhavissati nīce āsane nisīditvā ucce āsane nisinnassa dhammaṃ desetuṃ.

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo
kimaṅgaṃ

ind. how much more so?; how much rather?; what to say of?; why not? [kiṃ + aṅga + aṃ] ✓

kimaṅga + aṃ

Variant kimaṅga
Sanskrit kim + aṅga

ime ce'pi, mahānāma, mahāsālā subhāsitaṃ dubbhāsitaṃ ājāneyyuṃ, ime c'āhaṃ mahāsāle byākareyyaṃ, sot'āpannā avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā'ti, kim'aṅgaṃ pana saraṇāniṃ sakkaṃ

SN 55.24 paṭhamasaraṇānisakkasuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ bhikkhū evam'āhaṃsu, m'āyasmā ativelaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamī'ti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi vuccamāno evam'āha, ime hi nāma therā bhikkhū kulāni upasaṅkamitabbaṃ maññissanti, kim'aṅgaṃ pan'āhan'ti?

SN 20.9 nāgasuttaṃ
kimaññatra

sandhi. (+abl) how except for?; what besides?; what apart (from)? [kiṃ + aññatra] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + adv, interr (+abl)
Meaning how except for?; what besides?; what apart (from)?
Construction kiṃ + aññatra
Sanskrit kaḥ + anyatra

yo hi, gahapati, imaṃ kāyaṃ pariharanto muhuttam'pi ārogyaṃ paṭijāneyya, kimaññatra bālyā?

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ

yo evarūpaṃ purisanāgaṃ purisasīhaṃ purisaājānīyaṃ purisanisabhaṃ purisadhorayhaṃ purisadantaṃ atikkamitabbaṃ maññeyya kim'aññatra adassanā'ti.

Grammar adj, comp, inter
Meaning what should one desiring the good?
Construction kiṃ + atthakāma
kimatthaṃ

ind. for what purpose?; what’s the reason?; what’s the meaning? [kiṃ + attha + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, interr, comp, acc sg of kimattha
Meaning for what purpose?; what’s the reason?; what’s the meaning?
Construction kiṃ + attha + aṃ
kimattha + aṃ
Compound abyayībhāva (kiṃ + atthaṃ)
Sanskrit kim + artha

kim'atthaṃ carah'āvuso, bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī'ti? anupādāparinibbān'atthaṃ kho, āvuso, bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī'ti.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

tuly'ādhikaraṇe'ti kim'atthaṃ? tena haññase tvaṃ devadattena.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 41o
kimatthāya

ind. for what purpose? ✗
kimatthiya

adj. (+nom) what’s the purpose of?; for what purpose? [kiṃ + atthiya] ✓

Grammar adj, interr, comp (+nom)
Meaning what’s the purpose of?; for what purpose?
Construction kiṃ + atthiya
Compound kammadhāraya (kiṃ + atthiya)
Commentary (MNa) kim'atthiyā'ti ko etissā attho.
Sanskrit kim + arthika

kim'atthiyaṃ nu kho, bho ānanda, samaṇe gotame brahmacariyaṃ vussatī'ti? chandappahān'atthaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī'ti.

SN 51.15 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, kim'atthiyo ādāso'ti? paccavekkhaṇattho, bhante'ti.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
kimatthiyabrahmacariyasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.152 (SN35.152) ✗
kimatthiyasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 38.4 (SN38.4) ✗
kimatthiyasutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.5 (SN45.5) ✗
kimatthiyasutta 3

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.1 (AN10.1) ✗
kimatthiyasutta 4

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 11.1 (AN11.1) ✗
kimanta

adj. having what end?; culminating in what? [kiṃ + anta] ~

Grammar adj, comp, interr
Meaning having what end?; culminating in what?
Construction kiṃ + anta
kimantara

adj. (+acc) what's between? what's happening with? [kiṃ + antara] ~

Grammar adj, comp, interr (+acc)
Meaning what's between? what's happening with?
Construction kiṃ + antara
Commentary (SNa) kim'antaran'ti kiṃ kāraṇaṃ?
kimassa

sandhi. what to him? [kiṃ + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron, interr
Meaning what to him?
Construction kiṃ + assa
Sanskrit kim + asmai

imassa pana te, māgaṇḍiya, kim'assa vacanīyan'ti? na kiñci, bho gotama.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
kimassāhaṃ

sandhi. what (can) I (do) for him? [kiṃ + assa + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron + pron, interr
Meaning what (can) I (do) for him?
Construction kiṃ + assa + ahaṃ
Variant kammassāhaṃ
Sanskrit kim + asmai + aham

assakhaḷuṅko hi, sandha, doṇiyā baddho, yavasaṃ yavasan'ti jhāyati. taṃ kissa hetu? na hi, sandha, assakhaḷuṅkassa doṇiyā baddhassa evaṃ hoti, kiṃ nu kho maṃ ajja assadammasārathi kāraṇaṃ kāressati, kim'ass'āhaṃ paṭikaromī'ti.

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ
kimahaṃ

sandhi. what I? [kiṃ + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron, interr
Meaning what I?
Construction kiṃ + ahaṃ
Sanskrit kim + aham

anumaty'atthe ca parikapp'atthe ca anuttakāle sattamīvibhatti hoti. tvaṃ gaccheyyāsi, kim'ahaṃ kareyyāmi.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 416
kimāgamma

ind. due to what? why? ✗
kimānisaṃsa

adj. with what purpose?; for what benefit?; lit. what profit? [kiṃ + ānisaṃsa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with what purpose?; for what benefit?; lit. what profit?
Construction kiṃ + ānisaṃsa
kimārabbha

ind. based on what? owing to what? ✗
kimārammaṇa

adj. what basis?; based on what? [kiṃ + ārammaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, interr
Meaning what basis?; based on what?
Construction kiṃ + ārammaṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (kiṃ + ārammaṇa)
Sanskrit kim + ālambana

kim'ārammaṇā, samiddhi, purisassa saṅkappavitakkā uppajjantī'ti? nāmarūp'ārammaṇā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kva nānattaṃ gacchantī'ti? dhātūsu, bhante'ti.

AN 9.14 samiddhisuttaṃ
kimi

masc. worm; maggot ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning worm; maggot
Commentary (APAa) kimi pāṇako
Sanskrit kṛmi

seyyathā'pi, māgaṇḍiya, kuṭṭhī puriso arugatto pakkagatto kimīhi khajjamāno nakhehi vaṇamukhāni vippatacchamāno aṅgārakāsuyā kāyaṃ paritāpeyya.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

sabbapaṭhamaṃ tāva kiñci'd'eva karuṇāyitabbarūpaṃ … hatthapādehi paggharantakimigaṇaṃ aṭṭassaraṃ karontaṃ disvā, kicchaṃ vat'āyaṃ satto āpanno, app'eva nāma imamhā dukkhā mucceyyā'ti karuṇā pavattetabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
kimikāḷā

fem. name of a river; lit. black maggot [kimi + kāḷa + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning name of a river; lit. black maggot
Construction kimi + kāḷa + ā
kimikāḷa + ā
Compound kammadhāraya (kimi + kāḷa)
Commentary (UDa) kimikāḷāyā'ti kāḷakimīnaṃ bahulatāya kimikāḷā'ti laddhanāmāya nadiyā.
Sanskrit kṛmi + kāla

jantugāme piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto yena kimikāḷāya nadiyā tīraṃ ten'upasaṅkami. addasā kho āyasmā meghiyo kimikāḷāya nadiyā tīre jaṅghāvihāraṃ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno ambavanaṃ pāsādikaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ.

AN 9.3 meghiyasuttaṃ
kimikula

nt. family of worms; species of maggot [kimi + kula] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning family of worms; species of maggot
Construction kimi + kula
Sanskrit kṛmi + kula
kimidaṃ

sandhi. what's with that? what up with this? how's that? [kiṃ + idaṃ] ~

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron, interr
Meaning what's with that? what up with this? how's that?
Construction kiṃ + idaṃ
kimina

adj. having worms, full of worms ✗
kimila

masc. name of a monk; associate of Anuruddha ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a monk; associate of Anuruddha
Variant kimbila

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā nātike viharati giñjak'āvasathe. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca nandiyo āyasmā ca kimilo gosiṅgasālavanadāye viharanti.

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kimilāyaṃ viharati niculavane. atha kho āyasmā kimilo yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

AN 7.59 kimilasuttaṃ
kimilattheragāthā 1

fem. Theragāthā 118 (TH118) ✗
kimilattheragāthā 2

fem. Theragāthā 138 (TH138) ✗

kimilā

fem. name of a town ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a town
Variant kimbilā, kimmilā
Commentary (ANa) kimilāyan'ti evaṃnāmake nagare.

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kimilāyaṃ viharati niculavane. atha kho āyasmā kimilo yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

AN 7.59 kimilasuttaṃ
kimetaṃ

sandhi. what is this? [kiṃ + etaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron, interr
Meaning what is this?
Construction kiṃ + etaṃ
Sanskrit kim + etam

kim'etaṃ bhavaṃ gotamo āha puna bhavaṃ gotamo bravitū'ti

DN 3.7 ambaṭṭhasuttaṃ

ehi tvaṃ, āvuso dāsaka, yena khemako bhikkhu ten'upasaṅkama, upasaṅkamitvā khemakaṃ bhikkhuṃ evaṃ vadehi, therā taṃ, āvuso khemaka, evam'āhaṃsu, yam'etaṃ, āvuso khemaka, asmī'ti vadesi, kim'etaṃ asmī'ti vadesi?

SN 22.89 khemakasuttaṃ
kimevidaṃ 1

sandhi. what is this?; what about this? [kiṃ + eva + idaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + pron, interr
Meaning what is this?; what about this?
Construction kiṃ + eva + idaṃ
Sanskrit kim + eva + idam

tam'enaṃ sāmikā ahikuṇapaṃ vā kukkurakuṇapaṃ vā manussakuṇapaṃ vā racayitvā aññissā kaṃsapātiyā paṭikujjitvā antarāpaṇaṃ paṭipajjeyyuṃ. tam'enaṃ jano disvā evaṃ vadeyya, ambho, kim'ev'idaṃ harīyati jaññajaññaṃ viyā'ti?

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
kimevidaṃ 2

sandhi. not to mention this [kiṃ + eva + idaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + pron, interr
Meaning not to mention this
Construction kiṃ + eva + idaṃ
Sanskrit kim + eva + idam

disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca,
n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ,
kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ,
pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9

Meaning name of a monk; associate of Anuruddha
Variant kimila

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā nātike viharati giñjak'āvasathe. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca nandiyo āyasmā ca kimbilo gosiṅgasālavanadāye viharanti.
