kimhi 1

pron. in what? [ka + mhi] ✓

Grammar pron, interr, masc and nt loc sg of ka
Meaning in what?
Construction ka > ki + mhi
Sanskrit kasmin

tamh'uddhaṭe tantikhīlake,
vissaṭṭhe vikale parikrite,
na vindeyya khaṇḍaso kate,
kimhi tattha manaṃ nivesaye.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
kimhi 2

pron. when what? [ka + mhi] ✓

Grammar pron, interr, masc and nt loc sg of ka, loc abs
Meaning when what?
Construction ka > ki + mhi
Sanskrit kasmin

tassa mayhaṃ bhikkhave etadahosi, kimhi nu kho sati jarāmaraṇaṃ hoti kiṃpaccayā jarāmaraṇan'ti

SN 12.65 nagarasuttaṃ
kira 1

ind. really; truly; definitely ✓

Grammar ind, adv
Meaning really; truly; definitely
Sanskrit kila

attānaṃ ce tathā kayirā,
yath'āññam'anusāsati,
sudanto vata dametha,
attā hi kira duddamo.

DHP 159 attavaggo
kira 2

ind. it is said; allegedly; apparently; one would think; I have heard; people say ✓

Grammar ind, adv
Meaning it is said; allegedly; apparently; one would think; I have heard; people say
Variant kila
Notes (MW) according to native lexicographers kila may be used in communicating intelligence, and may imply "probably", "possibly", "agreement", "dislike", "falsehood", "inaccuracy", and "reason."
Sanskrit kila

sādhu kira bhavaṃ ānando yena subhassa ... nivesanaṃ ten'upasaṅkamatu

DN 10.1 subhasuttaṃ

ty'āhaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadāmi, saccaṃ kira tumhe āyasmanto evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ
kirati

pr. scatters, sprinkles [√kir] ✗
kirapatika

masc. name of a layman [kira + patika] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a layman
Construction kira + patika
Commentary (VINa) kirapatiko'ti ettha kiro'ti tassa kulaputtassa nāmaṃ, adhipacc'aṭṭhena pana kirapatiko'ti vuccati. so kira issaro adhipati māsa-utu-saṃvacchara-niyāmena vetanaṃ datvā kammakārake kammaṃ kāreti. (PYt) kiro eva patibhāve niyutto kirapatiko'ti atthaṃ dassento āha kirapatiko'ti etthā'ti ādi.
kirāyasmā

sandhi. we heard the venerable; it is said the venerable [kira + āyasmā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + masc
Meaning we heard the venerable; it is said the venerable
Construction kira + āyasmā
Sanskrit kila + āyuṣmān

no ce kir'āyasmā khemako imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu kiñci attaṃ vā attaniyaṃ vā samanupassati. tenah'āyasmā khemako arahaṃ khīṇ'āsavo'ti.

SN 22.89 khemakasuttaṃ
kiri

aor. scattered [√kir] ✗
kiriya 1

nt. making; doing; performing [√kar + iya] ✓

Grammar nt, in comps, from karoti
Meaning making; doing; performing
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction √kar > kir + iya
Derivative kita (iya)
Phonetic Change a > i (sk ṛ)
Antonym akiriya
Commentary (DNa) dukkhass'antakiriyāyā'ti sakalassa vaṭṭadukkhassa pariyantakaraṇ'atthaṃ.
Sanskrit kriyā
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

das'uttaraṃ pavakkhāmi,
dhammaṃ nibbānapattiyā,
dukkhass'antakiriyāya,
sabbaganthappamocanaṃ.

DN 34.1 dasuttarasuttaṃ
kiriya 2

nt. (gram) verb, predicate [√kar] ✗
kiriya 3

nt. action of an arahant, not kamma [√kar] ✗
kiriyavāda

masc. (proponent of) doctrine of action; doctrine of efficacy of activity [kiriya + vāda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (proponent of) doctrine of action; doctrine of efficacy of activity
Construction kiriya + vāda
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kiriyassa + vāda)
Antonym akiriyavāda
Commentary (VINa) kiriyavādino'ti ete kiriyaṃ na paṭibāhanti, atthi kammaṃ, atthi kammavipāko'ti evaṃdiṭṭhikā.
Sanskrit kriyā + vāda

santaṃ'y'eva kho pana kiriyaṃ n'atthi kiriyā'ti vācaṃ bhāsati, s'āssa hoti micchāvācā. santaṃ'y'eva kho pana kiriyaṃ n'atthi kiriyā'ti āha, ye te arahanto kiriyavādā tesam'ayaṃ paccanīkaṃ karoti.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
kiriyavādī 1

masc. who promulgates the view of belief in the consequence of action ✗
kiriyavādī 2

adj. professing the doctrine that activity is morally significant and produces effects; advocating activity ✗
kiriyā 1

fem. act; action; activity; deed; performance [√kar + iyā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, in comps, from karoti
Meaning act; action; activity; deed; performance
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction √kar > kir + iyā
Derivative kita (iyā)
Phonetic Change a > i (sk ṛ)
Antonym akiriyā
Sanskrit kriyā
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

ālasyaṃ anuṭṭhānaṃ bhogānaṃ paripantho, amaṇḍanā avibhūsanā vaṇṇassa paripantho, asappāyakiriyā ārogyassa paripantho

AN 10.73 iṭṭhadhammasuttaṃ

tassa imissā ca asappāyakiriyāya, asuci visadoso apanīto saupādiseso tadubhayena vaṇo puthuttaṃ gaccheyya.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
kiriyā 2

fem. consequence of actions; lit. action [√kar + iyā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, in comps, from karoti
Meaning consequence of actions; lit. action
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction √kar > kir + iyā
Derivative kita (iyā)
Phonetic Change a > i (sk ṛ)
Antonym akiriyā
Sanskrit kriyā
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

santaṃ'y'eva kho pana kiriyaṃ n'atthi kiriyā'ti'ssa diṭṭhi hoti, s'āssa hoti micchādiṭṭhi. santaṃ'y'eva kho pana kiriyaṃ n'atthi kiriyā'ti saṅkappeti, sv'āssa hoti micchāsaṅkappo. santaṃ'y'eva kho pana kiriyaṃ n'atthi kiriyā'ti vācaṃ bhāsati, s'āssa hoti micchāvācā.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
kiriyāpada

Meaning (gram) verb; lit. action word
Construction kiriyā + pada
Synonym ākhyāta
Variant kriyapada
kilañja 1

masc. reed mat; bamboo screen ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning reed mat; bamboo screen
Sanskrit kilañja, kiliñja

paṭicchannaṃ nāma āsanaṃ kuṭṭena vā kavāṭena vā kilañjena vā sāṇipākārena vā rukkhena vā thambhena vā kotthaḷiyā vā yena kenaci paṭicchannaṃ hoti.

VIN 1.3.1 paṭhamāniyatasikkhāpadaṃ

chattaṃ nāma tīṇi chattāni, setacchattaṃ, kilañjacchattaṃ, paṇṇacchattaṃ maṇḍalabaddhaṃ salākabaddhaṃ.

VIN 2.7.6 surusuruvaggo
kilañja 2

masc. reed; rushes ~

Grammar masc
Meaning reed; rushes

kilañjacchatta

Meaning bamboo sunshade; bamboo umbrella
Construction kilañja + chatta
Compound kammadhāraya (kilañja + chatta)

Sanskrit kilañja + chattra

chattaṃ nāma tīṇi chattāni, setacchattaṃ, kilañjacchattaṃ, paṇṇacchattaṃ maṇḍalabaddhaṃ salākabaddhaṃ.

VIN 2.7.6 surusuruvaggo
kilanta 1

adj. worn out; tired; exhausted [√kilam + ta] ✓

Grammar adj, pp of kilamati
Meaning worn out; tired; exhausted
Root Family √kilam
Root √kilam･1 a (be weary)
Construction √kilam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change m > n
Commentary (ANa) kilanto'ti maggakilanto.
Sanskrit klānta
Sanskrit Root √klam 1, 4 (be weary)

yadā kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā jhattā assu kilantā, atha kho yo nesaṃ pāṇakānaṃ balavataro assa tassa te anuvatteyyuṃ, anuvidhāyeyyuṃ vasaṃ gaccheyyuṃ.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

puratthimāya ce'pi disāya puriso āgaccheyya ghamm'ābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
kilanta 2

pp. got tired; became exhausted [√kilam + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of kilamati
Meaning got tired; became exhausted
Root Family √kilam
Root √kilam･1 a (be weary)
Construction √kilam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change m > n
Variant kilamanta
Sanskrit klānta
Sanskrit Root √klam 1, 4 (be weary)

ahaṃ kho kammaṃ akāsiṃ. kammaṃ kho pana me karontassa kāyo kilanto. hand'āhaṃ nipajjāmī'ti. so nipajjati, na vīriyaṃ ārabhati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.

AN 8.80 kusītārambhavatthusuttaṃ

api ca kho me aticiraṃ anuvitakkayato anuvicārayato kāyo kilameyya. kāye kilante cittaṃ ūhaññeyya. ūhate citte ārā cittaṃ samādhimhā'ti.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ
kilantakāya

adj. physically tired; physically worn out ✗
kilantacitta

adj. mentally tired; mentally worn out ✗
kilantarūpa

adj. really tired; absolutely exhausted; worn out; lit. tired form [kilanta + rūpa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning really tired; absolutely exhausted; worn out; lit. tired form
Construction kilanta + rūpa
Compound kammadhāraya (kilanta + rūpa)
Commentary (DNt) kilantarūpo attabhāvo hoti, na pana khaṇḍiccapālicc'ādī'ti adhippāyo.
Sanskrit klānta + rūpa
kilamati 1

pr. grows tired; gets fatigued [√kilam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning grows tired; gets fatigued
Root Family √kilam
Root √kilam･1 a (be weary)
Base √kilam + a > kilama
Construction kilama + ti
Commentary (MNa) kilamatī'ti kāye uppannadukkhena kilamati.
Sanskrit klamati
Sanskrit Root √klam 1, 4 (be weary)

tatra, bhikkhave, taramānassa bhāsato kāyo'pi kilamati, cittam'pi upahaññati, saro'pi upahaññati, kaṇṭho'pi āturīyati, avisaṭṭham'pi hoti aviññeyyaṃ taramānassa bhāsitaṃ.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati sammohaṃ āpajjati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bahiddhā asati paritassanā hotī'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
kilamati 2

pr. (+instr) is difficulty (with); is trouble (with); lit. is tired [√kilam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+instr)
Meaning is difficulty (with); is trouble (with); lit. is tired
Root Family √kilam
Root √kilam･1 a (be weary)
Base √kilam + a > kilama
Construction kilama + ti
Sanskrit klamati
Sanskrit Root √klam 1, 4 (be weary)

kacci vo, anuruddhā, khamanīyaṃ, kacci yāpanīyaṃ, kacci piṇḍakena na kilamathā'ti?

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
kilamatha

masc. fatigue; tiredness; weariness [√kilam + a + tha] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, from kilama
Meaning fatigue; tiredness; weariness
Root Family √kilam
Root √kilam･1 a (be weary)
Construction √kilam + a + tha
kilama + tha
Derivative taddhita (tha)
Sanskrit klamatha
Sanskrit Root √klam 1, 4 (be weary)

so kho ahaṃ, bhante, aññatr'eva asitapītakhāyitasāyitā aññatra uccārapassāvakammā aññatra niddākilamathapaṭivinodanā vassasat'āyuko vassasatajīvī vassasataṃ gantvā appatvā'va lokassa antaṃ antarā'y'eva kālaṅ'kato.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

yāva'd'eva ca pana so puriso kilamathassa vighātassa bhāgī assā'ti.

SN 20.5 sattisuttaṃ
kilamanta 1

prp. (+instr) becoming weary (from); growing tired (from) [√kilam + a + nta] ~

Grammar prp of kilamati, intrans (+instr)
Meaning becoming weary (from); growing tired (from)
Root Family √kilam
Root √kilam･1 a (be weary)
Base √kilam + a > kilama
Construction kilama + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit klāmyat
Sanskrit Root √klam 1, 4 (be weary)
kilamanta 2

prp. (+acc) wearing down; oppressing [√kilam + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of kilamati, trans (+acc)
Meaning wearing down; oppressing
Root Family √kilam
Root √kilam･1 a (be weary)
Base √kilam + a > kilama
Construction kilama + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Commentary (MNa) kilamato'ti āhār'ūpaccheda-bandhan'āgārappavesan'ādīhi sayaṃ kilamantassā'pi parehi kilamāpentassā'pi.
Sanskrit klāmayat
Sanskrit Root √klam 1, 4 (be weary)

santi, gahapatayo, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, karoto kārayato, chindato chedāpayato, pacato pācāpayato, socayato socāpayato, kilamato kilamāpayato, phandato phandāpayato ... karoto na karīyati pāpaṃ.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
kilamāpayanta

prp. (+instr) causing (others) to wear (someone) down; causing (others) to oppress [√kilam + *āpaya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of kilamāpayati, caus, intrans (+instr)
Meaning causing (others) to wear (someone) down; causing (others) to oppress
Root Family √kilam
Root √kilam･1 *āpaya (be weary)
Base √kilam + āpaya > kilamāpaya (caus)
Construction kilamāpaya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Commentary (MNa) kilamato'ti āhār'ūpaccheda-bandhan'āgārappavesan'ādīhi sayaṃ kilamantassā'pi parehi kilamāpentassā'pi.
Sanskrit klāmayat
Sanskrit Root √klam 1, 4 (be weary)

santi, gahapatayo, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, karoto kārayato, chindato chedāpayato, pacato pācāpayato, socayato socāpayato, kilamato kilamāpayato, phandato phandāpayato ... karoto na karīyati pāpaṃ.

aor. was wearied or fatigued [√kilam] ✗

aor. made weary; tired out; exhausted [√kilam] ✗

Meaning form of leprosy; white leprosy
Commentary (NIDD1a) kilāso'ti sabalo.
Sanskrit kilāsa

iti imasmiṃ kāye vividhā ābādhā uppajjanti, seyyath'idaṃ ... pakkhandikā sūlā visūcikā kuṭṭhaṃ gaṇḍo kilāso soso apamāro daddu kaṇḍu kacchu nakhasā vitacchikā lohitaṃ pittaṃ madhumeho aṃsā piḷakā bhagandalā

kilāsi

fem. kind of leprosy ✗

adj. afflicted with leprosy, leprous ✗
kilāsu

adj. disinclined (to), making no effort (to) ✗
kilijji

aor. was wet; was moist [√kilid] ✗
kiliṭṭha

pp. soiled; stained; dirtied; defiled; corrupt; tarnished; tainted [√kilis + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of kilissati
Meaning soiled; stained; dirtied; defiled; corrupt; tarnished; tainted
Root Family √kilis
Root √kilis･3 ya (be dirty, be molested)
√ In Comps kilis or kkilis
Construction √kilis + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Sanskrit kliṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √kliś 4, 9 (distress)

idha socati pecca socati,
pāpakārī ubhay'attha socati,
so socati so vihaññati,
disvā kammakiliṭṭham'attano.

DHP 15 yamakavaggo

kena loko litto saṃlitto upalitto kiliṭṭho saṃkiliṭṭho makkhito saṃsaṭṭho laggo laggito palibuddho, brūsi ācikkhasi desesi paññapesi paṭṭhapesi vivarasi vibhajasi uttānīkarosi pakāsesīti, kiss'ābhilepanaṃ brūsi.

NIDD2 2.1 ajita māṇava pucchā niddesa
kilinna

pp. wet, soiled, moist [√kilid] ✗
kilisati

pr. troubles, afflicts, molests; spoils [√kilis] ✗
kilissati

pr. is dirtied; is stained (by blame) [√kilis + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass, intrans
Meaning is dirtied; is stained (by blame)
Root Family √kilis
Root √kilis･3 ya (be dirty, be molested)
√ In Comps kilis or kkilis
Base √kilis + ya > kilissa (pass)
Construction kilissa + ti
Phonetic Change y > s
Commentary (DHPa) attānañ'hi tattha anivesetvā kevalaṃ param'eva anusāsamāno parato nindaṃ labhitvā kilissati nāma, tattha attānaṃ nivesetvā anusāsamāno parato pasaṃsaṃ labhati, tasmā na kilissati nāma. evaṃ karonto paṇḍito na kilisseyyā'ti.
Sanskrit kliśyati
Sanskrit Root √kliś 4, 9 (distress)

attānam'eva paṭhamaṃ,
patirūpe nivesaye,
ath'aññam'anusāseyya,
na kilisseyya paṇḍito.

DHP 158 attavaggo
kilissanta

prp. becoming soiled or stained, being impure [√kilis] ✗
kilissi

aor. became soiled or stained, was impure [√kilis] ✗
kilesa 1

masc. defilement; impurity; unwholesome mental state [√kilis + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from kilissati
Meaning defilement; impurity; unwholesome mental state
Root Family √kilis
Root √kilis･3 ya (be dirty, be molested)
√ In Comps kilis or kkilis
Construction √kilis > kiles + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Variant klesa, kelisa
Sanskrit kleśa
Sanskrit Root √kliś 4, 9 (distress)

kilesehi kho, vāhana, tathāgato nissaṭo visaṃyutto vippamutto vimariyādīkatena cetasā viharati.

AN 10.81 vāhanasuttaṃ

akammaṃ h'etaṃ, mahārāja, jinaputtānaṃ yadidaṃ pūjā, sammasanaṃ saṅkhārānaṃ, yoniso manasikāro, satipaṭṭhān'ānupassanā, ārammaṇasāraggāho, kilesayuddhaṃ, sadattham'anuyuñjanā, etaṃ jinaputtānaṃ karaṇīyaṃ, avasesānaṃ devamanussānaṃ pūjā karaṇīyā.

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
kilesa 2

nt. defilement; impurity; unwholesome mental state [√kilis + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from kilissati
Meaning defilement; impurity; unwholesome mental state
Root Family √kilis
Root √kilis･3 ya (be dirty, be molested)
√ In Comps kilis or kkilis
Construction √kilis > kiles + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Variant klesa, kelisa
Sanskrit kleśa
Sanskrit Root √kliś 4, 9 (distress)

yo ve kilesāni pahāya pañca,
paripuṇṇasekho aparihānadhammo,
cetovasippatto samāhit'indriyo,
sa ve ṭhit'atto'ti naro pavuccati.

Commentary (MNt) kilesadukkhan'ti kilesasambhavarāgapariḷāhadukkhaṃ.

Construction kilesa + pahāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kilesānaṃ + pahāna)

uttarimanussadhammo nāma jhānaṃ vimokkho samādhi samāpatti ñāṇadassanaṃ maggabhāvanā phalasacchikiriyā kilesappahānaṃ vinīvaraṇatā cittassa suññ'āgāre abhirati.

Sanskrit Root √kṛś 4 (be lean)

paṃsukūladharaṃ jantuṃ,
kisaṃ dhamanisanthataṃ,
ekaṃ vanasmiṃ jhāyantaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 395 brāhmaṇavaggo

eṇijaṅghaṃ kisaṃ vīraṃ,
app'āhāraṃ alolupaṃ,

kāmesu anapekkhinaṃ,
upasaṅkamma pucchāma,
kathaṃ dukkhā pamuccatī'ti

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

tatr'idaṃ, bhante, pūraṇena kassapena paramasukk'ābhijāti paññattā, nando vaccho kiso saṃkicco makkhali gosālo. pūraṇena, bhante, kassapena imā chaḷabhijātiyo paññattā'ti.

iti bālassa saṅkappo,
icchā māno ca vaḍḍhati.

kismiṃ kubbati santhavaṃ,

Meaning on what grounds?

Phonetic Change a > i
Commentary (VINa) atha, pācittiyaṃ vā dukkaṭaṃ vā'ti vutte vatthuṃ pucchanto, ahaṃ kismiṃ āpanno'ti vadati.
Sanskrit kasmin

ko āpanno, kiṃ āpanno, kismiṃ āpanno, kathaṃ āpanno, kaṃ bhaṇatha, kiṃ bhaṇathā'ti. eso aññavādako nāma.

VIN 2.5.2.2 aññavādakasikkhāpadaṃ

pron. when what? [ka + smiṃ] ✓

Meaning when what?

Phonetic Change a > i
Sanskrit kasmin

sātaṃ asātañ'ca kutonidānā,
kismiṃ asante na bhavanti h'ete,
vibhavaṃ bhavañ'cā'pi yam'etam'atthaṃ,
etaṃ me pabrūhi yatonidānaṃ.

Sanskrit kasya

evaṃ maṃ avadantaṃ yo evaṃ puccheyya, kissa nu kho, bhante, viññāṇ'āhāro'ti, esa kallo pañho.

aho vata me anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimucceyyā'ti, atha khv'assa n'eva anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimuccati. taṃ kissa hetu? abhāvitattā'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ. kissa abhāvitattā?

masc. arising of what? [kissa + uppāda] ~

Meaning arising of what?
Construction kissa + uppāda
kiṃ 1

Phonetic Change a > i

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ puccheyyuṃ, kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
kiṃ 2

ind. how?; what? [ka + iṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, interr, from ka
Meaning how?; what?
Construction ka > ki + iṃ
Phonetic Change a > i
Sanskrit kim

mā, bhikkhave, viggāhikakathaṃ katheyyātha, na tvaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānāsi, ahaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānāmi. kiṃ tvaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānissasi!

SN 56.9 viggāhikakathāsuttaṃ
kiṃ 3

ind. not to mention; much less; what about? [ka + iṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, interr, from ka
Meaning not to mention; much less; what about?
Construction ka > ki + iṃ
Phonetic Change a > i
Sanskrit kim

idha pana, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa t'ādisaṃ'y'eva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, n'āṇu'pi khāyati, kiṃ bahu'd'eva.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
kiṃadhiṭṭhāna

Meaning relying on what?; supported by what?
Construction kiṃ + adhiṭṭhāna
kiṃadhipateyya

adj. governed by what?; overseen by what?; ruled over by what? [kiṃ + adhipateyya] ✓

Grammar adj, interr, comp
Meaning governed by what?; overseen by what?; ruled over by what?
Construction kiṃ + adhipateyya
Compound kammadhāraya (kiṃ + adhipateyya)
Sanskrit kim + ādhipatya

te pana, samiddhi, kiṃadhipateyyā'ti? sat'ādhipateyyā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃuttarā'ti? paññ'uttarā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃsārā'ti? vimuttisārā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃogadhā'ti? amat'ogadhā, bhante'ti.

AN 9.14 samiddhisuttaṃ

kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā, kiṃpamukhā sabbe dhammā, kiṃadhipateyyā sabbe dhammā, kiṃuttarā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsārā sabbe dhammā, kiṃogadhā sabbe dhammā, kiṃpariyosānā sabbe dhammā'ti

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
kiṃadhippāya

adj. aimed at what? with what goal? [kiṃ + adhippāya] ~

Grammar adj, comp, interr
Meaning aimed at what? with what goal?
Construction kiṃ + adhippāya
Commentary (THa) kim'adhippāyā'ti kīdis'ādhippāyā kīdis'ajjhāsayā, kiṃ saṃkiles'ajjhāsayā, udāhu vodān'ajjhāsayā'ti attho.
kiṃabhinivesa

adj. insisting on what? with what adherence? [kiṃ + abhinivesa] ~

Grammar adj, comp, interr
Meaning insisting on what? with what adherence?
Construction kiṃ + abhinivesa

Grammar adj, interr, comp
Meaning what is supervisor?; what is superior?
Construction kiṃ + uttara
Compound kammadhāraya (kiṃ + uttara)
Sanskrit kim + uttara

te pana, samiddhi, kiṃadhipateyyā'ti? sat'ādhipateyyā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃuttarā'ti? paññ'uttarā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃsārā'ti? vimuttisārā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃogadhā'ti? amat'ogadhā, bhante'ti.

AN 9.14 samiddhisuttaṃ

kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā, kiṃpamukhā sabbe dhammā, kiṃadhipateyyā sabbe dhammā, kiṃuttarā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsārā sabbe dhammā, kiṃogadhā sabbe dhammā, kiṃpariyosānā sabbe dhammā'ti

te pana, samiddhi, kiṃadhipateyyā'ti? sat'ādhipateyyā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃuttarā'ti? paññ'uttarā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃsārā'ti? vimuttisārā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃogadhā'ti? amat'ogadhā, bhante'ti.

AN 9.14 samiddhisuttaṃ

kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā, kiṃpamukhā sabbe dhammā, kiṃadhipateyyā sabbe dhammā, kiṃuttarā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsārā sabbe dhammā, kiṃogadhā sabbe dhammā, kiṃpariyosānā sabbe dhammā'ti

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
kiṃkaṅkhati

pr. has any doubt about; has any uncertainty about [kiṃ + kaṅkhati] ~

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning has any doubt about; has any uncertainty about
Construction kiṃ + kaṅkhati
kiṃkata

adj. done what? ✗
kiṃkaraṇīya

nt. thing which must be done; task to be performed; duties to be done [kiṃ + karaṇīya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning thing which must be done; task to be performed; duties to be done
Construction kiṃ + karaṇīya
Compound kammadhāraya (kiṃ + karaṇīya)
Commentary (ANa) kiṃkaraṇīyānī'ti iti kattabbāni. (ANa) kiṃkaraṇīyānī'ti kiṃ karomī'ti evaṃ vatvā kattabbakammāni.
Sanskrit kim + karaṇīya

puna caparaṃ, subhūti, bhikkhu yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnaṃ ucc'āvacāni kiṃkaraṇīyāni tatra dakkho hoti analaso tatr'upāyāya vīmaṃsāya samannāgato alaṃ kātuṃ alaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ.

AN 11.14 subhūtisuttaṃ

dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa, kiñ'c'āpi yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnaṃ ucc'āvacāni kiṃkaraṇīyāni tattha ussukkaṃ āpanno hoti, atha khv'āssa tibb'āpekkhā hoti adhisīlasikkhāya adhicittasikkhāya adhipaññāsikkhāya.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
kiṃkāraṇā

ind. for what reason?; because of what?; why?; lit. from what cause? [kiṃ + kāraṇa + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, interr, comp, abl sg of kiṃkāraṇa
Meaning for what reason?; because of what?; why?; lit. from what cause?
Construction kiṃ + kāraṇa + ā
kiṃkāraṇa + ā
Compound abyayībhāva (kiṃ + kāraṇā)
Antonym taṃkāraṇa
Sanskrit kim + kāraṇā

bahūni vassāni tay'āmhi yācito,
agāravāsena alaṃ nu te idaṃ,
taṃ dāni maṃ pabbajitaṃ samānaṃ,
kiṃkāraṇā citta tuvaṃ na yuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

adhipātakā vuccanti sabbā'pi makkhikāyo. kiṃkāraṇā adhipātakā vuccanti sabbā'pi makkhikāyo? tā uppatitvā uppatitvā khādanti, taṃkāraṇā adhipātakā vuccanti sabbā'pi makkhikāyo.

NIDD1 16 sāriputta sutta niddeso
kiṃkārapaṭissāvī

adj. willing and able; agreeing to do what the other wants; following instructions obediently; lit. what deed agreeing [kiṃ + kāra + paṭissāvī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning willing and able; agreeing to do what the other wants; following instructions obediently; lit. what deed agreeing
Construction kiṃ + kāra + paṭissāvī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kiṃkāraṃ + paṭissāvī)
Commentary (MNa) kiṃ karomi, ayyaputta? kiṃ karomi ayyaputtā'ti? mukhaṃ olokento kiṃkāraṃ paṭisāvetī'ti kiṃkārapaṭissāvī.
Sanskrit kim + kāra + prati + śrāvin

so taṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatiputtaṃ vā upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante'ti. tam'enaṃ so gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā upaṭṭhāpeyya. so upaṭṭhaheyya pubb'uṭṭhāyī pacchānipātī kiṃkārapaṭissāvī manāpacārī piyavādī.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ
kiṃkusalagavesī

adj. seeking what is good; lit. seeking "what is good?" [kiṃ + kusala + gavesī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning seeking what is good; lit. seeking "what is good?"
Construction kiṃ + kusala + gavesī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kiṃkusalaṃ + gavesī)
Variant kiṃkusalaṃgavesī, kiṃ kusalagavesī,kiṅkusalagavesī
Commentary (MNa) kiṃ kusalagavesī'ti kiṃ kusalan'ti gavesamāno
Sanskrit kim + kuśala + gaveṣin

so evaṃ pabbajito samāno kiṃkusalagavesī anuttaraṃ santivarapadaṃ pariyesamāno yena āḷāro kālāmo ten'upasaṅkamiṃ

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
kiṃkusalaṃgavesī

adj. seeking what is good; lit. seeking "what is good?" [kiṃ + kusalaṃ + gavesī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning seeking what is good; lit. seeking "what is good?"
Construction kiṃ + kusalaṃ + gavesī
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (kiṃkusalaṃ + gavesī)
Variant kiṃkusalagavesī, kiṃ kusalagavesī, kiṅkusalagavesī
Sanskrit kim + kuśala + gaveṣin

so evaṃ pabbajito samāno kiṃkusalaṃgavesī anuttaraṃ santivarapadaṃ pariyesamāno yena āḷāro kālāmo ten'upasaṅkamiṃ.

kiṃjātika

adj. born from what?; descended from what? produced by what?; generated by what? [kiṃ + jātika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning born from what?; descended from what? produced by what?; generated by what?
Construction kiṃ + jātika
Compound kammadhāraya (kiṃ + jātika)
Commentary (MNa) kā jāti etesan'ti kiṃjātikā.
Sanskrit kim + jātīya

ime ca, bhikkhave, cattāro upādānā. kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā? ime cattāro upādānā taṇhānidānā taṇhāsamudayā taṇhājātikā taṇhāpabhavā.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ

ime ca, bhikkhave, cattāro āhārā kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā? ime cattāro āhārā taṇhānidānā taṇhāsamudayā taṇhājātikā taṇhāpabhavā.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
kiṃdada

adj. giving what? [kiṃ + dada] ✓

Grammar adj, interr, comp
Meaning giving what?
Construction kiṃ + dada
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kiṃ + dada)
Sanskrit kim + dada

kiṃdado balado hoti,
kiṃdado hoti vaṇṇado,
kiṃdado sukhado hoti,
kiṃdado hoti cakkhudo,
ko ca sabbadado hoti,
taṃ me akkhāhi pucchito'ti.

SN 1.42 kiṃdadasuttaṃ
kiṃdadasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.42 (SN1.42) ✗
kiṃdiṭṭhika

adj. having what view?; believing what? [kiṃ + diṭṭhika] ✓

Grammar adj, interr, comp
Meaning having what view?; believing what?
Construction kiṃ + diṭṭhika
Compound kammadhāraya (kiṃ + diṭṭhika)
Sanskrit kim + dṛṣṭika

sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi. ekam'antaṃ nisinnaṃ kho anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ te aññatitthiyā paribbājakā etadavocuṃ vadehi, gahapati, kiṃdiṭṭhiko samaṇo gotamo'ti?

SN 41.6 dutiyakāmabhūsuttaṃ
kiṃpaccayā

ind. dependent on what?; due to what condition?; with what as prerequisite?; lit. from condition of what? [kiṃ + paccaya + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, interr, comp, abl sg of kiṃpaccaya
Meaning dependent on what?; due to what condition?; with what as prerequisite?; lit. from condition of what?
Construction kiṃ + paccaya + ā
kiṃpaccaya + ā
Sanskrit kaḥ + pratyayāt

evaṃ maṃ avadantaṃ yo evaṃ puccheyya, kiṃpaccayā nu kho, bhante, phasso'ti, esa kallo pañho. tatra kallaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ, saḷ'āyatanapaccayā phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā

SN 12.12 moḷiyaphaggunasuttaṃ

evaṃ c'āhaṃ na vadāmi. evaṃ maṃ avadantaṃ yo evaṃ puccheyya, kiṃpaccayā nu kho, bhante, vedanā'ti, esa kallo pañho. tatra kallaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ, phassapaccayā vedanā

SN 12.12 moḷiyaphaggunasuttaṃ

Sanskrit kim + prabhava

ime ca, bhikkhave, cattāro upādānā. kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā? ime cattāro upādānā taṇhānidānā taṇhāsamudayā taṇhājātikā taṇhāpabhavā.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
kiṃpamukha

Meaning headed by what?; with what foremost?
Construction kiṃ + pamukha
Compound kammadhāraya (kiṃ + pamukha)
Sanskrit kim + pramukha

te pana, samiddhi, kiṃsamudayā'ti? phassasamudayā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃsamosaraṇā'ti? vedanāsamosaraṇā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃpamukhā'ti? samādhippamukhā, bhante'ti.

AN 9.14 samiddhisuttaṃ

kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā, kiṃpamukhā sabbe dhammā, kiṃadhipateyyā sabbe dhammā, kiṃuttarā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsārā sabbe dhammā, kiṃogadhā sabbe dhammā, kiṃpariyosānā sabbe dhammā'ti

kiṃparama

Construction kiṃ + parama
Commentary (SNt) kīdisī paramā uttamā koṭi etissā'ti kiṃparamā.

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning proceeding from what? produced by what?
Construction kiṃ + pahotika
Commentary (SNa) kiṃpahotikā'ti kiṃpabhutikā, kuto pabhavantī'ti attho?
Sanskrit kim + prabhavati +
kiṃpurisa

masc. mythical creature with the head of a horse and the body of a man; lit. what kind of man? [kiṃ + purisa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mythical creature with the head of a horse and the body of a man; lit. what kind of man?
Construction kiṃ + purisa
Synonym kinnara
Commentary (APt) assamukhanarasarīratāya kucchito puriso, kiñci vā puriso, purisasadiso'ti vā kimpuriso. evaṃ kinnaro. turaṅgavadana, assamukh'ādīni'pi kinnarassa nāmāni.
Notes see MW kimpuruṣa for more details
Sanskrit kimpuruṣa
kiṃpoṇaṃ

sandhi. sloping down to what?; inclining towards what? [kiṃ + poṇaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pp
Meaning sloping down to what?; inclining towards what?
Construction kiṃ + poṇaṃ
Sanskrit kim + pravaṇam

saññāvedayitanirodhasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhitassa pana, bhante, bhikkhuno kiṃninnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, kiṃpoṇaṃ, kiṃpabbhāran'ti?

SN 41.6 dutiyakāmabhūsuttaṃ
kiṃphala

adj. having what fruit?; with what result?; (or) fruit of what?; result of what? [kiṃ + phala] ✓

Grammar adj, interr, comp
Meaning having what fruit?; with what result?; (or) fruit of what?; result of what?
Construction kiṃ + phala
Compound kammadhāraya (kiṃ + phala)
Commentary (ANa) ayaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi kiṃ phalo'ti iminā ayaṃ therī tālaphalaññ'eva gahetvā, idaṃ phalaṃ kiṃ phalaṃ nāmā'ti pucchamānā viya arahattaphalasamādhiṃ gahetvā, ayaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi kiṃ phalo vutto bhagavatā'ti pucchati.
Sanskrit kimphala

yāyaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi na c'ābhinato na c'āpanato na ca sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato, vimuttattā ṭhito, ṭhitattā santusito, santusitattā no paritassati. ayaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi kiṃphalo vutto bhagavatā'ti?

AN 9.37 ānandasuttaṃ
kiṃmūlaka

adj. rooted in what? stemming from what? [kiṃ + mūlaka] ~

Grammar adj, interr, comp
Meaning rooted in what? stemming from what?
Construction kiṃ + mūlaka
kiṃvādī

adj. teaching what doctrine?; holding what view?; of what opinion? [kiṃ + vādī] ✓

Grammar adj, interr, comp
Meaning teaching what doctrine?; holding what view?; of what opinion?
Construction kiṃ + vādī
Compound kammadhāraya (kiṃ + vādī)
Sanskrit kaḥ + vādin

ekam'antaṃ ṭhito kho daṇḍapāṇi sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, kiṃvādī samaṇo kim'akkhāyī'ti?

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

idha no, āvuso sāriputta, bhagavā kiṃvādī kim'akkhāyī, kathaṃ byākaramānā ca mayaṃ vuttavādino c'eva bhagavato assāma, na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkheyyāma

SN 12.25 bhūmijasuttaṃ
kiṃsaññī

adj. aware of what?; percipient of what? [kiṃ + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, interr, comp
Meaning aware of what?; percipient of what?
Construction kiṃ + saññī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kissa + saññī)
Commentary (ANa) kiṃsaññī'ti katarasaññāya saññī hutvā.
Sanskrit kim + saṃjñin

saññī'm'eva kho, āvuso, tadāyatanaṃ no paṭisaṃvedeti, no asaññī'ti. kiṃsaññī pan'āvuso, tadāyatanaṃ no paṭisaṃvedetī'ti?

AN 9.37 ānandasuttaṃ

kiṃsaññī pan'āyasmā sāriputto tasmiṃ samaye ahosī'ti?

AN 10.7 sāriputtasuttaṃ
kiṃsamācāra

adj. having what source?; arising from what? [kiṃ + samudaya] ✓

Meaning having what source?; arising from what?
Construction kiṃ + samudaya
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (kamhā + samudaya)
Commentary (MNa) ko samudayo etesan'ti kiṃsamudayā.
Sanskrit kim + samudaya

te pana, samiddhi, kiṃsamudayā'ti? phassasamudayā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃsamosaraṇā'ti? vedanāsamosaraṇā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃpamukhā'ti? samādhippamukhā, bhante'ti.

AN 9.14 samiddhisuttaṃ

kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā, kiṃpamukhā sabbe dhammā, kiṃadhipateyyā sabbe dhammā

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
kiṃsamosaraṇa

adj. converging upon what?; coming together where? [kiṃ + samosaraṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, interr, comp
Meaning converging upon what?; coming together where?
Construction kiṃ + samosaraṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (kiṃ + samosaraṇa)
Sanskrit kim + samavasaraṇa

te pana, samiddhi, kiṃsamudayā'ti? phassasamudayā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃsamosaraṇā'ti? vedanāsamosaraṇā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃpamukhā'ti? samādhippamukhā, bhante'ti.

AN 9.14 samiddhisuttaṃ

kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā, kiṃpamukhā sabbe dhammā, kiṃadhipateyyā sabbe dhammā

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
kiṃsambhava

adj. produced by what? originating from what? come into being from what?; lit. what source [kiṃ + sambhava] ✓

Grammar adj, interr, comp
Meaning produced by what? originating from what? come into being from what?; lit. what source
Construction kiṃ + sambhava
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (kena + sambhava)
Sanskrit kim + sambhava

sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ puccheyyuṃ, kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā, kiṃpamukhā sabbe dhammā, kiṃadhipateyyā sabbe dhammā, kiṃuttarā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsārā sabbe dhammā'ti, evaṃ puṭṭhā tumhe, bhikkhave, tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ kin'ti byākareyyāthā'ti?

AN 8.83 mūlakasuttaṃ
kiṃsāra

adj. what is the essence?; what is the core? [kiṃ + sāra] ✓

Grammar adj, interr, comp
Meaning what is the essence?; what is the core?
Construction kiṃ + sāra
Compound kammadhāraya (kiṃ + sāra)
Sanskrit kim + sāra

te pana, samiddhi, kiṃadhipateyyā'ti? sat'ādhipateyyā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃuttarā'ti? paññ'uttarā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃsārā'ti? vimuttisārā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kiṃogadhā'ti? amat'ogadhā, bhante'ti.

AN 9.14 samiddhisuttaṃ

kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā, kiṃpamukhā sabbe dhammā, kiṃadhipateyyā sabbe dhammā, kiṃuttarā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsārā sabbe dhammā, kiṃogadhā sabbe dhammā, kiṃpariyosānā sabbe dhammā'ti

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
kiṃsīla

adj. having what conduct? ✗
kiṃsīlasutta

nt. Sutta Nipāta 2.9 (SNP 21) ✗
kiṃsu

ind. what? [ka + iṃ + su] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning what?
Construction ka > ki + iṃ + su
kiṃ + su
Phonetic Change a > i
Variant kiṃsū
Sanskrit kaḥ + svid

kiṃsū'dha vittaṃ purisassa seṭṭhaṃ,
kiṃsu suciṇṇo sukham'āvahati,
kiṃsu have sādutaraṃ rasānaṃ,
kathaṃjīviṃ jīvitam'āhu seṭṭhan'ti.

SN 1.73 vittasuttaṃ

kena'ssu nivuto loko,
kena'ssu nappakāsati,
kiss'ābhilepanaṃ brūsi,
kiṃ'su tassa mahabbhayaṃ.

pārāyanavaggo 1

kiṃsu bhūtā upajīvanti,
ye pāṇā pathavissitā'ti.

kīṭa

masc. insect ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning insect
Sanskrit kīṭa

kadā nu maṃ tandi khudā pipāsā,
vāt'ātapā kīṭasarīsapā vā,
na bādhayissanti na taṃ giribbaje,
atth'atthiyaṃ taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

ḍaṃsā ca makasā ca ḍaṃsamakasaṃ, kuntho ca kipilliko ca kunthakipillikaṃ, kīṭo ca sarīsapo ca kīṭasarīsapaṃ. evaṃ khuddajantuk'atthe.

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, dve sahāyakā sahapaṃsukīḷikā. te kadāci karahaci aññam'aññaṃ samāgaccheyyuṃ. añño pana sahāyako sahāyakaṃ evaṃ vadeyya, idam'pi, samma, sarasi, idam'pi, samma, sarasī'ti. so evaṃ vadeyya, sarāmi, samma, sarāmi, sammā'ti.

kīḷita 2

nt. impromptu game; lit. arisen play [kīḷita + jāta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning impromptu game; lit. arisen play
Construction kīḷita + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (kīḷita + jāta)
Sanskrit krīḍita + jāta

seyyathā'pi nāma kuñjaro saṭṭhihāyano gambhīraṃ pokkharaṇiṃ ogāhetvā sāṇadhovikaṃ nāma kīḷitajātaṃ kīḷati, evam'ev'āhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ sāṇadhovikaṃ maññe kīḷitajātaṃ kīḷissāmi.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ

ty > cc

jhāyī na pādalol'assa,
virame kukkuccā nappamajjeyya,
ath'āsanesu sayanesu,
appasaddesu bhikkhu vihareyya.

Phonetic Change a > u (sk ṛ)
ty > cc
Sanskrit kaukṛtya +
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū chattapāṇissa gilānassa dhammaṃ desetuṃ kukkuccāyanti.

VIN 2.7.6 surusuruvaggo

dvinnaṃ, bhikkhave, āsavā vaḍḍhanti. katamesaṃ dvinnaṃ? yo ca na kukkuccāyitabbaṃ kukkuccāyati, yo ca kukkuccāyitabbaṃ na kukkuccāyati. imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ āsavā vaḍḍhantī'ti.

ahiṃ gahetvā daḷhāya rajjuyā bandheyya. suṃsumāraṃ gahetvā daḷhāya rajjuyā bandheyya. pakkhiṃ gahetvā daḷhāya rajjuyā bandheyya. kukkuraṃ gahetvā daḷhāya rajjuyā bandheyya. siṅgālaṃ gahetvā daḷhāya rajjuyā bandheyya. makkaṭaṃ gahetvā daḷhāya rajjuyā bandheyya.

kukkurakuṇapa

Meaning corpse of a dog; dead dog's body
Construction kukkura + kuṇapa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kukkurassa + kuṇapo)
Sanskrit kukura, kukkura, kurkura + kuṇapa

seyyathā'pi, bhante, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko sīsaṃnhāto ahikuṇapena vā kukkurakuṇapena vā manussakuṇapena vā kaṇṭhe āsattena aṭṭīyeyya harāyeyya jiguccheyya

AN 9.11 sīhanādasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, kaṃsapāti ābhatā āpaṇā vā kammārakulā vā parisuddhā pariyodātā. tam'enaṃ sāmikā ahikuṇapaṃ vā kukkurakuṇapaṃ vā manussakuṇapaṃ vā racayitvā aññissā kaṃsapātiyā paṭikujjitvā antarāpaṇaṃ paṭipajjeyyuṃ.

Sanskrit kukura, kukkura, kurkura + citta

idha, puṇṇa, ekacco kukkuravataṃ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, kukkurasīlaṃ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, kukkuracittaṃ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, kukkur'ākappaṃ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ.

Sanskrit kukkura + vratika

atha kho puṇṇo ca koliyaputto govatiko acelo ca seniyo kukkuravatiko yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā puṇṇo koliyaputto govatiko bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

MN 57 kukkuravatikasuttaṃ
kukkuravatikasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 57; Discourse to the Dog Practice Ascetic (MN57) [kukkura + vatika + sutta] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Majjhima Nikāya 57; Discourse to the Dog Practice Ascetic (MN57)
Construction kukkura + vatika + sutta
Sanskrit kukkuravratika (bsk) + sūtra
kukkurasaṅgha

masc. pack of dogs [kukkura + saṅgha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning pack of dogs
Construction kukkura + saṅgha
kukkurasaṅghaparivuta

adj. surrounded by a pack of dogs [kukkurasaṅgha + parivuta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning surrounded by a pack of dogs
Construction kukkurasaṅgha + parivuta
kukkurasīla

nt. conduct of a dog; dog's behaviour [kukkura + sīla] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning conduct of a dog; dog's behaviour
Construction kukkura + sīla
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kukkurassa + sīla)
Commentary (MNa) kukkurasīlan'ti kukkurācāraṃ.
Sanskrit kukura, kukkura, kurkura + śīla

idha, puṇṇa, ekacco kukkuravataṃ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, kukkurasīlaṃ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, kukkuracittaṃ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, kukkur'ākappaṃ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ.

MN 57 kukkuravatikasuttaṃ
kukkurākappa

masc. bodily behaviour of a dog; dog's physical manner [kukkura + ākappa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning bodily behaviour of a dog; dog's physical manner
Construction kukkura + ākappa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kukkurassa + ākappa)
Commentary (MNa) kukkur'ākappan'ti kukkurānaṃ gaman'ākāro atthi, tiṭṭhan'ākāro atthi, nisīdan'ākāro atthi, sayan'ākāro atthi, uccārapassāvakaraṇ'ākāro atthi, aññe kukkure disvā dante vivaritvā gamanākāro atthi, ayaṃ kukkur'ākappo nāma, taṃ bhāvetī'ti attho.
Sanskrit kukura, kukkura, kurkura + ākalpa

idha, puṇṇa, ekacco kukkuravataṃ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, kukkurasīlaṃ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, kukkuracittaṃ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, kukkur'ākappaṃ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ.

kukkuḷavagga

masc. Chapter 14 of the Khandasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 3 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
kukkuḷasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.136 (SN22.136) ✗
kucchi 1

masc. stomach; belly [√kus + chi] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning stomach; belly
Root Family √kus
Root √kus×1 *a (fill, enfold)
Construction √kus + chi
Derivative kita (chi)
Sanskrit kukṣi
Sanskrit Root √kuś 4 (enfold)

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā tiṇhena govikantanena kucchiṃ parikanteyya, evam'eva kho adhimattā vātā kucchiṃ parikantanti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

so santuṭṭho hoti kāyaparihārikena cīvarena kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena so yena yen'eva pakkamati samādāy'eva pakkamati

MN 27 cūḷa hatthipadopamasuttaṃ
kucchi 2

masc. womb [√kus + chi] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning womb
Root Family √kus
Root √kus×1 *a (fill, enfold)
Construction √kus + chi
Derivative kita (chi)
Sanskrit kukṣi
Sanskrit Root √kuś 4 (enfold)

tam'enaṃ, bhikkhave, mātā nava vā dasa vā māse gabbhaṃ kucchinā pariharati mahatā saṃsayena garubhāraṃ. tam'enaṃ, bhikkhave, mātā navannaṃ vā dasannaṃ vā māsānaṃ accayena vijāyati mahatā saṃsayena garubhāraṃ.

kucchigata 1

adj. (+gen) gone into the belly (of) [kucchi + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+gen)
Meaning gone into the belly (of)
Construction kucchi + gata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (kucchismiṃ + gata)
Sanskrit kukṣigata

tena kho pana samayena māro pāpimā āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa kucchigato hoti koṭṭham'anupaviṭṭho. atha kho āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa etadahosi, kiṃ nu kho me kucchi garugaro viya mās'ācitaṃ maññe'ti.

adj. looking after the stomach; taking care of the belly [kucchi + parihārika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning looking after the stomach; taking care of the belly
Construction kucchi + parihārika

Commentary (MNa) kucchiparihārikenā'ti kucchipariharaṇamattakena.
Sanskrit kukṣi + parihāraka

seyyathā'pi nāma pakkhī sakuṇo yena yen'eva ḍeti sapattabhāro'va ḍeti, evam'eva kho ahaṃ, āvuso, santuṭṭho ahosiṃ kāyaparihārikena cīvarena, kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
kucchimant

adj. pregnant ✗
kucchiroga

Meaning disease of the stomach; stomach pain
Construction kucchi + roga

kujjhati

pr. (+dat) is angry (with); gets angry (with) [√kudh + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass, intrans (+dat)
Meaning is angry (with); gets angry (with)
Root Family √kudh
Root √kudh･3 ya (be angry)
√ In Comps kkudh
Base √kudh + ya > kujjha (pass)
Construction kujjha + ti
Phonetic Change dhy > jjh
Sanskrit krudhyati
Sanskrit Root √krudh 4 (be angry)

saccaṃ bhaṇe na kujjheyya,
dajjā appam'pi yācito,
etehi tīhi ṭhānehi,
gacche devāna santike.

DHP 224 kodhavaggo

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pāsāṇe lekhā na khippaṃ lujjati vātena vā udakena vā, ciraṭṭhitikā hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco puggalo abhiṇhaṃ kujjhati. so ca khv'assa kodho dīgharattaṃ anuseti.

AN 3.133 lekhasuttaṃ
kujjhanta

prp. (+dat) being angry [√kudh] ✗
kujjhi

aor. (+dat) was angry [√kudh] ✗
kuñja

nt. glen, dell ✗
kuñjara

masc. elephant ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning elephant
Derivative taddhita (ra)
Synonym gaja, hatthi, hatthī, mātaṅga
Sanskrit kuñjara

varam'assatarā dantā,
ājānīyā ca sindhavā,
kuñjarā ca mahānāgā,
attadanto tato varaṃ.

DHP 322 nāgavaggo

seyyathā'pi nāma kuñjaro saṭṭhihāyano gambhīraṃ pokkharaṇiṃ ogāhetvā sāṇadhovikaṃ nāma kīḷitajātaṃ kīḷati, evam'ev'āhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ sāṇadhovikaṃ maññe kīḷitajātaṃ kīḷissāmi.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
kuñjaramattakareṇuloḷita

adj. disturbed by male and female elephants rutting [kuñjara + matta + kareṇu + loḷita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning disturbed by male and female elephants rutting
Construction kuñjara + matta + kareṇu + loḷita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (kuñjaramattakareṇūhi + loḷita)
Commentary (THIa) kuñjaramattakareṇuloḷitan'ti mattakuñjarehi hatthinīhi ca migānaṃ cittatāpanena rukkhagacch'ādīnaṃ sākhābhañjanena ca āloḷitapadesaṃ.
Sanskrit kuñjara + matta + kareṇu + lolita

vāḷamigasaṅghasevitaṃ,
kuñjaramattakareṇuloḷitaṃ,
asahāyikā gantum'icchasi,
rahitaṃ bhiṃsanakaṃ mahāvanaṃ.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
kuñjarābhiruda

adj. filled with the sound of elephants ✗
kuṭa

masc. water pot ✗
kuṭaja

masc. medicinal herb; Wrightia antidysenterica; Holarrhena antidysenterica; vermicide ✓

Meaning medicinal herb; Wrightia antidysenterica; Holarrhena antidysenterica; vermicide
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wrightia_antidysenterica
Non IA kuṭacam (Tamil)
Sanskrit kuṭaja

anujānāmi, bhikkhave, paṇṇāni bhesajjāni, nimbapaṇṇaṃ, kuṭajapaṇṇaṃ, paṭolapaṇṇaṃ, sulasipaṇṇaṃ, kappāsapaṇṇaṃ, yāni vā pan'aññāni'pi atthi paṇṇāni bhesajjāni, n'eva khādanīye khādanīy'atthaṃ pharanti, na bhojanīye bhojanīy'atthaṃ pharanti.

kuṭajakasāva

kuṭi 1

fem. hut; monk’s dwelling [√kuṭ + i] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning hut; monk’s dwelling
Root Family √kuṭ
Root √kuṭ･1 a (be crooked, bent)
Construction √kuṭ + i
Derivative kita (i)
Commentary (VIN 1.2.6) kuṭi nāma ullittā vā hoti avalittā vā ullitt'āvalittā vā.
Sanskrit kuṭi
Sanskrit Root √kuṭ 6 (be crooked)

sare hatthehi bhañjitvā,
katvāna kuṭim'acchisaṃ,
tena me sarabhaṅgo'ti,
nāmaṃ sammutiyā ahu.

TH 228 sarabhaṅgattheragāthā

pakk'odano duddhakhīro'ham'asmi,
anutīre mahiyā samānavāso,
channā kuṭi āhito gini,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

SNP 2 dhaniyasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 2
kuṭi 2

fem. curve; curvature, shape [√kuṭ + i] ✓

Grammar fem, in comps
Meaning curve; curvature, shape
Root Family √kuṭ
Root √kuṭ･1 a (be crooked, bent)
Construction √kuṭ + i
Derivative kita (i)
Sanskrit kuṭi
Sanskrit Root √kuṭ 6 (be crooked)

atha kho, bhikkhave, vedehikā gahapatānī kāḷiṃ dāsiṃ etadavoca, he je kāḷī'ti. kiṃ, ayye'ti? kiṃ, je, divā uṭṭhāsī'ti? na khv'ayye, kiñcī'ti. no vata re kiñci, pāpi dāsi, divā uṭṭhāsī'ti kupitā anattamanā bhākuṭiṃ akāsi.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
kuṭikaṇṇa

Grammar fem, dimin of kuṭi

Root √kuṭ･1 a (be crooked, bent)
Construction √kuṭ + i + ikā
kuṭi + ikā
Derivative taddhita (ikā)
Sanskrit kuṭikā
Sanskrit Root √kuṭ 6 (be crooked)

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ sambahulā bhikkhū, kosalesu viharanti himavantapasse araññakuṭikāya uddhatā unnaḷā capalā mukharā vikiṇṇavācā muṭṭhassatino asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā pākat'indriyā.

SN 2.25 jantusuttaṃ

mātaraṃ kuṭikaṃ brūsi,
bhariyaṃ brūsi kulāvakaṃ,
putte santānake brūsi,
taṇhaṃ me brūsi bandhanan'ti.

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.19 (SN1.19) ✗
kuṭila

adj. bent; crooked; curved [√kuṭ + ila] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning bent; crooked; curved
Root Family √kuṭ
Root √kuṭ･1 a (be crooked, bent)
Construction √kuṭ + ila
Derivative kita (ila)
Antonym akuṭila
Synonym bhogga, vaṅka
Sanskrit kuṭila
Sanskrit Root √kuṭ 6 (be crooked)

so yā tā sālalaṭṭhiyo kuṭilā oj'āpaharaṇiyo tā chetvā bahiddhā nīhareyya, antovanaṃ suvisodhitaṃ visodheyya. yā pana tā sālalaṭṭhiyo ujukā sujātā tā sammā parihareyya.

Meaning base of a wall
Construction kuṭṭa + mūla
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kuṭṭassa + mūla)
Variant kuḍḍamūla, kuḍḍa
Commentary (THa) kuṭṭamūlaṃ nissāyā'ti tassa purisassa pasādajanan'atthaṃ t'ādise gharabhittisamīpe nisīditvā
Sanskrit kuḍya + mūla

rājagahe sapadānaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā taṃ piṇḍapātaṃ aññataraṃ kuṭṭamūlaṃ nissāya paribhuñjati. atha kho sūcimukhī paribbājikā yen'āyasmā sāriputto ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca.

SN 28.10 sūcimukhīsuttaṃ
kuṭṭarāja

masc. petty king; minor authority; lit. wattle and daub king [kuṭṭa + rāja] ~

Grammar masc, atta group, comp
Meaning petty king; minor authority; lit. wattle and daub king
Construction kuṭṭa + rāja
Variant kuḍḍarāja
Commentary (SNa) kuṭṭarājāno'ti khuddakarājāno. khuddarājāno'ti'pi pāṭho.
Sanskrit kuḍya + rāja
kuṭṭha 1

nt. leprosy; severe skin inflammation [√kus + ta] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning leprosy; severe skin inflammation
Root Family √kus
Root √kus×1 *a (cut, tear)
Construction √kus + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Sanskrit kuṣṭha
Sanskrit Root √kuṣ 6, 9 (?)

tassa so bhisakko sallakatto bhesajjaṃ kareyya. so taṃ bhesajjaṃ āgamma kuṭṭhehi parimucceyya, arogo assa sukhī serī sayaṃvasī yena kāmaṃ gamo.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

iti imasmiṃ kāye vividhā ābādhā uppajjanti, seyyath'idaṃ ... pakkhandikā sūlā visūcikā kuṭṭhaṃ gaṇḍo kilāso soso apamāro daddu kaṇḍu kacchu nakhasā vitacchikā lohitaṃ pittaṃ madhumeho aṃsā piḷakā bhagandalā

Sanskrit kuṣṭhin

seyyathā'pi, māgaṇḍiya, kuṭṭhī puriso arugatto pakkagatto kimīhi khajjamāno nakhehi vaṇamukhāni vippatacchamāno aṅgārakāsuyā kāyaṃ paritāpeyya.

saññācikā nāma sayaṃ yācitvā purisam'pi puris'atthakaram'pi goṇam'pi sakaṭam'pi vāsim'pi parasum'pi kuṭhārim'pi kudālam'pi nikhādanam'pi vallim'pi veḷum'pi muñjam'pi pabbajam'pi tiṇam'pi mattikam'pi.

AN 10.15 appamādasuttaṃ
kuṇapa 1

masc. corpse; carcass; dead body ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning corpse; carcass; dead body
Synonym kaḷebara, kalevara
Sanskrit kuṇapa

kiṃ te idha sārasammataṃ,
kuṇapapūramhi susānavaḍḍhane,
bhedanadhamme kaḷevare,
yaṃ disvā vimano udikkhasi.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo na matena kuṇapena saṃvasati.

SN 44.9 kutūhalasālāsuttaṃ
kutūhalasālāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 44.9 (SN44.9) ✗
kutettha

sandhi. how in this matter?; what in this regard?; lit. from where here [kuto + ettha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + adv, interr
Meaning how in this matter?; what in this regard?; lit. from where here
Construction kuto + ettha
Sanskrit kutas + atra

anatthaṃ me acari, taṃ kut'ettha labbhā'ti āghātaṃ paṭivineti, anatthaṃ me carati, taṃ kut'ettha labbhā'ti āghātaṃ paṭivineti, anatthaṃ me carissati, taṃ kut'ettha labbhā'ti āghātaṃ paṭivineti

AN 9.30 āghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

tattha devamanussā gandhamāl'ādīhi pūjayamānā, mahāpurisa, idha tumhehi sadiso añño n'atthi, kut'ettha uttaritaro'ti āhaṃsu.

JAa 1.N.2 avidūre nidāna kathā
kuto 1

ind. from where?; where? [ka + to] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of ka, interr
Meaning from where?; where?
Construction ka > ku + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Phonetic Change a > u
Sanskrit kutas

eta'r'ahi vā paccuppannam'addhānaṃ ajjhattaṃ kathaṃkathī hoti, ahaṃ nu kho'smi? no nu kho'smi? kiṃ nu kho'smi? kathaṃ nu kho'smi? ayaṃ nu kho satto kuto āgato? so kuhiṃ gāmī bhavissatī'ti?

MN 2.2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

sīlagandhasamo gandho,
kuto nāma bhavissati,
yo samaṃ anuvāte ca,
paṭivāte ca vāyati.

VISM 1.1.2 sīlānisaṃsa kathā
kuto 2

ind. how?; in what way? [ka + to] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of ka, interr
Meaning how?; in what way?
Construction ka > ku + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Phonetic Change a > u
Sanskrit kutas

yo'pi hetu yo'pi paccayo cakkhuviññāṇassa uppādāya, so'pi hetu so'pi paccayo anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī. aniccaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, paccayaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ cakkhuviññāṇaṃ kuto niccaṃ bhavissati!

SN 35.93 dutiyadvayasuttaṃ
kuto 3

ind. let alone; not to mention; what to say of; lit. from where [ka + to] ✓

Grammar ind, abl sg of ka
Meaning let alone; not to mention; what to say of; lit. from where
Construction ka > ku + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Phonetic Change a > u
Sanskrit kutas

piyato jāyatī soko,
piyato jāyatī bhayaṃ,
piyato vippamuttassa,
n'atthi soko kuto bhayaṃ.

DHP 212 piyavaggo

so tassa pattavaṭṭiṃ vinibbhujanto pheggum'pi nādhigaccheyya, kuto sāraṃ!

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ
kutoci

ind. from anywhere; from somewhere; from some other ✗
kutoja

adj. born from what?; sprung from where? [kuto + ja] ~

Grammar adj, comp, interr
Meaning born from what?; sprung from where?
Construction kuto + ja
Commentary (SNPa) kutojā kutojātā'ti pucchati.
kutonidāna

adj. from what source?; from where? [kuto + nidāna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, interr
Meaning from what source?; from where?
Construction kuto + nidāna
Compound kammadhāraya (kuto + nidāna)
Commentary (SNa) kutonidānā'ti kiṃnidānā, kiṃpaccayā'ti attho?
Sanskrit kutas + nidāna

sātaṃ asātañ'ca kutonidānā,
kismiṃ asante na bhavanti h'ete,
vibhavaṃ bhavañ'cā'pi yam'etam'atthaṃ,
etaṃ me pabrūhi yatonidānaṃ.

SNP 49 kalahavivādasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 11

piyā su lokasmiṃ kutonidānā,
ye c'āpi lobhā vicaranti loke,
āsā ca niṭṭhā ca kutonidānā,
ye samparāyāya narassa honti.

SNP 49 kalahavivādasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 11
kutopabhutika

adj. originated from where?; descended from where? ✗
kutopahūta

adj. arisen from what?; appeared from where?; come from where? [kuto + pahūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, interr
Meaning arisen from what?; appeared from where?; come from where?
Construction kuto + pahūta
Compound kammadhāraya (kuto + pahūta)
Sanskrit kutas + prabhūta

kutopahūtā kalahā vivādā,
paridevasokā sahamaccharā ca,
mān'ātimānā sahapesuṇā ca,
kutopahūtā te tadiṅgha brūhi.

Construction kuto + mukha + ā
kutomukha + ā
kutta 1

nt. behaviour, coquetry [√kar] ✗
kutta 2

pp. created; formed; fashioned [√kar] ✗
kuttaka 1

adj. fake; sham; bogus; lit. acting; behaving [√kar + ta + ka] ~

Grammar adj, from kutta
Meaning fake; sham; bogus; lit. acting; behaving
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction √kar + ta + ka
kutta + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change a > u (sk ṛ)
Commentary (VINa) samaṇakuttako'ti samaṇavesadhārako. so kira sikhāmattaṃ ṭhapetvā sīsaṃ muṇḍetvā ekaṃ kāsāvaṃ nivāsetvā ekaṃ aṃse katvā vihāraṃ'y'eva upanissāya vighāsādabhāvena jīvati.

kuttavāla

adj. with a braided tail ✗
kuthita 1

Commentary (SNa) kuthitan'ti kudhitaṃ, heṭṭhā santattāya vālikāya upari ātapena ca atitikhiṇan'ti attho. idaṃ pana tepiṭake buddhavacane asambhinnapadaṃ.
Sanskrit kvathita
Sanskrit Root √kvath 1 (boil)

tena kho pana samayena uṇhaṃ hoti kuthitaṃ, te ca therā bhikkhū paveliyamānena maññe kāyena gacchanti, yathā taṃ bhojanaṃ bhuttāvino.

AN 4.159 bhikkhunīsuttaṃ
kudācanaṃ

mā piyehi samāgañchi,
appiyehi kudācanaṃ,
piyānaṃ adassanaṃ dukkhaṃ,
appiyānañ'ca dassanaṃ.

DHP 210 piyavaggo

gamanena na pattabbo,
lokass'anto kudācanaṃ,
na ca appatvā lok'antaṃ,
dukkhā atthi pamocanaṃ.

SN 2.26 rohitassasuttaṃ
kudāla

masc. spade; hoe ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning spade; hoe
Variant kuddāla
Commentary (SPM) kuṃ pathaviṃ dālayati padāleti bhindati etenā'ti kudālo.
Notes commentary suggests kuṃ + dāla
Sanskrit kuddāla

saññācikā nāma sayaṃ yācitvā purisam'pi puris'atthakaram'pi goṇam'pi sakaṭam'pi vāsim'pi parasum'pi kuṭhārim'pi kudālam'pi nikhādanam'pi vallim'pi veḷum'pi muñjam'pi pabbajam'pi tiṇam'pi mattikam'pi.

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso āgaccheyya kudālapiṭakaṃ ādāya. so evaṃ vadeyya, ahaṃ imaṃ mahāpathaviṃ apathaviṃ karissāmī'ti.

AN 4.159 bhikkhunīsuttaṃ
kuddāla

masc. spade; hoe ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning spade; hoe
Variant kudāla
Commentary (SPM) kuṃ pathaviṃ dālayati padāleti bhindati etenā'ti kudālo.
Notes folk etymology suggests kuṃ + dāla "digging the earth"
Sanskrit kuddāla

atha puriso āgaccheyya kuddālapiṭakaṃ ādāya. so taṃ māluvālataṃ mūle chindeyya, mūle chetvā palikhaṇeyya, palikhaṇitvā mūlāni uddhareyya, antamaso usīranāḷamattāni'pi.

atha puriso āgaccheyya kuddālapiṭakaṃ ādāya. so taṃ māluvālataṃ mūle chindeyya, mūle chetvā palikhaṇeyya, palikhaṇitvā mūlāni uddhareyya, antamaso usīranāḷamattāni'pi.

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, vappa, thūṇaṃ paṭicca chāyā paññāyati. atha puriso āgaccheyya kuddālapiṭakaṃ ādāya. so taṃ thūṇaṃ mūle chindeyya, mūle chinditvā palikhaṇeyya, palikhaṇitvā mūlāni uddhareyya, antamaso usīranāḷimattāni'pi.

AN 4.195 vappasuttaṃ
kuddiṭṭhī

adj. (one) who holds wrong views ✗
kuddha 1

masc. angry person; lit. angered [√kudh + ta] ✓

Grammar masc, pp of kujjhati
Meaning angry person; lit. angered
Root Family √kudh
Root √kudh･3 ya (be angry)
√ In Comps kkudh
Construction √kudh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Variant kodha
Sanskrit kruddha
Sanskrit Root √krudh 4 (be angry)

tass'eva tena pāpiyo,
yo kuddhaṃ paṭikujjhati,
kuddhaṃ appaṭikujjhanto,
saṅgāmaṃ jeti dujjayaṃ.

SN 7.3 asurindakasuttaṃ

kuddho atthaṃ na jānāti,
kuddho dhammaṃ na passati,
andhatamaṃ tadā hoti,
yaṃ kodho sahate naraṃ.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
kuddha 2

pp. angered; enraged; infuriated [√kudh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of kujjhati
Meaning angered; enraged; infuriated
Root Family √kudh
Root √kudh･3 ya (be angry)
√ In Comps kkudh
Construction √kudh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Sanskrit kruddha
Sanskrit Root √krudh 4 (be angry)

ṭhānañ'hi so manuj'indo,
rajjaṃ laddhāna khattiyo,
so kuddho rājadaṇḍena,
tasmiṃ pakkamate bhusaṃ,
tasmā taṃ parivajjeyya,
rakkhaṃ jīvitam'attano.

so kupito anattamano sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ūmibhayassa bhīto sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvatto.

atha kho te māṇavakā kupitā anattamanā yena lohicco brāhmaṇo ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu

taṃ nissito kuppapaṭicca santiṃ.

Sanskrit kupyate
Sanskrit Root √kup 4 (be angry)

rajanīye rajjati, dussanīye dussati, mohanīye muyhati, kuppanīye kuppati, madanīye majjati.

AN 5.81 rajanīyasuttaṃ

lābhakamyā na sikkhati,
alābhe ca na kuppati,
aviruddho ca taṇhāya,
rasesu n'ānugijjhati.

AN 4.197 mallikādevīsuttaṃ
kubbati

pr. (+acc) does; makes; creates [√kar + o + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning does; makes; creates
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + o > karo > kubba (irreg)
Construction kubba + ti
Phonetic Change kar > kubb (Kacc 512, 522)
Variant kurute, karoti
Sanskrit kurvanti
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

na kappayanti na purekkharonti,
accantasuddhī'ti na te vadanti,
ādānaganthaṃ gathitaṃ visajja,
āsaṃ na kubbanti kuhiñci loke.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4

sabbattha munī anissito,
na piyaṃ kubbati no'pi appiyaṃ,
tasmiṃ paridevamaccharaṃ,
paṇṇe vāri yathā na limpati.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6
kubbato

prp. (+acc) for one doing (something) [√kar + o + nta + to] ✓

Grammar prp, dat sg of kubbanta, trans (+acc)
Meaning for one doing (something)
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + o > karo > kubba (irreg)
Construction kubba + nta + to
kubbanta + to
Phonetic Change kar > kubb (Kacc 512, 522)
Antonym akubbato
Variant sakubbato, pakubbato, sukubbato
Sanskrit kurvate
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

yathā'pi ruciraṃ pupphaṃ,
vaṇṇavantaṃ sugandhakaṃ,
evaṃ subhāsitā vācā,
saphalā hoti kubbato.

DHP 52 pupphavaggo
kubbanaka

nt. small forest, brushwood ✗
kubbanta 1

prp. (+acc) doing; performing [√kar + o + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of kubbati, trans (+acc)
Meaning doing; performing
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + o > karo > kubba (irreg)
Construction kubba + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change kar > kubb (Kacc 512, 522)
Antonym akubbanta
Sanskrit kurvat
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

duddadaṃ dadamānānaṃ,
dukkaraṃ kamma kubbataṃ,
asanto n'ānukubbanti,
sataṃ dhammo duranvayo.

SN 1.32 maccharisuttaṃ
kubbanta 2

prp. (+acc) making [√kar] ✗
kubbamāna

prp. doing, performing [√kar] ✗
kubbaye

opt. (+acc) should do; should make; should form [√kar + o + eyya] ✓

Grammar opt of kubbati, trans (+acc)
Meaning should do; should make; should form
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + o > karo > kubba (irreg)
Construction kubba + eyya > aye
Phonetic Change kar > kubb (Kacc 512, 522)
Sanskrit kuryāt
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

mosavajje na nīyetha,
rūpe snehaṃ na kubbaye,
mānañ'ca parijāneyya,
sāhasā virato care.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15

purāṇaṃ n'ābhinandeyya,
nave khantiṃ na kubbaye,
hiyyamāne na soceyya,
ākāsaṃ na sito siyā.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
kubbara 1

masc. carriage pole ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning carriage pole
Sanskrit kūbara

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā pacchā laṅghati, kubbaraṃ hanati, tidaṇḍaṃ bhañjati. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo assadoso.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ
kubbara 2

masc. hub of a wheel; axle shaft ~

Grammar masc
Meaning hub of a wheel; axle shaft
Commentary (SNa) nemī'va rathakubbaran'ti yathā divasaṃ gacchantassa rathassa cakkanemi kubbaraṃ anupariyāyati na vijahati, evaṃ āyu anupariyāyatī'ti.
kubbāna

prp. (+acc) doing; making; performing [√kar + o + āna] ✓

Grammar prp of kubbati, trans (+acc)
Meaning doing; making; performing
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + o > karo > kubba (irreg)
Construction kubba + āna
Derivative kita (āna)
Phonetic Change kar > kubb (Kacc 512, 522)
Antonym akubbāna
Commentary (DHPa) attano kamma kubbānan'ti attano kammaṃ nāma tisso sikkhā, tā pūrayamānan'ti attho.
Sanskrit kurvāṇa
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

sīladassanasampannaṃ,
dhammaṭṭhaṃ saccavedinaṃ,
attano kamma kubbānaṃ,
taṃ jano kurute piyaṃ.

DHP 217 piyavaggo
kubbetha

opt. (+acc) one oneself should do; one oneself should make [√kar + o + etha] ✓

Grammar opt, reflx 3rd sg of kubbeyya, trans (+acc)
Meaning one oneself should do; one oneself should make
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + o > karo > kubba (irreg)
Construction kubba + etha
Phonetic Change kar > kubb (Kacc 512, 522)
Variant krubbetha
Commentary (SNa) kubbethā'ti kareyya.
Sanskrit kuryeta
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

sabbhi'r'eva samāsetha,
sabbhi kubbetha santhavaṃ,
sataṃ saddhammam'aññāya,
sattā gacchanti suggatin'ti.

SN 1.31 sabbhisuttaṃ

yaṃ kiñci dhammam'abhijaññā,
ajjhattaṃ athavā'pi bahiddhā,
na tena thāmaṃ kubbetha,
na hi sā nibbuti sataṃ vuttā.

aṭṭhakavaggo 14

Notes (MW) ku māra, √mṛ ? 'easily dying'

kacci, bhante, bhagavā sukham'asayitthā'ti? evaṃ, kumāra, sukham'asayitthaṃ. ye ca pana loke sukhaṃ senti, ahaṃ tesaṃ aññataro'ti.

AN 3.35 hatthakasuttaṃ

ayañ'hi, deva, kumāro nigrodhaparimaṇḍalo yāvatakv'assa kāyo tāvatakv'assa byāmo, yāvatakv'assa byāmo, tāvatakv'assa kāyo

Sanskrit Root kumāra - (child)

AN 9.11 sīhanādasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena sambahulā kumārakā antarā ca sāvatthiṃ antarā ca jetavanaṃ macchake bādhenti.

kumārakasutta

nt. Udāna 44 (UD 44) ✗
kumārakassapa

masc. name of a monk; foremost in talking on diverse topics [kumāra + kassapa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monk; foremost in talking on diverse topics
Construction kumāra + kassapa
Compound kammadhāraya (kumāra + kassapa)
Commentary (AN 1.217) etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ cittakathikānaṃ yadidaṃ kumārakassapo. (MNa) kumārakassapo'ti tassa nāmaṃ. kumārakāle pabbajitattā pana bhagavatā, kassapaṃ pakkosatha, idaṃ phalaṃ vā khādanīyaṃ vā kassapassa dethā'ti vutte, katarassa kassapassā'ti kumārakassapassā'ti evaṃ gahitanāmattā tato paṭṭhāya vuḍḍhakāle'pi kumārakassapo tv'eva vuccati.
Sanskrit kumāra + kāśyapa

atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ andhavanaṃ obhāsetvā yen'āyasmā kumārakassapo ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi.

kumudaṃ sāradikaṃ'va,
santimaggam'eva brūhaya,
nibbānaṃ sugatena desitaṃ.

Construction kumbha + thenaka
Compound kammadhāraya (kumbha + thenaka)
Commentary (SNa) kumbhatthenakehī'ti ye paragharaṃ pavisitvā dīp'ālokena oloketvā parabhaṇḍaṃ haritukāmā ghaṭe dīpaṃ katvā pavisanti, te kumbhatthenakā nāma, tehi kumbhatthenakehi. (ANa) kumbhatthenakehī'ti kumbhe dīpaṃ jāletvā tena ālokena paraghare bhaṇḍaṃ vicinitvā thenakacorehi.
Sanskrit kumbha + stena + ka

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yāni kānici kulāni bahu'tthikāni appapurisāni tāni suppadhaṃsiyāni honti corehi kumbhatthenakehi.

Meaning tabla playing; drumming; lit. water-pot groan
Construction kumbha + thuna

Variant kumbhathūṇa
Sanskrit kumbha + stanana

kva naccaṃ, kva gītaṃ, kva vāditaṃ, kva akkhānaṃ, kva pāṇissaraṃ, kva kumbhathunan'ti, ime kho, gahapatiputta, cha ādīnavā samajj'ābhicaraṇe

sabhayo c'eso maggo sappaṭibhayo ca sakaṇṭako ca sagahano ca ummaggo ca kummaggo ca duhitiko ca. asappurisasevito c'eso maggo, na c'eso maggo sappurisehi sevito.

kummaggapaṭipannānaṃ,
ārā saṃyojanakkhayo.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

kummaggapaṭipannaṃ maṃ,
ariyamaggaṃ samānayi,
dak'ābhisecanā bhoti,
imaṃ sāṭaṃ dadāmi te.

kurute

pr. (+acc) one oneself does; one oneself makes [√kar + o + te] ✓

Grammar pr, reflx 3rd sg of karoti, trans (+acc)
Meaning one oneself does; one oneself makes
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + o > karo > kuru (irreg)
Construction kuru + te
Phonetic Change o > u (Kacc 511, 521)
a > u (Kacc 512, 522)
Sanskrit kṛ
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

pupphāni h'eva pacinantaṃ,
byāsattamanasaṃ naraṃ,
atittaññ'eva kāmesu,
antako kurute vasaṃ.

DHP 48 pupphavaggo

yādisaṃ kurute mittaṃ,
yādisaṃ c'ūpasevati,
sa ve t'ādisako hoti,
sahavāso hi t'ādiso.

ITI 76 sukhapatthanāsuttaṃ
kurupañcālā

masc. people of Kuru and Pañcala ✗
kurumāna

prp. (+acc) doing; making [√kar + o + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of karoti, trans (+acc)
Meaning doing; making
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + o > karo > kuru (irreg)
Construction kuru + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change o > u (Kacc 511, 521)
a > u (Kacc 512, 522)
Sanskrit kurvāṇa
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

so tadassādeti, taṃ nikāmeti, tena ca vittiṃ āpajjati. tattha ṭhito tadadhimutto tabbahulavihārī aparihīno kālaṃ kurumāno brahmakāyikānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.

AN 4.123 paṭhamanānākaraṇasuttaṃ

so muṭṭhassati kālaṃ kurumāno aññataraṃ devanikāyaṃ upapajjati. tassa tattha sukhino dhammapadā plavanti. dandho, bhikkhave, sat'uppādo, atha so satto khippaṃ'y'eva visesagāmī hoti.

thokaṃ thokaṃ kule kule,

masc. son of a good family; respectable young man; young gentleman [kula + putta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning son of a good family; respectable young man; young gentleman
Construction kula + putta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kulassa + putta)
Synonym gahapatiputta
Commentary (MNa) kulaputtā'ti duvidhā kulaputtā jātikulaputtā ācārakulaputtā.
Sanskrit kulaputra

tassa ce, bhikkhave, kulaputtassa evaṃ uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato te bhogā n'ābhinipphajjanti. so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, moghaṃ vata me uṭṭhānaṃ, aphalo vata me vāyāmo'ti

MN 13 mahā dukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ

yass'atthāya kulaputtā samma'd'eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraṃ brahmacariyapariyosānaṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.

puna caparaṃ bhikkhave bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ kākehi vā khajjamānaṃ kulalehi vā khajjamānaṃ gijjhehi vā khajjamānaṃ kaṅkehi vā khajjamānaṃ

Sanskrit kuśalapakṣa

iti kho, bhikkhave, vīsati kusalapakkhā, vīsati akusalapakkhā, mahācattārīsako dhammapariyāyo pavattito appaṭivattiyo samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā kenaci vā lokasmiṃ.

kusalamūlasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 17.32 (SN17.32) ✗
kusalarāsi

masc. heap of wholesome; pile of beneficial [kusala + rāsi] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning heap of wholesome; pile of beneficial
Construction kusala + rāsi
kusalarāsisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 47.45 (SN47.45) ✗
kusalavitakka

masc. healthy thinking; wholesome thought; skilful thinking [kusala + vitakka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning healthy thinking; wholesome thought; skilful thinking
Construction kusala + vitakka
Compound kammadhāraya (kusala + vitakka)
Antonym akusalavitakka
Sanskrit kuśala + vitarka

tayo'me, bhikkhave, kusalavitakkā anandhakaraṇā cakkhukaraṇā ñāṇakaraṇā paññāvuddhikā avighātapakkhikā nibbānasaṃvattanikā. katame tayo?

ITI 87 andhakaraṇasuttaṃ
kusalasaṅkappa

masc. skilful intention; wholesome purpose [kusala + saṅkappa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning skilful intention; wholesome purpose
Construction kusala + saṅkappa
kusalasaṅkhāta

adj. what is considered good; what is considered beneficial [kusala + saṅkhāta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning what is considered good; what is considered beneficial
Construction kusala + saṅkhāta
Compound kammadhāraya (kusala + saṅkhāta)
Antonym akusalasaṅkhāta
Sanskrit kuśala + saṃkhyāta

siyā kho pana te, nigrodha, evam'assa, ye no dhammā kusalā kusalasaṅkhātā sācariyakānaṃ, tehi vivecetu'kāmo samaṇo gotamo evam'āhā'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ, nigrodha, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. kusalā c'eva vo te dhammā hontu kusalasaṅkhātā ca sācariyakānaṃ.

DN 25 udumbarikasuttaṃ
kusalasañcetanika

adj. accompanied by wholesome intention; with skillful volition [kusala + sañcetanika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning accompanied by wholesome intention; with skillful volition
Construction kusala + sañcetanika
Compound kammadhāraya (kusala + sañcetanika)
Sanskrit kuśala + saṃcetanika (bsk)

tatra, bhikkhave, tividhā kāyakammantasampatti kusalasañcetanikā sukh'udrayā sukhavipākā hoti, catubbidhā vacīkammantasampatti kusalasañcetanikā sukh'udrayā sukhavipākā hoti, tividhā manokammantasampatti kusalasañcetanikā sukh'udrayā sukhavipākā hoti.

kusalasaññā

Meaning skilful perception
Construction kusala + saññā
kusalasīla 1

nt. skill in ethical conduct ✗
kusalasīla 2

adj. skilled in ethical conduct; adept in virtue [kusala + sīla] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning skilled in ethical conduct; adept in virtue
Construction kusala + sīla
Commentary (ANa) kusalasīlo'ti anavajjehi sīlehi samannāgato.
Sanskrit kuśala + śīla

yam'pi, bhante, bhagavā sīlavā vuddhasīlo ariyasīlo kusalasīlo kusalasīlena samannāgato, idam'pi kho ahaṃ, bhante, atthavasaṃ sampassamāno bhagavati evarūpaṃ paramanipaccakāraṃ karomi, mett'ūpahāraṃ upadaṃsemi.

kusalasīlī

kusalasutta

fem. doing good deeds; undertaking skilful actions; making merit; lit. undertaking skilful [kusalassa + upasampadā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp

sabbapāpassa akaraṇaṃ,
kusalass'ūpasampadā,
sacittapariyodapanaṃ,
etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.

DHP 183 buddhavaggo
kusalā

masc. masters; "masters"; experts; "experts" [kusala + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl, sometimes derog, from kusala
Meaning masters; "masters"; experts; "experts"
Construction kusala + ā
Antonym akusalā
Sanskrit kuśalāḥ

sakaṃ sakaṃ diṭṭhiparibbasānā,
viggayha nānā kusalā vadanti,
yo evaṃ jānāti sa vedi dhammaṃ,
idaṃ paṭikkosamakevalī so.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12

taṃ v'āpi ganthaṃ kusalā vadanti,
yaṃ nissito passati hīnam'aññaṃ,
tasmā hi diṭṭhaṃ va sutaṃ mutaṃ vā,
sīlabbataṃ bhikkhu na nissayeyya.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5
kusalākusala 1

adj. skilful and unskilful; wholesome and unwholesome; good and bad [kusala + akusala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning skilful and unskilful; wholesome and unwholesome; good and bad
Construction kusala + akusala
Compound dvanda (kusala ca akusala ca)
Commentary (SNa) kusal'ākusalā dhammā'tiādīsu kusalā'ti kosallasambhūtā anavajjasukhavipākā. akusalā'ti akosallasambhūtā sāvajjadukkhavipākā.
Sanskrit kuśala + akuśala

ko ca, bhikkhave, āhāro anuppannassa vā dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā? atthi, bhikkhave, kusal'ākusalā dhammā, sāvajj'ānavajjā dhammā, hīnapaṇītā dhammā, kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgā dhammā.

SN 46.2 kāyasuttaṃ
kusalākusala 2

nt. what is skilful and what is unskilful; what is wholesome and what is unwholesome; what is good and what is bad [kusala + akusala] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning what is skilful and what is unskilful; what is wholesome and what is unwholesome; what is good and what is bad
Construction kusala + akusala
Compound dvanda (kusala ca akusala ca)
Sanskrit kuśala + akuśala
kusalānuesī

adj. seeking the good; looking to become a master [kusala + anuesī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning seeking the good; looking to become a master
Construction kusala + anuesī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kusalaṃ + anuesī)
Variant kusalānvesī
Commentary (DNa) kiṃ kusal'ānuesī'ti kiṃ kusalan'ti anuesanto pariyesanto. tattha, kiṃ kusalan'ti sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ adhippetaṃ, taṃ gavesanto'ti attho.
Sanskrit kuśala + anveṣin

paradhammikānam'pi na santaseyya,
disvā'pi tesaṃ bahubheravāni,
ath'āparāni abhisambhaveyya,
parissayāni kusal'ānuesī.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
kusalābhisanda

masc. outflow of good; wholesome result; stream of merit [kusala + abhisanda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning outflow of good; wholesome result; stream of merit
Construction kusala + abhisanda
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kusalānaṃ + abhisanda)
Commentary (SNa) puññābhisandā kusal'ābhisandā'ti puññanadiyo kusalanadiyo. (ANt) kusal'ābhisandā'ti kusalānaṃ pavāhā.
Sanskrit kuśala + abhiṣyanda

ayaṃ paṭhamo puññ'ābhisando kusal'ābhisando sukhass'āhāro.

SN 55.31 paṭhamapuññābhisandasuttaṃ
kusalī 1

masc. virtuous person; good man; lit. good [kusala + ī] ✓

Grammar masc, from kusala
Meaning virtuous person; good man; lit. good
Construction kusala + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Sanskrit kuśalin

ekam'pi ce pāṇam'aduṭṭhacitto,
mettāyati kusalī tena hoti,
sabbe ca pāṇe manasānukampī,
pahūtamariyo pakaroti puññaṃ.

AN 8.1 mettāsuttaṃ
kusalī 2

masc. auspicious words; favourable words; lit. good [kusala + ī] ✓

Grammar masc, from kusala
Meaning auspicious words; favourable words; lit. good
Construction kusala + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Commentary (SNa) kusalan'ti idaṃ vacanaṃ imassa atthī'ti kusalī, tesaṃ therānaṃ tvaṃ kusalaṃ anavajjaṃ bhāsasi, thomesi pasaṃsasi, paṇḍito'si devaputtā'ti vadati.
Sanskrit kuśalin

kusalī bhāsasī tesaṃ,
mārapāsappahāyinaṃ,
kassa te dhammam'aññāya,
acchiduṃ bhavabandhanan'ti.

SN 1.50 ghaṭīkārasuttaṃ
kusalī 3

adj. benevolent; wishing well; expressing approval ✗
kusalūpasaṃhita

adj. connected with the wholesome; to do with the skilful [kusala + upasaṃhita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning connected with the wholesome; to do with the skilful
Construction kusala + upasaṃhita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (kusalena + upasaṃhita)
Commentary (ANa) dān'ādiupakaraṇānaṃ asampattiyā uppajjamānaṃ pana kusal'ūpasaṃhitaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassan'ti
Sanskrit kuśala + upasaṃhita

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno yaṃ nimittaṃ āgamma yaṃ nimittaṃ manasikaroto uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā vitakkā chand'ūpasaṃhitā'pi dos'ūpasaṃhitā'pi moh'ūpasaṃhitā'pi, tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tamhā nimittā aññaṃ nimittaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ kusal'ūpasaṃhitaṃ.

MN 20 vitakkasaṇṭhānasuttaṃ

yam'pi'ssa kusal'ūpasaṃhitaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ, tam'pi'ssa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti. yasmiṃ, bhante, samaye ariyasāvako pavivekaṃ pītiṃ upasampajja viharati, imāni'ssa pañca ṭhānāni tasmiṃ samaye na hontī'ti.

AN 5.176 pītisuttaṃ
kusāpāta

masc. casting or dropping of markers (on shares of material to be distributed) ✗
kusāvatī

fem. name of the royal capital of king Mahāsudassana; lit. having lots of kusa grass [kusa + vant + ī] ✓

Grammar fem, from kusavant
Meaning name of the royal capital of king Mahāsudassana; lit. having lots of kusa grass
Construction kusa + vant + ī
kusāvant + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Sanskrit kuśavatī

bhūtapubb'āhaṃ, bhikkhu, rājā ahosiṃ khattiyo muddh'āvasitto. tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītinagarasahassāni ahesuṃ kusāvatī rājadhānippamukhāni.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ

tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā nagarasahassānaṃ ekaññ'eva taṃ nagaraṃ hoti yam'ahaṃ tena samayena ajjhāvasāmi, kusāvatī rājadhānī.

DN 16.14 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ
kusīta

adj. lazy; slack; inactive; apathetic [√sad + a + a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning lazy; slack; inactive; apathetic
Root Family √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + a > sada > sīda (irreg)
Construction ku + sīda > sīta + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change a > ī
d > t
Compound kammadhāraya (ku + sīda)
Antonym āraddhavīriya, akusīta
Synonym hīnaviriya
Commentary (MNa) kusītā'ti kosajj'ānugatā.
Sanskrit kusīda, kuṣīda
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

subh'ānupassiṃ viharantaṃ,
indriyesu asaṃvutaṃ,
bhojanamhi c'āmattaññuṃ,
kusītaṃ hīnavīriyaṃ,
taṃ ve pasahati māro,
vāto rukkhaṃ'va dubbalaṃ.

DHP 7 yamakavaggo

āraddhavīriyassāyaṃ dhammo n'āyaṃ dhammo kusītassa

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ
kusītamāgamma

ind. due to a lazy person; owing to a lethargic person [kusītaṃ + āgamma] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to a lazy person; owing to a lethargic person
Construction kusītaṃ + āgamma
Commentary (ITIa) evaṃ kusītaṃ āgamma, sādhujīvī'pi sīdatī'ti evam'eva kusītaṃ vīriy'ārambharahitaṃ kilesavasikaṃ puggalaṃ nissāya tena katasaṃsaggo sādhujīvī'pi parisuddh'ājīvo parisuddhasīlo'pi samāno hīnasaṃsaggato uppannehi kāmavitakk'ādīhi khajjamāno pāraṃ gantuṃ asamattho saṃsār'aṇṇave'y'eva sīdati.
kusītamūlakasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 14.22 (SN14.22) ✗
kusītavatthu

nt. grounds for laziness; basis for sloth [kusīta + vatthu] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning grounds for laziness; basis for sloth
Construction kusīta + vatthu

Commentary (ANa) kusītavatthūnī'ti kusītassa alasassa vatthūni patiṭṭhā, kosajjakāraṇānī'ti attho.
Sanskrit kusīda + vastu

aṭṭh'imāni, bhikkhave, kusītavatthūni. katamāni aṭṭha?

AN 8.80 kusītārambhavatthusuttaṃ
kusītasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 37.12 (SN37.12) ✗
kusītahīnavīriyasandosahetu

ind. due to the defilement of laziness and low effort [kusīta + hīnavīriya + sandosahetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to the defilement of laziness and low effort
Construction kusīta + hīnavīriya + sandosahetu
Sanskrit kusīda + hīnavīrya + saṃdosa + hetu

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kusītā hīnavīriyā araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, kusītahīnavīriyasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

pabbatakandarapadarasākhāparipūrā kusubbhe paripūrenti, kusubbhā paripūrā mahāsobbhe paripūrenti, mahāsobbhā paripūrā, kunnadiyo paripūrenti, kunnadiyo paripūrā mahānadiyo paripūrenti, mahānadiyo paripūrā mahāsamuddaṃ paripūrenti

SN 12.23 upanisasuttaṃ
kusuma

nt. flower; blossom ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning flower; blossom
Commentary (THIa) kusumarajena samuṭṭhitā dumā'ti ime rukkhā mandavātena samuṭṭhahamānakusumareṇujātena attano kusumarajena sayaṃ samuṭṭhitā viya hutvā samantato surabhī vāyanti.
Sanskrit kusuma

madhurañ'ca pavanti sabbaso,
kusumarajena samuṭṭhitā dumā,
paṭhamavasanto sukho utu,
ehi ramāma supupphite vane.

taṃ nadīhi vijānātha,
sobbhesu padaresu ca,
saṇantā yanti kusobbhā,
tuṇhīyanti mah'odadhī.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
kussubbha

masc. small pool; stream in a small channel or running through a small pool ✗
kussobbha

masc. small pool; stream in a small channel or running through a small pool ✗
kuha 1

adj. deceitful; deceptive; fraudulent; fake [√kuh + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from kuheti
Meaning deceitful; deceptive; fraudulent; fake
Root Family √kuh
Root √kuh･8 *e (deceive)
Construction √kuh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym akuha
Commentary (ANa) kuhā'ti kuhakā.
Sanskrit kuha
Sanskrit Root √kuh 10 (cheat)

ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū kuhā thaddhā lapā siṅgī unnaḷā asamāhitā, na me te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū māmakā.

AN 4.26 kuhasuttaṃ
kuha 2

masc. cheat; fraud; imposter [√kuh] ✗
kuhaka 1

adj. deceitful; deceptive; fraudulent; fake [√kuh + aka] ✓

Grammar adj, from kuheti
Meaning deceitful; deceptive; fraudulent; fake

Root √kuh･8 *e (deceive)
Construction √kuh + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Antonym akuhaka
Commentary (DNa) tividhena kuhanavatthunā lokaṃ kuhayanti, vimhāpayantī'ti kuhakā.
Sanskrit kuhaka
Sanskrit Root √kuh 10 (cheat)

att'ukkaṃsakaparavambhakā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, sandiṭṭhiparāmāsā ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggino, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, kuhakā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, pāpicchā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, pāpamittā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi asaddhammehi samannāgatā nigaṇṭhā'ti.

AN 4.25 brahmacariyasuttaṃ
kuhanalapanā

fem. deceit and flattery ✗
kuhanā

fem. cheating; deceiving; misleading; creating a false impression [√kuh + anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from kuheti
Meaning cheating; deceiving; misleading; creating a false impression
Root Family √kuh
Root √kuh･8 *e (deceive)
Construction √kuh + anā
Derivative kita (anā)
Commentary (MNa) tividhena kuhanavatthunā lokaṃ etāya kuhayanti vimhāpayantī'ti kuhanā
Sanskrit kuhanā
Sanskrit Root √kuh 10 (cheat)

katamo ca, bhikkhave, micchāājīvo? kuhanā, lapanā, nemittikatā, nippesikatā, lābhena lābhaṃ nijigisanatā, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, micchāājīvo.

MN 117 mahācattārīsakasuttaṃ
kuhanāparivārita

adj. surrounded by deception; encircled by fraud [kuhanā + parivārita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning surrounded by deception; encircled by fraud
Construction kuhanā + parivārita
kuhasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.26 (AN4.26) ✗
kuhasutta 2

nt. Itivuttaka 108 (ITI 108) ✗
kuhiñci

ind. somewhere; anywhere; wherever [ka + hiṃ + ci] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from kuhiṃ
Meaning somewhere; anywhere; wherever
Construction ka > ku + hiṃ + ci
kuhiṃ + ci
Derivative taddhita (ci)
Phonetic Change a > u
ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit kuhacid

yassa jālinī visattikā,
taṇhā n'atthi kuhiñci netave,
taṃ buddham'anantagocaraṃ,
apadaṃ kena padena nessatha.

DHP 180 buddhavaggo

saṅkhāya lokasmi paroparāni,
yass'iñjitaṃ n'atthi kuhiñci loke,
santo vidhūmo anīgho nirāso,
atāri so jātijaran'ti brūmī'ti.

SNP 58 puṇṇaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 3
kuhiṃ

ind. where? [ka + hiṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, interr, from ka
Meaning where?
Construction ka > ku + hiṃ
Derivative taddhita (hiṃ)
Phonetic Change a > u
Sanskrit kuha

uddhaṃ adho ca tiriyaṃ,
disā anudisā sv'ahaṃ,
anvesaṃ n'ādhigacchāmi,
godhiko so kuhiṃ gato'ti.

SN 4.23 godhikasuttaṃ

patthayamānassa hi jappitāni,
pavedhitaṃ v'āpi pakappitesu,
cut'ūpapāto idha yassa n'atthi,
sa kena vedheyya kuhiṃ'va jappe.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13

Construction kuhiṃ + gāmī

Sanskrit kuha + gāmin

api nu tumhe, bhikkhave, evaṃ jānantā evaṃ passantā etarahi vā paccuppannam'addhānaṃ ajjhattaṃ kathaṃkathī assatha, ahaṃ nu kho'smi, no nu kho'smi, kiṃ nu kho'smi, kathaṃ nu kho'smi, ayaṃ nu kho satto kuto āgato, so kuhiṃgāmī bhavissatī'ti?

Sanskrit Root √kuṭ 6 (be crooked)

yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ āvikattā hoti satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ

ahañ'hi, bhante, pahomi hatthidammaṃ sāretuṃ, yāvatakena antarena campaṃ gat'āgataṃ karissati sabbāni tāni sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni vaṅkeyyāni jimheyyāni pātukarissati.
