ahañ'c'eva kho pana sabbaso ajaddhukaṃ paṭijāneyyaṃ, imā ca me devatā dibbaṃ ojaṃ lomakūpehi ajjhohāreyyuṃ, tāya c'āhaṃ yāpeyyaṃ, taṃ mam'assa musā'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gūthakūpo kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭito bhiyyosomattāya duggandho hoti.

samaṇā samaṇā'ti vo, bhikkhave, jano sañjānāti. tumhe ca pana, ke tumhe'ti puṭṭhā samānā, samaṇ'āmhā'ti paṭijānātha.

sadā puññaṃ pavaḍḍhati,

ke janā saggagāmino'ti.

AN 10.15 appamādasuttaṃ

ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā evaṃ rūpaṃ abhiññāya ... rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannā, te suppaṭipannā.

Construction keci + ime
Sanskrit ke + cid + ime

seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, ye kec'ime bījagāmabhūtagāmā vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjanti, sabbe te pathaviṃ nissāya pathaviyaṃ patiṭṭhāya. evam'ete bījagāmabhūtagāmā vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjanti.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
keṭubhi

adj. cheating, fraudulent, deceiving ✗
keṭubhī

adj. cheating, fraudulent, deceiving ✗
keṇiya

masc. name of a dreadlocked ascetic ✗
ketabī

adj. treacherous; deceitful; fraudulent; dishonest; corrupt ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning treacherous; deceitful; fraudulent; dishonest; corrupt
Antonym aketabī
Variant keṭubhī
Commentary (MNa) ketabino'ti sikkhitakerāṭikā, nipphannathāmagatasāṭheyyā'ti vuttaṃ hoti. sāṭheyyañ'hi abhūtaguṇadassanato abhūtabhaṇḍaguṇadassanasamaṃ katvā, kerāṭiyan'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit kaitavī

ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā assaddhā jīvik'atthā na saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitā saṭhā māyāvino ketabino uddhatā unnaḷā ... na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

tatra, bhikkhave, nevāpikassa ca nevāpikaparisāya ca etadahosi, saṭhāssunām'ime tatiyā migajātā ketabino, iddhimantāssunām'ime tatiyā migajātā parajanā, imañ'ca nāma nivāpaṃ nivuttaṃ paribhuñjanti, na ca nesaṃ jānāma āgatiṃ vā gatiṃ vā.

ketuṃ

inf. (+acc) to buy; to purchase [√kī + tuṃ] ~

Grammar inf of kiṇāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning to buy; to purchase
Root Family √kī
Root √kī･5 nā (buy)
√ In Comps kkī
Construction √kī > ke + tuṃ
Phonetic Change ī > e
Antonym vikketuṃ
Commentary (ANa) kusalo hoti paṇiyaṃ ketuñ'ca vikketuñ'cā'ti sulabhaṭṭhānaṃ gantvā kiṇanto dullabhaṭṭhānaṃ gantvā vikkiṇanto ca ettha kusalo nāma hoti, dasaguṇam'pi vīsatiguṇam'pi lābhaṃ labhati.
Sanskrit krayitum
Sanskrit Root √krī 9 (buy)
kedha

sandhi. which here?; who of them here? [ke + idha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + adv, interr
Meaning which here?; who of them here?
Construction ke + idha
Sanskrit ke + iha

tesu ussukkajātesu,
bhavasot'ānusārisu,
ke'dha taṇhaṃ pajahiṃsu,
ke lokasmiṃ anussukā'ti.

SN 1.28 mahaddhanasuttaṃ

kesū'dha araṇā loke,
kesaṃ vusitaṃ na nassati,
ke'dha icchaṃ parijānanti,
kesaṃ bhojissiyaṃ sadā.

SN 1.81 araṇasuttaṃ
kena 1

pron. by what?; by who?; with what?; how? [ka + ena] ✓

Grammar pron, interr, instr sg of ka
Meaning by what?; by who?; with what?; how?
Construction ka + ena
Antonym tena
Sanskrit kena

ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,
bhagavā hi me sakkhi brahmajjadiṭṭho,
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.

SNP 31 māghasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 5

savanti sabbadhi sotā,
sotānaṃ kiṃ nivāraṇaṃ,
sotānaṃ saṃvaraṃ brūhi,
kena sotā pidhiyyare.

SNP 56 ajita māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 1
kena 2

pron. why?; lit. because of what? [ka + ena] ✓

Grammar pron, interr, instr sg of ka
Meaning why?; lit. because of what?
Construction ka + ena
Antonym tena
Sanskrit kena

araññe viharantānaṃ,
santānaṃ brahmacārinaṃ,
ekabhattaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ,
kena vaṇṇo pasīdatī'ti.

SN 1.10 araññasuttaṃ

kena'ssu nappakāsatī'ti kena loko nappakāsati na bhāsati na tapati na virocati na ñāyati na paññāyatīti, kenassu nappakāsati.

NIDD2 2.1 ajita māṇava pucchā niddesa
kenaci

pron. by anyone; with anyone; by something; with something; with anything; by anything [ka + ena + ci] ✓

Grammar pron, masc instr sg of kaci
Meaning by anyone; with anyone; by something; with something; with anything; by anything
Construction ka + ena + ci
kena + ci
Derivative taddhita (ci)
Sanskrit kena + cid

phassena phuṭṭho na sukhena majje,
dukkhena phuṭṭho'pi na sampavedhe,
phassadvayaṃ sukhadukkhe upekkhe,
anānuruddho aviruddha kenaci.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ

evaṃ vimuttacitto kho, aggivessana, bhikkhu na kenaci saṃvadati, na kenaci vivadati, yañ'ca loke vuttaṃ tena voharati, aparāmasan'ti.

kiss'ābhilepanaṃ brūsi,
kiṃ'su tassa mahabbhayaṃ.

SNP 56 ajita māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 1

kena'ssu nīyati loko,
kena'ssu parikassati,
kissa'ssu ekadhammassa,
sabb'eva vasam'anvagū'ti.

SN 1.62 cittasuttaṃ
kenassubbhāhato

sandhi. wounded by what?; afflicted with what? [kena + ssu + abbhāhato] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + pp, interr
Meaning wounded by what?; afflicted with what?
Construction kena + ssu + abbhāhato
Commentary (SNa) kenassu'bbhāhato'ti kena abbhāhato. sukāro nipātamattaṃ. (SNt) kenass'abbhāhato'ti pana pāṭhe ukāralopena padasandhi.
Sanskrit kena + svid + abhyāhata

kenassu'bbhāhato loko,
kenassu parivārito,
kena sallena otiṇṇo,
kissa dhūpāyito sadā'ti.

SN 1.66 attahatasuttaṃ
kenīdha

sandhi. about what here; by what reason in this case; lit. by what here [kena + idha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + adv
Meaning about what here; by what reason in this case; lit. by what here
Construction kena + idha
Variant tenidha
Sanskrit kena + iha

sa sabbadhammesu visenibhūto,
yaṃ kiñci diṭṭhaṃ va sutaṃ mutaṃ vā,
tam'eva dassiṃ vivaṭaṃ carantaṃ,
ken'īdha lokasmi vikappayeyya.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4

accayo ce na vijjetha,
no'c'idh'āpagataṃ siyā,
verāni na ca sammeyyuṃ,
ken'īdha kusalo siyā'ti.

SN 1.35 ujjhānasaññisuttaṃ
kenesa

sandhi. why (does) this?; lit. by what this [kena + esa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron, interr
Meaning why (does) this?; lit. by what this
Construction kena + esa
Commentary (SNa) kenā'ti kena kāraṇena.
Sanskrit kena + etaḥ

ken'esa yañño vipulo mahaggato,
samena dinnassa na aggham'eti,
kathaṃ sataṃ sahassānaṃ sahassayāginaṃ,
kalam'pi n'āgghanti tathāvidhassa te'ti.

SN 1.32 maccharisuttaṃ
kelāyati

pr. (+acc) cherishes; treasures; takes care of [√kel + āya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, deno of kīḷā, trans (+acc)
Meaning cherishes; treasures; takes care of
Root Family √kel
Root √kel×1 āya (care, cherish)
Base √kel + ā + āya > kelāya (deno)
Construction kelāya + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (MNa) kelāyethā'ti taṇhādiṭṭhīhi kīḷamānā vihareyyātha.
Notes Saddanīti takes this as an independent root kele mamāyane
Sanskrit kelāyati (bsk)
Sanskrit Root kelāya - (sport, play)

imaṃ ce tumhe, bhikkhave, diṭṭhiṃ evaṃ parisuddhaṃ evaṃ pariyodātaṃ allīyetha kelāyetha dhanāyetha mamāyetha, api nu me tumhe, bhikkhave, kull'ūpamaṃ dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājāneyyātha nittharaṇ'atthāya no gahaṇ'atthāyā'ti?

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
kevaṭṭa 1

masc. fisherman ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning fisherman
Commentary (ANa) kevaṭṭā maññe macchavilope'ti kevaṭṭā viya macchavilope. tesañ'hi macchapacchiṃ gahetvā āgatānaṃ vikkiṇanaṭṭhāne, mayhaṃ detha mayhaṃ dethā'ti vadato mahājanassa evarūpo saddo hoti.
Sanskrit kevarta, kaivarta

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā nāgito bhagavato upaṭṭhāko hoti. atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ nāgitaṃ āmantesi, ke pana kho, nāgita, uccāsaddamahāsaddā, kevaṭṭā maññe macchavilope'ti?

yāvat'atthī'ti vuccati.

evam'etassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa samudayo hoti

kevalassa-appayogattā,
akāro sannidhīyate.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa

adj. almost the entire; lit. resembling the whole [kevala + kappa] ✓

Sanskrit kevala + kalpa

KHP 5 maṅgalasuttaṃ

mañ'hi, bhante, aññatitthiyā sāvakaṃ labhitvā kevalakappaṃ nāḷandaṃ paṭākaṃ parihareyyuṃ, upāli amhākaṃ gahapati sāvakattaṃ upagato'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
kevalakappaṃ

ind. entirely, wholly; decidedly ✗

VIN 1.0 verañjakaṇḍaṃ

ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ abhivadanti

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4

ye ca kho keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā ... rūpassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimuttā, te suvimuttā. ye suvimuttā, te kevalino. ye kevalino vaṭṭaṃ tesaṃ n'atthi paññāpanāya.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
kesa

masc. (head) hair ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning (head) hair
Sanskrit keśa

atha kho bho mahāgovindo brāhmaṇo tassa satt'āhassa accayena kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbaji

DN 19.15 mahāgovindasuttaṃ

atthi imasmiṃ kāye kesā lomā nakhā dantā taco maṃsaṃ nhāru aṭṭhi aṭṭhimiñjaṃ vakkaṃ hadayaṃ yakanaṃ kilomakaṃ pihakaṃ papphāsaṃ antaṃ antaguṇaṃ udariyaṃ karīsaṃ (matthaluṅgaṃ)

Construction kesa + kambala

Commentary (SNa) kesakambalassa dhāraṇato ajito kesakambalo'ti vutto.
Sanskrit keśakambala

ye'pi te, bho gotama, samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa, seyyath'idaṃ, pūraṇo kassapo, makkhali gosālo, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto, sañcayo belaṭṭhaputto, pakudho kaccāyano, ajito kesakambalo

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ

ayam'pi kho ajito kesakambalo saṅghī c'eva gaṇī ca gaṇ'ācariyo ca ñāto yasassī titthakaro sādhusammato bahujanassa.

SN 44.9 kutūhalasālāsuttaṃ

nt. hair blanket [kesa + kambala] ✓

Construction kesa + kambala

Commentary (MNa) kesakambalan'ti manussakesehi katakambalaṃ. yaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, yāni kānici, bhikkhave, tantāvutānaṃ vatthānaṃ, kesakambalo tesaṃ paṭikuṭṭho akkhāyati. kesakambalo, bhikkhave, sīte sīto, uṇhe uṇho, dubbaṇṇo duggandho dukkhasamphaso'ti
Sanskrit keśakambala

so sāṇāni'pi dhāreti masāṇāni'pi dhāreti chavadussāni'pi dhāreti paṃsukūlāni'pi dhāreti tirīṭāni'pi dhāreti ajinam'pi dhāreti ajinakkhipam'pi dhāreti kusacīram'pi dhāreti vākacīram'pi dhāreti phalakacīram'pi dhāreti kesakambalam'pi dhāreti vāḷakambalam'pi dhāreti ulūkapakkham'pi dhāreti

Sanskrit kānām + cid

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

sārambhaṃ nāma ... dīpīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti, acchānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, taracchānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, yesaṃ kesañci tiracchānagatānaṃ pāṇānaṃ āsayo hoti, pubb'aṇṇanissitaṃ vā hoti, apar'aṇṇanissitaṃ vā hoti

veṭhitasīso nāma kes'antaṃ na dassāpetvā veṭhito hoti.

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo

anāpatti asañcicca, assatiyā, ajānantassa, gilānassa, kes'antaṃ vivarāpetvā deseti, āpadāsu, ummattakassa, ādikammikassā'ti.

masc. top of the hair [kesa + matthaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning top of the hair
Construction kesa + matthaka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kesānaṃ + matthaka)
Commentary (VISM) adho kesamatthakā'ti kes'aggato heṭṭhā.
Sanskrit keśa + mastaka

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ uddhaṃ pādatalā adho kesamatthakā tacapariyantaṃ pūraṃ nānappakārassa asucino paccavekkhati

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ
kesamassu

nt. hair and beard [kesa + massu] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning hair and beard
Construction kesa + massu
Compound dvanda (kesa ca massu ca)
Sanskrit keśaśmaśru

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajeyyan'ti.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ

atha kho bho mahāgovindo brāhmaṇo tassa satt'āhassa accayena kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbaji

DN 19.15 mahāgovindasuttaṃ
kesamassulocaka

masc. who plucks out hair and beard [kesamassu + locaka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning who plucks out hair and beard
Construction kesamassu + locaka
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (kesamassuṃ + locaka)
Sanskrit keśaśmaśru + luñcana

kesamassulocako'pi hoti kesamassulocan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ubbhaṭṭhako'pi hoti āsanappaṭikkhitto, ukkuṭiko'pi hoti ukkuṭikappadhānam'anuyutto, kaṇṭak'āpassayiko'pi hoti kaṇṭak'āpassaye seyyaṃ kappeti, sāyatatiyakam'pi udak'orohan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati.

kesamassulocana

adj. pulling out the hairs of the head and of the beard ✗

kesamassulocako'pi hoti kesamassulocan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ubbhaṭṭhako'pi hoti āsanappaṭikkhitto, ukkuṭiko'pi hoti ukkuṭikappadhānam'anuyutto, kaṇṭak'āpassayiko'pi hoti kaṇṭak'āpassaye seyyaṃ kappeti, sāyatatiyakam'pi udak'orohan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
kesamutta

nt. name of a town of the Kālāmas in Kosala ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning name of a town of the Kālāmas in Kosala
Variant kesaputta
Commentary (ANa) kālāmānaṃ nigamo'ti kālāmā nāma khattiyā, tesaṃ nigamo.

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṃ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ yena kesamuttaṃ nāma kālāmānaṃ nigamo tadavasari.

ke janā saggagāmino'ti.

parapāṇāni hiṃsati,
asmā lokā paramhā ca,
ubhayā dhaṃsate naro.

tasmā't'iha, phagguna, tava ce'pi koci sammukhā avaṇṇaṃ bhāseyya, tatr'āpi tvaṃ, phagguna, ye gehasitā chandā ye gehasitā vitakkā te pajaheyyāsi.

Meaning even some; just some; some or other

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ

siyā kho pana bhoto rañño mahāyaññaṃ yajamānassa koci'd'eva vippaṭisāro, mahā vata me bhogakkhandho vigacchatī'ti, so bhotā raññā vippaṭisāro na karaṇīyo

nt. wickerwork stool; rattan seat; cane stool ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning wickerwork stool; rattan seat; cane stool

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghikaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā bhisiṃ vā kocchaṃ vā ajjhokāse santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyya, na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

Base √kuṭṭ + *e > koṭṭe
Construction koṭṭe + si
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit kuṭṭ
Sanskrit Root √kuṭṭ 10 (divide, crush)
koṭṭha 1

masc. store-room; granary [√kus + *ta] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning store-room; granary
Root Family √kus
Root √kus×1 *a (fill, enfold)
Construction √kus > kos + *ta
Derivative kita (*ta)
Phonetic Change u > o
st > ṭṭh
Sanskrit koṣṭha
Sanskrit Root √kuś 4 (enfold)

so aparena samayena chātakabhaye sampatte yathānikkhittaṃ dhaññaṃ paribhuñjanto koṭṭhesu ca cāṭiādīsu ca nikkhittadhaññe parikkhīṇe parijane pakkosāpetvā āha.

DHPa 2.18.10 meṇḍakaseṭṭhi vatthu

Phonetic Change u > o
st > ṭṭh
Commentary (MNa) koṭṭh'āsayā vātā'ti antānaṃ antovātā.
Sanskrit koṣṭha
Sanskrit Root √kuś 4 (enfold)

yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ vāyo vāyogataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, uddhaṅ'gamā vātā, adhogamā vātā, kucchisayā vātā, koṭṭh'āsayā vātā, aṅgam'aṅg'ānusārino vātā, assāso passāso … ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā vāyodhātu.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena māro pāpimā āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa kucchigato hoti koṭṭham'anupaviṭṭho. atha kho āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa etadahosi, kiṃ nu kho me kucchi garugaro viya mās'ācitaṃ maññe'ti.

VIN 1.3.1 paṭhamāniyatasikkhāpadaṃ
kotthu

masc. jackal ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning jackal
Commentary (DNa) kotthū'ti siṅgālo. (MNa) kotthū'ti siṅgālo, soṇo'ti'pi vadanti.
Sanskrit kroṣṭu

sīho'ti attānaṃ samekkhiyāna,
amaññi kotthu migarāj'āham'asmi,
tath'evaso siṅgālakaṃ anadi,
ke ca chave siṅgāle ke pana sīhanāde'ti.

DN 24.5 pāthikasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi nāma kotthu nadītīre macche maggayamāno jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati apajjhāyati.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
kotthuka

masc. little jackal [kotthu + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, dimin of kotthu
Meaning little jackal
Construction kotthu + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (SNa) chavo sigālo'ti lāmako kālasigālo. kotthuko'ti tass'eva vevacanaṃ. (SNt) kotthuko'ti khuddakakotthu.
Sanskrit kroṣṭuka

sah'ācaritena chavo sigālo,
na kotthuko sīhasamo kadāci,
naggo musāvādī gaṇassa satthā,
saṅkassar'ācāro na sataṃ sarikkho'ti.

āvudhaṃ nāma cāpo kodaṇḍo.

VIN 2.7.6 surusuruvaggo

āvudhapāṇissā'ti ettha kiñ'c'āpi vuttaṃ, āvudhaṃ nāma cāpo kodaṇḍo'ti, atha kho sabbā'pi dhanuvikati saddhiṃ saravikatiyā āvudhan'ti veditabbaṃ.

VINa 2.7.6 surusuruvaggavaṇṇanā
kodha 1

masc. anger; wrath; rage; temper [√kudh + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from kujjhati
Meaning anger; wrath; rage; temper
Root Family √kudh
Root √kudh･3 ya (be angry)
√ In Comps kkudh
Construction √kudh > kodh + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym akodha
Synonym āghāta
Commentary (MNa) tattha kujjhanalakkhaṇo kodho, caṇḍikkalakkhaṇo vā, āghātakaraṇaraso, dussanapaccupaṭṭhāno. (ANa) paresu kujjhanalakkhaṇo kodho.
Sanskrit krodha
Sanskrit Root √krudh 4 (be angry)

kodhaṃ jhatvā sukhaṃ seti,
kodhaṃ jhatvā na socati,
kodhassa visamūlassa,
madhur'aggassa devate,
vadhaṃ ariyā pasaṃsanti,
tañ'hi jhatvā na socatī'ti.

SN 1.71 chetvāsuttaṃ

yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
kodha 2

sandhi. who here [ko + idha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + adv
Meaning who here
Construction ko + idha
Sanskrit kaḥ + iha

ko'dha santusito loke,
kassa no santi iñjitā,
ko ubh'antam'abhiññāya,
majjhe mantā na lippati,
kaṃ brūsi mahāpuriso'ti,
ko idha sibbinim'accagā.

SNP 57 tissametteyya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 2

pakkamissañ'ca nāḷāto,
ko'dha nāḷāya vacchati,
bandhantī itthirūpena,
samaṇe dhammajīvino.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appam'pi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.

uragavaggo 6

AN 10.84 byākaraṇasuttaṃ
kodhapareta

adj. afflicted with anger; overcome by rage; overwhelmed with wrath [kodha + pareta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning afflicted with anger; overcome by rage; overwhelmed with wrath
Construction kodha + pareta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (kodhena + pareta)
Commentary (ANa) kodhapareto'ti kodh'ānugato.
Sanskrit krodha + parīta

kodhano'yaṃ, bhikkhave, purisapuggalo kodh'ābhibhūto kodhapareto, kiñ'c'āpi so hoti sunhāto suvilitto kappitakesamassu odātavatthavasano, atha kho so dubbaṇṇo'va hoti kodh'ābhibhūto. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo dhammo sapattakanto sapattakaraṇo kodhanaṃ āgacchati itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
kodhapeyyāla

nt. Chapter 16 of Dukanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 2.181-190 ✗
kodhabala

adj. having anger as one's power; lit. anger strength [kodha + bala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having anger as one's power; lit. anger strength
Construction kodha + bala
Compound kammadhāraya (kodha eva bala)
Commentary (JAa) kodhabalā'ti paṇḍitā nāma khantibalā bhavanti, na kodhabalāti.
Sanskrit krodha + bala

ruṇṇabalā, bhikkhave, dārakā, kodhabalā mātugāmā, āvudhabalā corā, issariyabalā rājāno, ujjhattibalā bālā, nijjhattibalā paṇḍitā, paṭisaṅkhānabalā bahussutā, khantibalā samaṇabrāhmaṇā, imāni kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭha balānī'ti.

AN 8.27 paṭhamabalasuttaṃ
kodhabhakkha

adj. anger-eating; feeding on wrath [kodha + bhakkha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning anger-eating; feeding on wrath
Construction kodha + bhakkha
Commentary (SNa) kodhabhakkho'ti sakkena gahitanāmam'ev'etaṃ. so pana eko rūp'āvacarabrahmā, sakko kira khantibalena samannāgato'ti sutvā vīmaṃsan'atthaṃ āgato.
kodhamakkhagaru

adj. valuing anger and denigrating others; who gives weight to rage and depreciating others [kodha + makkha + garu] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning valuing anger and denigrating others; who gives weight to rage and depreciating others
Construction kodha + makkha + garu
Commentary (NPa) kodhamakkhagarū'ti kujjhanalakkhaṇaṃ kodhaṃ, paraguṇamakkhanalakkhaṇaṃ makkhañ'ca garuṃ katvā uddhaṃ katvā ukkhipitvā caranto.
kodhamāna

masc. anger and pride; temper and superiority [kodha + māna] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning anger and pride; temper and superiority
Construction kodha + māna
Commentary (ANa) kodhamāno'ti kodho ca māno ca.
kodhamānamakkhavinayatthaṃ

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for removing anger, conceit and denigration
Construction kodha + māna + makkha + vinaya + attha + aṃ
kodhamānamakkhavinayattha + aṃ
kodharūpa

nt. form of anger [kodha + rūpa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning form of anger
Construction kodha + rūpa
Compound kammadhāraya > bahubbīhi (kodha + rūpa)
Sanskrit krodha + rūpa

it'āyaṃ kodharūpena,
maccupāso guhāsayo,
taṃ damena samucchinde,
paññāvīriyena diṭṭhiyā.

Construction kodha + vinaya
kodhasammadasammatta

adj. exhilarated with the intoxication of anger ✗

adj. close to anger; bordering on rage [kodha + sāmanta] ✓

Compound kammadhāraya (kodha + sāmanta)

Sanskrit krodha + sāmanta

puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhasāmantā vācaṃ nicchāretā. yam'p'āvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhasāmantā vācaṃ nicchāretā, ayam'pi dhammo dovacassakaraṇo.

MN 15 anumānasuttaṃ
kodhūpāyāsa

masc. anger and irritation; wrath and mental agitation [kodha + ūpāyāsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning anger and irritation; wrath and mental agitation
Construction kodha + ūpāyāsa
Compound dvanda (kodha ca ūpāyāsa ca)
Antonym akodhūpāyāsa
Sanskrit krodha + upāyāsa (bsk)

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ūmibhayassa bhīto sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvatto. ūmibhayan'ti kho, bhikkhave, kodh'ūpāyāsassa-etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ūmibhayaṃ.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

uddhumāyikā'ti kho, bhikkhu, kodh'ūpāyāsass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. ukkhipa uddhumāyikaṃ, pajaha kodh'ūpāyāsaṃ, abhikkhaṇa, sumedha, satthaṃ ādāyā'ti ayam'etassa attho.

MN 23 vammikasuttaṃ
kodhūpāyāsapaccayā

ind. dependent on anger and irritation; due to wrath and mental agitation [kodhūpāyāsa + paccaya + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, abl sg of kodhūpāyāsapaccaya
Meaning dependent on anger and irritation; due to wrath and mental agitation
Construction kodhūpāyāsa + paccaya + ā
kodhūpāyāsapaccaya + ā
Sanskrit krodha + upāyāsa (bsk) + pratyayāt

ahañ'c'eva kho pana kodh'ūpāyāsī assaṃ, attā'pi maṃ upavadeyya kodh'ūpāyāsapaccayā, anuviccā'pi maṃ viññū garaheyyuṃ kodh'ūpāyāsapaccayā, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā kodh'ūpāyāsapaccayā.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
kodhūpāyāsī

adj. who is angry and irritable; who is wrathful and mentally agitated [kodha + ūpāyāsa + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from kodhūpāyāsa
Meaning who is angry and irritable; who is wrathful and mentally agitated
Construction kodha + ūpāyāsa + ī
kodhūpāyāsa + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Antonym akkodhūpāyāsī
Sanskrit krodha + upāyāsa (bsk) +

ahañ'c'eva kho pana kodh'ūpāyāsī assaṃ, attā'pi maṃ upavadeyya kodh'ūpāyāsapaccayā, anuviccā'pi maṃ viññū garaheyyuṃ kodh'ūpāyāsapaccayā, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā kodh'ūpāyāsapaccayā.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
konāma

adj. of what name? called what? ✗
konāmo

sandhi. what is (something) called?; what is the name of? [ko + nāmo] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + masc, interr
Meaning what is (something) called?; what is the name of?
Construction ko + nāmo
Commentary (MNa) ko nāmo āyasmā'ti na thero tassa nāmaṃ na jānāti. jānanto'y'eva pana sammodituṃ labhissāmī'ti pucchi
Sanskrit kiṃnāmaka

evaṃ vutte, āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṃ puṇṇaṃ mantāṇiputtaṃ etadavoca, konāmo āyasmā, kathañ'ca pan'āyasmantaṃ sabrahmacārī jānantī'ti? puṇṇo'ti kho me, āvuso, nāmaṃ, mantāṇiputto'ti ca pana maṃ sabrahmacārī jānantī'ti.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

api hi me, bhante, imaṃ dhammapariyāyaṃ sutvā lomāni haṭṭhāni. konāmo ayaṃ, bhante, dhammapariyāyo'ti? tasmā't'iha tvaṃ, nāgasamāla, imaṃ dhammapariyāyaṃ lomahaṃsanapariyāyo tv'eva naṃ dhārehī'ti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
kopa 1

masc. anger; wrath; rage; temper [√kup + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from kuppati
Meaning anger; wrath; rage; temper
Root Family √kup
Root √kup･3 ya (shake, be angry)
Construction √kup > kop + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit kopa
Sanskrit Root √kup 4 (be angry)

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appam'pi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ

kiṃ nu kho me ayyā santaṃ'y'eva nu kho ajjhattaṃ kopaṃ na pātukaroti udāhu asantaṃ udāhu mayham'ev'ete kammantā susaṃvihitā yena me ayyā santaṃ'y'eva ajjhattaṃ kopaṃ na pātukaroti, no asantaṃ?

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
kopa 2

masc. disturbance; perturbation; agitation; lit. shaking [√kup + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from kuppati
Meaning disturbance; perturbation; agitation; lit. shaking
Root Family √kup
Root √kup･3 ya (shake, be angry)
Construction √kup > kop + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (SNPa) yass'antarato na santi kopā'ti tatiyamaggena samūhatattā yassa citte na santi kopā'ti attho.
Sanskrit kopa
Sanskrit Root √kup 4 (be angry)

yass'antarato na santi kopā,
itibhavābhavatañ'ca vītivatto,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

kopaneyya

yo ce na paṭigaṇhati,
kop'antaro dosagaru,
sa veraṃ paṭimuñcatī'ti.

SN 1.35 ujjhānasaññisuttaṃ
kopita

pp. (+instr) annoyed (by); angered (by); infuriated (by) [√kup + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of kopeti, caus (+instr)

Root √kup･3 *e (shake, be angry)
Base √kup + *e > kope (caus)
Construction kope + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit kopita
Sanskrit Root √kup 4 (be angry)

sabbattha te citta vaco kataṃ mayā,
bahūsu jātīsu na me'si kopito,
ajjhattasambhavo kataññutāya te,
dukkhe ciraṃ saṃsaritaṃ tayā kate.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
kopina

nt. genitals; private parts [√kup + *īna] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning genitals; private parts
Root Family √kup
Root √kup･3 ya (shake, be angry)
Construction √kup > kop + *īna
Derivative kita (*īna)
Phonetic Change u > o
Variant kopīna
Commentary (NIDD1a) hirikopīnapaṭicchādan'atthan'ti niyatapayojanaṃ, itarāni kadāci honti. tattha hirikopīnan'ti taṃ taṃ sambādhaṭṭhānaṃ. yasmiṃ yasmiñ'hi aṅge vivariyamāne hirī kuppati vinassati, taṃ taṃ hiriṃ kopanato hirikopīnan'ti vuccati. tassa ca hirikopīnassa paṭicchādan'atthan'ti hirikopīnapaṭicchādan'atthaṃ.
Sanskrit kaupīna
Sanskrit Root √kup 4 (be angry)

paṭisaṅkhā yoniso cīvaraṃ paṭisevāmi yāva'd'eva sītassa paṭighātāya uṇhassa paṭighātāya ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-siriṃsapa-samphassānaṃ paṭighātāya yāva'd'eva hirikopinapaṭicchādan'atthaṃ

komārabrahmacariyā

fem. vow of chastity beginning from the infancy ✗
komārabhacca 1

masc. paediatrician; (comm) raised by a prince; lit. nurturing the youthful [komāra + bhacca] ✓

Commentary (MNa) kumārena bhato'ti komārabhacco. . yath'āha, kiṃ etaṃ bhaṇe kākehi samparikiṇṇan'ti? dārako devā'ti. jīvati bhaṇe'ti? jīvati devā'ti. tena hi bhaṇe taṃ dārakaṃ amhākaṃ antepuraṃ netvā dhātīnaṃ detha posetun'ti. tassa jīvatī'ti jīvako'ti nāmaṃ akaṃsu, kumārena posāpito'ti komārabhacco'ti nāmaṃ akaṃsū'ti (mahāva. 328).

SN 1.14 khattiyasuttaṃ

Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (MNa) komudiṃ cātumāsinin'ti pacchimakattikacātumāsapuṇṇamaṃ. sā hi kumudānaṃ atthitāya komudī, catunnaṃ vassikānaṃ māsānaṃ pariyosānattā cātumāsinī'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit kumuda

idh'ev'āhaṃ sāvatthiyaṃ komudiṃ cātumāsiniṃ āgamessāmī'ti. assosuṃ kho jānapadā bhikkhū, bhagavā kira tatth'eva sāvatthiyaṃ komudiṃ cātumāsiniṃ āgamessatī'ti.

Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jujube
Sanskrit kola

santi kho pana, sāriputta, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, āhārena suddhī'ti. te evam'āhaṃsu, kolehi yāpemā'ti. te kolam'pi khādanti, kolacuṇṇam'pi khādanti, kol'odakam'pi pivanti, anekavihitam'pi kolavikatiṃ paribhuñjanti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
kola 2.2

masc. jujube tree ✗
kolaṅkola

adj. who goes from (good) family to (good) family, middlemost type of sotāpanna; who will become an arahant within six more births ✗
kolacuṇṇa

nt. powdered jujube [kola + cuṇṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning powdered jujube
Construction kola + cuṇṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (kola + cuṇṇa)
Sanskrit kola + cūrṇa

santi kho pana, sāriputta, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, āhārena suddhī'ti. te evam'āhaṃsu, kolehi yāpemā'ti. te kolam'pi khādanti, kolacuṇṇam'pi khādanti, kol'odakam'pi pivanti, anekavihitam'pi kolavikatiṃ paribhuñjanti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

Construction kolaṭṭhi + matta
Commentary (SNa) kol'aṭṭhimattiyo'ti padar'aṭṭhipamāṇā.
kolaputti

fem. state of being a son of a good or noble family ✗
kolamatta

adj. size of a jujube fruit [kola + matta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning size of a jujube fruit
Construction kola + matta
kolamba

masc. big jar ✗
kolavikati

fem. jujube preparation; jujube concoction [kola + vikati] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning jujube preparation; jujube concoction
Construction kola + vikati
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kolānaṃ + vikati)
Commentary (MNa) kolavikatin'ti kolasāḷava-kolapūva-kolaguḷ'ādikolavikāraṃ
Sanskrit kola + vikṛti

santi kho pana, sāriputta, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, āhārena suddhī'ti. te evam'āhaṃsu, kolehi yāpemā'ti. te kolam'pi khādanti, kolacuṇṇam'pi khādanti, kol'odakam'pi pivanti, anekavihitam'pi kolavikatiṃ paribhuñjanti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
kolaṃkola

masc. stream enterer who returns to the human state two or three times; lit. family to family [kolaṃ + kola] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning stream enterer who returns to the human state two or three times; lit. family to family
Construction kolaṃ + kola
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (kolaṃ + kola)
Commentary (SNa) yo pana dve tayo bhave saṃsaritvā dukkhass'antaṃ karoti, ayaṃ kolaṃkolo nāma. (ANa) kolaṃkolo'ti kulā kulaṃ gamanako.
Sanskrit kaulam + kaula

taṃ vā pana anabhisambhavaṃ appaṭivijjhaṃ tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā kolaṃkolo hoti, dve vā tīṇi vā kulāni sandhāvitvā saṃsaritvā dukkhass'antaṃ karoti.

AN 3.89 tatiyasikkhāsuttaṃ
kolāpa

masc. dead or hollow tree ✗
kolāhala 1

nt. rabble; mob; noisy crowd ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning rabble; mob; noisy crowd
Variant kotūhala
Commentary (THa) kolāhalaṃ tat'uttarin'ti tato tayato upari ca bahūnaṃ saṃvāso kolāhalaṃ uccāsadda-mahāsadda-mahājanasannipātasadiso, tasmā ekavihārinā bhavitabban'ti adhippāyo'ti.
Sanskrit kolāhala

yathā brahmā tathā eko,
yathā devo tathā duve,
yathā gāmo tathā tayo,
kolāhalaṃ tat'uttarin'ti.

TH 178 yasojattheragāthā

Meaning uproar; pandemonium

kolitasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 21.1 (SN21.1) ✗
koliya

masc. name of a clan neighbouring the Sakyans ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a clan neighbouring the Sakyans
Sanskrit koḍya, koliya (bsk)
koliyadhītar

fem. young woman of the Koliyan clan; (comm) daughter of the Koliyan king [koliya + dhītar] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning young woman of the Koliyan clan; (comm) daughter of the Koliyan king
Construction koliya + dhītar
Commentary (UDa) koliyadhītā'ti koliyarājaputtī. sā hi bhagavato agg'upaṭṭhāyikā paṇītadāyikānaṃ sāvikānaṃ etadagge ṭhapitā sot'āpannā ariyasāvikā.
koliyaputta

masc. young Koliyan man [koliya + putta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning young Koliyan man
Construction koliya + putta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (koliyānaṃ + putta)
Sanskrit koḍya, koliya (bsk) + putra

atha kho sambahulā sāmugiyā koliyaputtā yen'āyasmā ānando ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdiṃsu.

AN 4.194 sāmugiyasuttaṃ

atha kho puṇṇo ca koliyaputto govatiko acelo ca seniyo kukkuravatiko yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā puṇṇo koliyaputto govatiko bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

MN 57 kukkuravatikasuttaṃ
koliyā

masc. people of the clan neighbouring the Sakyans; Koliyans [koliya + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl, from koliya
Meaning people of the clan neighbouring the Sakyans; Koliyans
Construction koliya + ā
Commentary (MNa) tattha koliyesū'ti evaṃnāmake janapade. so hi eko'pi kolanagare patiṭṭhitānaṃ koliyānaṃ rājakumārānaṃ nivāsaṭṭhānattā evaṃ vuccati. tasmiṃ koliyesu janapade.
Sanskrit koḍya, koliya (bsk)

ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ānando koliyesu viharati sāmugaṃ nāma koliyānaṃ nigamo.

AN 4.194 sāmugiyasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā koliyesu viharati haliddavasanaṃ nāma koliyānaṃ nigamo.

MN 57 kukkuravatikasuttaṃ
koleyyaka

adj. of good breed, (said of dogs) ✗
kolodaka

Commentary (MNa) kol'odakan'ti kolāni madditvā katapānakaṃ.

santi kho pana, sāriputta, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, āhārena suddhī'ti. te evam'āhaṃsu, kolehi yāpemā'ti. te kolam'pi khādanti, kolacuṇṇam'pi khādanti, kol'odakam'pi pivanti, anekavihitam'pi kolavikatiṃ paribhuñjanti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
kovida

adj. (+gen or +loc) skilled (in); expert (in); proficient (in); master (of) [ku + √vid + *a] ✓

Grammar adj (+gen or +loc)
Meaning skilled (in); expert (in); proficient (in); master (of)
Root Family √vid
Root √vid･1 a (know)
Construction ku > ko + √vid + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym akovida
Sanskrit kovida
Sanskrit Root √vid 1, 2, 6 (know)

gambhīrapaññaṃ medhāviṃ,
magg'āmaggassa kovidaṃ,
uttam'attham'anuppattaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 403 brāhmaṇavaggo

idha, gahapati, sutavā ariyasāvako ariyānaṃ dassāvī ariyadhammassa kovido ariyadhamme suvinīto sappurisānaṃ dassāvī sappurisadhammassa kovido sappurisadhamme suvinīto na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati

kusalo tādi pavuccate tathattā.

kosajja

nt. laziness; inactivity; idleness [ku + √sad + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from kusīta
Meaning laziness; inactivity; idleness
Root Family √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction ku > ko + √sad + *ya
Derivative kita (*ya)
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym vīriyārambha, uddhacca
Commentary (ANa) kosajjāyā'ti kusītabhāv'atthāya.
Sanskrit kusīda
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

sace, bhikkhave, adhicittam'anuyutto bhikkhu ek'antaṃ samādhinimittaṃ'y'eva manasi kareyya, ṭhānaṃ taṃ cittaṃ kosajjāya saṃvatteyya.

AN 3.103 nimittasuttaṃ

asajjhāyamalā mantā,
anuṭṭhānamalā gharā,
malaṃ vaṇṇassa kosajjaṃ,
pamādo rakkhato malaṃ.

DHP 241 malavaggo
kosajjasampayutta

adj. closely associated with idleness [kosajja + sampayutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning closely associated with idleness
Construction kosajja + sampayutta
Commentary (SNa) kosajjasahagato'ti idha bhikkhu chandaṃ uppādetvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ manasikaronto nisīdati. ath'assa citte līn'ākāro okkamati, so līn'ākāro me okkanto'ti ñatvā apāyabhayena cittaṃ tajjetvā puna chandaṃ uppādetvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ manasi karoti. ath'assa puna līn'ākāro okkamati. so puna apāyabhayena cittaṃ tajjetvā chandaṃ uppādetvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ manasi karotī'ti evam'assa kosajjena vokiṇṇattā chando kosajjasahagato nāma hoti. kosajjasampayutto'ti tass'eva vevacanaṃ.
kosajjasahagata

adj. accompanied by laziness [kosajja + sahagata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning accompanied by laziness
Construction kosajja + sahagata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (kosajjena + sahagata)
Commentary (SNa) kosajjasahagato'ti idha bhikkhu chandaṃ uppādetvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ manasikaronto nisīdati. ath'assa citte līn'ākāro okkamati, so līn'ākāro me okkanto'ti ñatvā apāyabhayena cittaṃ tajjetvā puna chandaṃ uppādetvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ manasi karoti. ath'assa puna līn'ākāro okkamati. so puna apāyabhayena cittaṃ tajjetvā chandaṃ uppādetvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ manasi karotī'ti evam'assa kosajjena vokiṇṇattā chando kosajjasahagato nāma hoti. kosajjasampayutto'ti tass'eva vevacanaṃ.
kosambika

adj. living in Kosambī; from Kosambī [kosambī + ika] ~

Grammar adj, from kosambī
Meaning living in Kosambī; from Kosambī
Construction kosambī + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Sanskrit kauśāmbya, kauśāmbīya
kosambiyasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 48; Discourse in Kosambī (MN48) [kosambiyā + sutta] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Majjhima Nikāya 48; Discourse in Kosambī (MN48)
Construction kosambiyā + sutta
Sanskrit kauśāmbī + sūtra
kosambisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 12.68 (SN12.68) ✗
kosambī

fem. name of a town; capital city of the Vatsas ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a town; capital city of the Vatsas
Commentary (MNa) kosambiyan'ti evaṃnāmake nagare. tassa kira nagarassa ārāmapokkharaṇīādīsu tesu tesu ṭhānesu kosambarukkhā'va ussannā ahesuṃ, tasmā kosambī'ti saṅkhaṃ agamāsi. kusambassa nāma isino assamato avidūre māpit'attā'ti'pi eke.
Sanskrit kauśāmbī

ekaṃ samayaṃ sambahulā therā bhikkhū kosambiyaṃ viharanti ghosit'ārāme. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā khemako badarik'ārāme viharati ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno.

SN 22.89 khemakasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena kosambiyaṃ bhikkhū bhaṇḍanajātā kalahajātā vivādāpannā aññam'aññaṃ mukhasattīhi vitudantā viharanti.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
kosala 1

masc. name of a kingdom ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a kingdom
Sanskrit kosala

yāvatā, bhikkhave, kāsikosalā, yāvatā rañño pasenadissa kosalassa vijitaṃ, rājā tattha pasenadi kosalo aggam'akkhāyati.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ

kosalarājā mahantena balen'āgantvā bārāṇasiṃ gahetvā taṃ rājānaṃ māretvā tassa aggamahesiṃ attano aggamahesiṃ akāsi

UDa 2.8 suppavāsā suttavaṇṇanā
kosala 2

adj. from the kingdom of Kosala; of Kosala ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning from the kingdom of Kosala; of Kosala
Sanskrit kausala

yāvatā, bhikkhave, kāsikosalā, yāvatā rañño pasenadissa kosalassa vijitaṃ, rājā tattha pasenadi kosalo aggam'akkhāyati.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme. atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ sambahulā bhikkhū, kosalesu viharanti himavantapasse araññakuṭikāya uddhatā unnaḷā capalā mukharā vikiṇṇavācā muṭṭhassatino asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā pākat'indriyā.

Sanskrit kauśika
Sanskrit Root √kuś 4 (enfold)

yathā kathaṃ pana kho, kosiya, bhagavā saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttiṃ abhāsi? sādhu mayam'pi etissā kathāya bhāgino assāma savanāyā'ti.

MN 37 cūḷataṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
kosiyakāraka

masc. silk weaver; lit. silk maker [kosiya + kāraka] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning silk weaver; lit. silk maker
Construction kosiya + kāraka
Commentary (VINt) pāḷiyaṃ kosiyakārake'ti ettha kosaṃ karontī'ti kosakārakā'ti laddhavohārānaṃ pāṇakānaṃ kosato nibbattaṃ kosiyaṃ, taṃ karontī'ti kosiyakārakā, tantavāyā.
kosiyagotta

nt. Kosiya family clan [kosiya + gotta] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Kosiya family clan
Construction kosiya + gotta
kosiyattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 209 (TH209) ✗
kosiyamissaka

adj. mixed with silk [kosiya + missaka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning mixed with silk
Construction kosiya + missaka
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (kosiyena + missaka)
Sanskrit kauśeya + miśraka

yo pana bhikkhu kosiyamissakaṃ santhataṃ kārāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning chapter about silk

Meaning rule about silk (robes); Nissaggiya 11

masc. thread of silk; fibre of silk [kosiya + aṃsu] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning thread of silk; fibre of silk
Construction kosiya + aṃsu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (kosiyassa + aṃsu)
Sanskrit kauśeya + aṃśu

kārāpeyyā'ti ekena'pi kosiy'aṃsunā missitvā karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ. paṭilābhena nissaggiyaṃ hoti.

VIN 1.4.2.1 kosiyasikkhāpadaṃ
kosī

fem. sheath ✗
kosu

sandhi. who definitely?; what certainly? [ko + su] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind, interr
Meaning who definitely?; what certainly?
Construction ko + su
Sanskrit kaḥ + svid

yehi manussā āgataṃ bhikkhuṃ na manasi karonti, tatra bhikkhussa evaṃ hoti, kosu nāma idāni maṃ imasmiṃ kule paribhindi, virattarūpā dān'ime mayi manussā'ti

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ hoti, kosu nāma me dhammo ajjhattaṃ appahīno yena me ekadā lobhadhammā'pi cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhanti, dosadhammā'pi cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhanti, mohadhammā'pi cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhantī'ti.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
koseyya 1

adj. silken; made of silk; lit. from a cocoon [√kus + *a + eyya] ✓

Grammar adj, from kosa
Meaning silken; made of silk; lit. from a cocoon
Root Family √kus
Root √kus×1 *a (fill, enfold)
Construction √kus > kos + *a + eyya
kosa + eyya
Derivative taddhita (eyya)
Phonetic Change u > o
Notes six types of robe cloth 1. khoma, 2. kappāsika, 3. koseyya, 4. kambala, 5. sāṇa, 6. bhaṅga
Sanskrit kauśeya
Sanskrit Root √kuś 4 (enfold)

dātā ca ahosi sukhumānaṃ mudukānaṃ attharaṇānaṃ pāvuraṇānaṃ khomasukhumānaṃ kappāsikasukhumānaṃ koseyyasukhumānaṃ kambalasukhumānaṃ

DN 30.10 lakkhaṇasuttaṃ

channaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataran'ti khomaṃ, kappāsikaṃ, koseyyaṃ, kambalaṃ, sāṇaṃ, bhaṅgan'ti imesaṃ channaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ.

VINa 1.4.1.1 paṭhamakathinasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
kosohita

adj. sheathed; enclosed; lit. deposited in a cocoon [kosa + ohita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning sheathed; enclosed; lit. deposited in a cocoon
Construction kosa + ohita
Compound sattamī tappurisa (kose + ohita)
Commentary (MNa) kos'ohite'ti vatthikosena paṭicchanne.
Sanskrit kośa + avahita, kośopagata (bsk)

dvīsu mahāpurisalakkhaṇesu kaṅkhati vicikicchati n'ādhimuccati na sampasīdati, kos'ohite ca vatthaguyhe, pahūtajivhatāya ca.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

kacci kos'ohitaṃ bhoto,
vatthaguyhaṃ nar'uttama,
nārīsamānasavhayā,
kacci jivhā na narassikā.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
kosohitavatthaguyha

adj. with the genitals enclosed in a sheath; tenth of the thirty-two marks of a great man [kosa + ohita + vattha + guyha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with the genitals enclosed in a sheath; tenth of the thirty-two marks of a great man
Construction kosa + ohita + vattha + guyha
Compound kammadhāraya (kosohita + vatthaguyha)
Sanskrit kośa + avahita + vastra + guhya, kośopagatavastiguhya (bsk)

kos'ohitavatthaguyho kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
kosohitavatthaguyhalakkhaṇa

Meaning auspicious mark of sheathed genitals
Construction kosohita + vatthaguyha + lakkhaṇa
kohañña

nt. hypocrisy, deceit ✗
koḷāpa

adj. (of wood) dry; dried-out; sapless ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning (of wood) dry; dried-out; sapless
Commentary (MNa) koḷāpan'ti chinnasinehaṃ nirāpaṃ.

seyyathā'pi, aggivessana, sukkhaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ koḷāpaṃ, ārakā udakā thale nikkhittaṃ. atha puriso āgaccheyya uttar'āraṇiṃ ādāya, aggiṃ abhinibbattessāmi, tejo pātukarissāmī'ti.

Sanskrit koli + ārāma

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sākete viharati koḷik'ārāme. tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca.

koḷiya

koḷivisa

masc. name of a family clan ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a family clan
Commentary (ANa) soṇo koḷiviso'ti soṇo'ti tassa nāmaṃ, koḷiviso'ti gottaṃ. koṭivesso'ti vā attho, issariyena koṭippattassa vessakulassa dārako'ti adhippāyo. yasmā pana aññesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vīriyaṃ nāma vaḍḍhetabbaṃ hoti, therassa pana hāpetabbam'eva ahosi. tasmā esa āraddhavīriyānaṃ aggo nāma jāto.

koḷumba

masc. large pot; big jar; container ✗
ky

pron. who?; what?; which? [ka] ✓

Grammar pron, in comps, interr, from ka
Meaning who?; what?; which?
Construction ka > ki > ky
Phonetic Change a > i > y
Notes pronoun ki in compounds
Sanskrit ki

ky'āssa byappathayo assu,
ky'āss'assu idha gocarā,
kāni sīlabbatān'āssu,
pahit'attassa bhikkhuno.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
kyassa

sandhi. who for him?; who by him? [ke + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning who for him?; who by him?
Construction ke + assa
Phonetic Change e > y
Sanskrit ke + asya

kesu na mānaṃ kayirātha,
kesu c'assa sagāravo,
ky'assa apacitā assu,
ky'assu sādhu supūjitā'ti.

SN 7.15 mānatthaddhasuttaṃ
kyassu

sandhi. who may be?; who should be? ✗
kyāhaṃ 1

sandhi. what I? [kiṃ + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron, interr
Meaning what I?
Construction kiṃ + ahaṃ
Sanskrit kaḥ + aham

ettha ky'āhaṃ, bho gotama, karomi? magg'akkhāyī'haṃ, bho gotamā'ti.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

ettha ky'āhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, karomi? magg'akkhāyī'haṃ, brāhmaṇa, tathāgato'ti.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
kyāhaṃ 2

sandhi. why would I?; (comm) for what reason would I? [kiṃ + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron, interr
Meaning why would I?; (comm) for what reason would I?
Construction kiṃ + ahaṃ
Commentary (ANa) ky'āhaṃ vakkhāmī'ti kiṃkāraṇā ahaṃ vakkhāmi.
Sanskrit kaḥ + aham

tam'ahaṃ jānanto tam'ahaṃ passanto ky'āhaṃ vakkhāmi, na jānāmi na passāmī'ti? jānām'ahaṃ, āvuso, passāmī'ti.

Grammar masc, comp

AN 6.57 chaḷabhijātisuttaṃ
krubbati

pr. does, makes; acts; performs; acts for the advantage or injury of another; (especially absolutive) puts, places [√kar] ✗
klesa

masc. defilement; impurity [√kilis + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning defilement; impurity
Root Family √kilis
Root √kilis･3 ya (be dirty, be molested)
√ In Comps kilis or kkilis
Construction √kilis > kles + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Variant kilesa, kelisa
Sanskrit kleśa
Sanskrit Root √kliś 4, 9 (distress)

tatr'ābhiratim'iccheyya,
hitvā kāme akiñcano,
pariyodapeyya attānaṃ,
cittaklesehi paṇḍito.

DHP 88 paṇḍitavaggo
kva

ind. where? ✓

Grammar ind, adv, interr
Meaning where?
Variant kuva
Sanskrit kva

kva naccaṃ, kva gītaṃ, kva vāditaṃ, kva akkhānaṃ, kva pāṇissaraṃ, kva kumbhathunanti, ime kho, gahapatiputta, cha ādīnavā samajj'ābhicaraṇe

DN 31.8 siṅgālasuttaṃ

kiṃ'sū asissāmi kuvaṃ vā asissaṃ,
dukkhaṃ vata settha kva-ajja sessaṃ,
ete vitakke paridevaneyye,
vinayetha sekho aniketacārī.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
kvacana

ind. somewhere; anywhere; in or regard to anything ✗
kvacani

ind. in something; in any place; in regard to something [kva + cani] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from kva
Meaning in something; in any place; in regard to something
Construction kva + cani
Derivative taddhita (cani)
Variant kvacini
Commentary (MNa) ayañ'hi n'āhaṃ kvacanī'ti kvaci attānaṃ na passati (MNa) na ca mama kvacanī'ti ettha mamasaddaṃ tāva ṭhapetvā na ca kvacani parassa ca attānaṃ kvaci na passatī'ti ayam'attho.
Sanskrit kva + cid

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, n'āhaṃ kvacani kassaci kiñcanat'asmiṃ, na ca mama kvacani kismiñci kiñcanaṃ n'atthī'ti.

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ
kvaci 1

ind. somewhere; anywhere [kva + ci] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from kva
Meaning somewhere; anywhere
Construction kva + ci
Derivative taddhita (ci)
Antonym na kvaci
Sanskrit kva + cid

evaṃ mano chassu yadā subhāvito,
phuṭṭhassa cittaṃ na vikampate kvaci,
te rāgadose abhibhuyya bhikkhavo,
bhavattha jātimaraṇassa pāragā'ti.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ

tato adinnaṃ parivajjayeyya,
kiñci kvaci sāvako bujjhamāno,
na hāraye harataṃ n'ānujaññā,
sabbaṃ adinnaṃ parivajjayeyya.

SNP 26 dhammikasuttaṃ
cūḷavaggo 14
kvaci 2

ind. (gram) in some places; in some contexts; optionally; in several examples [kva + ci] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from kva
Meaning (gram) in some places; in some contexts; optionally; in several examples
Construction kva + ci
Derivative taddhita (ci)
Antonym vikappena
Sanskrit kva + cid

ādibhūtānaṃ vaṇṇānaṃ ekassarānaṃ kvaci dvebhāvo hoti. titikkhati, jigucchati, tikicchati, vīmaṃsati, bubhukkhati, pivāsati, daddallati, dadāti, jahāti, caṅkamati. kvacī'ti kim'atthaṃ? kampati, calati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 458

517, 488. kvaci dhātu vibhatti paccayānaṃ dīgha viparīt'ādesa lop'āgamā ca.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 517
kvacini

ind. somewhere; anywhere; in or regard to anything ✗

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
kvattho

sandhi. (+instr) (gram) what is meant (by)?; what is the purpose (of)? [ko + attho] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + masc, interr (+instr)
Meaning (gram) what is meant (by)?; what is the purpose (of)?
Construction ko > kv + attho
Phonetic Change o > v (Kacc 18, 20)
Sanskrit kaḥ + arthaḥ

samāsa'icc'anena kv'attho?

kaccāyana samāsakappa 316

abyayībhāvam'icc'anena kv'attho? aṃvibhattīna makār'antā abyayībhāvā.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 319
kvanu

ind. where? [kva + nu] ~

Meaning where?
Construction kva + nu

ind. where? [kva + nu] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp, interr
Meaning where?
Construction kva + nu
kvaṃ

ind. where? ✗
kvāssa

sandhi. where could it?; where would it? [kva + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, interr, adv + opt
Meaning where could it?; where would it?
Construction kva + assa
Variant kāya
Sanskrit kva + syāt

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kūṭ'āgāre vā kūṭ'āgārasālāyaṃ vā pācīnavātapānā sūriye uggacchante vātapānena rasmi pavisitvā kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? pacchimāyaṃ, bhante, bhittiyan'ti.

SN 48.42 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ

pacchimāyaṃ, bhante, bhittiyan'ti. pacchimā ce, bhikkhave, bhitti n'āssa kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? pathaviyaṃ, bhante'ti. pathavī ce, bhikkhave, n'āssa kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? āpasmiṃ, bhante'ti. āpo ce, bhikkhave, n'āssa kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? appatiṭṭhitā, bhante'ti.

SN 12.64 atthirāgasuttaṃ
kvi

ind. (gram) technical term in kaccāyanabyākaraṇa for any primary derivative which forms a noun ✓

Grammar ind
Meaning (gram) technical term in kaccāyanabyākaraṇa for any primary derivative which forms a noun

sabbadhātūhi kvipaccayo hoti, so ca kitasaññattā kattari bhavati.

padarūpasiddhi kibbidhānakaṇḍa 584
kvettha

sandhi. who are you?; lit. who is here [ko + ettha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + adv, interr
Meaning who are you?; lit. who is here
Construction ko + ettha
Variant ko tettha, kvattha
Commentary (ANa) kv'ettha, āvuso'ti ko ettha, āvuso.
Sanskrit kaḥ + atra

addasā kho kokanudo paribbājako āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ dūrato'va āgacchantaṃ. disvāna āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca, kv'ettha, āvuso'ti? aham'āvuso, bhikkhū'ti.
